Summary: Our trip to Disneyland was to celebrate our granddaughter's birthday.  In the past we have stayed at one of Disney's properties but decided to go with the Holiday Inn as it is next to Disneyland (it seems necessary to say that our usual Disney hotel was under significant construction and there were no guest services being offered). The location was perfect and we were able to use a door to door bus ride provided by the city for a small fee (a real bargain for multiple days).  The room was tight but comfortable and clean enough. The reduced cleaning schedules brought on by covid is taking its toll on hotel rooms (we have seen this everywhere in the past 2 years). However, the housekeeping staff are great. They were so helpful with anything we needed including some quick sewing

Unfortunately, my wife only recorded video and TripAdvisor won‚Äôt let me upload screen shots from that video as pictures so I can‚Äôt share how great things looked. Another plus is that each bedroom had a bathroom, and the bathroom sinks are separate from the shower areas so 4 of us were able to get ready for the day at the same time. There

In that case, it works perfectly - easy sidewalk walking to the "secret" back entrance to Disneyland by Downtown Disney.    The hotel rooms a very clean, and the beds are comfortable - those are the most important things to me on a trip like this and why i rated it the way I did. The hotel though needs some major help - one of the two small elevators is out (and looks like it has been for awhile). Signs on the wall have all the letters peeled off. The loose carpet in

By far the best place to stay while going to Disney. Itzy at the front desk made the experience so much better! Nothing but top of the line customer service! I would not suggest any other place around.

The best hotel close to Disney! We‚Äôve stayed here a couple of times and the staff is so reliable and friendly. Parking near rooms and a nice gift shop close to the lobby.  Not to mention the rooms, they are extremely clean in a nice a quiet neighborhood.

Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback shannon h.  We take any and all concerns seriously.  We had the room inspected both by my team and by a national pest control company and was unable to find any pest of any kind in the room. I'm sorry that you felt refunding you the room and tax was insufficient but based on the facts we had, we felt it was more than adequate. Summary: This hotel is awesome.  Great staff. Vanessa was wonderful and Georgiana was amazing with the food. Thank you and I will be coming back. Everyone here was very professional the rooms were clean and comfortable.

Summary Heading: New $25 per night "Amenity Fee" forces guests to leave the parks to eat at the limited hours and poor quality restauran.
Summary: As of December 2023 this hotel has added a mandatory $25 "Amenity Fee" per night. You have to eat at their restaurant or loose the money, all the other 'amenities' are the same as before and were free: like the workout room. Because the restaurant has limited hours it forces you to leave the Parks to eat at the poor quality restaurant. On my visit for breakfast the cut fruit was literally rotting and a piece of toast sat in the oatmeal. We both agreed the food was terrible and it started the day off wrong. Being forced to eat there or loose $25 is just cruel, greedy and poor customer service. I do not recommend this location.

Perks: small kitchen area minus the stove. Bring you own sponge and dishwashing soap. Big room separated by double doors. Don‚Äôt bring your pet here unless you want to stay in your room the entire time.  when we checked in we were informed that our puppy couldn‚Äôt be left alone in the room, wait WHAT???   This hotel is 2 seconds from Disneyland so obviously that is were the majority of their ‚Äúguests‚Äù are going.but they honestly expected us to stay in our room, I could have stayed home & done that,    in addition another guest came to her & asked for water she actually told him to walk to a gas station at 11;45 in the evening, the supervisor needs some guest relations training. Manager Response: Dear 1disneynut71,  Thank you for staying with us.  In regards to your comments, no hotel will allow the guests to leave their pet in their room while they go out to Disney.  In those situations, there are plenty of kennels nearby where you can leave the pet for the day.  In leaving the pet at the hotel all day without someone taking them out, they are more inclined to go to the bathroom in the guestroom which you, as the guest, would be charged for and possibly chance of damage to the room.  In the times guests have tried leaving their pet in the room without supervision, pets have been known to cause disruption to other guests.  These restrictions are in place for the pet's sake, for you to avoid any cleaning or damage fees from being assessed and for our other guests who are staying with us for a comfortable enjoyable non-disruptive stay.    Unfortunately, we do not offer free water at 11:45pm when all the outlets are closed.  Guests can choose to purchase water from the vending machines or at a nearby store.  We offer options to our guests.    In regards to cleanliness, our scores and multiple positive comments say that we do a very good job in regards to cleanliness of the hotel.   We are not perfect but we absolutely work at ensuring the rooms are cleaned properly pre-COVID or during and if there are issues, we address them right away.  I do question the cleanliness of a room when the guest chooses to leave their pet there all day without supervision nor allowing them to go outside to use the bathroom.

There is a microwave and small fridge in the room. The TV is good with plenty of channels. I will certainly stay here the next time I need to be at Disney. The only thing to note (and this is not the hotel's fault) is that there aren't any quick dining options just across the street. There is a nice area about a mile away with pretty much any thing you want and Downtown Disney but there's nothing really close for a quick bite or a place to grab some

Summary Heading: property with all that you need near Disneyland
Summary: The hotel is a very short walk to Downtown Disney on quiet roads and paths.  The ART transit system is also very good with the shuttle coming right to the front door of the hotel and running TO Disney in 10minutes and FROM Disney in less than 10minutes.  The hotel staff is very friendly.  The on-site restaurant is good with lots of options and a small bar.  We didn't use the pool, but it looked good.  We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite.  It was themed Pirates and was very well done.  Nights were quiet.  Room was well apportioned with a small kitchen area (microwave and coffee).  Master bedroom with the king bed was HUGE with very large walkin closet attached.

Summary Heading: Good Value, Great Service (but needs some love)
Summary: e stayed in a ‚ÄúOne Bedroom Themed Suite‚Äù (Star Wars) 10/7/21-10/11/21 in Building 3, 6th floor.  Our party consisted of two adults, a pre-teen, and twin toddlers.  Pros: -Service was excellent.  All staff was friendly and any service requests were timely.  -The room felt very large (two pack and plays, a double stroller and all of our stuff did NOT make us feel claustrophobic like most hotels) -They give you two types of pillows (soft and firm) and the beds were comfortable -The room felt clean, though outdated and in need of some upkeep (see cons) -There was fun theming and the price didn‚Äôt seem to be inflated because of it -It‚Äôs a 1.1 mile walk to the Disneyland turnstiles BUT part of the walk is through Downtown Disney which means you can grab Starbucks on your way, take your

I can honestly say THE BEST HOLIDAY INN IN 44 states!!!!   We travel for a living and have stayed in multiple different Holiday Inn/Express in 44 states and this one by far exceeds all. Just reopened this month and is clean, well staffed and accommodating no matter the question asked. Minor issues arise, like any where you stay, but they will handles efficiently and quickly. From the front desk to the maintenance man everyone appeared happy to help. The GM, Tia is beyond helpful. But the most amazing part is the respect he has for his employees, he does nothing but praise them. And the employees do nothing but respect his actions, if given a chance they will be more than happy to tell you how amazing he is to all of them.  Plus it‚Äôs just around the corner from the Disney parks.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your experience at Holiday Inn ANAHEIM (1 BLK/DISNEYLAND¬Æ).  Please know that your feedback is extremely valuable to us. We use feedback, such as yours, to continuously make changes to our brand to improve the guest experience. We hope that you will give us the opportunity to serve you again in the future.

Summary Heading: Excellent location! One block to Downtown Disney
Summary: One the best hotel in the Disneyland area. Just one block to Downtown Disney. Good service, good rooms, parking Lot (paid), clean rooms, family environment. Only concern is the noice in the lobby area.

its a nice place.  kinda like the one on harbor but a little older.  nice shower,  hot jacuzzi.  im told the elevator can be a problem but i didnt have any trouble.  they sell art tickets but not like a kiosk.  couldnt get senior tickets anly general tickets

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for a family to stay when visiting Disneyland
Summary: Service was excellent all round - Front desk had a problem with my reservation because of my tour provider and did everything they could to fix it as quickly as they could. It had no impact on the rest of my trip, check in just took a little longer than usual. Restaurant was excellent. I was by myself with two kids, aged 8 & 12. Both ate for free if I purchased something. They even brought my 12 year old an extra pizza when he inhaled the first one and didn't charge me for it. This saved me a fair bit of money in meals. If I didn't eat, then they charged a reasonable price to eat off the kids menu, much cheaper than anything else available. Food was also good. They also had a small selection of local craft beer which was nice.   Pool was heated to the point that it was warm and

Summary Heading: They Threw My Garment Bag Away
Summary: I accidentally left my white hanging garment bag on the bed. I got a return call informingme that my garment bag was placed in a black trash bag and thrown away. And their trash service had already been picked up!
Manager Response: Hi Letthelastcheckbounc,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us and for posting a candid review. I was very concerned to read about what happened to your garment bag. I understand your dismay and I am sorry. This is not the experience that we wanted for all our guests and I will make sure to share your comments with our team for necessary improvements needed on our end.   I would also like to follow up on your concern that is why I have sent you a private message. I hope you get the time to read it and respond.  Mike F. Case Manager IHGService

Summary: We really had a wonderful time for 3 days. Thank God we live in San Diego, which is an hour 1/2 away from there. We really appreciate both Juan, Front Desk Manager and Jose at the Onyx restaurant for working out all our concerns at the hotel. We had lots of fun and a very nice breakfast each day. We are thinking about coming back for the IDEA FITNESS EXPO in July. So we expect to get a great deal for about 5 days.  Thank you so very much Jose and Juan. See you soon!

Convenient place to visit Disneyland. They need a complete renovation, but not big faults on the building. I recommend it. As IHG member they gave me 50%off on parking, a good surprise. Good late check in(2am) experience

We stayed at this hotel to be within walking distance of Disneyland. That was amazing! The room was excellent, clean, and cozy. The staff was friendly and helpful. Maid service had it back to perfect every day. Highly recommend for Disney trips.

Summary Heading: Not very close to Disney if you're walking
Summary: After reading several reviews, we decided to stay here for our three night visit to Disneyland.  We had family staying at Disneyland Hotel so wanted to be close to them.  I read many reviews most stating about a 15 minute walk to Disneyland.  It is probably a 10 minute walk to Disneyland Hotel and a good 20-25 minute walk to Disneyland entrance without kids.  A portion of the walk is very bare and scarce of people and I didn't feel comfortable walking with just me and my daughter at night.  Not to mention on one night upon our return there was a guy booking it from the hotel and two police cars at our hotel.  That made me feel very uncomfortable walking at night.  We did take the ART shuttle bus to Disney one morning but honestly would have been faster to walk due to traffic.
Manager Response: Hello angelac1964,  Thanks for staying with us and taking the time to share your thoughts. We're glad to see your perfect rating of 5/5 stars for the level of our room and service. On the other hand, An incident with some other guests and the presence of police at the hotel made you uneasy. I am sure that this is a rare instance. At any rate, your feedback is important. I will share them with the team and I am sure that further improvement will be made.  We hope that if you find yourself in the area again, you'll allow us to host your stay.   Best,  Ronald R. Case Manager IHGService

Summary: I booked two rooms at this hotel for myself and family members.  As soon as I arrived, I sensed that this hotel was not quite what I expected from reading the hotel's website and reviews.  My room felt cold and musty, and the rug was still wet from something.  My room was across from the elevator which had a noise like a semi truck jake brake, and next to that was the laundry supply room.  The bathrooms in both rooms looked like we were camping in a RV.  the wood trim was rotting at the bottom of the bathroom door, and we couldn't use the sink/vanity area without shutting the door into the toilet and shower area.  When I booked these rooms I was encouraged by the person taking my call to pay in advance for breakfasts for the four of us.  When my daughter turned up for breakfast,
Manager Response: Hi CapitolaJewel,  Thank you for your review and expressing your thoughts about how we have hosted your IHG experience.  I am sorry about the less than helpful level of customer service delivered by the upper management of the hotel. I recognize your disappointment with the hotel amenities, dining experience and hotel information via the website. Kindly be informed that this is not our standard service and I am sorry about the experience. This information will be shared with the upper management and each individual staff involved for checking. In line with this, I have sent you a private message to ask more information about your stay.  Again, thank you for making us aware as we value your visit. I look forward to your response.  Best,  Zel N. Case Manager  IHGService

Summary: Stayed here for one night with my family of four. After a long day at Disneyland, the front desk staff were pleasant upon check in. The dining room staff were friendly and overly accommodating. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great value, friendly staff, and close access to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: So warm and welcoming and the place is beautiful
Summary: They have all around amazing service. Also their amazing staff was warmly accommodating quick at getting my room together, and all the above. The building is gorgeous definitely worth staying here. They will even text you when your room Is ready. Love it

This Holiday Inn is the perfect distance from Disney Land, that‚Äôs why we booked it. Amazing location and a certified Disney‚Äôs Good Neighbour.  Stayed in the Marvel suite. Lots of decals and posters on the wall, so fun for the kids and lots of space.  Rooms could use a little sprucing up though, lots of wear and tear as the place is steady full.

Great hotel. They didnt have the room I requested via my points, but was upgraded to a nicer room. Great hotel. Close to Disneyland and restaurants and room was clean. Wish they had a continental breakfast though.

Prerty standard King room. Comfortable bed and close to devebt food spota. Aside from no decent lighting this was a good place to stay. Walking distance to Disneyland monorail entrance! There were a few other places in the same price range so look around!
Manager Response: Hi 510nathanaelc,   I agree that our beds are comfortable and I am glad you experienced it. Close proximity to the Disneyland Monotrail entrance is indeed a big plus for our guests.   Sorry that the lighting was insufficient. We will definitely check on this. Thank you for your feedback.  We would love to have you back!   Warmest Regards,  Dhang R Case Manager  IHGService

Summary: Nice rooms for our family of 4. Hotel right next door to Disney Parking structure. 10 minute walk to Downtown Disney and Disneyland Hotel.  It‚Äôs down a road on the backside of the parking structure. Pretty walk but a little dark at night. So make sure you're with people to feel safe.  Hotel has Good service and great price. :)

Summary Heading: Has Disneyland in its name: expensive and kids
Summary: To start: I like kids, so I enjoyed my stay as a business traveller as this is not a typical business hotel. Breakfast was an environment with more animation than usual, including Disney movies on the TV. Regarding breakfast: I had buffet, but for once, it looks like the a la carte menu orders were for sure looking good as well, with more options like waffles that are not available at the buffet. The room itself was one of the old style Holiday Inns, it can use an update. Things are all functional and clean, no comment on that part. The bed was like the room, an update would not hurt, but nothing dramatic. I had a room on the third floor, and had to wait that long for the elevator I decided to use the stairs. The fan in the bathroom makes a lot of noise Given the price, I will
Manager Response: Hello erbee64,    Welcome back. Thank you for your loyalty and taking the time to share your insights.   It is great to know that you found the property very convenient for your stay and the staff to be welcoming and helped you during your stay. We appreciate your honest feedback about the condition of the property and its need for maintenance as well as the options provided at the breakfast buffet. Hotel Management and our maintenance team has been notified of your concerns and are working diligently to ensure that we provide an elevated stay experience once you do come back.   We are determined to deliver a combined sense of comfort and happiness with touches of real wonder and delight in your next stay. At the end of the day, it is the smile that we see in our guests and the joy that you share of your stay that we always look forward to.      Looking forward to your visit in the future.               Hector P        Case Manager        IHGService

Summary: It may be one block from Disneyland as the crow flies but is about a 15 ‚Äì 20 minute walk down Walnut, cut through the Disneyland Hotel grounds, through Downtown Disney to the entrance area.  We stayed one night here. Upon check-in were given a room on the 3rd floor and when we opened the door the occupants, who were changing, were as surprised as us. Back to the front desk for a new room and were given a room on the 4th floor in a building further away from the front desk. No apologies from the front desk about the mix-up. The new room was OK but had to call maintenance, the TV did not work. Maintenance arrived quickly and fixed this problem. My profile requests a top floor away from elevator. We were on the 4th floor, across from the elevator.  Had coffee in the morning and the
Manager Response: Hello SoCalOregonian,  Thanks for the stay and for sharing your experience. I am very sorry to learn about your experience with the room allocation, the level of service and the condition of the room, and the unwanted charge. This is not the experience we want our guests to have. I have forwarded your feedback to our hotel management to work on these points raised in your review to give you the best hotel experience in the future.     On a lighter note, I am happy that they were able to adjust your bill.   Once again, thank you for staying with us and hope you visit us again.    Best Regards,   John O  Case Manager  IHGService

Summary Heading: Not ‚Äú1BLK/Disneyland‚Äù but decent place to stay
Summary: The official name of this hotel is deceiving...it‚Äôs certainly not 1 block from Disneyland. It‚Äôs a 15-20 minute walk to get to downtown Disney, then thru downtown Disney to the parks. For us it wasn‚Äôt a problem but if the customer is expecting to be that close to Disney due to mobility limitations then they should rethink. There is a shuttle that stops at the hotel and for a one way fare of $4 you can get dropped right outside the main gate area of the parks. They also have a $6 day pass for that bus, but you must buy that from the front desk, it cannot be purchased on the bus. The hotel itself was just fine, we found the staff to be kind, the room was fine, beds comfortable. Room has coffee maker, fridge and small microwave. Pool was open but splash park was not. The restaurant
Manager Response: Hello Kizchris,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us among your many lodging options. We appreciate your willingness to share your feedback.  We're resolute in combining a sense of comfort and happiness with touches of real wonder and delight to all our guests. That said, I am glad that you found our hotel nice, our staff members inviting, along with finding your room adequate with comfortable beds and good amenities. It is also great that you enjoyed our pool area, and had a great dining experience, for finding our rates fair. It is with regret though learning that the hotel name caught you off guard on its location.  We strive to provide our guests with excellent facilities and an unforgettable stay. We take feedback seriously, and I'll inform our hotel management team to make the necessary modifications so we can provide a better experience in the future.   Again, thank you for your comments, and for choosing to stay with us. I hope that we can win back your heart back and try us again.   Best,  Kenneth F. Case Manager IHGService

Summary: This is our second time at this hotel and we‚Äôll be coming again. The rooms are updated, well insulated and quiet. The staff are very friendly and helpful. There are restaurants near by, Disneyland is a short walk away, and the price is amazing. What more can you ask for?

Holiday Inn is great! Staff is 10/10! Super helpful. Clean rooms. Pizza at the restaurant is a great value and tastes good. Breakfast buffet is great. The small gift shop is cool to check out for Disney Knick knacks.

I dont typically leave bad reviews and I'm late doing this one but had friends ask where I stayed most recently and figured I'd share my experience.   The hotel itself is nice. Average, affordable, clean and decent location if you dont mind the walk to Disney (totally fine with us). Perfect for what we needed.   What disappointed me was the service.  First night- fast asleep after a day of travel. Someone tries to enter my room. They assigned it to someone else! I called down and she said no one is on this room, well clearly I am. I'm calling you from it, you gave me a key, I filled out paperwork. She asks if she can sort it out and call me back. No, its 1130 and my kid and I want to sleep. Just give the new family another room.  Next morning I stop at the desk and ask if I need

We are reaching out to you on behalf of InterContinental Hotels Group or IHG. We appreciate you bringing your concern to our attention and would like to say sorry as to how your stay has become. I hope this matter will not deter you from keeping us as your dependable choice to continue sharing your joy of travels.    Sincerely,  Jeraldine R.   Case Manager   IHGService

Summary: Very nice motel in a good location. I would definitely recommend this motel. They had a real good breakfast each morning. The weather was a little to cool to go in the motel pool. I visited several places close to Anaheim including Los Angelos and Beverly Hills. I took a tour bus and got to see a lot of sights. I also took a train ride along the Pacific and went to San Diego for a day. This was a very nice trip.

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland and downtown Disney
Summary: Stayed here for four nights last month and had a good time.  We walked to Disneyland everyday and it only took approx 15 minutes.  there is a shuttle you can catch at the hotel but it cost, we just decided to walk.  One nice thing about walking and going in the park at the downtown Disney entrance was there was never a wait.  We always used the entrance next to the Disneyland hotel. The staff was friendly and was very accommodating,  rooms were clean and quiet.  There is a restaurant on site, we did have their breakfast buffet which had a fairly good selection along with an omelet station. you can also order off their menu. there is a pool but didn't really look into it.  we had a good stay and we will be staying here again on our next trip.

We were able to walk in about 16 min to the parking structure and downtown Disney.  Great location decent price.  18 dollars to park but worth it if you don't mind walking a little.  May be tough with a bunch of kids.  Clean room nice staff.  Kids water splash zone on site.

Nice place, very clean and close to the park. Short walk to downtown Disney. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Very accommodating on our late check in. We will definitely stay again on our next trip.

Summary Heading: Clean and Comfy but NOT close
Summary: The hotel itself is clean and comfy.  The staff was very nice.  Never saw the bar/restaurant opened.  It's a little over a mile walk to Disneyland and mostly down a relatively untraveled street not well lit street.  The hotel is directly behind the Mickey and Friends parking structure and if there was a way to walk in there from the street you could grab the shuttle or walk since you could cut through stuff but unfortunately you can't and have to walk all the way around everything to downtown Disney.  There is no shuttle but the ART does pick up at the hotel but for the price of the ART tickets per person it was cheaper and faster to use Uber (about $8 each way).  There are no restaurants nearby so you have to drive anywhere to eat, fortunately they have a larger easy to get in
Manager Response: Hi calivaligirl,  Thank you for your review and for staying with us. We strive to provide the best possible experience and it is great to read from our guests on how we are doing. We are glad to hear you found our hotel clean and comfy and we greatly appreciate your kind words about our staff. If there is anything you need next time you stay with us, just approach our Front Desk.  Many thanks for your feedback. We look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,  Connie D Case Manager IHGService

Summary: The hotel is about a 15 minute walk to Downtown Disney, but there is nothing nearby the hotel itself. That would not be an issue but for the fact that the bar/lounge does not open until 4:00. Worse yet, they never opened on time a single day we were there. I asked around 4:15 when it would open and was told ‚ÄúI‚Äôm running late, maybe 30 minutes.‚Äù Again, this happened every single day. I complained to the front desk and was told that the restaurant manager would not be in until the next morning. I would recommend going elsewhere.
Manager Response: Hi there, K7830MTnickm!  Thanks for choosing Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim (1 BLK/Disneyland) for your lodging needs and for leaving us feedback.  I understand that we fell short of your expectations on some aspects of your stay particularly with your breakfast experience and condition of our in-room facilities. Our hotel is committed to providing our guests with the highest quality services and facilities. I am sorry for letting you feel otherwise. Reviews like yours are very valuable as they enable us to target areas we need to improve on. I'll share your thoughts with our hotel management team as a reference for future enhancements.  Your feedback will definitely help us towards bettering our services and we hope to host you again soon.  All the best,  Peter J. Case Manager IHGService

Summary: I enjoyed staying in this hotel 11/2011 for 3nights very clean and comfortable  very near to Disneyland it was bed only without breakfast we had coffee machine in the room but it‚Äôs near to many places to eat breakfast

I enjoyed my stay at Holiday Inn Suites Anaheim. The bed and pillows were so comfortable, my room was very quiet. It was spacious and comfortable. Staff are very helpful. The restaurant is basic and there doesnot seem to be any other restaurants/ eating venue within walking distance, so a car or Uber is necessary, there is no courest bus at this Holiday Inn.

Great place to stay if you want a little extra room for the family and be next to Disney land. Clean rooms with Disney themes to choose from like superheroes to frozen. Good food, fun splash pad and warm pool. Highly recommend

We stayed at the holiday inn at 1240 s Walnut in Anaheim, Ca. Staff was nice however the room we were in 3101 was terrible. You know how loud it is when your phone vibrates on the table? Amplify that by 20 and you get the sound coming from the elevator on the other side of the wall. At all hours. There's no way nobody has complained about it before. Really disappointed that we didnt get any warning on this at the very least. Really liked the location, room service and staff, however the noise made our stay rough when it came time to sleep
Manager Response: Hi JeccaOR,  Thank you for your review and for staying with us. While we are delighted to read you liked our location, room service and staff, I am sorry to hear the noise coming from the elevator greatly affected your stay.   If there is anything we an do to make your next stay more comfortable, please don't hesitate to approach our Front Desk or ask for the Manager on Duty.   Again, thanks for staying with us. we hope to see you again and make your stay as best as it can be.  Sincerely,  Connie D Case Manager IHGService

Summary: I booked this hotel on Booking.com. When I arrived with my confirmation, I was told the reservation hadn‚Äôt gone through. I could either pay an extra $300 or take a room with one King bed instead of two queens I had reserved. Since I hadn‚Äôt prepaid I took the King for $100  more than original quote. Luis, the manager in duty was not empathetic. I will not stay at this Holiday Inn again despite being 0.6mi from Diane.
Manager Response: Hello Karen S,   Thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us.  We always strive to ensure total guest satisfaction and I'm sorry to learn your undesirable challenges with your reservation. I'm also concerned that the level of assistance given to address this is a letdown.   I shared this with our local management. Rest assured that corrective measures will be given to the concerned staff, so event as this will be handled better.   We value the confidence you've placed in us. I hope you'll give us another chance to show you our dedication to providing an exceptional service.   Kind regards,   Jomar M.  Case Manager  IHGService

Summary: We stayed here recently for two nights whilst visiting Disney. The 2 bedroom suite was spacious and comfortable but a bit dated. The staff were friendly, breakfast had a good selection and most importantly it was quick, easy walk with a stroller.  My son loved the cars pictures in the room! I would recommend for families wanting something close to the parks/ dining

We have stayed here 4 times over the last 5 years and it never fails. Rooms are nicely renovated, breakfast spot is quite good. The best part is how close it is to downtown Disney, it‚Äôs a 5 minute walk so it was always nice with kids. Going back again next year!

We stayed here because it's within walking distance to Disney. Check in was easy and the room was clean and comfortable. There's a pool and hot tub as well as a pizza restaurant here. The staff was friendly and helpful with directions. We spent very little time here, but the beds were comfortable after a long day at Disney! PS - parking is an extra charge.

Pretty nice room.  Standard issue.  Sinks separate from the small bathroom.  Water pressure is good. Clean room. Very comfy bed!Headboard needed cleaning though. Place needs some updating. Room service took about an hour.  Breakfast included in our AAA stay. Husband was raving about how good the buffet was.   We had a view of the splash pad. Looked like it would be good for kids. We didn't swim in the pool. It's next to the restaurant so we'd have people looking at us the whole time.  There is a shuttle to Disneyland but not to/from the airport. The shuttle is $6 a person and runs every 30 mins. We used Uber. Was cheaper for us and faster.

We stayed here for a week. Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. Room comfortable and clean. We had an end room it was nice and quiet. The restaurant in the hotel was great. Food was very good and great staff. We would definitely stay here again

Stayed for one night for a birthday trip to Disneyland. Booked this Holiday Inn merely because of the last minute need, price and proximity to the park. No real customer service from the desk upon arrival. No recognition of IHG status. Cold response for an early check in was, ‚Äúwe‚Äôll charge you $50.‚Äù Even though there were four people behind the desk, always had to say what I needed instead of being welcomed.   Older hotel style with bathroom sink in the main room, needs upgrading as the bathroom is motel style and room carpet was dirty. Rooms are small and common areas/hallways were always hot and smelled chemically.   Biggest peeve was coming out to the car at various times to drop off a Disney items and staff were by the cars in the parking lot eating lunch and smoking. Is
Manager Response: Hi jkhotels,  Thank you for your review and for staying with us. We aim to provide a high standard of customer service to all our guest to make them feel welcome and at home in our Hotel. I am sorry that you were made to feel unwelcome on your arrival and not valued as IHG Rewards Club Member. I have alerted our management about this, so they may address this internally.  Again, thanks for your thoughts as it helps us better our service.   Sincerely,  Connie D Case Manager IHGService

Summary: Hotel has outstanding staff everywhere: Front desk, room service, breakfast cooks and servers.  Front desk personnel saved grandparents and kids twice by recovering our phone and a beloved toy.  Rooms are very clean and beds are very comfortable.  AC awesome.  Buffet breakfast good way to start the day.  Hotel in quiet area behind Disneyland parking garage and adjacent to a residential area off the main streets.  Short walk to Disneyland shopping area and attractions or get bus tickets at the front desk and catch the ART bus out front every 30 minutes.  Hotel store has necessities but closes at 10PM.  Parked morning for our two night stay, and charged only for two nights.  This Hotel is now our Disneyland favorite !!!!!

Room is quite tight with 2 queens beds.  Bathroom was tiny but the water pressure was amazing. That said the room was starting to show its high wear and age, water damage along the baseboards, bubbly wall paper and a strange film on the carpet that made you not want to walk around in bare feet. While I don't have any big complaints, I am not ecstatic about the hotel either.

We recently stayed here for a trip to Disneyland, the hotel is basic(ho-hum) and slightly past its prime but it did the job and met the expectations well. Rooms are  a slightly smaller size than expected and have the full standard set of amenities. Cleaned and cared for promptly on a daily basis and very friendly and efficient staff in both the hotel and the restaurant. The restaurant food was good and the breakfast buffet was as expected. The hotel is definately not across from the main gate and is a good 15 minute walk to Disney but other than for that, a nice pleasant stroll. Would we stay there again - if another trip to Disney comes up proably will do so.

Our family (two adults, two kids age 3 and infant) stayed here for our recent Disney trip. There are pros and cons for sure but a few reasons I would not stay here again.   PROS:  Close to Disneyland. 1 block - a very long block away. It is on the other side of the new parkade which is huge so a very long block but we still walked every day to/from the park. I wouldn't say it was close enough to comfortably exit the park and walk back to your hotel for nap time though. We rocked the stroller naps this week, difficult with a baby but we managed.   The price was the best we saw for a suite where we could put the kids to bed in a separate room and still be able to sit and watch tv or visit after they went to sleep. The room was large and they provided a crib which we were able to
Manager Response: Hi formertravelagent,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us and for posting a candid review. While I am glad that you had a great time at the pool and splash park, I was also concerned to read your comments about our staff. I understand your dismay and I am sorry. This is not the elevated experience that we wanted for all of our guests and I will make sure to share your comments with our team for necessary improvements needed on our end.  I still hope you would give us another chance in the future and this time, we will show you a better stay.  Mike F. Case Manager IHGService

Summary: I recently stayed at the hotel for a bussines trip and i discovered they charged me 300 dlls extra, i called them to check and they said that i had broken a TV, i tryed to explaine  that i didnt and that they seid everything was ok when i checked out. I don't think is fair that i get charged for something i didnt do, i wouldnt be here writting. I hope there is something that can be done.

room was nice, clean. water pressure was bad both in the morning and night. I dont think the 1 block from disney is accurate. about 15 mins through downtown disney, or a few mins less if you walk around the huge parking structure and take the tram. all and all it worked.

This is a convenient location, a short walk from Disneyland without paying the extortionate price of staying there.  Clean, big rooms.  Pool is nice.  There is a gas station next door that sells everything.

This hotel is a close 15-20 minute walk to Disneyland through downtown Disney.  I had booked my reservation with west jet and on the confirmation it had said we were getting a king room. However, upon check in the staff informed us that there were no king rooms available, which was unfortunate.  The rooms are dated and basic. Nothing fancy here.  Pool was always busy and filled with kids when we went, and breakfast was not worth the money. You are better off finding somewhere in downtown Disney to eat before the park. Not sure if we would stay again.
Manager Response: Hello Kallilynn,  Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to leave us a review. Exceptional service and quality amenities to ensure a carefree stay are what we aim to provide. I am sorry this wasn't the case on your recent visit due to the issues you had with the room allocated, pool and with the breakfast options. We value your candid feedback. I have shared your comments with our hotel management and I am confident steps will be taken in the future enhancement of our services and facilities. On the upside, I am glad that you found the hotel proximity convenient.  I hope you give us another try to make your next stay the best that it can be!  All my thanks,  Jonathan A.  Case Manager IHGService

Summary: Was ok I guess...  Pros: Plenty of parking, the kids liked the pool, wasn't loud (and we stayed on the first floor), strong AC and walking distance to Disneyland (roughly 15 mins)  Cons:  The staff was not really friendly, the food from the restaurant was not good, vending machine was not working  Overall, not sure if we will stay here again.
Manager Response: Hi John H,  Thank you for choosing to stay in our hotel and going out of your way to share your feedback. I appreciate your positive feedback about our parking space, the convenience of our location, and how the kids enjoyed our pool. We do take pride in catering to our guests' needs the best way we can. That said, I'm sorry if you found our hotel staff not pleasant and our food selection not to your liking.   IHG's goal is to provide consistent and exemplary guest satisfaction so your comments will certainly help us in filling in the missing gaps of our continued enhancements.  Even though your stay was not spotless, we do hope you give us another chance as we will definitely improve our services.  All the best,  Dhang R Case Manager IHGService

Summary: I‚Äôve never had anything but good things to say about Holiday Inn, until today. Rather, last night. This place is an absolute disaster, if I didn‚Äôt get in so late I‚Äôd have the energy to leave in the middle of the night. Issue #1 - This place has unfriendly staff. As if they assume they are doing all the Disneyland goers a favor to even bother to talk to them. #2 I‚Äôm a member of the IHG platinum club but here they don‚Äôt care. The room we were given would not pass for a cheap motel. The carpet has stains, the room after one use of the shower smells like rot. #3 The A/C in the rooms must be from the 70‚Äôs because I didn‚Äôt sleep at all. Gave up on this place at 3am. It felt like I was waterboarded by the constant endless noise. I tried sleeping with my special airplane earplugs and
Manager Response: Hi Cestovatel4,  Thank you so much for sharing your feedback about our hotel as we value your loyalty to IHG as our Platinum Elite member.   I am sorry to hear about the issues you had with the level of staff service, room amenities and cleanliness of the room. We strive to exemplify flawless environments and efficient services, and I am sorry this was not provided for you. I sent you a private message to ask more information about your stay.  Thank you again for your feedback as we value your loyalty to IHG. We hope to offer you a more pleasant stay in the future.  Best,  Zel N. Case Manager  IHGService

Summary: We were going to Disneyland for two days and staying one night so that we could have a close place to rest in between days.  When we arrived we were then told that there would be a hold on our credit card for $100 and that we would not get the charge removed for 7-10 business days.  Then we go inside the room and it was pretty clean but not in very good condition considering how much we spent for one night. The beds were pretty comfortable but we were extremely tired and our standards were pretty low at this point. We went to the free breakfast area in the morning and there was no cream or creamer for the coffee. There were hard boiled eggs that were sitting in a big bowl with no lid. It was kinda gross. The bread, donuts and waffles were a little stale. There was nowhere to sit
Manager Response: Hi 05ericad,  Thank you for trusting us for your travel needs.   I appreciate you bringing your concerns to our attention. I am disappointed to read that we fell short of your expectations with the issues at the breakfast area and the staff less accommodating. I would like to look into this further and have sent you an e-mail to get more information.    Your review is important to us and will help our hotel to host you better the next time you visit the area.  I hope for your usual prompt response!   Happy to help,  Virgil N. Case Manager IHGService

Summary: The first thing we noticed was the staff, they were great from the time we pulled up to the door until we left.  Always friendly and willing to go the extra to make sure you were happy!  We found the location great, only a block from Disney and there were plenty of restaurants nearby.  The room was nice, clean and comfortable. Would recommend staying here, we will should we get the chance!

Hotel is very dated, and needs serious updates and has lots of wear and tear.  If you are a seasoned traveler you will be disappointed. Rooms are not very spacious, but beds were comfortable.  However, they do try and keep it clean and the staff was very helpful.  They made a big mistake on my reservation and Erika in the front desk went out of her way to correct the mistake. Close to Disney, about 15 min. walk or ART bus stops in the front every 30 or so mins.  Breakfast is ok, wet/pool area is nice. $20/night parking.
Manager Response: Hi IME_Texas,   Thank you for leaving us feedback following your recent visit to the Happiest Place on Earth.   Although you found our beds comfortable along with our friendly service,  I'm sorry that you found our rooms dated.  I also applaud Erika's efforts in making sure that you're all set with your reservation.   Your feedback will not go unheard and your comments will help our management team to plan for future upgrades.   Cheers,   Tine B.  Case Manager IHG Service

Summary Heading: Good Location to Disney, Good Amenities
Summary: When we checked in we were greeted with pineapple water and a sparkling reception area with couches and a large screen TV with the Disney Channel running. The pool was right off the lobby as well as the restaurant, and restrooms. The restaurant had a buffet for 17 dollars complete with cooked to order omelets, parfaits, waffles, pancakes, fruit bar, sausage, bacon, eggs, oatmeal, cereals, assorted breads and pastries, potatoes, French toast, egg mcmuffins, and juice and coffee. The cooked to order omlet may have been the best I've had. The service was excellent. The served lunch and dinner as well. The gym was equipped with free weights and cardio equipment. They had a complementary business center with free printing. The room was in Stars theme and had a mini frig, microwave,

We changed our Marriott reservations to stay here so my son could enjoy the splash park for the first 2 days of our vacation only to find out When we arrived there was out of order signs without any notification on website or when we called to confirm reservation! When I asked the front desk staff if it would be available the only answer was ‚Äúwe don‚Äôt have an ETA as of yet‚Äù did not want to help accommodate us. We spent $300 for 2 nights specifically for the splash park never got a chance to use and the rooms are the size of a closet! Will not be staying here again! My husband was an IHG employee for years and knows that customers should be warned ahead of time if amenities are not available! Or at least compensated when they are not happy customers! This was a huge
Manager Response: Hi H6488KBlaurieb,  Thank you for always choosing our hotel for the first 2 days of your vacation. I also appreciate you sharing your experience.   We do our best to ensure our hotels are always clean, our service is always friendly and everything always works for all our family travelers. Regrettably, we've let you down because of the room size, and for the Splash park not being available. I certainly understand that your son was looking forward to our water park.   I've passed on your comments to our hotel housekeeping team so we can make the necessary changes to provide a better experience in the future.   I've also sent you a message in your mailbox discussing your stay further.  All the Best,  Kenneth F Case Manager IHGService

Summary Heading: Nearest to Disney Land Los Angeles
Summary: Holiday Inn has maintained its standards every where in the United States of America, their service is great, their Breakfast is worth having, as it contains all the stuff which one consumes it at home, like cereals, fruits, juices, breads, live omelette, just to name a few, it had laundry services as well for $3, swimming pool, gym and the location is perfect if you to visit Disney Land, it's hardly 10 mins walk, the area is so beautiful one can stay a week easily, there is a abundant parking space, the staff is very friendly and very welcoming nature and ready to help you at all times.

Summary Heading: Cleaned out our room before we checked out & poor customer service :(
Summary: This hotel presents like it has all kinds of amenities, but sadly their amenities are broken.  They advertise a fun splash pad for kids and yet the whole 3 days we were there it was broken, however it had been broken much longer.  The front desk kept saying someone would work on it but there wasn't anyone there and all staff kept giving different answers on how long it would be down or if someone was coming to work on it.    Also on the last day of our stay there, we got a flat tire, and were waiting for the tow truck to come.  We had breakfast down stairs and went back to our room to let the kids watch some TV to wait, only to find out the had already cleared out all of drinks and food, and started cleaning the room, at 10:45.  We had not checked out yet.  So when I asked the
Manager Response: Dear travelingwithsmallch,   I appreciate you for sharing your review about your recent stay.  We are very sorry that you did not experience an exemplary hotel stay because of the level of service your have received. I apologize for any inconvenience you might have experienced. I have sent you a private message to reaffirm my apologies.  I very much hope that you will grant us the opportunity to prove ourselves again.  Best Regards,  Ben W. Case Manager IHGService

Summary: It's been two years since I was last here and I still love the convenience of location (about 5 min walk to Downtime Disney) and the friendliness of the staff.  This is the first time my IHG preferences weren't granted. I always ask - and usually get - a room away from the elevator.  I was surprised when realised my room was only one door away from it this time. It was still okay, but made the difference between me giving 4 stars or 5 stars.  The room itself seems to be for wheelchair access, so not like the rooms I've had here in the past. It was spacious at entry point and bathroom, then tight and cramped around the bed area. I always find it weird when I'm given wheelchair access rooms. If someone needing this room needed accommodation at the last minute, they might not get

Summary Heading: Great location, great price, very friendly, clean, and 1 block from Disney
Summary: My daughter and I stayed here for an unplanned visit after a soccer game that ended a tourney early.  Booking was easy, and when we checked in very late the desk felt bad and waived the parking fee.  We usually stay on the opposite side of the park by the main entrance, but this hotel is on the Downtown Disney side.  It's more like two blocks from the park because the blocks are so large, but still a short walk.  I didn't see any porn on the TV, which isn't always the case with Holiday Inn's.  This one actually is family friendly.  At night we could actually see fireworks from the hotel.  Would stay here again.

We stayed for 6 days at this hotel and every thing was super.  Staff is very courteous and helpful, break fast is fresh, location is superb and the pizza is just great   The only thing is that there is no element of Disney theme

This hotel was just short distance to Disney. Had amazing breakfast and food choices. There was a target and other food places not far away. Hotel had a pool and very secure parking area.  Would stay again.

The property is OK. No luxury just the basic needs to have a place to lay your head and clean up. The pool is basic and loses sun early in the day. The on site restaurant is descent and reasonably priced. Staff everywhere and in all areas of the property were always friendly and helpful, extra shout out to them on jobs well done!  Walking distance to Disney gates was an easy 20-25 minutes depending on security line up. They do have a shuttle for a surcharge should anyone have tired legs at the end of a day at the parks.   Bottom line, if you want to take the family on a special trip to Disney and are on a tight budget, this is a great place to consider!
Manager Response: Hi lisserb,  Thank for choosing to stay with us and for sharing your experience. I am glad that our hotel was able to meet your expectations especially with our staff service. I know we still have a lot of room for improvement so if you have any other comment or suggestion, feel free to let us know.  Thanks again and we hope to see you again in the future so we can show you the joy of travel.  Mike F. Case Manager IHGService

Summary: The hotel staff were very friendly.  Check in and out were also easy.  The hotel is a clean place to stay and get a good nights rest.  On the night we arrived, we ate at the hotel restaurant which had a great staff and the food was good.  The walk to Disneyland is a good mile, but it‚Äôs a flat, easy walk.  First, you get to Downtown Disney and go through security (the lines are long in the morning).  You walk through charming Downtown Disney to get to the gates of Disneyland where the lines move the people through much quicker.   If you are looking for a basic hotel, I recommend this place.

We stayed here for 7 days (leaving today). A few hiccups that were rectified quickly by the front desk. We were very fortunate that our room when we arrived. The staff were very friendly and seemed to really care about their guests. The breakfast buffet in the restaurant was excellent, pretty much the same foods daily but something for everyone. The pool and hot tub were great after a long day of walking! Close enough to Disneyland, about a 15 minute walk going to Downtown Disney. However, coming back took us a bit longer as we're out of shape, tired and sore feet/legs (much better on day 6). I don't think we'd hesitate to stay here again...the staff, amenities and distance to Disneyland make this hotel a pleasure to stay at.

Our room was good and well maintained.  Staff was friendly, especially the restaurant staff.  We enjoyed the distance from Downtown Disney, which was about a 15 minute walk.  The rates were a little confusing, we were charged for parking even though we did not have a car, but we were told that if they removed the parking, our rates would be higher.

Loved staying here, great location and good value. We didn't have a car so walking to Disneyland was vital. The facilities are great. Rooms are nice and clean. Pool and spa are heated. Meals are good quality & good value

Overnight stay with my daughter and her friend while visiting Disneyland. The room had very comfortable beds, good facilities. The breakfast buffet was good. The shuttle picked us right from the entrance, so it is really conveniently located for anyone visiting Disneyland. Will definitely return here during our next trip.

Summary Heading: Spacious suites fun themes and walking distance to disney!
Summary: Love love this hotel. Family of6 stayed in 2 bed suite... was so much bigger than I expected and 7 min walk to disney entrance so no driving or parking needed. Breakfast was very nice and friendly if needed. Master bedroom huge and huge bathroom. Twin room was 2 large beds plus bathroom.sofa bed in living area and mini kitchen. Absolutely great for our large family.

We've been here two nights with one more to go. This is an option on par with the disney hotels. It is a short walk to the Monorail or the Disney entry gates. Very clean, the staff are lovely, and the beds are super comfortable. Nice pool and water play area. All in all whilst its smaller than the Disney ones, the cost is more reasonable. The food is reasonably priced a delicious. We will definatley be back next time we are in the country.

Summary Heading: Great value and walking distance to the park
Summary: The highlight of the hotel is the ease of walking to Disney. It‚Äôs approx a 5 minute walk to the downtown Disney entrance along a quiet street with wide sidewalks. However, other than Disney, there isn‚Äôt anything else for services in the direct area of the hotel. We found we ate in the park or downtown Disney area but if you‚Äôre looking for other options, you‚Äôll have to rent a car or ride share. The hotel does have a nice restaurant with great options and reasonable prices for breakfast, lunch and supper as well as a great gift shop for souvenirs and snacks.   We had two rooms and found both clean and spacious. There‚Äôs nothing really flashy here. It‚Äôs been renovated and gives you all the basics including comfy beds and bath and body works products. Rooms were quiet but as in most

The hotel is in the back of downtown Disney. One could walk directly into the Disneyland Park. The check in was easy and I got my room key to the third building. Parking for handicap could be better. I could not locate any parking for the disabled in the evening. I double parked to allow my passenger to exit before I could locate parking. The room has a microwave and huge refrigerator which I appreciated as the Hampton did not offer a microwave in the room or in the lobby. I was able to use the microwave to heat up some food. My room had two double beds with a 32 inch LG flat screen. Most hotels seem to offer LG tv‚Äôs which I have found to be very good. The room offered a table and a dresser. The wash basin was outside the shower area allowing guests to clean up easily. The
Manager Response: Hi n w,  Your stay with us is much appreciated and your thoughts are valuable. On the upside, I am happy to hear that you find our hotel accessible to Disneyland Park and that the check in process was swift. Sad to say that you find parking at night a hurdle and our bathroom facility needs some updating. I will make sure to share your feedback to the team so it can be used for further improvements. We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back on your future leisure travels to this location.   Thanks,  Ronald R. Case Manager IHGService

Summary Heading: Just ok but suited our needs for a quick trip
Summary: We came and stayed here for two nights and had the two bedroom Disney princess suite. It was cheesy but quite cute. Pink duvet covers with princess pillows, princess mural on the wall with Disney princess stick on decorations on the doors. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable.  One bedroom with a king and the second with two queens. It had a little fridge (no freezer), microwave and sink in a kitchenette area.  A sitting area also between the two bedrooms which was nice. Looked out onto the splash pad (there is also a pool here too separate from the splash pad)   My complaint about the room would be that there was only one bathroom for the two bedroom room and it was IN the kids room. Since they go to bed before us it didn‚Äôt make sense to have to go through their

Beds are nice, breakfast buffet is good and about a 15 minute walk to Disneyland. At check in I was never told that kids' breakfast buffet is not included and that parking is $15 a night. My first day I had to pay $25 for my daughter's buffets (even after informing the front desk that I was only told I had to give the restaurant my name and room number). They "solved" the issue by giving my kids a free buffet the next morning. The day of checkout I notice a charge of $52 on my bank account. After asking at the front desk I am informed that parking is $15 a night. Again, not told this at check in. After asking to speak with a manager, she proceeded to tell me "it's hotel policy", "it's on our website", "booking.com says it", "I will remind the staff to inform customers at check

Good for a close place to crash near Disney. Nothing bad about the hotel. A little longer walk than they claim. Next door Marriot is much better and newer but also more expensive. Building 3 Rooms and bathrooms are tight. Beds are hard. Parking is $15/day. Surprisingly quiet, which is a big plus. Breakfast, lunch, and dinner until 10pm at in hotel restaurant.
Manager Response: Hi louisp751,  Thanks for choosing the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim (1 BLK/Disneyland) for your lodging needs and for leaving us feedback.  I'm happy that you enjoyed that prime location of our property. These types of reviews keep us motivated to be on top of our game. But, I know that you had issues with the quality of our beds and the parking fee, and I'm so sorry. Our room should be comfortable and I know that this time, it wasn‚Äôt. As IHG wants to make your every stay flawless, your thoughts are taken into account and are shared with our hotel management to be used as a reference to better your next experience with us.   Your feedback will definitely help us towards bettering our services and we hope to host you again soon, louisp751.  All the best,  Peter J. Case Manager IHGService

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay for Disneyland
Summary: Stayed here 4 nights due to the location - 10 to 15mins walk to Disneyland/Adventure Park and 15 or so mins drive to Knotts Berry Farm Theme Park.  Staff are friendly, parking is reasonable.  The restaurant is good for breakfast with a good choice of cooked and fresh food.  Kids eat free off the Children's Breakfast Menu.  We ate there for dinner one evening and had no complaints food was enjoyable.  Room was reasonable and the quality of the bed was excellent.  An excellent choice for the area

Summary Heading: Beds comfy, if you like bright lights, fireworks and broken faucets
Summary: Got rooms for our team for Expo West expecting what I‚Äôve experienced at other Holiday Inns around the US, updated, modern, clean, etc.  rooms are minimally updated, musty, smoky smell through halls, bright halogen lights from pool glare into room unless you pull the black out shades...too it off with surprise firework shows a block away that sound like street shootout from the room. Then final night bathroom faucet snaps off while brushing teeth.  That‚Äôs the negative cuz I‚Äôm up waiting for maintenance to fix while sink runs. Positives, 5 min. ride to convention center, very comfy pillows and nice beds with cozy sheets/comforters that are very clean. Bar/restaurant downstairs has decent food and friendly bar tenders.  Breakfast buffet is also decent with multiple options.

Summary Heading: Holiday Inn with easy acces to Disneyland
Summary: This hotel is every bit the standard for Holiday Inn.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  We found the Onyx restaurant staff to be very friendly and professional.  The room and public areas were clean and well maintained.  Metro busses (ART) stop here for easy access to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland and quiet too
Summary: The best place to stay in the Disneyland area. Quiet and convient with a great helpful staff and very nice rooms. Easy walk to the parks through Downtown Disney and great for families that want to head back to the hotel for a break.

We loved the hotel itself, the rooms were very comfortable. My little one loved the splash pad and keeps asking to go back to the hotel. This was such a short walking distance to Downtown Disney and Disneyland. Very convenient. The check in and out was very quick and the staff was very friendly. The only reason I took points away was due to breakfast; we thought we had purchased the room that included breakfast but was very rudely told that we did not. We overheard a few other families going through this as well mostly because the man seating people was raising his voice very rudely at everyone who made this mistake. We ended up purchasing the buffet anyways and wish we hadn't because the food was cold and bland and the host/waiter had an attitude the entire time, especially

We wanted a hotel within walking distance to Disneyland and this hotel was perfect! Front door to Downtown Disney was about 15 minute walk with two kids in tow. Front door to park gates through Downtown Disney was 30 minutes walk. Walk on a sidewalk the entire way which was safe and well lit. Hotel buffet breakfast was simple but sufficient. Miguel in the dining room greeted us warmly every morning and provided the best hospitality and service we've had in any restaurant recently. We took a Lyft ($6 each direction) to the Anaheim Packing District- worth a visit for great food and drink.options. This is an older hotel with recent surface upgrades (newer carpet, freshly painted walls) as well as upgraded beds and linens. Front desk was friendly and helpful.

Due to severe weather warnings and road conditions, we had to stay in Anaheim.  It was late (11:30pm) but were able to find rooms at this hotel.  Checked-in after midnight and the front desk clerk was wonderful!  Had a very restful stay!  My 5-year old grandson left his teddy bear in the hotel room.  The teddy bear was given to him by the hospital after his surgery a year ago.  The hotel staff found the bear and is sending it to him!  THANK YOU Holiday Inn for showing compassion in my grandson's time of need!  We've stayed at this hotel previously and they have never let us down! Great hotel and very close to Disneyland!

Good hotel and great location. Wish there were more quiet spaces in the building. Nice family location, and great for kids. Nice pool area too. The access to the building is good, given the OC traffic.

We stayed here because we booked wrong at the paradise pier and Trip Advisor gave it a 4/5. I would give it a 2/5! It wasnt horrible but not worth the money. 1st the breakfast pkg is not worth the trouble. We have 5 in our party, when I ordered the pkg it didnt say it was only for 2 and the kids eat free. It also didn't state that the kids eat off of a separate menu with tiny portions they made us pay for our oldest son $18 for a not so great meal. 2nd the laundry, it's a pay per use using an app you have to download "pay range". The laundry is $3 per service, but the money you apply is only in $5 increments. You will waste money unless you do 5 loads. 3rd we got the "Starwars Suite" what a joke! It was stickers on the walls and the posters were horribly hung and in the wrong
Manager Response: Hi Rebekahontherun,  Thank you for taking the time to leave us a rating and sharing your experience.   We love being able to offer convenient amenities and strive to make sure that every guest has an amazing stay at our hotel. I understand you were disappointed with the room you received and level of service delivered by the hotel team. After a tiring journey, one would expect an accommodating demeanor with a genuine interest in assisting guests, forgive us for not delivering the best. Please know that I have forwarded your comments to the concerned department for necessary training.   We want nothing more but to provide you the best we can give whenever you visit us. Your comments about the breakfast package, pool towels and laundry service is being reviewed by the hotel management, and the involved department will refine how they should handle situations.  You are our most valued guest and your relationship with IHG matters. I hope you will reconsider another visit so we can show you the genuine IHG experience.  Best,  Zel N. Case Manager  IHGService

Summary: They have a microwave, refrigerator, and coffee maker in the rooms. No free breakfast or free parking. Nice safe clean area & location, convenient store nearby. No benches for smokers to sit that I saw.

Summary Heading: Good for families. Uneven staff service.
Summary: Stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. Rooms were spacious and beds/pillows very comfortable. Bathroom quite small. Front desk wasn‚Äôt very courteous (day 1) or professional (day 3). Payed $612 for 3 nights and would expect a better service.
Manager Response: Hello Papersen,  Thank you for your feedback regarding your stay at Holiday Inn Anaheim (1 Blk/Disneyland¬Æ), CA. We take our guest comments very seriously and always strive to provide comfortable and friendly accommodations. We appreciate your nice comment about the room size and the pillow.   On behalf of the hotel, I'm sorry we fell below your expectation regarding the front desk service which was unacceptable. We will address this concern. We hope you give us a chance in the future to show you how great our hotel is.   Sincerely,   Orlando   Case Manager  IHGService

Summary: Let me start off by saying how much not only my kids but my wife as well enjoyed this hotel. We argued the whole time about getting a Disneyland hotel resort room but that price was CRAZY! we were staying for 2 days and I couldn't see myself spending $1000 on 2 days just for rooms. (We live in California we just hate the morning traffic) Once I told her they have Disney rooms she knew out Son would not even know the difference. Thats exactly what happen he WAS IN AHHHH!!! right next to the Parking lot of Disneyland, Not to mention the Firework show he got to see Right from our Hotel like we were in the park. Thats just about the location. The staff was great too. Obviously most hotel workers are nice. But even when we got there at 12 Midnight The front desk worker (She wore

This hotel has a few perks and a few irks. But that is every hotel right? The proximity to Disneyland is great. We had a party of 4 and enjoyed our stay just fine. There were lots of families enjoying the pool area and all the touchs of Disney kept everyone in the magic. This is not a place for early birds or light sleepers since it is so close to Disney and it sounds and feels like you are right next to the fireworks being shot of at the park, but if you head to bed after that you should be just fine. We had a 2 bedroom, 2 bath suite that had a Pixar theme. Very cute, not exactly Disney level but nice for the money. We had more than enough room to spread out and everyone had their own place to sleep along with the 2 bathrooms for everyone to get ready without being on top of

When we checked in, we found roaches in the room. They were crawling on the kitchen area counter and on the walls. When we informed the people at the front desk, they didn't seem surprised. We went to a different hotel.

Stayed here with the family for a visit to Disney. Good location. Good hotel, nothing out of the ordinary. Staff were nice, hotel was clean. Pool was a nice temperature and hot tub was nice. Restaurant has decent food, servers were excellent.

We have stayed at this Holiday Inn property on 3 different occasions. It is a Convenient location near the Disneyland Park. We have had breakfast at the Onyx restaurant and twice had Miguel as our server. He is an excellent server. Always smiling and greets the customer warmly. He has a positive energy about him. I really appreciate a server that remains attentive, happy and demonstrates humor amid circumstances with families that at times have children that maybe a little tired and cranky. He is positive representative for the Holiday Inn.

Summary Heading: 2 block Walking distance to Disneyland Tram
Summary: I loved this hotel!!  We chose the mickey themed suite room and it was gorgeous. Mickey themed wall hangings, clocks, bedding, pillows, light switches and the shower curtains!  My nieces didn't want to leave the room because of the decor.  And we loved walking down the hallway and seeing the different decorated room doors ( Frozen, Pirates & Star Wars ).  Plus the hotel has a splash park.  You do have to pay for parking but it is cheaper than the Disneyland parking structures.  Everything was clean and the sofa sleeper was comfortable.  We had breakfast in the morning and they make Mickey Mouse pancakes üòç
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us during your vacation. Were thrilled to hear you enjoyed our themeded suites, we do hope you visit is again soon.

Summary: We stayed three nights and had a King-size room. The room had new, comfortable beds. Complimentary coffee in room and maid service very good. Front desk very nice and helpful. We were able to purchase our Disneyland Park Hoppers at the front desk with a $10 discount each ticket. The restaurant had a great breakfast in the morning with quick service. The only downfall I thought was the long 20 minute walk to the park. Years ago, most hotels offered complimentary shuttles to the park, but those days are long gone. Now everything costs an arm and a leg! If you wanted to catch a shuttle, it would cost you an extra $5.50 a day per adult! We even had to pay an extra $12/day to park our car on site. This was the only issue I had with Holiday Inn Express.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay at the Holiday Inn and Suites. I must agree with you about our comfy beds, it's like sleeping on clouds after a long day at Disneyland. We do hope that you stay with us again on your next vacation.

Summary: I would say for a budget hotel, this place is perfect. I went in not expecting much and was pleasantly surprised. Check in was a breeze and the staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was kept very clean and it was nice to have a fridge. The beds were comfortable and I was excited to have a firm pillow option, most hotels pillows are too soft. The walk to the park was short(ish), especially to downtown Disney. It was quick getting into Disneyland just by hopping onto the monorail and walking to California Adventure took about 20 minutes. We spent some time at the splash pad and my kids had a blast. If you want a clean and comfortable room at a good price, I completely recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying wit us during your vacation. As I've mentioned before we do have comfortable beds so you may get a good nights rest after a busy day at Disneyland. We look forward to seeing you again when you visit the Anaheim area.

Summary: We stayed for 2 nights whilst visiting Disneyland. Front desk staff were great and so were staff in the restaurant/ bar. Breakfast / evening meal were good high quality and drinks in bar were reasonably priced- the prices for food drinks increased on the second night as new menu had been introduced. The rooms had new beds and furnishings however the bathroom needed updating- air conditioning was very noisy. Lobby and restaurant were well decorated but hallways/ lifts were dated. Only $7 in an Uber to Disneyland. We would definitely return!

Front desk staff was very polite and efficient. The restaurant wait staff were always great. The hotel was clean and had everything I needed. Breakfast in the restaurant was OK, but pizza later in the day was better! We had room service a couple times. Breakfast was good, another time the sliders were very very dry. Overall, a good experience.

Stayed here for three nights as part of ATI Western Discovery Trip. Hotel was clean and comfortable. All staff very friendly and helpful. Most people staying here were families going to Disney. The hotel is a bit remote with nothing much around. The nearest supermarket was about a ten minute walk which was the local petrol station. There is a huge food mall about a mile away with a good selection of restaurants.  The pool was very nice.
Manager Response: Were are a hidden gem on the back side of Disney away from the hustle and bustle. We thank you for choosing to stay with us during your magical vacation. We do hope to see you soon.

Summary Heading: Average hotel - disappointing check in experience
Summary: Arrived for a 6 night stay at start of a 18 night trip. Male clerk checking us in knew we were gold card holders but made no mention of it to us, not even a welcome, just barked out ‚Äúlast name‚Äù as the first words when we approached his counter. No safety boxes in room. None available in reception but he offered us a plain brown envelope to store all our cash, passports and valuables in the manager‚Äôs office. This wasn‚Äôt acceptable as we had no control so we had to check each morning then carry our valuables to the theme parks with us each day as a safety box never came available during our stay. Staff were on the whole helpful apart from our check in experience. Breakfast buffet was good value, albeit only for 2 of our 3 adults in the room. Rooms were clean , comfortable and
Manager Response: Mr. Colin B, thank you for sending your feedback requiring your past stay. I apologize for the way you were treated as a loyal Gold member. Overall, I'm happy you had enjoyed most of your stay. Again your feedback gives us the opportunity to correct so issues there are. We hope to see you again in the near future.

Summary: Was very good place.clean and quiet. the sleep was amazing.  nice size rooms and the fridge and microwave was a bonus. Down fall restaurant closed afternoon, and no other restaurant in the area  Great little store and vending machines in hotel. pool and hot tub nice and clean  I would recommend this place

Summary Heading: "Those People" At Holiday Inn - Run A Great Hotel !!!
Summary: I stayed at this property fairly recently, when rev-par totals, occupancy %, and ADR is typically higher than most months of the year. I arrived at the hotel late, check-in staff was courteous, efficient, and quick. When I 1st pulled up by the blinding, bright green lights out front to check in- I thought to myself.. Oh No !!! What A Dump !!! What A Total Flophouse !!! But that just wasn't the case. Room was comfy, decent sized- and the buttons on both the TV remote & coffeemaker (A Keurig, how nice) worked, so I was a happy camper. A ping-pong table would be great, if they could afford- that is. Otherwise, The GM here seems to have a good handle on things.
Manager Response: Todd, thank you for staying with us during your vacation. You remind me of a GM as well as you talk about rev-par and ADR's !! Are you in the same industry? Again I'm glad you enjoed your stay and we hope to see you and your family again real soon.

Summary: The reviews of this hotel said it was 1 block from Disney. Yes it is over the fence! But if you plan on walking to the main gate entrance to the park, plan on walking a good half mile! Brand new beds, very nice and comfortable, but rooms were small.  2 QUeen beds and a chair, no sofa in the room.
Manager Response: Hi GrandmaCy,  Thank you for sharing your experience, I'm pretty sure you enjoyed exploring the area. Being a Disney fan myself, I know how exciting it is to be in close proximity to the area. I am happy you like our hotel location and comfy beds.  A comfortable, welcoming room makes such a difference, especially when you are away from home. I understand you had difficulties moving around the room due to its dimension. Most travelers do expect hotels to provide more value-for-money services and facilities.You feedback will be shared to the involved management for future upgrades as it is crucial to refining our guest encounter experience.   Again, thank you for sharing your review. I hope that this experience doesn‚Äôt deter you from visiting our hotel again.   Best,  Zel N. Case Manager  IHGService

Summary: Located a healthy walk from the main gates, but close to Downtown Disney and Disneyland Hotel, this hotel is situated in a very unique location of Anaheim and the Disneyland good neighbor hotels. If one would be able to walk a straight line starting from the hotel it would honestly take you less than 10 to get into the parks. However, I would be lying if I said it was a 10 minute walk.
