I would honestly say it is about a 30 minute walk to the front of the parks. They do offer a bus that does a great job getting to and from the hotel, and it has A/C!  One major positive of this hotel is the staff who work at the front desk and the bar/restaurant area. I do not want to use their names (they are people with lives), however each group is very welcoming and willing to go above and

This is a budget hotel but it is clean and comfortable I think the 1 block to Disneyland could be rather streached it is a good 20 minutes walk coming from London I would expect a block to be 5 minutes or less. It is approximately $15 by taxi or uber to the main enterence
Manager Response: Bags52, the walk can be about 15 minutes from our hotel to the main entrance of Disneyland, about a 10-12 minute walk from the Holiday Inn and Suites to the monorail station or the tram. Being Disney is a big park, the blocks are a bit larger. We do appreciate you staying with us during your vacation. Please come back to visit us when you in the Anaheim area.   Thank you

Summary: Stayed for a couple days with my family. Did not have the best experience:  Pro: "Close" to Disney, affordably priced, clean rooms and suites, city bus stops at the hotel that takes you to Disney. You can watch the fireworks from the parking lot. Staff was friendly.  Cons: I can only tell you what happened to me: Arrived, got my key and directions to the room. Went to find my room to find that it is on a floor that does not have an elevator. When I went back to talk about it, the woman behind the desk told me that there was no elevator and no other suite in the hotel available for the nights that I booked. I asked if there was a disclaimer anywhere as someone in my party has movement issues and they said that they would suggest it to management, which is there their typical
Manager Response: Hi drumclub,  All guest feedback is important and welcome as it helps us focus on the areas that need improvement. I am elated to read that you enjoyed your interaction with our friendly staff and appreciated the cleanliness of our rooms. Guest satisfaction is important to us and we try our hardest to make sure all of our guests have a rewarding experience at our hotel.   Although, I am sorry to hear that the absence of an elevator, television remote function and noise from the pool dampened your overall stay. Please know that your comments are being reviewed by the hotel's management and appropriate action will be taken.   Again, thank you for sharing your experience. We do hope to have the opportunity of hosting you again at any of our properties as we would love to have you as our guest again.   Best,  Zel N. Case Manager  IHGService

Summary Heading: Good place to sleep after a long Disneyland trip
Summary: We basically booked this hotel last minute after some other plans to crash at a friends house fell through.  We just needed this hotel to basically sleep at after a long day at Disneyland and then drive home early the next morning.  I needed something budget friendly and relatively clean.  I would say that is what we got.  It is definitely not a high end hotel so don't expect that.  Our room was pretty small.  It was just a basic room with two full beds. Parking is $12 which is fine.  All hotels in this area will charge you for parking.  The plus to this parking is that there is plenty of it and it seems pretty safe.  We have stayed in hotels around here where parking is limited and you wonder how safe your belongings will be that night.  Also, the hotel is not on the main
Manager Response: Thank you Mr. James for your feedback. We are a hidden gem that is not on the main street of Disney like you mentioned. We will be in the process of doing some upgrades to our hotel soon.So we do hope to see you again when you come back to the Anaheim area.

Summary: Outstanding customer service is the reason for the four-start rating.  Otherwise, I would have given it a three.  It's a very tired hotel; not quite old and dingy.  It is well-kept up, that is the grounds.  Lots of places for the kids to play.  I would never stay here on business or a couple getaway.  I should say the price for a IHG was commendable.  I had to stay here in an ER situation and the rate was $85 when making reservations.  I, being a Spire member was upgraded to a fun suite!!!!  It was a Disney Princess suite and, after such an emotionally hard day, I forgot about it for just a little bit.  Again, the room was tired and old, but they did try.  Oh, this complex is HUGE!  Many buildings, lots of floors.    The con, I didn't see anywhere when I made my reservation that
Manager Response: Thank you fairgirl59 for taking the time to send your review. Were glad that it did soot your needs during your ER stay. We do hope to come back when you visit the Anaheim area.

Summary Heading: Good enough but doesn't seem as nice as the Marriott Next Door
Summary: Had a play area, close to Disneyland and everything was "fine" but then you look over at the Marriott and see a bigger play area and think about all the things that could be inside there. It is cheaper so it's more a matter of what is your budget. To be fair, I haven't stayed at the Marriott. But of close places to Disneyland, this is one of our favorite and has more amenities for kids than say the Hyatt does.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us at the Holiday Inn and Suites on Walnut street. We hope to see you again in the future.

Summary Heading: Really good place to stay with a family for a Disney trip
Summary: Stayed here for 5 nights during a Disney trip with kids aged 4 & 7. Hotel was great for what we needed, pool and splash area for day off in the middle, regular busses to Disney, clean rooms, air con and decent beds, I would definitely stay here again if I went to Disney.

We stayed here for a few days in August. The room was lovely,, very clean. Beds very comfy. Breakfast was delicious üòã. Staff very helpful. Shuttle bus to Disney was excellent. Pool area was excellent too. Lovely pool bar with  very friendly staff. üòä
Manager Response: Good morning Nerak42, our breakfast is delicious I do have to agree. We are a hidden gem when its easy to walk not to crowded, but like you mentioned Anaheim has a shuttle if need. We do hope you come back and visit us again.

Summary: My son and I had our very first overseas holiday visiting CA, from Australia, We loved the hotel, very friendly staff ,nice family  restaurant ,amazing food ,with tv screens for the kids to watch ,the pool area was great, had out door spa and a few shelter shades also had water park for the kids they also have a gift shop,The room was spacious good size bathroom, beds are very comfortable ,Our room was cleaned daily towels changed every day  has laundry for visitors ,10 minute walk to Disney, close to bus stop, there is McDonalds, and other restaurants, shops  further down past Disney abt 15 min walk or 5 min by car...also has free wifi
Manager Response: What a memory with you and your son! This is where dream do come true, and memories are made. We thank you for choosing to stay with us, and thrilled to hear you enjoyed out amenities. We hope one day in the future you can come back.

Summary: Me and the kids like to hotel , since it has the water playground, nice restaurant for kids with tv screens in the table kids eat free , i like the  pizza  , good swimming pool but always crowded  , nice staff
Manager Response: You are right about our pizza, its a tasty meal after a long day at the park. We thank you Abdulla223 for choosing our hotel for your magical family vacation.

Summary: Checked in with a very pleasant woman.  Had an issue the next morning with our reservation and Luis at the front desk was incredibly rude and flippant about it.  He told us the manager was only there from 10:30 AM - 3:30 PM.  (What hotel manager keeps those kind of hours?) Well we weren‚Äôt going to leave Disney to come back and talk to them about it, so I asked him to please have the manager call us.  That was Monday morning.  On Wednesday morning, we got our bill and still had not heard from the manager.  How ridiculous!!!  Again I dealt with a kind woman at the desk who immediately took care of our issues.  Not sure why Luis couldn‚Äôt have just done that on Monday morning?  I don‚Äôt think he is in the right business based on his attitude toward the customers!    The hotel is fine

As others have said, the beds really are very comfortable, and you also have the option of a soft or firm pillow.  How cool is that?  The pool area is nice and front desk staff are helpful.  The hotel is on the #11 ART bus line, which is handy, because even though it's a relatively short walk, this has been a scorcher of a summer, so traveling on an air conditioned bus to/from Disneyland is great.  My only comment is that there's not a lot of food options in the immediate area, other than the hotel restaurant, and if you're vegan, there's not a lot of options.  It seems there's no grocery stores at all in the Disneyland Park area.  Wish there was a Whole Foods.
Manager Response: Jessica I agree the beds are super comfy here its like sleeping on clouds. Thank you for choosing to stay with is n your family vacation. There are grocery stores in the area but the closest Whole Foods is about a 15 minute drive. Well Jessica we'll see you again soon when you travel back to the Happiest Place on Earth !

Summary: I stayed here with my 3yo son and my mother. We enjoyed our stay - hotel was clean, on the smaller side but staff were helpful and it's a great location to walk to and from Disneyland easily. There is ample parking at the hotel which makes it easy especially travelling with a toddler.
Manager Response: Thank you Cat G for your comment. Were are a hidden gem in the Anaheim area. We look forward to seeing you on your next Disney vacation.

Summary Heading: Bigger than usual mini-fridge was great!
Summary: Overall, we enjoyed our stay.  1) OK service 2) Not the cleanest 3) Loved the location 4) Loved the bigger than usual mini fridge plus a micro! 5) Bathroom was small, but still nicer than the Hilton LAX hotel bathroom 6) My son loved the splash park!  1) Check in was easy and the staff were friendly. However, they told me breakfast was included with my stay. I showed up the next morning with my son, and they tried to charge me. I said they told me it was included, and it was not, but they gave me the first morning free. It was buffet for me, but not for my son. This was weird and annoying. I was glad it was free because it was not that great.  They did have carts you could use to help haul your luggage into your room. We appreciated that these were available. However, once we

Every single time that I go to the front door of this hotel for some reason I do feel comfortable and that is a pleasant feeling.   If you book breakfast plus 1,000 package then you Will know that you Will be getting 1,000 bonus points per night of your stay and a free breakfast for two adults.  To me, this is one of my favorite hotels!
Manager Response: This is your home away from home! I'm glad were able to create memories with you and your family. I will share this with the rest of our staff as well. Until next time  Abrelascajas, have a great rest of your summer.

Summary: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The beds are the most comfortable hotel bed I have slept in. The rooms are spacious and spotless. Breakfast is satisfying and the staff are great. Shuttle service is convenient.
Manager Response: Nancy I do have to agree with you about our beds. They are like sleeping on puffy clouds which is needed after a long day at Disneyland. We hope you visit us again when your in the Anaheim area.

Summary: This hotel is nothing fancy and luxury. The only thing that goes in its favor is its location. Try getting a hotel closer to Disney Park and the prices would be sky rocket high! This hotel is decently priced and is around 15-min walk to Downtown Disney. The breakfast is basic, but the staff is very good. The rooms are old and a bit dull. But again, if you are here for the park you are hardly going to be in the room. They have a small store on the ground floor which is open at specific hours and you can buy water and snacks from here.
Manager Response: Thank you Dipti for sharing your comments. We are that hidden hotel that's off the busy path. Come back soon.

Summary: It is very easy to get to Disney resort from here. You can purchase a bus pass  for one or three days. The bus comes right to the door every 20~30 minutes and loops around other hotels and goes to Disney. The room was spacious and clean. It had a fridge and microwave. It also has a nice pool.
Manager Response: Hi Hannah, we are a hidden gem off the busy Disney hustle and bustle. It is a easy  convenient walk or as you mention the ART bus can and will pick you up at the hotel for  fee. Hannah, we hope to see you soon and thank you for your feedback.

Summary: So we came in on a Sunday and left on a Tuesday we came back to the hotel from visiting the park to a uncleaned room the maid came and knocked and asked if we wanted her to clean we asked if she could come back and she said I‚Äôm about to leave Spanish then asked if we understood we said no but that isn‚Äôt entirely true she then proceeded to say ok bye and left we took a nap and called to the front desk and she came back and did very little cleaning then when we came back from the park later that night found not 1 but 2 roaches in the restroom that hadn‚Äôt been cleaned the hinges on the restroom door were almost completely rusted this isn‚Äôt the first time we‚Äôve found roaches at this hotel I don‚Äôt know why we came back and will never come back.
Manager Response: Derek, thank you for the feedback you experienced. I will share this with our maintenance department. I'm sorry you did not have an enjoyable time. I hope you can give us another try in the near future.

Summary Heading: Great service at a Nice Hotel
Summary: Stayed here on an emergency stop after the car broke down and couldn‚Äôt be repaired until the next day. Three frazzled adults and 3 cranky kids were warmly accommodated by a very friendly staff at the front desk. Shoon especially was so helpful. She up graded our room and offer help in storing our luggage and making arrangement for the next day while the car was being repaired. The wait staff in Onyx restaurant were also excellent. Emilio who waited on us at breakfast, was very attentive and handled the wants and needs of our party of 6 with a smile. The room was nice and the kids loved the water park area and the pool. Not far from Disneyland too!
Manager Response: Thank you for so much for your amazing five star review of our hotel! We truly appreciate your recognition of our Holiday Inn and Suites staff. I will gladly share this wit Shoon and Emilio. We all work very hard to give our guests the best service, and we love to make people feel like they are at home. We would absolutely love for you to stay with us next time you are in Anaheim! Thanks again!

Summary: This is a good place to stay.  Close to Disneyland and quiet.  Front staff were amazing!  Room was clean and comfortable, but in need of a redesign.  Bathroom is tiny, even for a suite such as the one we stayed in.  Be aware that you will need to pay ahead for parking with one of their "packages", or pay $15 per night.  Be aware that breakfast can be included with your package as well, otherwise you can pay extra after arrival.  Also be aware that "Kids eat free" is not part of their buffet, but a very limited menu with just a few things on it.  It is with the breakfast that we took issue.  Our first morning, we headed to breakfast.  We were seated and handed menu's for our two 12 year old's and told that my wife and I could hit the buffet.  The menu had two items on it for
Manager Response: Thank you Daddy chop for you and your family staying with during your vacation. I'm sorry you did not have a pleasant experience in our restaurant. I can see your frustration in this experience.  I will share this with our management staff.   Have a great summer

Summary Heading: Amazing Property, Amazing Staff - Long Walk
Summary: We stayed here for a weekend trip to Disney in June 2018.  We were very pleased with the spacious and clean updated rooms.  The beds - oh the beds were like sleeping on clouds as they had been recently been replaced from what we understood.  The staff throughout the stay were absolutely incredible, fun and full of energy.  We were able to check in about an hour early and our room was ready.  We utilized their bag storage upon checkout to get a few extra hours in the park before our flight left.  We noticed that the restaurant closed around 10, which doesn't help when you are hungry after a long day at the park, but very easily fixed by calling for pizza.  The only downfall we had with the hotel was that is is quite a hike to Disney, it would take anywhere from 15-25 minutes
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your wonderful comments. I am so thrilled that you enjoyed your time here while visiting Disneyland. We have such an amazing staff, and they work endlessly to keep our hotel in top shape,so I will share your comment with our staff and management. We would love to see you back!

Summary: Stayed here one night, fast check in and out, the room was clean and well stocked with enough towels, we did order a pizza from the restaurant, a large was 16 which was reasonably priced, it was very good and the service was quick, the pool and the splash pad area for the kids was very nice and was well stocked with towels. They do charge a 12 dollar daily parking fee which comes to 14 dollars after taxes, which I don't agree with if you are staying at their hotel but they all do now a days, it is a little far from the parks but you can walk to them or they do have a shuttle that you can take but it does charges a fee I believe, didn't use so not sure on the price. The washer and dryer are 2 dollars a load and soap is 2 dollars as well, would definitely stay again.

It is showing its age.  Clean and there is a restaurant with it.  The rooms are small and the bathrooms are especially small.  The place is clean and the beds are comfortable.  If you are staying here you probably not going to be spending anytime in your room.  We found the staff, for the motel and restaurant to be friendly and responsive to our requests.  Next comment is about price, one of the most important aspects.  The room was reasonable what will hurt you are the state imposed charges.  For  our two room stay those charges added $62.00  The room tax is 15% then there is anaheim tourism assessment then the california tourism assessment.   From my perspective those charges are way too much.    There is a shuttle bus that stops here, run by the town, not the motel.  It is a
Manager Response: JoeBrannin, Thank you so much for taking the time out of your day to write a review for our hotel; we appreciate it more than you know! We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay here,and we hope to be able to welcome you back next time you are in the area!  Warm Regards

Summary: Great place to stay and it's a 1-2 minute drive to the parking entrance to Disneyland or a 10 minute walk.  Our room was clean and easy to get to from the parking lot. Kids eat free for breakfast and they have tv's in the breakfast area for kids to watch cartoons while you eat.  You cannot beat the price and location.  The room features a microwave & mini refrigerator, free high-speed wireless internet, 32-inch HDTV, work desk, reading chair, Keurig coffeemaker, hair dryer, iron and ironing board.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us during your magical vacation. I'm glad you enjoyed our hotel and the amenities. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: Nice hotel, good rooms, good meals.Regarding distance to the parks, it's a matter of opinion that it's walkable, especially if you are seniors with grandchildren- if it wasn't for the Monorail we would not have made it!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us during your vacation.

Summary: Rooms lovely and clean and the valets and kitchen staff were great. Reception staff couldn't wait for us to leave. Any request was a bother, regardless of who we spoke to. We felt like an annoyance when asking the most basic questions and we felt like they couldn't wait for us to leave. Not the happiest place on earth, but good rates.
Manager Response: Thank you CaliHol18 for your feedback, I will share your comments with our management to better train our staff. I do hope you come back and give us another try. Please reach our if you have any other feedback to share at jenniferr@hianaheim.com

Summary: The staff is weird I ask to extend to 12pm n was told that i have to call in the morning of the day i check out Bed very good  Clean  Other then the staff all else is good Bed is good Lighting is bad  Room dark n not bright Breakfast have to pay but not nice Near disney  Can walk Food not good
Manager Response: I'm sorry to hear that we did not meet your expectations during your stay. I will share your feedback with other department managers so we may train our staff. If you like to reach me please contact me at jenniferr@hianaheim.com   Thank you

Summary: This Holiday Inn is just a short walk to Disneyland. Great location with plenty of restaurant choices on the way to the parks. Friendly and helpful staff.  Clean with a large area for the free breakfast. I recommend this to anyone and I will stay here again.
Manager Response: AZtraveler499, I'm thrilled to hear you had a great time with your family. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Pretty nice property. Walking distance to the park. But it‚Äôs tricky you have to walk 20 min to the entrance, for family with kids this is a pain in the neck. You could stay at other hotels in the vicinity, all with shuttle bus service, would haven been the same thing. Hotel itself is not bad at all, but this is the only Holiday Inn that doesn‚Äôt offer Spire Elite members breakfast during my last decade traveling with IHG group. Staff is nice and all, but I guess they are just too busy to care about frequent travelers.  One thing worth noting is the wet playground they‚Äôve got, kids would love it.

Nice hotel has newly been refurbished the beds and pillows were very comfortable. We had a very nice sleep. The hotel is literally around the block from Disney. Reception staff are nice and friendly. You have to pay for parking.

If you want to go to Disneyland, just stop right now and book this hotel! It isn't the most luxurious, but it does the job! The service is great and the rooms were kept very clean. The best part about it is that it is only a short walk away from Disneyland. If you don't want to walk the half mile, the ART system is about $5/person/ride and stops right in front of the hotel. Staying here saved my group a ton of money from parking in the actual park.  I have absolutely no complaints about this hotel. Great price, great location, and great service. If you're looking for a great deal for your trip to the most magical place in the world, book this hotel right now!
Manager Response: Thank you Ciarbucks for positive feedback. I will gladly share this with our whole team. We do hope you come back soon to this magical place.

Summary Heading: Just stop searching. This is the best deal
Summary: Second visit this year wanted to update my review.....If you can walk to the Disneyland Hotel parking lot you are pretty much at this hotel. It is a quiet walk down a beautiful tree-lined street in the shade. You were deposited into a security line that really has any people, and then you have the option to step onto the monorail and go right into Disneyland or grab a Starbucks and find your way into California adventure. This hotel is one of the best holiday inns I‚Äôve stayed in. They offer a pool,they offer an aquatic Play area for the young ones. They have a great restaurant and even a small takeout window on the poolside so you don‚Äôt have to make their lobby all wet.   They have at least four ultra comfortable pillows on the beds, they use a sheet and duvet system so you

Hotel rooms are just normal, and we even had their special "Avengers Suite" which just meant that there were Avengers posters on the wall. Lobby is nice and comfortable, they have a gift shop for Disney and snack items as well that is convenient. Did not try hotel restaurant because of price but it looks roomy. Hotel bar had pretty good menu but a bit pricey. I think it is just that you pay so much for a hotel room there there are a bit higher expectations. But the pool is very nice, hot tub is nice but small, and splash pad is great for kids! And location is great, because you can actually walk to Disneyland from it, albeit a long walk.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, it sounds like you had a magical time. We do hope to see you soon.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay close to Disneyland
Summary: Wonderful service and rooms.  It's close to Disneyland, but you should use the ART system since after a long day at Disneyland, it would be nice to have a ride back to the hotel.  Our Granddaughters loved this place and the pool is warm.  Breakfast is the normal buffet, if you get it included with your room price.  Kids eat free with paid adult meals.  When booking, book at their webpage and get the room, breakfast and parking (if you drive).  Great deals on the package deal.
Manager Response: SDD517, thank you so much for sharing your comments. It sounds like you had a magical stay with your family!! We do hope to see you soon.

Summary: The hotels rooms and bathroom are quite small and the amenities are limited, however, it's the prefect location for Disney. It's about a 7 minute walk from Downtown Disney which is perfect, no need to park, take a taxi or a shuttle. The staff can give you a Map outlining the route.  The WiFi at the hotel is free but very slow.  Our travel agent had booked us in for two single nights which meant that we needed to go back to the reception but a deposit down again and get new keys despite staying in the same room, which was annoying.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback Chloefarrell2018. It sounds like you had a nice vacation. We do hope to see you again real soon.

Summary: Had a day with friends at DisneyLand, they stayed on the property a the resort, but I had my dog with me so we stayed close by. This was a close location to the DownTown Disney entrance leading to both parks. You can see fireworks from the parking lot of the hotel in case you're not at the park. Dog was fin- plenty of grass, requested a handicap room- didn't get it. Remote only turned TV on, 2 ice machines were empty and I was too tired to try the third. Restaurant was decent, store inside the hotel has souvenirs and good selection of snacks and sundries. They also have menus for local places that deliver late.

Summary Heading: Quiet, comfortable, and close to Disneyland.
Summary: This is an older hotel in four buildings. The rooms were refurbished recently and are comfortable.    The bathroom is beyond small. The door practically hits the toilet when you open it and the shower was just plain bad.   The staff was great all around.  It‚Äôs about a 25 minute walk to Disneyland and it‚Äôs an easy walk.   Overall a really nice place to stay.
Manager Response: Thank you ConVino for sharing your feedback. I'd like to see what room you were in so we can take a look at the shower. Can you please contact me at jenniferr@hianaheim.com   We hope to see you again real soon.

Summary: My wife and I stayed 8 nights in March of this year. It was our 30th anniversary. The location was good, the room was clean and the staff friendly - especially the "breakfast guys". On our 5th day one of my wife's silver bracelets went missing from our room. Whether it was stolen or carelessly removed by accident we don't know. But we did seek to speak to a manager about the matter 3 days in a row. No manager reached out to us. We left feeling very disappointed. We are not demanding people, but were expecting an appropriate gesture from management that would affirm our loss and make us feel like we were important to the hotel as customers. After all, we gave them 8 days and nights of business. This never happened. The only recognition of our concern was by the hotel operator
Manager Response: Thank you for sharring your feedback. If you can please call me at 714.535.0300 or e-mail at jenniferr@hianaheim.com I'd like to follow up on the issues you had.   Thank you

Summary: We had the pleasure of staying at this hotel. Initially, we were booked to stay at another Holiday Inn nearby. When we were checking into the other hotel, they told us they were moving us to this hotel because of an incident. Upon arriving (at 12:30 am!), the clerk told us we would be staying in a family suite because the 2-bed rooms were all booked and that we would have to move in the morning. Exhausted, we took our key cards and went to bed. In the morning, I inquired at the front desk where we would be moving to. A bit confusing at first but Jennifer helped us sort out our room and allowed us to stay in the family suite instead of moving. It made a bumpy start to our vacation a whole lot better!!  The staff were friendly, our room was clean, and the food was great at the
Manager Response: Hello Pricegeorgegirl, I'm glad I had the pleasure meeting you and your family, and the rest of your vacation was smooth sailing. e hope to see you again real soon.

Summary: Poor hotel customer service. Checked in after a good but long day in the park and encountered the worst check in reception ever at the front desk. We had booked two rooms  with a written request for the rooms to be close but at the check in desk was told the rooms were far apart as we had not requested the rooms to be close?!?! The girl at the front desk (Alexa) was so rude and unhelpful it made check in a complete misery. We were given two Wi-Fi codes, neither of which worked, the carpet in the room was soaking wet, the clock radio crackled all night until we unplugged it.  Although it seamed a cheaper option we wish we booked somewhere else to stay and would not recommend this particular hotel to anyone.

Summary Heading: Convenient location at a great price
Summary: Provided nice accommodations for a family Holiday vacation.  Booked three rooms for six adults, and four children.  The staff was helpful, friendly and very accommodating for our entire stay.  Enjoyed their buffet breakfast at the hotel restaurant on several occassions and the food and service was very good.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us during your magical vacation. Our food here in the Onyx restaurant is delicious. We do hope to see you and your family very soon.

Summary Heading: Great Family Friendly Hotel close to Disney
Summary: This was a very family friendly hotel within easy walking distance of Downtown Disney and the two Disney sites.  The restaurant had a varied and child-friendly menu.  The swimming pool was large and great for families to relax around after a hectic day in the Disney parks.  And an extra bonus - you could view the Disney fireworks from the hotel. There was a good guest laundry facility.   The staff were very family friendly.
Manager Response: Good morning norfolkmgs2017, thank you for choosing to stay with us on your magical vacation.

Summary: Unfortunaly selected this hotel for a family trip to Disneyland. Checked-in yesterday, in theory they charged the 5 nights I‚Äôll stay here. Today my room card didn‚Äôt work, so went to the front desk, they reporogramed them and I asked if there was some problem with the payment, they confirmed everything was ok. Asked because it is common that my bank HSBC rejects charges in foreign countries based on ‚Äúsecurity reasons‚Äù. Later they called me to say there was a problem with my payment and agreed with the lady to go in the morning to solve it. Called my bank to see if there was a problem, but the bank‚Äôs call center was already closed. Next act, a POLICEMAN is knocking at my room‚Äôs door at 23:30 hours asking me to go and solve the problem or to leave the room! Yes, they sent the
Manager Response: AMorenos ~ I'm so sorry to hear about what happened. I'd like it if you   have a moment to contact me directly so I can find out more information on your experience. You can email at jenniferr@hiananheim.com or  714.535.0300 ext # 601  I look forward to hearing from you soon.  Thank you

Summary Heading: Comfortable quick overnight stay in Anaheim
Summary: We made a last minute booking at Holiday Inn Anaheim for a one night stay on our way from San Diego to Santa Clarita. It was a quick trip but managed to find time to walk to downtown Disney (about a 10 minute walk) and enjoyed some time by the hotel pool with a drink from the bar. Ordered pizza to take back to the room which was pretty delicious.  The room was big and the beds were comfortable.  The hotel has all of the amenities you would need for a family trip to Anaheim.
Manager Response: Thank you Jemma for staying with us on your quick trip up north. The pizza is a winner here for a quick delicious meal. Come visit us soon.

Summary Heading: Perfect for our family Disney trip
Summary: This hotel was perfect for our family of four for our Disney trip. When we weren't at the parks, the kids loved the splash pad and the heated pool. The room was spacious enough and the beds & pillows were very comfortable. We appreciated the mini fridge and microwave in the room. We walked to Disney and Cal Adventure from the hotel. It is a long walk but doable for us with kids in stroller. The walk to Disneyland monorail entrance is shorter than the walk to main entrance of the parks. This hotel was a great value for the money and we would definitely stay here again for a future Disney trip.
Manager Response: Thank you Yogalawer10, for choosing the Holiday Inn and Suites. It sounds like you had a magical time on your family vacation so we do hope to see you again next time.

Summary Heading: Very disappointing, didn't get what we paid for
Summary: I was very excited about staying in a Star Wars suite after we saw the pictures on the website, but it was very disappointing. The beds looked nothing like either of the rooms shown online, and the room only had a few decorating touches that made it special. For the difference in price between the character suites and regular suites, it was extremely disappointing. Additionally, they gave us the wrong room at first. We were given a regular king suite instead of the Star Wars double queen suite we booked. When we went back to the front desk to get it corrected, it took a while for them to find us the correct room. And the staff at the front desk at check-in was not overly friendly. I was also disappointed in the breakfast that we had paid for with our reservation. The room was
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback, kids do eat free with a paying adult off the kids menu 12 and under but the buffet is not included. Your correct the entrance is about a mile, we are about 1 block however it's a big block. We have the advantage of being on the quite side of Disney which makes it convenient for our guest.   Thank you again Amanda B for sharing your thoughts I will also share your comments with the rest of the staff. Please feel free to reach out if you have further questions or concerns @ jenniferr@hianaheim.com  Thank you

Summary: Staff: They were very accommodating, from housekeeping to the front desk. We requested for early check-in and check-out which were both granted (mainly because we are IHG members).   Cleanliness/Room: There is room for improvement but it was still pretty clean. The rooms were small, which is typical for a Holiday Inn at a busy tourist spot. However, the beds were very comfortable. As indicated in a flyer, the beds were new.   Location: It is only a 15 to 20-minute walk to Disney, which was great! Also, there are multiple restaurants, grocery stores, gas stations, etc. nearby. If someone wanted to visit and did not have a car, everything is within reasonable walking distance. Lyft and Uber are also available for a very reasonable price (usually under $10, including the tip).
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback and choosing to stay with us. We do charge for parking however we are one of the few hotels that does not charge over $15 per day. We thank you for being a loyal IHG member and we hope to see you soon.

Summary Heading: Good Choice for a Visit to Disneyland
Summary: We enjoyed our stay here. The room was well appointed with all the amenities,and comforts. The pool is large and inviting. Most importantly, all the staff were helpful and friendly.  The restaurant was very good; I will review it separately. My only complaint is that the windows have heavy curtains at the sides but only sheers in the middle so it cannot be made dark enough. The hotel is a short walk to the theme parks; however, since a person walks a lot in the parks it is wise to take the ART shuttle.
Manager Response: Thank you dgreenbee, thank you for sending your feedback we value our clients comments so we may better our hotel. Here's a little hint for the next time you stay here. Behind the sheer curtains are what we call black outs so your room is completely dark. We thank you for choosing to stay with us and again hope to see you and your family soon.

Summary Heading: Service of a typical US Hotel
Summary: Not sure why, but hotels that we‚Äôve stayed here in the US does not give complimentary bottled water, nor provide the service that is at par globally. They even charge you for parking your car, and even have to call to have a toothbrush sent to your room. No wonder Airbnb is disrupting the hotel business here.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. I will share this with our management team.

Summary Heading: Great value for comfort and convenience
Summary: This hotel has excellent service, the property and rooms are clean and well kept, the beds are very comfortable. We stayed in a 2 queen room and it was a good size. We loved the fact that this hotel is a bit secluded compared to other area hotels yet still fantastically close to Disneyland Resort. It's a wonderful change of pace to walk from the hotel to Magic Way and enter security through Downtown Disney where the crowds are typically significantly less than the main gate. Another benefit of this method of entry is just after you get inside the Downtown Disney security gate, you can simply hop on the monorail and be whisked directly to the heart of Tomorrowland. It was rainy while we visited and we only stayed one night but we noticed an in-lobby lounge with a bar. They also
Manager Response: Thank you TKSF78, for taking the time to send your feedback. We are a hidden gem away from the hustle and bustle of Disneyland. We hope to see you back here every soon.   Thank you again

Summary: I came to Anaheim on business, first booking with another hotel. I went to the other hotel and was immediately put off by its seedy appearance. I didn‚Äôt feel safe and knew I had to stay somewhere else. There was a huge convention in town and my heart sank as I realized that most hotels were already sold out. I decided to take a chance and headed to Holiday Inn & Suites, which is always a good choice in almost all towns. I was greeted by Shoon who works the front desk and told her my hotel horror story. She was kind and gracious and she found me a room for all the nights I was needing right away. Thanks to Shoon, I got an amazing room with the most comfortable bedding and slept like a baby. I highly recommend this hotel, for those traveling for work or for fun. The buffet
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to send your feedback. I will defintaly share your comment with Shoon, as she is a great asset to our comoany. We hope to see you againreal soon.

Summary: My friend and I stayed here in December and loved it. The hotel is a super close walk to downtown Disney and it provides everything you need. The restaurant was nice for breakfast before heading into the parks as well, the staff was lovely :) Only complaint is that we got stuck in a king size room when we were meant to have 2 queens but all was good and we didn‚Äôt mind sharing since the bed was very large anyways. Would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you Brittany for staying with us on your vacation. See you guys again real soon.

Summary: This hotel is walking distance to Disneyland.  If you don't want to walk, the Disney bus pulls right up to the front several times an hour.  The hotel itself is very clean.  There are several buildings in the hotel complex.  Each area appears to have its own Disney theme, I stayed in the "Princess Suite," which had murals and decor centered around the Disney Princesses.  The rooms are spacious and nice.  However, they should consider some updates in certain areas.  The room I occupied didn't have the adequate electrical plugs for charging electronics, I had to unplug a light.  Overall the stay was wonderful.   The staff was very helpful and considerate.  If you are booked in building 5 on the second floor be advised that there is no elevator, and you will have to walk up and
Manager Response: Nate J,   Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. we hope to see you in the near future, maybe next time you can book a different themed suite so you can see the variety we have here on property.   See you soon !  Jennifer Rivera

Summary: We stayed at this Holiday Inn from Feb 10-17.   The front desk staff  Roberto, Jay and more people whose names I can't remember but equally outstanding went out of the way to be helpful and pleasant. We got in late and it took no time at all to get checked in.   Just an note, some websites say they have room safes. This is not the case.While they have them behind the front desk and they do not have enough. However the staff we more than happy to store what we had in the managers lock up for us.   We passed lovely gardens, the gym, a pool, hot tub and the children's splash pad on the way to our well equipped room. The beds were very comfy even having a choice of pillow firmness.   The pillow cases were embroidered either firm or soft so you could choose which you liked.  The only
Manager Response: Good morning, I am pleased to share your feed back with Jay, Roberto and the rest of our team. We do hope to see you again real soon.

Summary Heading: Food at Oxny bar is great, alas the beds not so great.
Summary: The food and service at Onyx Bar and Restaurant was fantastic. Even in the Morning the staff was terrific. But alas the downside to this Hotel is the mattress on the bed I slept in needed to be replaced. The mattress sank in,and indented down the center of the bed. ( felt as if I was sleeping on a rock). Other than that downfall the hotel wasn't bad. You can walk to downtown disney from this hotel. For those on a budget. This is one place you can try. But there are others even closer to the disney park.
Manager Response: Good morning Chris D,   Thank you for taking the time to send your feedback. I'm sorry to hear you didn't sleep well on our new mattress. If you have the time please let me know what your you stayed in so we can take a look into this. You can reach me at jenniferr@hianahim.com  Hope to see you soon.

Summary: The location of this hotel was perfect. We chose it because it was a short walk to Downtown Disney and then either a quick walk over to the park entrance or we could get on the monorail.   The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. The hotel restaurant was great. The food was good and the service was fantastic (great bonus that kids ate free!).   The rooms were a little dated, especially the bathrooms. I thought they could use some renovating.   Overall a very good hotel and would recommend for families going to Disney.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you very much for your positive review of our hotel. We look forward to having you back with us again next year, but that doesn't mean you can't stay with us at anytime, we'd be pleased to have you! I would also like to thank you for your business and the time you took to write the review. Best regards,

When we got to the other room they had a black dirty towel on it but at least was on the second floor and was a little more quiet than the other room.  I would say the

Summary: We were staying in a Marriott hotel nearby, they recommended this Holiday Inn for dinner, the staff, from front desk reception to restaurant were warm and friendly, the food was also very good and reasonably priced, T-bone was on special, well fed and watered, and yes I would go back. Well done!!!

This is not a 5 star hotel so let‚Äôs get it out of the way. It‚Äôs a bit pricey but that is still cheaper than a hotel in the park. The place is quiet so it‚Äôs nice and quiet and the staff is super friendly. There is no bell boy for your bags so help yourself with the bag trolley and bring your bags up. There is an ice machine and a small laundromat for your clothes. In the room the beds are comfortable and decent and the bathroom is clean. There is a microwave and coffee machine in the room. Everything to make you comfortable. However the room is small so take note. The restaurant at the lobby sells a decent pizza which to me is cheap and delicious. Would go back there in a heartbeat.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you very much for your positive review of our hotel. Summary: I would like to thank the management and staff for making a very nice stay for a family that needed some laughter. Checked in on the 2nd and was upgraded after a conversation about the circumstances. My family was allowed to stay in one of the Disney themed suites. According to my wife there was plenty of laughter to go along with some tears.  They stayed for three nights and plenty of room to relax .  I would recommend this hotel to anyone that has kids or big families!

I would also like to thank you for your business and the time you took to write the review. Best regards,

Summary: This Place Is Like Our Second Home. I Have Been Coming To Holiday Inn For 9 Years,And Every Time Has Been Perfect.Staff Are Friendly And Helpful.Rooms Are Super Clean.The Location Is Superb,A Great And Safe Walk To Downtown Disney.I Would Highly Recommend This Hotel To Anybody

This hotel is perfectly fine to stay at. It‚Äôs close to Downtown Disney in a quiet area. There are no other stores or restaurants close by, but the hotel does have a restaurant and a gift shop. It was difficult to connect to wifi at night, but it was no problem during the day. The best thing about the hotel is the staff. They were extremely friendly and always helpful. Overall, staying here was a positive experience. No major complaints. Good value for the money.
Manager Response: Hello Ruth L,  Thank you so much for staying with us and taking the time to leave us your feedback. Sincerely,  Krysllin G Case Manager IHGService

Summary Heading: Stay here EVERY visit if you can! Seriously!
Summary: Do not believe the reviews that say it‚Äôs too far from the park, it really isn‚Äôt. It‚Äôs actually close enough to go back and eat at Onyx. (I will review separate). This hotel is a good sized facility that is in line with the Intercontinental Hotel Group expectation. The rooms are clean and well appointed for business travelers and families. Microwaves, mini fridge and K cup machines in the room. A wonderful variety of pillows on a really great bed. The towels were white and crisp. Standard Bath and Body Works product. Get breakfast delivered to the room each morning with a simple door hang card the night prior. The pool was nice and there is a splash pad area for the kids as well. Ice and soda vending on site. Excellent Shell station on the corner as well. Fresh fruit each

We were impressed by the friendly reception upon arrival. Staff were helpful when we had questions. Accommodations were clean. Parking was available. We were so busy with Disneyland and Universal Studios that we didn‚Äôt have time to use their fitness room, pool and hot tub!  The inner door to our building did not lock although we had a card key. Although we brought this to the attention of the staff, the door lock did not get repaired before we checked out. Nice restaurant available on the grounds. All day bus card available to purchase to get to Disneyland and back.  Would we come back again? If we return to Anaheim for Disneyland or other sites to see, Holiday Inn Hotel and Suites is on the public transportation route, we would stay there again.

This hotel was chosen by a friend and would not have been my first pick for a Disney trip.  It was, however, clean and quiet.  We all had restful sleeps and good breakfasts.  We were comfortable and really, that was all we needed.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disneyland trip
Summary: Really easy walk to Downtown Disney, great staff, and good seeming neighborhood. We would stay here again. The hotel was really clean, but there was one dead roach in the sink. We decided better dead than alive and flushed him!

Arrived at six am and was checked in very quickly. Got to the room and crashed out with the family. Beds were very comfortable, soft and quickly feel asleep. That afternoon and evening, we jumped in the pool and hot tub. Just what I needed after a long flight. Got to watch fireworks at Disney from the hotel and the walking distance location is perfect. Plenty of access to many restaurants in waking distance. Room service was good. Can't wait till our next visit.

I arrived to California to take my children to Disneyland & Universal Studios for their bday & x-mas presents. I expected that the hotel would be new & surrounded by shops & grocery stores etc., as other reviews seemed to imply. However, the location was barren for any other immediate restaurants or stores.   The cleaning was great, the food at the restaurant was good. I was expecting a shuttle that would transport guests to & from Disney for free, however one must pay for an ART bus pass that is available in the hotel gift shop. The walk to Disney from the hotel is about 15-20 mins.   Everything was nickeled & dimed at the hotel. Coffee was $2.00 when most hotels provide free coffee for their guests.   The location of the pool was also disappointing. The pool was clean & really
Manager Response: Thank you for your stay and for leaving a review about our hotel on TripAdvisor. Summary: Myself and my husband were visiting Disney for our honeymoon and the moment we walked in every part of staying here was exceptional.  Karla greeted us at reception, she is extremely friendly and upgraded our room free of charge as it was our honeymoon.  Our Disney park tickets were also bought at reception with a discount. Nina in the restaurant is also a credit to Holiday inn, again very friendly and couldn't do enough for us.  Other amazing staff members include Elexa and jennifer. Eveyone made sure our stay (2 night's) was comfortable and ran as smoothy as possible. The gift shop is pretty impressive as i bought all my souvenirs from here (not disney) for a fraction of the price!  Disney is a 10 min walk so the location is perfect! Absolutely nothing to compmain about our

over all the accommodation is sufficient and comfortable, there are amenities for children the breakfast is adequate and the staff are friendly and helpful, the restaurant serves tasty food and at no time did we have a complaint the rooms were comfortable, in fact it is the first hotel ever that i have stayed in where the pillows were exceptionally comfortable, thank you.

This is the perfect hotel to stay at when visiting Disneyland. We went with our 6 year old twins we originally booked a 2 queen size bed room. We stayed a week and after the first night we upgraded to a suite, it made a world of difference and not much more in price. The kids loved the theme room and we loved that they had space to themselves, the kitchenette was nice to have to make quick meals. The walk was so close to Disneyland, the kids made the trip easily a few times a day. It felt like being at a Disneyland Resort but without paying the Resort prices. The hotel was nice and quiet, we felt very safe, the staff was all so friendly and helpful. We loved it there, we will for sure be going back to this hotel on our next Disney trip!

I spent a long time looking at hotels and reviews for our Disneyland trip before booking this hotel. Staff was friendly and it was an OK distance to Disney but not nearly as close as they make it out to be. The distance they speak of is to the gates of Downtown Disney, not the entrance gates to the park.   The purpose of my review is the cleanliness of the room. The carpet was old and uneven and looked dirty, but I assumed it was just the dark brown colour. When we checked in, there was a lot of really long, black hair on the floor of the bathroom. The shower walls were covered in old shampoo and who knows what else. I complained and asked for the room to be cleaned properly while we were out, and it seemed to have been. Two mornings later, I put the white bath towel on the

Summary Heading: Great place to stay near Disneyland - EXCELLENT STAFF
Summary: I stayed at this hotel last weekend and the hotel staff was by far the best hotel staff I have seen in a long time.  Two people in particular, Adrianna and Hugo, were so kind and went above and beyond to make sure our stay was extraordinary. If you are looking for a hotel that is close to the parks and Downtown Disney and has a great staff, this is the hotel you are looking for.  I will highly recommend this hotel to friends and family staying in the area.  Thank you Holiday Inn!! I'll be back. :)
Manager Response: Hello RoWe84,  Thank you so much for taking the time and giving us your amazing feedback! 5 star reviews like these are the reason why we strive everyday to provide the most Top 10 service. Our team here at Holiday Inn and Suites Anaheim are truly happy that we made a very memorable stay for you and your family. We can't wait to see you next time!  Warm Regards,  Brendon T. Assistant Front Office Manager

Summary: I have an annual pass to Disneyland and To Walt Disney World.  I stay at a LOT of hotels and have seen almost all of them around these resorts.  To find a good one where you can't hear your neighbors talking, or finding one within walking distance is hard and you usually pay a pretty penny for it.   I decided to run the Avengers Run Disney race last min. and looked high and low all over the internet for a close hotel to the park as my regular hotel was sold out for Veterans Day weekend.  I decided that this hotel must be the closest (it's right behind the parking garage of Disney land)  and thought "how have I never seen this one before!"    So I decided to book and thought, "it's just for this weekend and it will be ok."  We arrived and it was MORE than OK! I realized the
Manager Response: Hello Niesja S,  Thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience of your recent stay, and summing it all into an amazing 5 star review! Our team here at Holiday Inn and Suites Anaheim, strive to always provide a Top 10 service attitude to any and all of our guests that choose to stay with us. We are beyond happy that you enjoyed your race, and your time spent at our property here in Anaheim. We definitely hope to see you again in the very near future on your next journey to Disneyland!  Warm Regards,  Brendon T. Assistant Front Office Manager

Summary Heading: Eat here but do not EVER stay here
Summary: My family and I just finished staying at this hotel and I‚Äôll be honest normally I use these review sites to leave good reviews, however not on this hotel!  First of all my 8 year old son, my husband as well as my 60 year old mother had been traveling since 3:30 in the morning just to arrive at this hotel at 4:00pm to be told that our reservations had been changed ( no notice) and that our room was not ready ( check in is 3:00pm) so they stored our bags and we were told by the front desk manager that she was going to some how compensate our troubles. We agreed and decided to walk downtown Disney. We left them our number and was told they would call us as soon as the room was ready..  5:45pm we retuned back to the hotel to inquire if our room was ready and low and behold it had
Manager Response: Hi Jenn W,   Thank you for leaving feedback about your recent stay. We strive to give our guests accommodations as soon as possible, and we thank you for being patient while our staff made sure that your room was in its best condition. I am sorry this impacted your experience at our hotel. It is our goal to meet your needs as a guest and I have sent you a private message to obtain additional information. The hotel management will also be alerted so that no other guest will experience this same level of dissatisfaction again.   It's great to hear that you enjoyed our onsite restaurant. It was a pleasure to host your family getaway! We hope to have the honor of hosting your future visits to Anaheim.  Hope to hear from you soon,   Anna B  Case Manager IHGService

Summary: This hotel is a lovely place. Its reasonably easy to find and is close to Disney. Like most of the hotels in the area there are shuttles to Disney that stop at the hotel that are wheelchair accessible. This saves people having to take their cars and wait for ages to get out of the car park and pay for parking. We stayed in an accessible room but unfortunately they only had a Queen room available and I was here with my father. They provided me a rollaway bed that was actually very comfortable. My father had a tumble and they sent someone along very quickly to help me lift him up. The bar and restaurant here is great. There is a big variety of food, including great pizza.
Manager Response: Hello Claire F,  Thank you for taking the time and giving us your feedback. We are very pleased that your stay was comfortable, and that we were able to accommodate your father and yourself. We do take any and all feedback very seriously so thank you for taking the time again. We hope to see you again on your next trip out to Anaheim!  Warm Regards,  Brendon T. Assistant Front Office Manager

Summary: Stayed at the hotel and was impressed overall. Brenden the front desk manager was very helpful and enjoyed talking with him daily. He made a point of making conversation with me. The hotel does have a splash park, pool and hot tub. My kids loved the splash pad. Rooms were updated and clean. Some of the housekeeping was spotty but we able to get those things missed fixed.  Grounds were kept in really good condition as well. Decent range to Disneyland. Restaurant food was really good as well. Kids do eat free with an adult eating in restaurant. They do have booths with tv which help entertain the exhausted kids. Would defiantly go back !

After getting back to my room, I noticed my silver bangle was tarnished which I never take off and have always worn it in pools and hot tubs. In addition my black swimsuit turned grey. I went to the front desk and talked to a young Hispanic man and showed him what happened and asked him to talk to maintenance and his manager. He seemed like he couldn't care less, and I heard nothing back. I recently visited again Sept 2017 and did not see this employee. go figure. I like to give a second chance and like the quiet street the hotel is located. This time the change machine in the laundry room was not working properly, and

Summary: The staff was pretty friendly (especially the staff in the dining area).  Hotel was pretty clean, yet aging.  A lot of bugs in pool area, but maybe that's just a California thing?  I guess I didn't notice that at all at our hotel in L.A.  Website advertised "secret" entrance to Disney, but closed at the beginning of the year.  One of the reasons why we chose this spot was it's proximity to Disney, but in actuality with kids and walking around the parks all day, it's not that close.  After first walk, we ended up taking the shuttle each time, which is not free.  Standard room was so small we upgraded to a suite after the first night.  That was fun.  Kids loved the Star Wars room and it was very spacious.  For all the advertising as a "Good Neighbor" hotel for Disney, I expected

Summary: The service is great, the rooms are very clean and the beds were really comfortable. I enjoyed the different choices in pillows they gave us. The air condition worked good and I particularly like that I could just run the fan at night to drown out the night noise.  The breakfast had a wide variety to chose from. It was a full breakfast, not a continental.  The front desk was so helpful. Check out time was 11:00 but our flight didn't leave until 6:30. They held our luggage for us so we could have more time in the park.  The walk was a little further than people with little ones might like to take but we found it worth the extra steps to have quiet.

Assistant Front Office Manager

Summary: Decided at last minute to take a quick trip to Disneyland. Chose this hotel because it was close to the parks and because it was reasonably priced. We had a great corner room with two comfortable beds. It also had a small fridge and keurig coffee maker. I agree with other reviews about the bathroom which is very small. All staff was courteous and helpful with both Disney tickets and bus transportation tickets. We took Uber from Orange County airport so no need for a car. The food in the restaurant was always very good. The gift shop was well stocked with things needed. Yes you can walk to the parks if you prefer and the security line on that side is quicker. On our last day we took a break from Disneyland and ubered to the beach. I would recommend this hotel for your Disneyland

Breakfast buffet (can be added to your room for $10, max of two) was definitely well worth the $10.  Parking in a regular parking lot for $12 a Day is excessive.  Should be included in room price.

Summary Heading: Anaheim Holiday Inn & Suites on S Walnut
Summary: Friendly and welcoming staff at reception. This is a large premises with four buildings. The room was a reasonable size with two large beds, at ground level. The bathroom was tiny -  bath / shower and WC. They need a new supplier of bathroom tissue - as that supplied was for babies and small children!  Parking (open air)  was just outside. It was a Friday night, just behind the Disney parking lot and there was plenty of parking.

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay When visiting Disneyland
Summary: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights in mid-September.¬† We had flown in from Colorado to visit my brother and his wife in Long Beach, and I, having grown up in the late 1950's and early 1960's watched (starting on black and white) TV "Walt Disney's Disneyland" every Wednesday it was on, which later moved to Sunday evenings decided to finally get to Disneyland! We checking at about 8PM on Monday evening and were very tired because we had been with my brother and his wife all day and had seen other interesting sites and things and had eaten at 2 other restaurants. ¬†¬†All the staff was very nice and helpful! ¬†They sell Disneyland multi-day tickets (but no single day pass)right inside the hotel lobby if you've not already purchased them.   By the front desk there was a kids area

Summary: My family and I, stay here during our trip to disneyland, and it was the best choice we could have made, it was within walking distance to disneyland, the rooms are great, they have a place in the lobby where they put children's movies all day, and they have a great splash zone where the kids can just go in and play in the water.

Summary: Booked this Inn at short notice due to cancellation of stay at Orlando due to hurricane, we chose Holiday Inn due to location (close to Disneyland) and cost. Check in was easy and good and staff friendly. the room was basic but clean and spacious enough to be comfortable. The bed was also comfortable and the room quiet. The restaurant was not what you call fancy but it was clean and had good food a small bar and very friendly staff, we also ate breakfast in the restaurant and there was a choice of buffet or menu. There is a nice pool here too to cool of in. We were lucky with the location as being on a Tuesday night we were able to see the fireworks at Disneyland. Checkout was early in the morning, the staff member friendly. I can recommend Holiday Inn

The room is nice and upgraded from before. The food at the restaurant wasn't good at all. We wouldn't eat there again even for the convenience. All in all it's an ok hotel to stay at, but preferred the previous version before the remodel.

I was really afraid when I notice a warming about the possibility of someone  get in the hotel and stole things from the rooms. Then, I notice how easy was to get in and I never saw a security guard, even late night.  Another problem is that they charged me twice for a terrible room.  The only good thing is the location, but they charge for the parking spot, so stay far and pay Disney parking will be the same.

All in all an amazing base to experience Disney and a trip of a lifetime. We would definitely recommend this Hotel.

Summary Heading: Always a pleasure to stay at this Holiday Inn.
Summary: I love this hotel. I love that the staff are always so friendly, and the rooms so fresh, inviting and immaculate. The entire Disneyland resort (including Downtown Disney) is only 10 minutes walk down the road and yet in the rooms in this hotel, there is no road noise or other noise. The rooms have a refrigerator, coffee maker and a microwave. Two doors down from the hotel is a Shell with a Food Mart attached. They have cereal, milk, snacks, fresh fruit etc - enough to keep you fed if you're on a budget and don't want to pay hotel or Disney food prices.  There is a guest laundry here, which is always a welcome item in any hotel. The washing machine and the dryer both take eight quarters ($2). There is a dispenser on the wall selling laundry detergent for $2 as well.  I didn't use

There was never a moment I was left waiting at the desk if he was around, and he gave great directions and tips of things to do in the area. He also thoroughly explained my bill and any questions that I had, and was aiming to please. Likewise, when we use the computer outside the printer does not work and takes lots of time to fix it. On the other hand, front staff is friendly and helpful. Hotel also has good location that is very convenient to access to Disneyland.

Summary: This is an older hotel, but the rooms were clean and comfortable, and the beds were new.  The rooms were good sized.  The pool and splash pad were nice.  It is in a very good location if you are attending a runDisney race weekend - easy walk to the expo and race start area.  It is definitely more than a block walk (more like half a mile to Downtown Disney) but easy.  My only complaints were that my entire hallway on my floor smelled like cigarette smoke, even though it was supposed to be non-smoking.  The room was fine, but the hallway was pretty bad.

Summary Heading: New beds,great price, spacious room for me and my teen-age daughter, very nice staff
Summary: I chose this hotel based on other reviews. I was on a budget but still wanted a decent place to spend the night. I'm glad that we stayed here. We came in the morning and was offered to use the luggage hold. Early check-in would cost me $50, so I just asked them to hold our bags while we went to Disneyland. It was half a mile walk The area was very safe. When we finally went inside our room late in the afternoon, we were pleased to rest on new beds and very comfortable pillows. We booked the 2 Double beds Room at a great rate and I was expecting a tiny room based on photos of other travelers who stayed at other Holiday Inn Double Beds rooms in other states. But this room was spacious. The bathroom is tiny, though, with the sink outside it. The room had a fridge, microwave, Keurig

Summary: We had 3 nights here. It is about 6 or 7 mins drive from Disney but not an easy drive. There is a shuttle bus every 20 mins which seemed to work well. The hotel is as expected, decent rooms with bunks for the kids. Lots of restaurants nearby. Very good pool

Summary: We knew what to expect when we booked two rooms as this chain is always the same no matter where in the world you are .  Checkin was a bit funny as we ended up in a room that was still occupied which we found quite funny . Jokes aside all the staff here were fantastic every single one of them . The four of us ordered t bone steak for dinner one night , we live on a farm in Australia so we are fussy about our meat but the steak was amazing as was the apple cobbler desert . So handy to be able to walk to Disneyland too .  Definitely recommend this place .

Summary Heading: Day trip to Disney - last minute reservations
Summary: We headed to Anaheim for a quick day trip from our Phoenix vacation, so needed a place to stay for a few nights. Of course "cheap" was on my radar since we all know Disney isn't anything cheap. Lol!   We chose this hotel mainly for the price ($93/night) and because it looked like it was well taken care of, and updated...it helps that it was close to DL as well, so we didn't have to find parking. It's about 3/4 of a mile to walk from the hotel to the gates of DL and Cali Adventure. The DL parking garage is right next door, so that's how close you are.   The rooms - we had a room with double beds; they were comfy. The pillows were great. The rooms are kind of small and the bathroom was also pretty small. The vanity was outside the bathroom so that was nice. I feel that the rooms

Summary: The Room - Contemporary decor, good closet and drawer storage, comfy bed, pillows for everyone,  nice shower head, clean and fairly well-lit. Standard double Queen room is a little tight and bathroom is small. Quiet:)  The Hotel -  A well laid-out property of five bldgs with a  pool, spa and Splash Zone. There are rooms with patio doors looking onto the Splash Zone that seem like a fun option. Plenty to offer the young ones; an indoor play area with books and a large screen with a video collection of Disney favorites. There's also a fitness center, gift shop with snacks and a bar and restaurant.  The Location -  From the front of the hotel it is .6 miles to the tram at the Mickey & Friends parking lot, .75 miles to the inside gate at Downtown Disney on foot or a little over .1

Summary: We have just spent 4 days whilst visiting Los Angeles. It was cheaper to stay outside of the beach resorts and so glad we did. After hiring a car we were able to easily travel around and about. Hotel is more like a good 4 star than 3. Lovely family hotel with pool and water splash area. Although we didn't visit nearby Disney it is on the doorstep. Small gym and excellent restaurant serving great food all day. Unlike a recent trip to San Francisco, staff at this hotel will swap and change meals/sides etc without any bother to ensure that you enjoy your meal. The rooms are huge and spotlessly clean with a microwave, fridge and coffee machine where you can make tea:coffee etc. Staff are extremely warm, welcoming, attentive and helpful. I would definitely like to stay there again

I recently stay at this hotel during a family trip to Disneyland. Hotel is a very short walk from the park which was very nice. Very clean hotel with nice rooms and comfortable beds.   We were there to celebrate a birthday in the family. When the morning desk staff learned about this they went out of their way to decorate the room for our return from the park.  It was a great way to end a birthday. Walking into a room with balloons and a card from the staff. Thank you Tyler and Tiara, that was very thoughtful   It is this type of friendly service that will have me referring this hotel to friends, and returning on future trips

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland, straigt forward service
Summary: This hotel is very close to Disneyland and adventure park. We thought it was a good value, clean and accepted a late evening check-in without any issue. The room was decently sized for two adults and two kids and the beds were comfortable.
Manager Response: Thank you JennyB612, for taking the time to give us your feedback of your recent stay. We hope that you had a magical vacation with us.  We look forward to having your family back soon. Please don't hesitate  to reach out to our team.    Thank you so much JenntB612,  Warn Regurds ,  Jennifer Rivera

Summary: We were in Anaheim for three days to do the Disney thing, but didn't want the expense of staying in the parks. This Holiday Inn was an excellent alternative. It was close enough to walk to Downtown Disney. The Anaheim bus route stopped at the hotel and dropped you off at the parks. It cost $5.00 per person per day. It was easy and convenient. The hotel sold the tickets which made it even easier. The room was typical Holiday Inn stuff, so no worries there. The staff was extremely helpful and cheerful throughout our stay. If you want to pay bigger bucks and stay inside the parks, fine, but if you want a reasonable price that is still convenient to go to Disney, then this is Holiday Inn is a great option.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel, close to Disneyland and Downtown Disney
Summary: We stayed here for two nights, and have a family of 5 (young kids).  The staff was friendly and accommodating.  The pool was nice, and the splash park was an added bonus for our kids.  It is a short walk to Disneyland, or you can walk into the parking garage and take the tram into Downtown Disney.  Overall it was a great trip, and the room was very comfortable and relaxing.  Room 2407

The room was fine, just what one would expect from Holiday Inn. The restaurant was the real attraction. After a long day of traveling, we were able to ignore each other at the dinner table due to the TV - with DirecTV and remote control - located at the table. For some, this wouldn't be a draw, but with the bickering siblings in our group, it was great to have something to stop the snark for 30 minutes.   Also, there is a pool and a splash pad. Please note that they are not near each other, and a building separates the two. Therefore, one parent cannot supervise two kids who are unwilling to compromise on swimming or splashing. Having said that, the splash pad gets two thumbs up from all the children - even the older ones.

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland and great hotel
Summary: Very quiet hotel even though it has lots of families.  Front desk personnel, especially Brandon, who when we checked in late after a long drive from Northern California, was kind, gave us bottles of cold water and had our rooms ready.  The on site restaurant was good, fast service and friendly servers.

My family stayed at the Holiday Inn to be close to Disney.  The hotel is a 15 minute walk to the park, so it was very convenient.  The rooms were great and the staff was friendly.  The hotel offers a pool and a restaurant, so that was convenient, as well.  Good place to stay if you are going to the park.

Summary Heading: Disney should take notes from this hotel
Summary: Amazing experience. First, the front desk was helpful with every request. We got the room we wanted, at a great price, and they made sure it was set up right. The Cars suite is so cool. My sons face lit up when he walked in and saw the big painting on the wall of Lightning McQueen. All the little accents and pictures of the characters are cool. After we got settled in, we went to the splash park. My kids had a blast. The pool area was clean and well maintained. Oh and don't spend hundreds of dollars on souvenirs at the park. The gift shop has almost everything, and a lot cheaper. We didn't get to try the restaurant, but my friends said it was tasty and affordable. All in all, a 5 star experience.

My friend and I arrived before check in, so our room wasn't ready yet. We left our things in the car and headed to Disneyland for the day. We got back to the hotel and they told us they ran out of the type of rooms we paid for they had to upgrade us. We got one the character suites they have and it was amazing! We were kind of sad we were only staying one night. The beds were comfy, the room was clean; it was amazing. When I got home I realized I left my toiletry bag in the room. I called the hotel and they agreed to hold it for me until I returned in May.   When I got there 2 months later, they kept their word and had saved my toiletry bag! I stayed for a few nights for a Run Disney event and had a regular room which was still nice, clean, and comfy. The best part is this hotel

Family trip to Disney - two rooms, three adults and one child. Room was clean and normal hotel size. Kind of liked the toilet/bath in a separate room from the sink/vanity - shared the room with my daughter. Ate in the restaurant quite a bit. Kids eat free with an adult so that was a plus. and the tv in the booth kept the little one entertained and made the meal more relaxing for the adults. The food was pretty good and the portions generous, reasonably priced. We took the public transit Disney shuttle which cost less than $20/ day for all of us and runs regularly throughout the day. Great if you are going back and forth to the park and it stops right outside the hotel! The monorail was not running. As far as walking to the park, you arrive at Downtown Disney in about ten
Manager Response: We are please that your stayed was delightful. Also, thank you for stopping by and trying out our restaurant, it's music to our manager's ear when he reads about how much the guest enjoyed the food. We hope to see you in the future and of course if there is anything we can do to help just give us a call.  Front Desk Supervisor Jonathan C.

Summary: The staff were friendly and helpful.  We got there a bit earlier then registration time and we were able to get early registration.  The room was clean and beds comfy. üíû Microwave, refrigerator, and Keurig in the room were a big plus!  This saved us on cost of eating out.  The hotel is walking distance to Downtown Disney.  There is a cost for parking your car, $12 per car per day.  However, its relatively cheap compared to most hotels in that area.  I would stay here again!
Manager Response: Hello there, thank you for sharing your experience with us. We are please that the amenities in the room as the micorwave and fridge came as an advantage to you. On behalf of our staff we would like to thank you for mentioning how helpful our staff is because it is what separate us from other hotels. We pride in delivering great customer service to all our guest. We hope to see you in the future and to welcoming you back with a smile.  Front Desk Supervisor  Jonathan C.

Summary Heading: Pet friendly and helpful front desk staff
Summary: OK, so I didn't plan very well.  This hotel is close to Disneyland and the Monorail line but I was not expecting that to be closed for repair.  Thankfully the staff was able to provide us with information on an alternative to driving and parking fees.  There was a city bus that they told us about that had an all-day pass for less than $7 per person.
