Also rather then kennel our small dog at the Park Kennel, because we had her carrier along, we were able to keep her in the room and still get back from time to time during the day for visits and walks to let her do her business.  Room was comfortable, clean, has great beds, and a fridge.  There was also a laundry that we took advantage of also.  On sight restaurant that was OK but nothing special.
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to write a review about your stay in our property. We are please that you choose us from all the hotels. We hope to see you return in the future and if we can do anything to help please call us at the hotel.   Front Desk Supervisor  Jonathan C.

Summary: I recently attended a University graduation and stayed three nights at the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites. I traveled solo.   Overall I thought the hotel was comfortable and offered some valued accommodations not common to most Holiday Inns. A pleasant surprise for me, as I was planning to spend most evenings at the hotel. The onsite facilities made my stay much more enjoyable.   The room decor and furnishings were current in decor and design, the linens were fresh, the room was clean. This part did not deviate from the standard Holiday Inn Brand I am familiar with. The room size was a bit smaller than other Holiday Inns I have been staying at during the past few years. The bathroom ... we will get to that a bit later.   The site offered a relaxing pool (with cocktail service, hey,
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience in detail. We are please that our staff was able to deliver excellent service. I do apologize for the size of the bathroom and the inconvenience it cause during your stayed. We hope to see you in the future and please don't hesitate to call us if there is anything we can do to help.  Front Desk Supervisor  Jonathan C.

Summary: So, lets say this the best way possible. Did I have a place to stay, yes, is it up against the Mickey and Friends parking lot yes. The problem is you cannot access the Mickey Parking lot or trams from the hotel. you must walk around the entire city block. The hotel is aged but clean, the splash pad was a bug hit with my Grandchildren. If you need somewhere to sleep and shower because you've spent 18 hours in the park this hotel will do the trick.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. I am sorry that your stay wasn't to your expectation and we hope that once we finish our renovation you can give us another chance as a returning guest.   Front Desk Supervisor  Jonathan C.

Summary Heading: Clean and close to Disney tram
Summary: We stayed for two nights and had two rooms. Property and rooms were clean and comfortable.  Rooms are a bit on the small side.  It would be difficult to fit a crib or extra bed in the rooms we had.  No breakfast included but we used the fridge and microwaves for our small meals.  Property is on the north side of Disneyland. We walked all the way to the main gate one day (thru downtown Disney) and returned by the tram. The tram saves a bit of walking especially at the end of the day. My 5 year old was tired and we carried her some of the way both directions.   Overall a good hotel for a park visit if the price is right. Parking is normally $12, but they reduced ours to $6/nt.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. We are please that you enjoyed your stay and that the agents were able to offer a discounted rate on the parking. We look forward to welcoming you back in the future.   Front Desk Supervisor Jonathan C.

Summary: First off, they claim to be 1 block from Disneyland. There is no way this is true. Not even 1 block to Downtown Disney. While it is possible to walk, I would recommend staying at a hotel on Harbor if that is what you want to do. The shuttles (ART) are a little slow and crowded at times and are not free. Plus you pay to park at the hotel.  The room was comfortable and has a Keurig, mini fridge and microwave. There is a LOT of noise from the hallway.  Next time I visit Disney, I will stay somewhere else.
Manager Response: Hello Mrs. Ellen, thank you for sharing your experience and I would like to apologize that your stay with us wasn't a great one. We do take guest reviews so that we can improve and would like to thank you for being honest. I do know that the parking fee can be an issue but the reason we do charge is because if we didn't random people who are not guest of the hotel would park in our property and our guest wouldn't have a spot to park. When booking through other companies as expedia hotels.com or booking.com they do express about the parking but they word it as "other fee may apply." But in our website it does state about the parking. About the noise there is no excuse and we would of been more than happy to move you if you had contacted an agent at the front desk. I do hope you can give us another try in the future and we will be more than happy to make sure your future stay can eliminate the bad experience you had. Please feel free to contact me directly if you would like to reserve for a future stay.  Front Desk Supervisor Jonathan C.  jonathanC@hianaheim.com

Summary: Our hotel stay here was the icing on our vacation cake! Our girls, ages 2 and 4, felt like princesses in their princess suite. All the princess details lit up their faces (especially the 4 year old's). We chose a very affordable package that included breakfast for 2 (plus the kids ate free) and parking for 2 days (even though we only stayed 1 night). The splash pad was a lot of fun and the girls loved running through it. We wish we had time to check out the pool. Breakfast was decent. The only complaint was the heating/cooling system in the room: the thermostat is in the bedroom while the vent is in the living room. My mother slept overnight on the pull-out sofa in the living room while we slept with the girls in the bedroom behind a closed door. We were burning up in the middle
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. I am glad the room was to your satisfaction. I do apologize for the A/C issue and I will make sure to touch base with the Maintenance manager. If there is anything we can do for a future stay please don't hesitate to send me an email.   Front Desk Supervisor Jonathan C.

Summary: Conveniently located just off of Highway 5 and right next to the Disneyland premises. Quite busy and loud. A lot of families with children and other guests in a party mood. Rooms are ok. Was quite disappointed they charged extra for parking.
Manager Response: I do apologize the the inconvenience for the parking fee. Because we are walking distance to the Disneyland Park and California Adventures we do have to charge for parking otherwise random people would park in the hotel and we wouldn't have parking spaces for our guest.  I do hope this doesn't prevent you from return and of course you can always contact me and I would be more than happy to see what we can do about the parking fee.  Front Desk Supervisor Jonathan C.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel within walking distance to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here for a trip to Anaheim to visit Disneyland and the Honda Center for Teemu Tribute night. The hotel was great. They were quick to upgrade us from 2 doubles to 2 queens because of our IHG member status, and gave us 2 free bottles of water upon check in. The beds were comfortable, and the room was very spacious. I loved the shower which had great water pressure, always a plus after a long day walking through the park. They do charge $10 a day for parking, but that's pretty standard around the area. They offer a $5 per person shuttle to disneyland, but we found that it's just as easy, and quick to walk there from the hotel.  The hotel also boasts a great splash area for kids, and an awesome outdoor heated pool and hot tub. The hot tub was much appreciated for the achy
Manager Response: Oh behave of the hotel I would like to thank you for taking the time to share your experience. We are grateful that your stay was amazing and thank you for being part of the IHG family. Le us know when you will be returning and as always feel free to contact me if there is anything I can do for you for a future stay.  Front Desk Supervisor Jonathan C. jonathanC@hianahiem.com

Summary: What a great deal! Walking distance to Disneyland, wonderful rooms with new beds and a great helpful staff. I'm almost afraid to post a review as it may either get too popular or raise rates but it was fantastic. Also, the walk to Disneyland from the room was safe at midnight.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your great experience. Don't worry about the prices going up I like to offer my help if there is anything I can do for return guest. Our goal is to make sure our guest are taken care of from the moment they walk in to check in until the day we have to said goodbye but we will see you soon. On behave of the staff we look forward to your return in the future.   Front Desk Supervisor  Jonathan C.  jonathanC@hianahiem.com

Summary: We stayed here when visiting Disneyland and it was awesome! The hotel is a 10 minute walk from downtown Disney, and there is a bus that goes directly between the hotel and the main gates. The restaurant is reasonably priced and the food is good. We ate there often. The rooms and clean and comfortable - they have a variety of pillow types. The pool is nice and there is a water play area for kids. We would definitely stay here again!!
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience. We are please that your stay with us was memorable. Our restaurant is popular for the pizza on the menu and of course the variety of option a guest can choose from. We look forward to your return and please feel free to reach to us for any future reservation or services.   Front Desk Supervisor Jonathan C.

Summary: The accommodation is good. Room size adequate for a couple. Pool. Good amenities throughout. Bed comfortable ( a major plus!). There is an adequate restaurant and the breakfast I'd fine. A bit expensive if all you are after is cereal and toast! The major benefit is its proximity to Disneyland. A 20 minute stroll along excellent and safe footpaths. Good value. Well recommended.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We value our guest experience and we are please that your stay was memorable. We do look forward to your return and don't hesitate to reach out to us for any future help.   Front Desk Supervisor Jonathan C.

Summary: The hotel was ok and the location was right behind Disneyland, which was great. The walls are thin and we were able to hear conversations and people walking up and down the hallway all night long. Also, because our room was close to the elevator and the back door, when people went out to smoke, they stood right outside the back door and the hall window into the hotel was open so the smoke just lingered in the hotel hallway.
Manager Response: Dear Hollie W,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback regarding your stay at our hotel. We are pleased to read you found the location of the hotel convenient to your needs. However, we apologize the inconvenience the noise challenges and the smoke from the other guests at the back door may have caused you. Please know that it is certainly not our intent to inconvenience our valued guests like you. We have shared your comments with the hotel management and we‚Äôre confident that necessary actions will be made, in order to meet our guest's comfort and satisfaction.  Thank you for staying with us and we hope to offer you a more pleasant stay in the future.  Sincerely,  Grace P. Case Manager IHGService

Summary: We stayed here for two nights at the end of our California vacation to be close to Disneyland.  They have a shuttle you can catch for $5.50 to and from the gates of Disneyland.  The hotel was wonderful with a large room (we were in the Fairy Suite), comfortable beds, great pool area, really nice restaurant with good food.  The staff I met were so friendly.
Manager Response: We are please that our staff could be at your service and thank you for taking the time to share your experience. We look forward to your return and let me know if there is anything I can do in the future.   Front Desk Supervisor Jonathan C. jonathanC@hianaheim.com

Summary: This place is right outside Disneyland and within a good 15 min walk to Downtown Disney.  Although the walk home after a long day in the park is a bit much.  Pay for parking is a rip off, charge more for rooms and stop trying to hide fees.  On a positive note, the bed was one of the most comfortable I've had in a while.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. We do have two types of rates in which parking is included and the second type includes parking and breakfast. However, that is only offer if you book directly through the hotel not third parties. But of course if there is anything I can do for a future stay feel free to reach out to me.   Front Desk Supervisor Jonathan C.  jonathanC@hianaheim.com

Summary: We booked this hotel through Disney Vacations- it was dramatically less expensive, and looking on the map we could tell it was super close. The positives: it was walking distance to the park (15 minute walk through Downtown Disney), was kept pretty clean, it was very quiet, super close to the Disneyland Hotel for Breakfast with Goofy, it is itself an ART (Local Busses to the park) stop, and had an abundance of free parking. The staff in general were pretty decent people to deal with.   The bad: The standard rooms (All we were told we could book through Disney) are TINY for anything more than two people- we were a family of four and wound up paying $240 extra for a "Suite" which was really just a suite because of the space, the hotel is really showing it's age in a number of ways
Manager Response: Hi langjw1,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us for your visit to Disney. I sincerely apologize that some aspects of our room accommodations and housekeeping. While I certainly would have preferred you had a more comfortable stay, I appreciate that you have shared your feedback with us. Let us assure your that it is in our continued efforts to maintain and improve our amenities and services in order to be consistent in providing our valued guests with the best accommodations possible. I do hope that you will allow us to welcome you back and give us another opportunity to make it up to you.  Kind regards,  Faith R Case Manager IHGService

Summary: Overall, this hotel met my expectations. It was clean and quiet with a spacious room and comfortable beds. The location was great, within a short walking distance of Disneyland.  Hotel staff was helpful and allowed us to drop off our bags when we arrived well before check-in time. This was a good value for our trip.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience and we are please that your stay met your expectations. Our goal is to make sure our guest are taken care of and feel free to reach out to us if we can assist with a future reservation.  Front Desk Supervisor Jonathan C.

Summary: Everything was great the week in my last visit at Buena park, Customer service was great, they offer transportation to some of near mall at that Area, My overall customer experience was great and I would stay in future visit
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience and we are please that our staff could deliver an excellent service. We hope to see you in the future.   Front Desk Supervisor. Jonathan C.

Summary: This is our second time to stay here. we really like this hotel, within 10 min walking distance from the back side of Disney, puts you in by the Rainforest Cafe.  New beds, room was clean, staff was very helpful and you can buy discount tickets to get into Disney there.  We like this place and will return again.  You can buy breakfast for an up charge, we chose to eat in the park they also have a pool and a cute small gift shop. You go Holiday Inn!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. We are please to have returning guest share how their stay was, it means a great deal that our staff hard work and dedication can be express and that our guest are getting the best. With so many hotels in the area we make sure our guest are our number one priority. Feel free to reach out to us if we can help with a future stay.   Front Desk Supervisor  Jonathan C.  jonathanC@hianaheim.com

Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights, as I took my daughter on a graduation trip to Disneyland.   The hotel has all the basic amenities and we slept well.  Since we spent every day and night at the parks, we didn't take advantage of what the hotel had to offer.  There is a lovely water park for children on sight.  The walk to the parks was about 15 minutes, through Downtown Disney.  We would stay here again.  The staff were friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. We are please that we could be your home for the 4 nights that you went to the park. We hope to see you in the future as we await the new attraction at Disneyland, Star Wars.  Front Desk Supervisor Jonathan C.

Summary Heading: Disneyland trip just my daughter and I.
Summary: I was a little nervous staying at this hotel since I'm not very familiar with the area but I felt completely safe even with us not coming back to the room until after midnight. It was a walk but not a terribly long one. At night with a toddler in a stroller and bags it got tiring but any walk would have been. About 10 minutes to the security at downtown Disney and then the walk through there which isn't bad at all. The bed was super comfy and I was happy with the fridge and microwave much cheaper to have a snack or cold water from our room than to have to go out everyday. I knew I had to pay for parking but it was annoying seeing people not staying at the hotel pull in and park there and walk for free. The marathon was when I was there so I saw quite a few people getting in
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. We are grateful you choice our hotel for your Disneyland trip. I do understand about the parking fee but if you would like to contact me when you return I will be more than happy to work with you for the parking. As a returning guest we want to make sure we tackle any issue, big or small, and make sure our guest leave with a memorable experience.   Front Desk Supervisor Jonathan C. jonathanC@hianaheim.com

Summary: We stayed here and had a nice stay. Easy walk to Disney and downtown Disney. Clean nice hotel. Comfy beds. Bath and body works shampoo lotion and conditioner. Restaurant downstairs had decent food. We ate breakfast and it was good. We would stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are please that your stay was a pleasant one and we look forward to your return.  Front Desk Supervisor Jonathan C.

Summary: This hotel was clean, close to Disneyland and a nice quiet spot.  The staff, particularly the restaurant staff really stood out as friendly, attentive and all around were excellent.  We had a fantastic experience with this hotel.  From the staff on the phone before our trip, to the front desk staff, to the cleaning staff, and again, particularly the restaurant staff.  We will definitely stay there again next time.
Manager Response: Thank you for a wonderful review and all our staff members appreciate your kind words. We always drive to provide our guest with excellent service and please don't hesitate to contact us for a future reservation.  Front Desk Supervisor Jonathan C.

Summary: We stayed here for 8 days while visiting Disneyland. The hotel was decent although our room was simple with only 2 queen beds, 1 night table, dresser/tv stand and desk. Not much storage and no place to eat if you want to eat in.  It's about a 15 - 20 min walk to Disneyland or the ART bus stops right out front.  The main reason we won't stay here again is that there's no restaurants around. The Restaurant in the hotel is OK (just don't order pizza, it's terrible!) but not somewhere you want to eat every day. All the restaurants are over on Harbour Blvd, which is on the other side of Disneyland. That's where I'd stay next time.
Manager Response: Dear PetuniaRC,  Thank you for your recent stay with us and reviewing our property. I am very sorry for the shortfalls you have noticed with the room you received and the quality of food we serve in our restaurant was not to your liking. We highly value views, opinions and feedback from our guests, as this allows us to constantly improve the service we provide. Thank you for staying and we hope you give us another chance to show you how great our hotel is.  Sincerely,  Anthony M Case Manager IHGService

Summary Heading: Wonderful family hotel close to Disneyland
Summary: The hotel was clean, comfortable and very family friendly! The staff at the hotel and restaurant were friendly and welcoming.   Walking distance to downtown Disney and the parks. We used the shuttle as we have young children, but the park is definitely in walking distance. The shuttle stops at the entrance of the hotel which was nice after a long day.  This hotel was perfect for our stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your stayed with us. We do hope to see you in the future and anything we can do please feel free to contact us for any assistance.   Front Desk Supervisor.  Jonathan C.

Summary Heading: Very Nice hotel, had a great time and easy walk to downtown Disney
Summary: The Hotel was very nice, clean, neat and friendly staff. Its location was excellent and we were able to walk to downtown Disney quite easily. The fact that you are charged for a cup of coffee just bothers me to no end, but that is what this hotel chain does.  Either way, very nice place.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing our properly for your Disneyland experience. I do apologize for the inconvenience for the coffee charge. I do hope that this doesn't prevent you from return and when you do coffee will be on me.   Front Desk Supervisor Jonathan C.  jonathanC@hianaheim.com

Summary: We really enjoyed our stay here and would easily book here again.   Location - it's about a 15 minute walk to Downtown Disney and about another 10 to 15 to the gate. There's also the ART shuttle that stops right outside the door and takes you to Disneyland's main gate in minutes.   Dining - There aren't any restaurants around like the hotels on the other side of Disney, but we could walk over to Downtown Disney, or eat at the restaurant in the hotel. The food was really good, big portions and really reasonable prices. They even gave us take out cups for our coffee every morning. Usually I only eat at a hotel restaurant as a last resort, but we landed up here for most of our meals. There's a convenience store at the Shell station around the corner to stock up on water or snacks -
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. We are glad that your stay was memorable and that our restaurant was able to deliver an excellent service.  We do hope to see you in the future and again thank you for your kind words.   Front Desk Supervisor Jonathan C.

Summary: We regularly stay here when we head to D'Land. The property is close enough to walk to the park, as well. They also allow pets in case you have one. Rooms are always clean! Staff is attentive and the service is always top notch.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience. We love it when returning guest leave us a review it helps us improve to achieve that excellent service we aim to provide. We do hope to see you in the future and contact us if there is anything we can do to assist you.   Front Desk Supervisor Jonathan C.  jonathanC@hianaheim.com

Summary: I only stayed one night, April 24, 2017.  I arrived about 9:30pm.  There was some confusion about whether my stay was prepaid or not- it wasn't.  Parking at that time of night was not great, but I did find a reasonably close parking spot.  My room was clean and comfortable.  The bathroom was spotless with nice thick towels.  The bed was soft and very comfortable.   I checked out by 8:30am and walked to the Disneyland Hotel for breakfast- it was a longer walk than I thought by looking at the map.  The walk was still not bad.  I'd stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review and we are please that you enjoyed your stay. We hope to see you in the future and if you ever have issue with finding parking please let the front desk agents know so that we can recommend a parking spot that is available so that you don't have to drive around to find one.   Front Desk Supervisor  Jonathan C.

Summary: I rate hotels based on overall value. This hotel was a great value for what we paid. For about $160/night we stayed a block from Disneyland and had all the regular comforts of a Holiday Inn. The breakfast was the standard Holiday Inn breakfast. The employees were all nice and helpful.   The only downsides were with our particular room. Upon checking in they noticed we'd asked for a ground floor room since we had kids. The room they had was close to the road so they told us to let them know if it was too noisy. The road wasn't noisy, but our walls seemed to be really thin. We were right next door to the gym and could hear people running on the treadmill. We were too close to the lobby and heard people talking. Basically, it was a loud room, BUT, I know they would have switched us
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. We are please that you enjoyed your stay with us. We are sorry to know that the room you stayed was loud and please next time let us know so that we can make it right and be able to move you to another room. We do hope that the issue doesn't keep you from returning and please contact us if there is anything we can do for you next time.   Front Desk Supervisor  Jonathan C.

Summary: My kids loved hanging out by the pool! Pool area was clean and enough towels to use. They were 8 and 10 so they were not interested in the splash zone.  Our room was clean with a door leading out to the pool area. Our room was a good standard size, I also loved that the sink and vanity are outside the restroom so I can get ready while my kids and husband shower. Breakfast was good, I believe kids eat free for breakfast. We also ordered from the pool which was nice, I didn't have to wait to get dry or go in to order food I just texted my order and they came right out 15 minutes later.   We also liked the small shop inside the hotel my kids purchased pens and stamps before going to the park, we bought cookies from the vending machine and were upset that there was no milk!! At
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. We are glad that you enjoyed your stay and sorry to hear about the inconvenience of the parking fee. Because we are so close to Disneyland we have to charge for parking otherwise non guest would use our parking lot to park their vehicles leaving our guest with no place to park. You did mention that you have two stay coming up and we will like to make sure we take care of you as a returning guest. If you could provide me with your reservation confirmation at jonathanC@hianaheim.com I will be more than happy to take care of your parking.   Front Desk Supervisor  Jonathan C.

Summary: We decided to try this good neighbor hotel instead of a park resort after feeling like we weren't gaining anything from previous experiences at resort hotels. We were so impressed! It's about 2 blocks away from downtown Disney, although a shuttle is available, (ART, $3/day or passes available), but easily walkable if you're up for it! The hotel isn't brand new, but the property has been kept well, and is clean- which is wonderful in my book. It's themed and the gift shop has what you need to get by as well. The rooms are small, but livable, you aren't spending any time there anyways! We ate breakfast each morning in the downstairs area, it overlooks one of the pools which is nice, and it was delicious and the options were vast. The staff was so friendly, and everything from the
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience and we are please you love your stay with us. Our staff works hard to make sure we welcome you with a smile. I do apologize about the parking fees, due to the fact that we are so close to the park if we didn't charge anyone would park in the hotel leaving no spaces for our guest. However, next time you return just give us a call and ask me for myself or let us know that you are a returning guest and we can see what we can do about the parking fee. As far as the restaurant closing at 10pm, please swing by the front desk so we can give you alternated options for deliver. I do hope that that won't keep you away from returning to our hotel. We want to make sure our guest are happy even when we have to say goodbye.   Front Desk Supervisor  Jonathan C.

Summary: From start to finish, our full week at the Holiday Inn was super. The staff were pleasant (Juan in the restaurant in particular is praiseworthy - He was amazing with my children, and they looked forward to the mornings he served us. Then when he invited us to stay at his house with him to extend our holiday, the kids were ecstatic - of course they knew we weren't staying, but for him to say that on our last morning really finished the trip off well). I appreciate the pool not having a deep end, the restaurant was clean and the food was great, our room was always tidy and neat, and after an eventful night of vomit, the ladies cleaned it up immediately and made it no big deal. I would definitely stay again. If you're looking for a warm, welcoming hotel within easy walking distance
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience and we are please that your stay was wonderful. We are so glad that Juan service was able to make your stay memorable and we would love to welcome you back in the future.   Front Desk Supervisor  Jonathan C.

Summary: We frequent Disneyland and we stayed at this hotel during our last visit. It is less than 5 minutes to drive to Mickey and friends parking structure, it is actually on the other side of the wall from the hotel. The service was great and the prices are very good being so close to Disneyland. I try to stay there every time we go to Disneyland now.
Manager Response: Thank you for making us your hotel choice. We are please to be giving the opportunity to make your disneyland experience fun for all. We look forward to your return.  Front Desk Supervisor  Jonathan C.

Summary: Clean facilities. Nice pool. Great location in relation to Disney.  Staff was courteous, friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay again.   Only bad things are the room was a touch small, but still adequate, and the parking spaces are a little tight (but I find there are tight parking spaces in all of LA - not meant for SUVs or Full size pickups).
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and thank you for sharing your experience. We are please that your stay was wonderful and we look forward to welcoming you back in the future.   Front Desk Supervisor  Jonathan C.

Summary: Stayed here with my adult kids for 6 nights. We got the 1 bdrm suite - queen bed, sofa bed and a fold away cot. Plenty of room for all of us and the beds were very comfy. Window facing the park so we could see the fireworks every night. Very quiet too. Breakfast buffet was tasty. Overall service was great. Location was perfect - Just around the corner from Disneyland. Definitely would stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience and we are so please that your stay with us was wonderful. Our suites are unique compare to other hotels due to the fact we decorate our suites base on different themes. We hope that when you return we can have you stay in another suite and always make sure that your stay with us is memorable.   Front Desk Supervisor  Jonathan C.

Summary: The hotel is a holiday inn so you almost know exactly what your getting.  The room was clean the staff nice and the property safe.  Its a great thing to be able to walk to the parks at a fraction of what the Disney hotels cost.  With I think most people who do a park trip the hotel is to sleep at.  If your looking to hang around the hotel this might not be for you the swimming area looked ok but you might want to look at other properties near by.  all in all a great trip and a lovely hotel.  will stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. We are glad that you enjoy your time. We look forward to welcoming you back in the near future.   Front Desk Supervisor  Jonathan C.

Summary Heading: The perfect stay and friendly, helpful staff.
Summary: We stayed on property Mar 31st -Apr 2nd. I had called beforehand to verify everything was set for our reservation and Johnathan was very patient with my questions and helpful in letting me know check in time and storage of a stroller rental we had coming. We arrived well before check-in and were accommodated with the parking pass and our stroller waiting for us (we use city stroller rentals anytime we visit Anaheim). The walk was a little more than I expected, but it wasn't horrible, I assumed we'd be able to cut thru the garage somewhere but this wasn't an option. However, for the character dining at Disneyland Hotel the walk was much shorter than it would have been had we stayed at the locations across from the main gate entrance and we did breakfasts at Goofy's Kitchen both
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. We are please that we were able to make your stay memorable. We will take into account the advise about the trash can and we look forward to your return. Our staff would also like to thank you for mentioning how helpful they were and I too would like to thank you for given the opportunity to assist you. No question is ever too big or small we are all here to make sure all your question get answer and that your stay is as relaxing as we can possibly make it.   Front Desk Supervisor Jonathan C.

Summary: It's an ok hotel, we just expected more from a 3-star. We were placed in an accessible room which had a terribly awkward and strangely inaccessible layout. And when we enquires about the safety deposit box they said there were none available, and that they would call us when one was. We stayed for a week. No call.  Generally the staff are excellent. Especially the restaurant staff!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your stay. We appreciate the great feedback about the hotel staff and we apologize for not getting a call back about the safe box. We will use your feedback to make sure that our agents are on top of a request that is made by our guest. We are also sorry that we couldn't change you to a better room and I'm sure if it was available we would of but I do hope that you can give us another chance so we can make sure we replace the bad experience with a better one. Please feel free to contact us if there is anything we could do for a future stay.   Front Desk Supervisor Jonathan C.

Summary: In-hotel restaurant with kid friendly pizza and other food items. Sports their own water park and for adults a bar. Have amazing family suites with themes such as Avengers, Star Wars, and Frozen.  2 blocks to Downtown Disney and access to both parks.
Manager Response: Dear Jmichaeln,   Thank you so much for your review of our hotel.¬†I am pleased to hear you enjoyed the restaurant/ bar, Splash Pak, and the suites.¬†It's something our staff takes great pride in, so we value your feedback. We hope you will visit us again.   Sincerely,  Anabel R. Front Desk Manager Holiday Inn & Suites Anaheim

Summary: We got in late and the staff was very helpful and got us in and to our rooms fast!! The bed was comfy and the room was clean. We had a nice breakfast in the restaurant. And check out was fast and easy.
Manager Response: Dear Lynettecr,  Thank you so much for your review of our hotel.¬†I am pleased to hear you enjoyed the fast and easy check-in experience, the rooms, and the breakfast.  It's something our staff takes great pride in, so we value your feedback. We hope you will visit us again.   Sincerely,  Anabel R. Front Desk Manager Holiday Inn & Suites Anaheim

Summary Heading: Torture....rooms need sound proofing/double glazing. Better choices elsewhere.
Summary: Rooms on the smaller side,with low ceilings and the property in general is looking tired and well worn.It is not up to the usual Holiday Inn standards in my honest opinion and perhaps time the chain sold this property. More suitable as a Super 8 or Motel 6. What totally ruined our stay was the noise from the adjoining multi storey Disney carpark.As every car drove up the floors of the carpark they drove over metal strips with a resulting bang bang/boom boom.........every car and every floor all everning until midnight and starting again around 6am.Like water dripping on a stone,........torture.,....... To have paid $150 odd for this "pleasure" rubbed salt in my wounds and I left feeling very irritated and annoyed. I had expressly asked for a quiet room. There would have been
Manager Response: Dear holdenfj,  Thank you for your feedback regarding your recent visit at our hotel and please accept our sincerest apologies for the disturbance you have experienced during your stay due to the room conditions.  Rest assured that these issues will be looked into. We value your comments and welcome the opportunity to serve you again.   Sincerely,  Anabel R. Front Desk Manager

Summary: This property is an older motel style building around a very nice pool  It is mostly 2 stories with the back side 3 stories resounded by a parking lot.  We first stayed in a king Suite on the third floor.  This suite was very dated with old carpet, furniture and hardware.  It had a separate living area and 2 TVs and a  shower over a jacuzi tub. The bed was fair and probably needs to be replaced soon.  The pillows were too soft. There was an issue where they only booked us for one night even though we asked for 2, so on the second night we moved to a king room on the second floor.  It had significantly better furnishings, carpet and hardware (towel and paper holders, faucet etc).  This hotel has many updates like new AC/heaters and some rooms done better.  It is also very clean.
Manager Response: Dear  Amos803,   Thank you for your feedback regarding your recent visit at our hotel and please accept our sincerest apologies for the disturbance you have experienced during your stay due to the room conditions.  Rest assured that these issues will be looked into. We value your comments and welcome the opportunity to serve you again.   Sincerely,  Anabel R. Front Desk Manager

Summary: The hotel is in a great location, but despite being behind the "Mickey and Friends" garage, you'll still be reliant upon ART to get to Disneyland or a bit of a walk to Downtown Disney for the Monorail (a walk you may not wish to make back when you're feet are tired at the end of the day). Disney has virtually cut-off access to the park shuttle @ the parking structure to anyone not parking in the garage. (tip, though, you can take the park shuttle back on the way out, go to the second floor of the garage and walk all the way across to the stairway, then exit out to Ball Road. / West Pl. through the employee parking lot. You can get to the Holiday Inn through the adjacent hotel parking lot from Ball Rd.)  The room was overall comfortable, though things like the valences in our
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. We are sorry about the parking lot shuttle, Disney has close the short cuts we use to be able to tell our guest to get to the park due to the waiting time increasing for those who do pay to park at the parking structure. As far as for our restaurant we do offer delivery menus at the front desk from restaurants to deliver as late as 2am. We hope you return to our hotel in the future and enjoy our remodel hotel because we are still going through a renovation.   Front Desk Supervisor Jonathan C.

Summary Heading: Cheap hotel at an expensive rate of 394$/night/room 2 guests, poor worth for the money
Summary: the hotel is not worth the price of 394$ /night including breakfast for two guests. Extremely basic room  furniture and features. Noisy because of lacking noise barriers from the surrounding roads. extremely limited choice in the restaurant, very cheap look in general. Room with few space ,bathroom poorly equipped and looking old . No courtesy slippers ,no bathrobes Poor value for the money.
Manager Response: We apologize for your experience and about the cost. Unfortunately due to the Natural Food Expo that's in Anaheim from the 3/6 until the 3/11 the rates of all hotels in the area are extremely high. We hope that you can give us another chance and return on a date that we don't have this convention in town. It is the second biggest convention that Anaheim holds. First one being NAMM show in the second week of January and then Natural Food Expo on March.   Front Desk Supervisor  Jonathan C.

Summary Heading: 25 minutes to gates of Disney, 10 minutes to Downtown DIsney
Summary: I booked this hotel because of the themed rooms, and to be honest...they looked like they went to Target and bought all the decor there and just slapped it up. I was unimpressed with the decor, but the suite was nice and big. The beds were clean and I thought very comfy. The bathroom was very small and and desperately needs updating. Like a walk in shower, no carpet, double sinks. It just needs updating.   So the main problem I had was that I booked before I knew this was a pet friendly hotel. My son is allergic to dogs and cats and has asthma so this is a very severe issue. I called and was told that they usually put pets on the first and second floors, so I requested a top floor. She said they usually don't put animals up there so it would be the best option. The second night
Manager Response: Dear rox214,  Thank you for taking the time to share your valuable review. Your feedback was shared with our team. Please pardon us for the inconveniences you experienced, if there is anything we can do, do not hesitate to contact us privately. We look forward to the opportunity to welcome you back and exceed your expectations. With your valued feedback we can only get better.   Kind regards,   Management

Summary Heading: Better than expected while visiting Disneyland!
Summary: Booked through Westjet Vacations.  We had low expectations with the low price we paid, but it turned out great!  Before we arrived we emailed a few requests.  The replies were quick and the notes all carried through.  The beds were very comfortable but the rooms are small.  Everything was clean.  We walked to the park (1 mile to the gate) most days but the #11 ART bus takes you there for a couple dollars.  Or UBER-X for $8.  The restaurant made decent food and the kids ate free!  Very friendly staff overall too!  Thanks!
Manager Response: Thank  you for taking the time to share your experience. We are glad that your stay was better than expected. We try our best to make sure all our guest request can be made and if not we try to see what other options we can produce. We hope to see you in the future whether through Westjet or just making a booking through IHG.   Front Desk Supervisor  Jonathan C.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel far walk from Downtown Disney & the Anaheim Convention Centre
Summary: We stayed at the Holiday Inn and Suites for a conference at the end of February. The hotel was clean. The beds were comfortable and the staff were friendly. The hotel was a a 40 minute walk to the Anaheim Convention Centre and about 30 minutes to Downtown Disney. There was an ART bus that stopped right outside the hotel which was vary convenient. We bought a 3 day ART pass for $15. There is a restaurant on site as well as a bar. We had breakfast one morning. It was reasonably priced. There were families as well as conference attendees staying at the hotel. A versatile hotel for anyone's vacationing needs.
Manager Response: Hello Nadya21!  Thanks for going out of your way to write a review for us and also for staying at our property. I'm delighted to read about your appreciation for the cleanliness of our property and convenient location. Also, it's good to know that you were able to enjoy your breakfast. It's regretful though that we weren't able to make sure that you stay was extraordinary. While I wish you had a more flawless experience, feedback like this helps us pinpoint the areas that need more attention. If you want to try us out again in the future, we hope to provide you with a service that aligns to many 5-star reviews that we receive regularly.   Warmest Regards,   Gian M Case Manager IHGService

Summary: This location was very close to the park. But they charged us for parking. We decided to ride the bus so it was very convenient. The room was mediocre but appropriate for the price. The front desk staff were aloof & unprofessional but got the job done.
Manager Response: Dear Katherine S,   Thank you for your candid review. We apologize that your recent stay did not meet expectations. We appreciate your comments and will share these with our team so that we can continue to improve our services. We do hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back in the future, so that we can provide a better experience.  Sincerely,  Anabel R.  Front Desk Manager

Summary Heading: 25 minute walk to the gates of the disney parks, 10 min walk to downtown disney
Summary: Rooms looked clean. No bugs/rodents. Staff were friendly. Bathroom fan was super LOUD!  Shower for pool/hot tub is in a poor location SO no one showered beforehand.  No restaurants in the area, but the onyx restaurant is good, but not as cheap as mcdonald's that has turkey sausage and egg whites.
Manager Response: Hi fwg2016,  Thank you for your stay and for taking the time out of your day to write your review of our hotel. I am delighted to read the kind endorsement of our location and the cleanliness of our rooms.  However, I would like to apologize for any inconvenience caused by the noise level from the bathroom fan. I have taken note and wish to thank you for all your valuable comments. These are of great importance to us and allow us to monitor and improve our service continually.    Again, thank you for your valued feedback and we look forward to hosting you on your next visit.   Sincerely,  Christian C. Case Manager IHGService

Summary: We chose to stay here during our recent visit to Disneyland. The hotel is in a perfect location and was only a 10 minute walk to Downtown Disney. Rooms were average size and clean. Beds were very comfortable and rooms quiet. There is a restaurant and bar in the lobby along with a gift/snack shop. Staff were very nice and helpful. Discount Disneyland tickets can be purchased at the front desk.
Manager Response: Dear CDEW,  Thank you so much for your review of our hotel.¬†I am pleased to hear you enjoyed your stay with us.¬†It's something our staff takes great pride in, so we value your feedback. We hope you will visit us again.   Sincerely,  Anabel R. Front Desk Manager

Summary: My better half and I booked this hotel for two nights (primarily because it's a 10-minute walk from Downtown Disney), and we were very pleased. Because we're IHG Priority Club members, we were upgraded to a Pirates of the Caribbean suite -- and, okay, it was supremely cheesy for two adults, but it was also HUGE, clean, and supremely quiet. As well, the beds were comfortable and the fitness center was lovely. We look forward to returning.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience. We are please that your stay was wonderful and that we were able to upgrade you so you can enjoy one of our theme suites. We look forward to your return and as always feel free to contact if you have any question for your future reservation.   Front Desk Supervisor Jonathan C.

Summary: We booked this hotel for a 4 night stay. Check in was quick and smooth after a long day. Staff were friendly. The room was spacious and seemed quiet. We always keep a fan running at night but never heard any neighbors or hallway noise. The room was clean and mostly updated. Large counter space in the bathroom was convenient. The fitness center was nice as well, quality equipment and stocked with water, towels, etc.     Only negatives I can find is that the pillows weren't super comfortable and a bottled water out of the vending machine $3.00.   The location was great, probably about a 15 minute walk to Disney and other restaurants and shopping at Downtown Disney so you don't have to pay additional parking if you head to those places. Overall, fantastic stay and we would stay

Loved loved the ambiance even the Mickey statue :) but the training facilities upstairs were  gorgeous & bright & convenient for our participants! The the staff were friendly & took care of the little things we needed throughout the day. Definitely looking forward to going back! Great place for business meetings as well as the close 10 minute walk to Disneyland!
Manager Response: We would like to thank you for taking the time to share your experience. We are glad that your stay was memorable and that our staff was able to deliver the best customer service we could provided. We look forward for your return and please feel free to call us so we could assist you in your future stay.   Front desk Supervisor  Jonathan C.

Summary: Smart new hotel. Location is very close to motorway, so road noise is an issue if you have good hearing.  What makes this place great is the staff. They were super friendly, funny and very engaging. Thanks for making our stay so great.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience and we are so proud of our staff for delivering such great service. We are improving and updating our hotel but in the end it is the staff that delivers the warm welcome and the "hope to see you again" smiles. We do hope that when you return to visit Disneyland you think of us and always wish to deliver a great experience.   Front Desk Supervisor Jonathan C.

Summary: Location: The hotel is located in Anaheim so if you're going to other parts of Los Angeles, it is out of the way for a lot of places but very convenient for Disneyland goers.  Essentially it is a walking distance to downtown Disney which then leads to both Disneyland as well as California Adventure Parks so staying here can save you some parking fees as well as time. You can arrive when the park opens and leave when the park closes and home will just be minutes away.   Room: The hotel has two sections. The main building with the reception area as well as a secondary building. Our rooms were located in the second building. If you've stayed at other Holiday Inn locations before, this one is very similar. The only thing about the room is that there is insufficient lighting at
Manager Response: We would like to thank you for sharing your experience and also to apologize for the inconvenience. We will touch basics with our housekeeping manager about the issue. We are going through renovations and take your feedback as our main tool to improve our hotel from the smallest issue to the biggest. We do hope that if you choose to return we can carry on our promise to deliver a memorable stay.   Front Desk Supervisor  Jonathan C.

Summary: This was our 2nd family trip to Disneyland. The first trip we stayed at Ramada Maingate (think it's called something different now?) and the hotel was such a dump so we decided to stay at the Holiday Inn & Suites for our 6 night stay this time.  We knew going in that this hotel was an investment into walking to the park so we opted to pay $92 for a 5 day pass for the four of us, the ART shuttle to the park as the stop was right outside the hotel front doors (At the designated smoking area with benches) and the ART shuttle runs frequently enough to be a great option for us without inconvenience (approx every 20 mins and we used the ART app)  The hotel was very clean and the front desk staff were extremely friendly and competent. Check in was quick and smooth. They preauthorized
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience and we are so glad that your stay was wonderful. We get great review about our restaurant and our staff and we are so proud to see that our staff is delivering everlasting memories. As we improve with our renovations we always make sure that our guest come first and we are excited that have made your stay a memorable one. We look forward to your return in the future.   Front Desk Supervisor Jonathan C.

Summary Heading: Comfy Bed, poor wifi and a bit of a walk to the parks.
Summary: So this has to be the sixth or seventh hotel we have stayed at in the Disneyland area so my review is based a little bit comparing the Holiday Inn to where we have stayed before.  So we typically stay in the park all day so I guess for Disney, I have three main criteria: comfy bed to sleep in as you are so tired, ease to get to the park and, in this day and age with kids, good wifi!  The bed was very comfy and we all slept really well, absolutely no complaints at all.  In fact, when we were there we had a note to say that the mattresses were being upgraded on one of the days we were there.  As for the rest of the room, there was a fridge and microwave, the sink area was spacious and one of those outside of the bathroom itself which just had a toilet and bath/shower.  The shower
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. We know that there are many hotels to choose when visiting Disneyland and we thank you for giving us a try. We apologies for the poor wifi and we are going through a renovation. We take your feedback as a tool to hit the issues that our guest experience so we can improve and stand out from the other hotels. We hope you give us another try and we will make sure you don't experience the same issue.  Front Desk Supervisor  Jonathan C.

Summary: We stayed at the Holiday Inn & Suites for 3 days at the end of January.  The hotel is within a 10 minute walk as it sits directly behind the Mickey parking lot.  The pool & hot tub were great after a long day at the park, but we couldn't get the jets to work and it didn't seem like the pool filters were working since it had a lot of bugs floating on top.  My husband said the men's bathroom at the pool was disgusting and needed to be cleaned.  We reserved a room with two queen beds.  The beds were comfy (soft, pillowtop) but the room was definitely one of the smallest hotel rooms I have ever seen.  With a family of four (two children 14 & 10), there was barely room for our bags and it was almost too close for comfort.  I would guess that there was maybe 3.5 feet from the end of
Manager Response: Dear Tanmansmom,   Thank you very much for taking the time to review our hotel. We apologize for the inconveniences you experienced and if there is anything we can do, please do not hesitate to contact us privately. Your feedback was shared with our team, and we look forward to the opportunity to welcome you back and exceed your expectations on your next visit.   Kind regards,   Anabel Ramos Front Desk Manager Holiday Inn & Suites Anaheim

Summary: Good location walking distance to disneyland 15 minute on foot at strolling pace.  If you are with children you can opt to buy a bus pass to get to the park instead of walking.  Parking at hotel overnight has a $12.00 fee.  The dinning area inside the hotel has reasonable pricing for simple food from $9-12 dollars.  Hotel has a children splash zone and a year round pool.  Rooms are spacious and the suites are wonderful for traveling with kids.  Recommended for value and comfort.
Manager Response: Dear NancyAndrew,   Thank you for taking the time to share your valuable review. We love to read that you enjoyed the Splash Park, restaurant, and rooms. We hope to see you next time to the Anaheim area. Thank you again for having shared your experience with us.   Kind regards,   Anabel Ramos Front Desk Manager Holiday Inn & Suites

Summary Heading: Made my daughters birthday trip magical
Summary: Pleasantly surprised when we arrived at the Holiday Inn and were greeted by the friendly check-in staff. We were having a reunion for our daughter and her friend to celebrate my daughters 6th birthday and the staff went out of there way to make it special!   The room was brilliantly decorated and when our kids saw it they were blown away. The hotel was clean, pool was warm and people friendly.  Thanks to Anabel and the rest of the staff for making it a great stay.
Manager Response: We are please for your review and thank you for taking the time to share it. We try to make sure that our guest arriving for a special occasion, especially a birthday, can experience something better than just a room with two beds, we make it fun and enjoyable. We thank you for giving us the opportunity to celebrate your daughter's birthday and hope to see you in the future. Call us if you ever return to visit Disneyland so we can make sure your return is as memorable as your first time.   Front Desk Supervisor Jonathan C.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel for visit to Disneyland
Summary: My husband and I checked out today and we had a fantastic stay!  Room was clean, resort was in good condition, and we were only a short 5-7 minute walk from Downtown Disney.  From there you can take the monorail to the parks or take a leisurely stroll through Downtown Disney to the parks.  I really enjoyed this location. Super friendly service, and a restaurant and gift shop on site, which was a nice plus!   We didn't utilize the pool area as the weather was a little too cold for us, but we had a great view of the Splash Zone from our room and it looked like lots of fun too!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to share your experience. We are proud of our staff and the level of customer service they provide to all the guest. We combine our agents with the knowledge of a hotel concierges to make sure we meet all your needs. We look forward to your return in the future.   Front Desk Supervisor  Jonathan C.

Summary: Quick trip to Disneyland Great price point Felt very safe even in a huge complex Comfortable beds Wifi Friendly help at check in Parking was hard to find late at night and didn't realize there was a fee of $10 But not a big deal Would stay here again
Manager Response: Dear Joan S,   Thank you very much for sharing your travel stay experience you had with our hotel. We love to read that you enjoyed all the amenities we have here at our hotel, such as the wifi and beds.Thank you again for having shared your experience with us.   Kind regards,   Anabel Ramos Front Desk Manager Holiday Inn & Suites Anaheim

Summary Heading: Must be one of the best value hotels round
Summary: Great location. Clean. Accommodated our large family in one room (4 kids). Public transport is right there. Super close to Disneyland. Walking distance to great restaurants, and target ect. Friendly staff. Clean pool. Spa. Cvs next door for a beer etc. No restaurant but most local businesses deliver pizza etc to you and you are surrounded by awesome places to eat out from The Cheesecake Factory to Subway so the restaurant isn't an issue.  I had a car there (rarely used it) and don't remember being stung for parking which was a huge bonus. Very family friendly. I've recommended this hotel to many friends from Australia and they all would stay again. I made a huge mistake and stayed at another local hotel on a more recent trip on a flash deal, and ended up paying more in parking,
Manager Response: We would like to thank you for your amazing review. We are glad that we left a long lasting experience and memorable stay. We know there are so many hotels to choose from and the fact that you gave us the opportunity we are glad that we were able to deliver not just a room but also a great staff treatment.   Front Desk Supervisor  Jonathan C.

Summary: I have stayed at most of the hotels around Disneyland. this one was affordable and clean which is better then I can say about most of the ones surrounding the park, close enough to walk into the park, good location to get around Anaheim, nice and close to the freeway is you plan on doing some travelling around. overall good staff nice and clean and affordable
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and we are glad that you enjoyed your stay with us. We know choosing a hotel can be a gamble but we are glad that you choice to give us a try. Thank you again for the great review and we look forward to your return in the future.   Front Desk Supervisor  Jonathan C.

Summary Heading: Reasonably priced stat within walking distance to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here to Dave money.  It was only 2 blocks further than the disneyland hotel.  The staff was helpful.  The room was clean and comfortable.  We are people who spend from opening until late at the parks.  So we didn't need anything fancy.  This was perfect for us!  Will definitely stay again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience and we are please that your stay was great. We look forward to your return in the future and let us know if we could assist you in anyway.   Front Desk Supervisor  Jonathan C.

Summary: I have stayed at this Holiday Inn a number of times over the years, making all of my reservations through Priceline. Recently, IHG has made a push to convert over Priceline customers, this would be me. Success, I made my first reservation for this hotel trough the IHG reservation line.(IHG has outsourced this service to a foriegn country as the reservationist said that she was from the Phillippines.) The reservationist took my reservation and I checked into the hotel.  I late found out that there were different options to the reservation that the reservationist did not inform me of (ie. breakfast). After finding out that there was a breakfast option, I called IHG and asked them to amend my reservation to include this breakfast option.  IHG said that they could not, being that I
Manager Response: Dear Daniel H,  Thank you for your review regarding your recent stay at Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim, CA. It is regrettable to know about your experience during your room reservation and if the level of assistance received from the hotel manager did not live up to your expectations.  I would like to address this with you further. I have sent you a private message to obtain more information about your stay. I look forward to hearing from you and being of further assistance.  Sincerely,  Grace P. Case Manager IHGService

Summary: WE HAVE STAYED AT THIS HOTEL FOR FIVE OUT OF THE PAST 6 YEARS VISITING THE ANAHEIM AREA AND WANTING TO VISIT DISNEYLAND. We have always had good service and the rooms are spacious and always clean.  Last year we stayed in the block behind the main reception block and a short walk along past the small pool and gym.  My only concern was the keypad security gate taking you to the parking lot from the hotels grounds was constantly left open leaving any member of the public access to the hotel blocks.  The fact that these security gates have a keypad entry for guests to access the hotel shows these gates should be left closed at all times.  It seemed as if hotel staff such as room attendants and maintenance staff were leaving the gates open. If we stay again it would be nice to see
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and for letting us know about our keypads. We will make sure we let our maintain department be aware of this.   Front Desk Supervisor  Jonathan C.

Summary: We stayed here for 1 night in December! Staff were friendly and the room was spacious. The hotel is set a little back from the main road in Anaheim but the shuttle bus to Disneyland stops right at the hotel making for easy transport :) would stay again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the to shared your stayed with us. We are grateful that our staff was able to deliver a great service and that you enjoy your room. Please contact us directly if you do return to the hotel and see what we can offer as a returning guest.   Front Desk Supervisor Jonathan C.

Summary Heading: Average hotel walking distance to Disney
Summary: We stayed here with our family in 3 different rooms. The rooms were average and appeared clean. We stayed around Christmas and there was always a line near the front desk and we could not get extra blankets and pillows because they were so busy. Those staff was courteous and helpful. The were a couple broken doors in our building but everything else was fine. We walked to Disney and it did not seem to far. Our four kids (youngest is 5) nor the grandparents had any issues with the walk.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to shared your experience. During the holiday it does get a bit busy at the front desk. We do apologize that your request was delay do to the line we of check ins. Your feedback is very important and we take into account to improve everyday. We are glad that your stay was memorable and hope to see you back in the future.   Front Desk Supervisor Jonathan C.

Summary: I've stayed here twice now with my dog. The amenities are dated but the room is relative clean. The price has been reasonable and I love that I can walk back and forth to Disneyland so that I can check on my dog. If you're not too tired from Disneyland, you can walk all the way back to the hotel. Otherwise, you can pick up the tram at the Mickey & Friends parking lot. Alternatively, you can walk to Downtown Disney and pick up the monorail to Tomorrowland in Disneyland. The monorail seems to come ~15 minutes at best, though.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience in our hotel. We are please that you enjoy your stay with us and always look forward to returning guest.   Front Desk Supervisor  Jonathan C.

Summary: We had our reservation fall through for where we planned to stay for our Christmas trip to Anaheim as we were driving. In a panic my wife located a second property and booked it sight unseen. When we saw the room there, I was not happy and started looking for another option.   I booked a family suite at this location and it was perfectly suited for our family of six! We loved the Cars, Monsters Inc., and Toy Story themed rooms in our suite. The hotel was an easy walk from Downtown Disney and the Monorail station there.   As far as negatives go, we were right by the pool and the music at the pool seemed to come on too early and stay on too late (on before the pool opened and still on after it closed for the night). The fridge in our room chilled a gallon of milk we had so that it
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience and on behave of the Hotel we are please to hear that we "saved your Christmas." We do apologize for the music by the pool, we are going through a renovation and we are sure to fix the minor problems like the music being too loud for our guest. We are glad that your Cars theme room came to your liking and look forward to your return. If you ever experience anything in the room not working properly please notify the front desk so we can tackle the issue and fix it right away.   Front Desk Supervisor  Jonathan C.

Summary: This was a clean little place to stay. Just very out dated and the bed...........my goodness the most uncomfortable small bed I have ever stayed in. I contemplated getting out of the bed and sleeping on the floor. Staff were very friendly and helpful though, we were wrapped with the staff. Ok just to sleep in as you aren't there much, you are most likely at Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and we apologize for the bad experience with our beds. We are going through a renovations to improve our hotel. We are please that our staff were able to provided an outstanding customer service and we hope that in the future you would give us another chance to make up for your first experience in our hotel.   Front Desk Supervisor  Jonathan C.

Summary: This hotel is a great find! For the price, we haven't found anything comparable in the Disneyland area. Our room was large, clean, quiet, and very comfortable. The microwave and fridge were nice to have. The best aspect of this hotel is the location....a pleasant 20 minute walk to Disneyland, along a fairly quiet residential street. Breakfast was good in the restaurant. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. My only complaint is with the wireless internet service....cut out constantly.....so basically non-existent. Another plus for this hotel is their pet policy....they allow small pets, which is great for those traveling with furry companions. A cute splash pool for children is fun when the weather is warmer. Nicely stocked gift shop, too. This will be our go-to Disneyland
Manager Response: We are please that your stay with us was memorible and excited that you have select the Holiday Inn and Suites for your return visited. We apologize about the issue with the wifi and we are going through a renovation to improve our hotel. We look forward to your return and please if you have any question give us a call.   Front Desk Supervisor  Jonathan C.

Summary: We are priority club members and have stayed at a lot of HI over the years so I felt comfortable selecting this hotel when it said it was the "closest HI to Disneyland" that may be correct but it isn't close (about a 15min - 20 min walk to Downtown Disney / 1/2 hour walk to Disneyland ticket booth).  There is a shuttle but it costs extra so plan on that and it runs every 30 minutes so don't miss it.  Before we arrived they called and said the room I had reserved months ago was over booked and could they switch me. So we agreed on a STar Wars themed room, when we arrived we didn't get it, so I was tired and didn't want to argue.  Also when we arrived I wanted to purchase Park Passes (they offer a discount to hotel guests) but they were all out of adults.  Front desk and I didn't
Manager Response: We are sorry that your stay was a disappointment and hope that you would give us another chance. We are going through a renovation and been tackling an upgrade on the rooms, especially the suites. We try our best to take care of our IHG members and not having the room type you book available is no excuse as why we fail our guest. If you ever return please feel like to contact our hotel directly so we can give you the best offer and replace your bad experience with a memorable one.   Front Desk Supervisor  Jonathan C.

Summary Heading: The walls and ceilings are paper thin
Summary: Haven't a clue what the neighbors next door are doing tonight, or what the neighbors upstairs did last night or the neighbors to the other side the night before.  They're likely just living and existing, but apparently everyone gets to hear what everyone is doing in this hotel.  Also, the ventilation system will not shut off completely which can be uncomfortable as in front of the ventilator system is the best place to sit.  Price was right for this close to the park.  Breakfast was $17 though; it was a good well made breakfast.
Manager Response: We are sorry to hear that your stay wasn't a good one. We are going through a renovation and are fixing the issues. We hope that you give us another try and that we can replace that bad experience with a better one. Please contact the hotel directly so we can give you a better offer if you return to our hotel.  Front Desk Supervisor  Jonathan C.

Summary Heading: EXCELLENT!!!! BEST KEPT SECRET NEAR DISNEYLAND!!!
Summary: This hotel is an incredible location: a quiet, pleasant 10 minute residential walk to Disneyland. The man at the desk, Sean, was tremendous. Even though I got there at about 9 in the morning and didn't have reservations until that afternoon, he found someplace for me without my asking! I was just asking for permission to leave my car in the lot until I could check in!!!! I was able to take a nap, have breakfast with the great waiting staff in their restaurant and then walk over to Disneyland. I have stayed here every year since I found it a couple of years ago INSTEAD of the Disneyland Hotel, which has become increasingly "corporate" and "sterile" This is also a great family spot with plenty of room in the suites and plenty for kids to do. You go, Sean!!!! I will definitely stay
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience. We are please that Sean was able to take care of you and that is the reason he is now a Front Desk Supervisor because of his great customer service and leadership he display to the team at the front desk. We look forward to your return.   Front Desk Supervisor  Jonathan C.

Summary: Enjoyed this hotel. Staff were very helpful & friendly. The rooms were cleaned daily. Offers in-hotel self-serve laundry facilities which is a massive plus. Easy access to Disneyland & walking distance to many shops & restaurants.
Manager Response: Dear Krisandyudi,   Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. Management is happy to hear you enjoyed the helpful and friendly staff, our self-serve laundry, and of course our cleaned rooms. Hope to see you next time!   Kind regards,   Anabel Ramos Front Desk Manager Holiday Inn & Suites Anaheim

Summary: My wife and I enjoyed our stay. All staff were very friendly, helpful and accommodating. Room was everything we needed and very clean. No complaints. Nice and close to Disney and we enjoyed the short walk to the park.
Manager Response: Oh behalf of the hotel staff we would like to thank you for sharing your experience. We are please that the staff made your stay memorable with our kindness and welcome attitude. We look forward to your return.   Front Desk Supervisor  Jonathan C.

Summary Heading: One night stay for work in the area
Summary: I came in with my husband for a mini vacation while he had work. This hotel is just down the road from his job walk so we didn't give much thought to how close it was to Disneyland. Turned out to be handy. I had 3 hours to kill with no car. Downtown Disney is only a 10 - 15 minute walk from the hotel, which is a large shopping and dining area outside Disneyland and California Adventure Land main entrances. I never went into the theme park, but had fun shopping and wondering around.  As for the hotel, The staff were very helpful and friendly. The room was right buy the elevator and on the ground floor. With people coming and going from 6am to 1130pm it was pretty noisey, but comfortable. I recommend something twards the middle and higher up. Parking was easy and plentiful. Plus
Manager Response: Dear  Aliengirl702,   Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and for for giving us a five star review! Management is happy to hear you enjoyed your mini vacation here at our hotel. The staff could not be more happier to hear you find us helpful and friendly. We hope to see you next to the Anaheim area.   Kind regards,  Anabel Ramos Front Desk Manager Holiday Inn & Suites Anaheim

Summary: Hotel needs an update! Felt Dirty and the overall appearance of the room was drab and out dated. Mattress and Pillows were very lumpy! Housekeeping staff was very friendly, but that was only positive about the stay. be prepared to pay over 11.00 a night for parking!!
Manager Response: Dear TonisT1001CU,   Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. Please pardon us for the inconveniences you may have experienced. Management will like to assure you that your comments will aid us in improving our services. Management could not be more happier to hear you enjoyed the friendly housekeeping staff. Once again thank you for your review.   Kind regards,   Anabel Ramos Front Desk Manager Holiday Inn & Suites Anaheim

Summary: Hotel is clean. Staff friendly. Meals were only free to children. Food was not good and extremely overpriced, except for pancakes so we ended up hitting the McDonalds which was the best McDonalds we've ever been to, greatly impressed. The shop in the lobby was excellent. The walk to Disney is around the back so not good lighting at night so wouldn't recommend that way unless a big guy was with you and even then it can be scary. Day time is fine and there is a shuttle for a fee. They also charge for parking $10 per day and they require a deposit for the parking up front.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! Management is happy to hear you enjoyed our clean hotel and friendly staff. We hope to see you next time to the Anaheim area.   Kind regards,   Management

Summary: It was good experience to stay in that hotel. The Chinese lady at reception was very welcoming. The facility at the hotel was good. I wished for microwave and fridge for my baby milk to heat and store it was there.  Breakfast was good but different variety would have been great!
Manager Response: Dear Neety S,   The staff is happy to hear you had a great experience with our hotel! We are happy to hear our receptionist staff was very welcoming, we will share your review with her. On a side note we will like to inform you that all of our rooms have a microwave and fridge. Once again thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. Until next time!   Kind regards,   Anabel Ramos Front Desk Manager Holiday Inn & Suites Anaheim

Summary Heading: Clean and comfortable but needs a makeover
Summary: We spent 6 nights here on a recent family trip to Disney.  The main plus about this hotel is the close proximity to the parks.  We walked everyday to and from.  The rooms were clean and comfortable beds.  The downsides of the hotel are other than the very pricey downtown Disney restaurants, there is nothing near this hotel.  We walked about 25 min to get to Walgreens to buy a case of water and some snacks.  Also the rooms are very tiny, smallest hotel I've ever been in.  The bedsides were maybe an inch from the wall, bathroom very small the toilet and tub were maybe 6 inches apart.  There were peeling wallpaper and a few dings I our walls as well as old dingy carpet in the room and halls.  I think these things can be improved with a Reno.  The pool area was nice and the pool
Manager Response: Dear Tracie W,  Thank you for your feedback and for staying with us. We realize you have many choices when it comes to lodging, and we sincerely appreciate your business with us. I am glad to read that you have liked the pool facilty, enjoyed the pizza served in the restaurant, and found the location of the hotel a close proximity to your needs. However, we are truly sorry if the condition of the room received and the carpet did not live up to your expectations. Your feedback is of great importance to us and allows us to monitor and improve the quality of our amenities and facilities we offer. Rest assured these concerns will be forwarded to the hotel management for evaluation and will be a basis for future upgrade.  Again, thank you for staying with us and we hope we get the opportunity to show you some of the improvements on your next trip.  Sincerely,  Grace P. Case Manager IHGService
