Summary: This property has been my go to for when I visit the Disneyland Resort. The staff is always friendly and helpful, the rooms are always clean and welcoming. Not to mention it's super convenient as far as getting to the parks and back, always a quick, cheap Uber or Lyft ride! Will definitely return!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and we are so glad to be your to go hotel. Give us a call in the future when you return so we can welcome you back with our great staff.   Front Desk Supervisor  Jonathan C.

Summary: This hotel has great staff that are always willing to help you out.  They are very friendly and knowledgeable about the area.  Disneyland/California Adventure gates are only a 10-15 minute walk from the hotel through Downtown Disney, where there is always lots to see and do.  We were fortunate to get an upgraded room and got a suite instead of a two queen bed room.  This was a nice surprise and was very beneficial to a family of four.  It made our vacation and was much appreciated.  The restaurant has great staff and food.  Kids eat breakfast and dinner for free, which really helps reduce the cost of a Disney vacation.  The pool area was nice and clean and was a welcome break from the crowds at the theme parks.    This is an older hotel but they have done a great job of
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and we are proud of our staff for delivery such great service to our guest. We are glad that we could deliver an amazing experience and we look forward to your return.   Front Desk Supervisor  Jonathan C.

Summary: My family and I stayed at this hotel from Oct.19 to Oct.25 for our trip to Disneyland.  The restaurant staff was amazing and the food was great along with reasonable pricing plus kids eat free! That really helped as Disneyland can get expensive on food and drinks.  The room we stayed in had 2 double beds which was okay but room was a little too small.  Pool and splash park was great on really hot days.  Some reviews wrote 15 minutes to Disneyland but its actually 15 minutes to Downtown Disney and another 10 minutes to the front of the park.    The only issue I had with the staff there was after our stay.  My daughter left her eye glasses in the room and I had called that day and asked if they can send it back to our home. The first time time I called they transferred me to a
Manager Response: Dear Remon E,  Thank you for posting a candid feedback from your recent stay with us. It is great to know that you were able to appreciate the service provided by our restaurant staff, the condition of our room, and our location. However, I was concerned to see that you were not impressed with our housekeeping services. I would like to apologize for any inconvenience these issues may have caused you during your stay. Rest assured, we have taken note of these and we will certainly discuss this with our team for further improvements needed on our product and services.     Again, thank you for staying with us and I hope that we would have another chance to accommodate you again in the future.    Regards,    Christian C. Case Manager  IHGService

Summary: I recently stayed for the first time at this Holiday Inn.  I was very surprised by our room. We were given an upgrade to a Spider Man Themed Suite in building 4.  We had a very spacious living room, kitchenette and a separate comfy bedroom with 2 beds.  The room had spider man decorations, lamps, shower curtain, bedspreads etc.  It was very fun.   The breakfast buffet was included in our room rate, but you could instead order off the menu up to the price of the buffet.  The staff was very nice.  Our room was so quiet, we never heard anyone.  And it is just around the corner from Disney.  My friend that traveled with me, said that she has stayed at this hotel at least a dozen times and has always been happy. Great value for the price.
Manager Response: We would like to thank you for taking the time to share your experience and are please that your friend's recommendation for our property was a success. The Averages theme suite is one of my favorite rooms  especially when you're visiting Disneyland. We look forward to your return and hope to always make your stay as amazing as our rooms.   Front Desk Supervisor  Jonathan C.

Summary Heading: Good hotel overall, great value if part of a vacation package
Summary: Please kindly indicate if this review is helpful so I know where to focus my future efforts.  The Holiday Inn & Suites Anaheim was the property chosen for our 4-day South California trip this month. October seems to be a quieter time if any families can make it out to check Disneyland. Please note although the property is a block from Disneyland, it is still a 20 minute walk of approximately one mile to the entrance (searched it online). The purpose of our trip was for a friend's wedding and as part of a vacation package, the flight and hotel was actually cheaper than the flight alone at the time of purchase. Thus, for those wishing to travel to California, this is a very good option to consider. Location was good for Southern California in general.  The property itself was
Manager Response: Thank you for a great informative review and taking the time to share your experience. We are please for the rating and we apologize for the minor issues. We are going through a renovation to improve our hotel in not just the restaurant but also the hotel rooms. We do hope that you can join us once we have remodel our hotel. Our goal is to make our guest experience memorable.   Front Desk Supervisor  Jonathan C.

Summary Heading: Not suitable for a business stay - probably fine for kids
Summary: Take this as a review from someone who was booked in for business at the convention center - I guess it might be fine as a cheap option for disneyland.  It start off with being told a $50 deposit would be taken off my card 'in case I broke anything' which would be paid back if I didn't break anything, but they didn't known how long. I then had to initial about 4 places in various disclaimers.  What a lovely welcome!    The room was OK, a bit tatty, but big and comfortable.   The restaurant and bar though were truly terrible.  More like a budget diner, with TVs at lots of tables pumping out cartoons or sales channels, with very little options, and the bar was just a few stools.  Opening times were limited, with nowhere to get a coffee etc.    Curiously it had a business   I was
Manager Response: Thank you Michael for your feedback, we do hope to you give us a try when you visit Disneyland.  Sincerely,  Jennifer Rivera

Summary: My friends and I booked into this Holiday Inn for a 3 night stay since it was located  in walking distance to Downtown Disney/Disneyland and not that far(?) from Universal Studios. (As the traffic flows).  I had no complaints with the hotel. Our room was large very clean, and the double queen beds were very comfortable. In the bathroom there was lots of room for a few people to spread their hba's out along with enough towels for the night along with the usual shampoo conditioner etc.   Our room had a small  fridge and 1 cup coffee maker along with a large TV and Wi-Fi. I loved having a laundry room close by. It really came in handy after "walking " to and from Disney. ( think 90¬∞ heat and humidity).   The hotel lobby to me was quite compact. There was a front desk & a small area
Manager Response: We would like to thank you for taking the time for reviewing our Hotel. We are glad that you enjoyed your stay and that your room was to your satisfaction. We are also please that you got to experience our restaurant and bar. I also agree with you about the bar stop after a day at Disneyland. We are going through a renovation and we hope that you can join us in the future to experience a new look to our hotel. Not just the rooms but also our restaurant and bar.   Front Desk Supervisor  Jonathan C.

Summary: This was my second time at this hotel and I was pleased once again. Michael, the manager, is "The Man". Without going into detail, he fixed an issue we had immediately when he arrived to work the next morning. We were very greatful. Thanks again MikeüòÄ. The suite was very clean. The food at restaurant and service was very good. Customer service in general was great. We enjoyed the short walk to the parks. In order to skip walking through Downtown Disney, if you already have your tickets, you can take the monorail right beside Rainforest Cafe and it will drop you off inside Disneyland....not California Adventures. Same to return.

We [me,my wife and parents] stayed at Holiday Inn,Anaheim for 2 nights during our visit to DisneyLand and California Adventure park in April 2016. Loved the hospitality, room cleanliness and facilities, costs and the food. We had an offer where we got 16$ large pizza plus lemonades free per night as part of the booking.  The location is great and you can walk down to Disneyland via MagicWay [takes around 15 mins]. There are quite a few shopping complexes nearby. Staff is friendly and nice and you can enjoy nice walks in the evening. Has a nice swimming pool as well. Overall, a great place to stay if you visit Disneyland without blowing a hole in your pocket.  Cheers :)  Best regards, Bharat
Manager Response: Thank you Bharatkumar for your feedback ~ I'm thrilled to hear you and your family enjoyed your stay. We look forward to seeing you back on your next magical journey.   Sincerely,  Jennifer Rivera Assistant General Manger

Summary: This hotel was included in our budget holiday package. The hotel was being updated but our stay wasn't disturbed in any way. Our room was clean and comfortable even thou we were hardly in it. Wifi worked. Loved the pizza from the restaurant and the gift shop was a fun place to last minute shop and get ice cream to go with that pizza.

Stayed here for 4 nights..... the stay was great but just a few downers that no airport shuttle and the kitchen should be operated 24hours coz ppl come from around the world with different time zones you know.....and it is 15 minute walk away from Disney tooo...and got a $10 shuttle for through out the day which takes 10mins is yea that's good....the rooms were good the staff was great....

Summary Heading: Great location if you are going to Disney.
Summary: This was my second time at this hotel. My husband and I were upgraded to a suite. The room was very spacious and clean. We were on the top floor, so there wasn't anyone above us to make noise. The hallway was exceptionally quiet as well which was surprising since the hotel has sold out for the night. We had a very enjoyable two night stay. We will definitely be staying here for our future Disneyland vacations.

My wife and I took two grand kids to see Disneyland last week and stayed here for five nights. Check in was quick and easy. The hotel is showing some age, yet there were maintenance people around everyday painting and doing upgrades. The room was large enough for the four of us, as was the bathroom.  I wouldn't say that the beds were comfortable, yet they were okay. I have certainly slept on worse mattresses. The air conditioning worked well, the showers were always warm with good water pressure. The only glitch was that one of the phones didn't work, yet it was fixed by the following morning. My wife and the kids only used the pool once. Mainly because we were all pretty exhausted by days end, but also because it is not meant for four and five year old children, too deep. The

We stayed here for a weekend when we decided to hit up Disneyland park. The parking lot was large and check-in process was smooth. They do charge for parking but they allowed us to keep our car parked there all day even on check-out day so that was nice. The room is the standard type you would expect from Holiday Inn, although the bathroom that we had in our King bed room was a little smaller than other IHG properties that I have stayed at.  As far as the walk to the park goes.. it's not too bad. I would say if you are a fast walker it will take around 15 minutes to get to the ESPN Zone side of Downtown Disney, and another 10 minutes to walk through the security gates. I enjoy walking but it can seem like a bit of a far walk. Overall, I do feel like this hotel is a good value

Summary Heading: a little less of a Holiday Inn than i am used to
Summary: Tho the staff was pleasant but very routine. Did feel like I was just another guest with the same questions. The lobby was cute with a area for kids to watch cartoons and color. Probably the least fancy Holiday Inn I have been to. Having said that it was comfortable and had a nice pool and a splash zone for the kids really nice. We did eat in the hotel breakfast not free....It was pretty good above the Dennys food .The wait staff were excellent in the restaurant. Don't be fooled that it is 1 block from Disneyland. It takes a good 15 min to walk to downtown Disney and another 10 or so min before your in the park. After being on your feet all day and having tired kids to drag along not sure I would do it again. The hotel itself was quite which I was surprised at. You can see the

From the moment we walked into the lobby at the hotel we felt very comfortable. Hotel was clean, pool area was clean and all staff were very friendly. The restaurant within the hotel serves very good food, never had a bad meal or bad service in a week.   Really enjoyed the short walk to Disneyland!  Would definitely stay there again.

Stayed here for a quick two night visit to the Disney parks.  Upon arrival, we were quickly checked into our room.  Once in the room my five year old son commented, "It's a little tight in here but nice."  Keep in mind that he has been in plenty of hotels.  This is not at all a knock on the hotel.  The room was very, very comfortable.  There was plenty of drawer and closet space.  The sink was outside of the shower/toilet area which made it easier for everyone to get ready in the morning.  The bathroom/vanity area was well lit.  The shower was extremely powerful.  There was a small fridge in the room, which was good.  The beds were quite comfortable.  It was hot while we were there and the AC did a nice job of cooling the room.  It was loud, but they usually are.  The location

We arrived at 8am due to the early arrival of our flight from Australia, the room would not be ready till 3pm  We asked for a change room so we could get changed out of our plane clothes to start our day at Disney, the receptionist sent us down the hall to a large toilet area, it was dirty and disgusting, paper towel, drink bottles and toilet paper everywhere not a great first impression.  We asked house cleaning if they could clean the room for us .  Off to Disney we went .. It's a 10 minute walk to downtown Disney which is the restaurant shopping area .. It's then a further 10 mins to the parks so be away it is a walk especially at night when there is not much lighting and you are carrying back your purchases from a day well spent at the parks ...  The room it self was very
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback regarding your recent visit at our hotel and please accept our  apologies for the disturbance you have experienced during your stay due to our lobby restrooms.  Rest assured that these issues will be looked into. We value your comments.   Thank you  Management at the Holiday Inn and Suites

Summary Heading: Very dissapointed needs a face lift.
Summary: We were told very close to Disney but in fact a good 15 minute walk. Very tired and a little dirty. Restaurant very tired as well food not that good either. This was not up to the standard of other Holiday inns.
Manager Response: Dear DRK042,   Thank you for your feedback, we apologize for the inconveniences you experienced during your recent stay. Management will like to assure you that your comments will aid us in improving our services. If there is anything we can do, do no hesitate to contact management.   Kind regards,   Management

Summary Heading: Excellent stay, no issues at all.
Summary: Had a great experience with this hotel. Will definitely stay here again next time! We made a mistake on days booking through our travel agent so they couldn't help us extend our stay, but when we booked 2 more days through our travel agent they made sure we stayed in the same room and didn't have to move which was nice. They rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. The kurieg in the room was nice as well since I'm the only coffee drinker. They staff was pleasant and we had absolutely no issues with the room. The cafe the lobby has great food as well. However, this listing says the hotel is a block from Disneyland, that is true that  physically its a block away, but it's more of a 3 block walk and that brings you to the Downtown Disney entrance so you will have to go
Manager Response: Dear Chris F,   Thank you for rating our hotel with 5 stars! Management is happy to hear you enjoyed your stay. Your comments will be share with the staff and we will like to thanked you for informing us and the cyber guest about your great stay at our hotel. Management could not be more happy to hear you enjoyed the beds, coffee, and the pleasant staff. See you next time!   Kind regards,   Anabel Ramos Front Desk Manager Holiday Inn & Suites Anaheim

Summary: Do not stay on the 5th floor. This floor has the suites and those seem to be rented by rowdy groups. We stayed 2 nights and both nights we were woke up after midnight by noise. When we complained to the Management upon checkout, they blew us off!!!!  STAY AWAY!!!
Manager Response: Dear  Jerald W,   Thank you for your review. Management will like to apologize for the inconveniences you experienced during your stay. If there is anything we can do, please do not hesitate to contact the hotel privately, once again please pardon us for the inconveniences.   Kind regards,   Management

Summary Heading: New, clean, cheap and only a 10 minute stroll to Disneyland!
Summary: The Holiday Inn and Suites Anaheim represents great value for money, given the convenient location. The hotel seems relatively new (as at September 2016) so the rooms are basic but clean and in excellent condition. We had a room with 2 queen beds -  and the sofa was all also made up as a double bed. There is a small fee for valet parking your car.  The staff were also happy, energized and very knowledgeable about everything to do with Disney - they were a great help to us, as this was our first visit. The in-room coffee is a bonus, and the complementary hot buffet breakfast is basic but has something for everybody. Would stay here again, but 3 days at Disneyland (14 hours, 14 hours and 12 hours!) was enough for a while!  ... (well until the new Star Wars/ space world opens in a
Manager Response: Dear Calvin066,   Thank you for your kind review and for taking the time to review our hotel. Management could not be more happier with your review. We are happy to hear you enjoyed our convenient location, rooms, the happy and energized staff and of course lets not forget about the coffee. Once again thank you for your review and we hope to see you next time!   Kind regards,   Anabel Ramos Front Desk Manager Holiday Inn & Suites Anaheim

Summary: 1.	August 10, 2016 I booked 2 rooms at the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim cancellable with breakfast to take our children and grandchildren to Disneyland over Fall break.  2.	When the Booking.com website asked for my credit card # it specifically said that the number was only necessary to hold the room 3.	I received a confirmation from Booking.com that showed a non cancellable reservation without breakfast. 4.	I immediately emailed Bookings.com. Received a automated email  telling me to contact the property 5.	 I called the Holiday Inn and spoke with Robert. He told me he couldn‚Äôt help me and I would need to talk to Annabel. She wouldn‚Äôt be in until Sunday after 2 pm.  6.	Sunday, Holiday Inn charged my card 7.	 I called the Holiday Inn and spoke with Annabel. She told me
Manager Response: Dear MollyTMo,   Thank you for your feedback, management will like to apologize for the inconvenience you experienced with your reservation. Moreover, we will like to go over your reservation, please feel free to contact us privately. If there is anything we can do please do not hesitate to let us know. Management will like to assure you that your comments will aid us in improving our services. Once again thank you for your review.   Kind regards,   Management

Summary: Kinda strange hotel.  It's about a mile walking to Disneyland so great location, but not the greatest hotel.  The front counter staff was lovely but when our reservation didn't come up the manager came out and said in front of us "she booked it on the wrong date" which was not true and rude.  The room had no water for drinking in it but had coffee.
Manager Response: Dear Michael H,   Thank you for your feedback. Management will like to apologize for the inconveniences you experienced with your reservation. If there is anything we can do, do not hesitate to let us know. Please feel free to contact us privately to go over your reservation. Once again please pardon us for the inconvenience.   Kind regards,   Management

Summary Heading: Better places to stay for the same price
Summary: The hotel is NOT a 15 minute walk. It is 20 if you walk quickly. The front desk talked us into buying ART bus tickets. What a waste, don't do it!! The bus takes an hour to reach the park and never showed up to the park when it said it would online. We found walking was faster. The front desk staff was rude and some were alright. They refused to let me check in even 30 minutes before 3. I've gone on many Disneyland trips and stayed in all sorts of hotels, I've never been told I had to wait until exactly 3 or even later. I've stayed at non Disneyland hotels but still get treated like I'm a guest. Here you won't feel any of the Disney magic. As a Holiday Inn it's what you expect or a bit less. But with its claims of being close to Disneyland, a lobby covered in mickey, and Disney
Manager Response: Dear Sky S,   Thank you for your review. Management will like to apologize for our shortcomings if there is anything we can do to amend the mishap, do not hesitate to contact us privately. Management will like to assure you that your comments will be aid us in improving our customer service. Thank you for your review and for the opportunity to better our services.   Kind regards,   Management

Summary: Stayed 2 nights.  Great location for Disneyland and Downtown Disney.  Rooms are big and clean.  It was January so no need to use pool, but they had a very nice water area for kids and a nice pool.  Restaurant was good also.
Manager Response: Dear  Jimmy_walker17,   Thank you for rating us with five stars! Management is pleased to hear you enjoyed the Splash Park, our location, rooms and restaurant. Hope to see you next time!   Kind regards,   Anabel Ramos Front Desk Manager Holiday Inn & Suites Anaheim

Summary: First of all, this is a really nice hotel to stay.  Staff are incredibly helpful and nice.  Rooms are very clean and well appointed, cleaning staff was really great too. We ate in the restaurant, very reasonable and good food (pizza was a good bargain and yummy!).  The pool is really nice it is open until 10 so we could have a dip in the pool. The ONLY thing that I was not happy about was the misleading 1 block to disneyland.  My husband and I timed the walk from the hotel entry to the security check point at disney entrance.  We walked briskly as we always do with NO stops at traffic lights and it was a solid 18 minutes.  It may not seem far but when you are really tired at the end of the day or want to slip back to the hotel for a rest it does not work.  You could take the ART
Manager Response: Dear  Jilli36,   Management will like to thanked you for taking the time to review our hotel. The staff is pleased to know you enjoyed the hotel staff, the rooms, and the restaurant. Please pardon for the inconveniences we may have created during your last stay, if there is anything we can do, please do not hesitate to let us know. Once again thank you for your valuable feedback. Until next time.  Kind regards,   Anabel Ramos Front Desk Manager Holiday Inn & Suites Anaheim

Summary: We have the Deluxe Annual Pass for Disneyland.  We have spent many pleasant nights at this hotel the past 4 years.  The morning walk to Disneyland to us is like winding up for the day. The walk back to the hotel after the park is closed is a wind down, anticipating a nice warm shower.  The room is the perfect size with a very comfortable bed.  Now after the remodel the rooms seem quieter.  The staff has always been helpful and friendly.  The last three visits, all the staff seem happy.  To me this is a sign of good management and proper training.   The breakfast is hot, fast, good flavor and a good value.  We had burgers cooked to perfection, juicy and flavorful. The bar has a good selection of cold beer, some good single malt scotch.  I don't want forget the well made
Manager Response: Dear  Jimhunni2,   Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel with Five Stars! The staff is pleased to know you enjoyed your stay at our hotel. Specially the close walk to Disneyland, the room, comfortable bed, restaurant and bar. Indeed, managers could not be more happier to know that our colleagues are happy at work. Once again thank you for your feedback and see you next time!  Kind regards,   Anabel Ramos Front Desk Manager Holiday Inn & Suites Anaheim

Summary Heading: Clean, updated since our last visit
Summary: Last visited 3 years ago, since then been updated in bar and restaurant, both now excellent, with attentive staff.  Food and drink both reasonably priced, Rooms excellent, nice and quiet, no traffic noise to speak of, Pool area nice and clean, again with good service,   Great location for Interstate, and Disney as well, use the shuttle service from the bus stop within hotel grounds, good value, and reliable.
Manager Response: Dear Guycarr360,   That you for your review! Management could not be more happy to hear you enjoyed the bar/ restaurant, the excellent rooms, and the good service provided by our colleagues. Management will share your feedback to the rest of our team! Once again thank you for your comments. Until next time!   Kind regards,   Anabel Ramos Front Desk Manager Holiday Inn & Suites Anaheim

Summary: This place was great. From the moment we were dropped off we felt very welcome.  Great service, very clean rooms, very comfy beds and walking distance to Disneyland. You guys were great. See you next time. Thanks for your warm hospitality.
Manager Response: Dear BhuddaBud,  Thank you for rating us with 5 stars! The entire staff is pleased to know you enjoyed your stay with us in regards to our customer service, proximity to Disneyland and hospitable atmosphere. Until next time! Once again thank you for your Awesome review!   Kind regards,   Anabel Ramos Front Desk Manager Holiday Inn & Suites Anaheim

Summary: We booked this prior to leaving the UK and glad we did. Its location to Disney is excellent and the hotel itself very good. Check in was quick and efficient and staff friendly. We did not eat breakfast here, got up to go to parks and ate there. We did eat pizza several nights and have to be honest it was excellent. Disney is a 10/15 minute walk from here, leisurely and saves $18 per day by doing so. Parking was included in the booking price and to be honest I thought overall it was a good deal.
Manager Response: Dear Martinrmn,   Management will like to thanked you for taking the time to review our hotel with 5 stars. We are delighted to hear you also enjoyed our friendly staff and the Pizza from our in-house Onyx Restaurant. Once again thank you for your excellent feedback, see you next time.   Kind regards,   Anabel Ramos Front Desk Manager Holiday Inn & Suites Anaheim

Summary: My daughter booked this hotel as part of a birthday surprise.  She mainly booked it for the close proximity to disneyland.  The hotel was clean the pillows and bed were comfortable and the staff very friendly.  Within walking distance to disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear Debbi M.,  Thank you for your recent stay at our hotel. The staff is pleased to know you enjoyed the comfortable bed, proximity to Disneyland, and our hospitable staff. On behalf of our Holiday Inn & Suites Team we will like to thank you for taking time to review our hotel. Until next time!   Kind regards,   Anabel Ramos Front Desk Manager Holiday Inn & Suites Anaheim

Summary: Stayed for 4 nights and we were very happy with the hotel and room. We traveled around a lot so it was only a base. We ate here every morning and the buffet was of a good standard. Plenty to choose from. We ate at the burger restaurant also and that wasn't too bad. Again, plenty of choices. Check in/out was really smooth and the rooms were kept clean and refreshed every day
Manager Response: Dear Mark B.,  The staff is pleased to know you enjoyed your recent stay at our hotel. We are happy to hear you liked the room, the breakfast buffet options, and our smooth check in/out procedure. Thank you for you lovely feedback. Hope to see you next time to the Anaheim area.   Kind regards,   Anabel Ramos Front Desk Manager Holiday Inn & Suites Anaheim

Summary Heading: Hotel Is Only OK, Will Search For Better Options Next Visit
Summary: This hotel is located near Disney so if you need a quick stay then go for it, but if any longer than that look for something else.  The staff was ok, the food ok, the room ok, but just wasn't really what you pay for.  Don't stay here unless it's #1 short or #2 only to visit Disney for a day.
Manager Response: Dear Patrick P,   Management will like to thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. Please pardon us for not being able to provide you with excellent service, if there is anything we can do please do not hesitate to contact us privately. Once again, thank you for your recent feedback.   Kind regards,   Management

Summary Heading: Nice place with the BEST employees!
Summary: We stayed here while visiting Disneyland with our two children. The room we had was clean, beds comfortable, air conditioner worked and the hotel is very convenient to get to and from Disneyland.  We ate breakfast every day here and enjoyed a couple of dinners. The meals were very good and reasonably priced. The waiters were the friendliest and went out of their way to accommodate us and added to our dining experience.  Our stay here was great and I just can't say enough about the great staff and workers. They truly made our stay more enjoyable and added to our Disney experience.   If we return to Disneyland, we will definitely stay here again. It was a good value, good location and has the friendliest people working there. We actually felt sad saying goodby to a couple of our
Manager Response: Dear Yukonjacko,   Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel! The staff is pleased with your recent review of our hotel. We are happy to hear you enjoyed our beds, restaurant, and our friendly service! See you on your next trip to the Anaheim area. Cheers!   Kind regards,   Anabel Ramos Front Desk Manager Holiday Inn & Suites Anaheim

Summary: The best thing about this hotel is that it's only 10 minutes walk to Disney. Maybe 15 if you walk slowly. If you can't walk - no problem, there's a bus every 20 minutes, but it goes a long way around and takes about 20 minutes to get there and costs $5 I believe. We used this hotel for the sole purpose of visiting Disneyland and California Adventure so I can't comment on much else regarding its location. The pool was small but clean and towels are provided. The room was spacious, clean and well kept with air con thermostat. Showers were average but did the job. Breakfast buffet was nice and reasonably priced. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel for visiting Disneyland for its price it is almost as close as the Disney hotel itself and much cheaper. If I were to be picky
Manager Response: Dear Michael D.,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel with 5 stars! Management is pleased to know you enjoyed the close walk to Disneyland, the spacious room, and the breakfast buffet. Hope to see you on your next trip to the Disneyland area.   Kind regards,   Anabel Ramos Front Desk Manager Holiday Inn & Suites Anaheim

Summary: Good hotel for Disneyland stay. monorail station in downtown Disney is in walkable distance ( 10-12 minutes). Breakfast is included in certain package and lot of options to choose in buffet. Fireworks can be viewed from hotel parking lot at the backside.   Overall good budget hotel
Manager Response: Dear Ganesh P.,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel! The staff is happy to hear you enjoyed the proximity to Disneyland, the breakfast buffet options, and seeing the firework just outside the hotel. Once again thank you for your lovely feedback. See you next time!  Kind regards,   Anabel Ramos Front Desk Manager Holiday Inn & Suites Anaheim

Summary Heading: check out everything on your first day!
Summary: I'm sure there are better rooms. My gf and I figured, it was clean, we were there to sleep,  get up, go to DL all day for the next 2 we were there! However, I had to make sure that I had on my flip flops, the bathroom tile was very old, you could see that needed a good cleaning or replacement. The room was tiny, two of us could not stand in front of the bed, maybe 2 feet? Furniture tired, TV, big, heavy, flat screen, one of those first models.  Do check out their restaurant, especially for breakfast! We blew it, we didn't check out until the last day. Very friendly staff! Met the hotel mgr. Last day, he was awesome too!
Manager Response: Dear Rosemarie A,   Management will like to thank you for your review and for your comments. We apologize for the smalls mishaps. Management will like to assure you that your comments will be taken into consideration to continue to improve our services. Once again thank you for your feedback.   Kind regards,   Management

Summary: Beware of this hotel I read the other reviews for this place before I booked and some people said good things.  I will tell you I was just there and it was terrible the room was dirty!!! It had a smell in it that actually got me sick. Do not stay here.
Manager Response: Dear Nicole J,   Thank you for your review. Management will like to apologize for the experience you had during your stay. We will like to go over your reservation, therefore, do not hesitate to contact management. Thank you once again for your feedback.   Kind regards,   Management

Summary: Checked into room and the carpet was soggy from previous guests. Room smelled awful from the wet musty odor. Additionally, there was a pair of dark boxer shorts in the desk lamp so the room clearly was barely cleaned. Disgusting!  Next night we were moved to a room with a broken air conditioner so we then had to check into a third room. This third room had ants on the bathroom sink! The guy at the front desk was rude and didn't care at all that our family was so inconvenienced.   I travel constantly for work and used points for this hotel for a family vacation. I fervently urge everyone to NEVER stay at this hotel. It is dirty, loud and needs cleaned. The 1980's wallpaper didn't help the decor either.   Horrible experience and a terrible hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Aaron J,  Thank you for your feedback. Management will like to apologize for the inconveniences you experienced at our hotel. Your feedback is greatly appreciated and will aid us in enhancing our service. Once again pardon us for not being able to provide you with a great experience.   Kind regards,   Management

Summary: We thoroughly enjoyed this hotel.  Loved the fact that we could walk to Disney.  It's more like 3 or 4 blocks, but still very do-able.  We went back and forth several times and only used the shuttle once.  The AC, beds and TV were very comfortable.  Frig and microwave added to the comforts.  Staff was professional and nice.  The only disappointment was that we couldn't check in early as they were booked from the night before.  I noticed they had washers and dryers for laundry which I thought was nice if staying longer.
Manager Response: Dear Carolyn095,   Management will like to thank you for your nice review. We are very happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay. We hope to see you next time and please pardon us for not being able to offer you an early check-in. If there is anything we can do please do not hesitate to contact the hotel.   Kind regards,   Anabel Ramos Front Desk Manager

Summary: From the minute we walked in to the minute we walked out we had nothing but exceptional, friendly service.  All the staff went out of their way to ensure we had what we needed.  The rooms were spacious and the setup of the bathroom / vanity area very clever, allowing for someone to use the washroom facilities (bath/shower, toilet) whilst in a separate area someone else could brush teeth, blowdry hair etc.  Swimming pool and hottub most enjoyable.  Restaurant/Bar facilities:  service and food excellent and affordable ( bfast, lunch and dinner) and accomodated both kids and adults taste.  Laundry Facilities: Excellent.  Separate laundry room where you can do family load of washing and drying for only $4.00 ($2.00 per wash load and $2.00 per dry load).  Whilst a shuttle service is
Manager Response: Dear Tanhin,   Management will like to thank you for your lovely review! We are pleased to know you had a great stay at our hotel. The staff is very happy to know that you find us exceptional as we take pride is what we do. We hope to see you next time, until then. Cheers!  Kind regards,   Anabel Ramos Front Desk Manager Holiday Inn & Suites Anaheim

Summary: As a business traveler  I DO NOT recommend this hotel. No breakfast, unless you book it in your package!? Went to use the lotion and it was half used! First room was decent (handicap) had to switch rooms to extend my stay and I damn near killed myself walking between the TV and bed. Outdoor pool and hot tub was nice, staff is friendly. More cons vs pros unfortunately.
Manager Response: Dear CLINTON H,  Thank you for staying with us and providing us with your valuable feedback. Your satisfaction is important to us and we try hard to make sure all of our guests have a rewarding experience at our hotel. It is nice to know that the pool facility is well to your liking and regarded our friendly staff. However, please accept our apologies if the rooms did not live up to your expectations. Your feedback is of great importance to us and allows us to monitor and improve the quality of our amenities and facilities we offer. Rest assured your concerns will be forwarded to the hotel management for evaluation in order to meet our guests' needs and comfort.  Thank you for staying with us and we hope to offer you a more pleasant stay in the future.  Sincerely,  Grace P. Case Manager IHGService

Summary: My wife and I spent one night at this hotel to go to Disney. Check in was simple and the employees were excellent. They were friendly and inviting. The room was fine, nothing amazing but it was clean and the room was quite. Our room was a distance from the lobby due to the hotel having many rooms but it was not an issue. A ten minute walk got you right to the Disney Tram. Overall it is good hotel if you will be visiting Disney for a couple of days.

We have had the best time here while on our Disney Family Vacation. The staff are very helpful and accommodating to all! Hotel is clean and the water park is awesome for the kids . Food is good and affordable!!! We will be back and will be spreading the word on this hotel for sure:) loved it!
Manager Response: Dear pmorrison1987,  Thank you so much for the positive review during your recent stay with us.  We couldn't be more thrilled to hear of your kids enjoyment of our splash park.  Looking forward to your return trip in the very near future with us.  Have a safe summer!  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager Holiday Inn Suites Anaheim

Summary: Constantly stay at this hotel, Disneyland is about a block away. Can't comment much on the hotel since we mainly use it just to sleep we always eat elsewhere but it does look a little run down. Pool is a tad on the smaller side, obviously always a lot of families there.
Manager Response: Dear miguerg,  I appreciate the time you took to share your experience while staying at our hotel. I am glad to know that our location suits your needs. On the other hand, I am sorry for the disappointments you had with the overall look of our property and pool. Your comments are valued and noted and be rest assured that this will be shared with the management team to help us determine what we could further improve on to be able to deliver a highly satisfactory experience.  Until your next visit, we remain at your service.  Sincerely,  Ingrid V. Case Manager IHGService

Summary: Stayed here f for one week on business, in standard room, with the expected level of comfort you get from holiday inn.  Room was well decorated, in good condition and kept very clean. Only ate at the bar in the evenings, good choice and quick service.  Found going across the lot to  Denny's easiest for early breakfast.  Overall I would recommend for business and also holiday...Disney just down the road.
Manager Response: Dear 99BAC,  Thank you for your kind words and for taking the time to share your experience.  We appreciate your nice comments about the level of comfort and cleanliness of the hotel.  We look forward to seeing you with us again in the near future and to earn a 5 star on your next magical trip at the Holiday Inn Suites Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Wow is all I can say
Summary: Wow, what a place! We are less than a block from the parking entry to Disney and they have free trams and busses that take you right to the gate, plus the rooms!! Very nice, the only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because they messed up my reservation twice! Then charged my card twice! Lol, and the lady at the front desk that checked us in wouldn't waive both nights of our upgrade fee, but they did waive one night! So the total for 2 nights, in the biggest 2 bedroom suite was only 400!! What a deal, it was so worth it! It's only 3 miles from the Anaheim trains, so our lyft was only $7! Wow, what a place! Cute pool, splash zone for kids, kids eat free all day (with paying adult).  And only a $50 deposit!! Beautiful  place, all upgraded. Granite counters,  soft beds!! I

We loved our stay here. Staff was friendly and helpful.  Short walk to Disneyland. We were able to walk easily all the way there and back, with small children.  Clean room. Had Star Wars theme so my little boys loved all the special details and decorations. After staying at Disney world resorts, we felt this was an affordable, comparable motel. And we were right. So happy we stayed here.   Beware entrance is kind of hard unless you u-turn well. Would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear lindawC9332NW,  Thank you for your positive feedback regarding your recent stay with us.  We are absolutely thrilled you had a great time during your time with us and your little boys having a blast with the Star Wars theme suite.  Please come back and see us again real soon..... and may the force be with you.  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager Holiday Inn Suites Anahim

Summary: Great Customer Service, room was on the small size but normal for older hotels. Our room was clean and comfortable.  The restaurant and bar on site had really good food, and the price was right with the kids eating free.  Staff was not only friendly with the guest, they were noticeable busy keeping all areas covered, even what appeared not to be their work area.
Manager Response: Dear L W.,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel! The staff is happy to hear you enjoyed our full service restaurant as well as our customer service. Hope to see you on your next trip to the area.   Kind regards,  Ramos A.  Front Desk Manager Holiday Inn & Suites Anaheim

Summary: Stayed here with my daughter and her friend while they attended VIDCON.  The bed was very comfortable.  Standard room is not very large, but is not cramped either. While close to Disneyland, it is a bit far to walk. A big plus - you can see the fireworks very well from the parking lot.  The hotel has a nice gift shop with reasonable prices.  The restaurant is good and fairly priced. We enjoyed our stay.

We stayed here for a week. It's about a 15 min walk to the actual park. You can use the ART shuttle that will pick you up from the hotel and drop you off in the front of the park itself though. The room was clean. The decor a bit old. The staff are okay. Although my daughter lost a hoodie in the room and we notified the front desk, they looked for it but to no avail. The outdoor pool was a good place to wind down after a long day at the parks. They also have a restaurant that's convenient for us to start our day and sometimes late at night when we're tired.
Manager Response: Dear Simpletexasgal,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our hotel. Our hotel staff is happy to hear that our hotel served as a great place for you to wind down after a long day at the parks. We hope that next time your stay will be even better than the previous one. We hope to see you soon on your next magical trip to the area!  Kind regards,   Ramos A. Front Desk Manager Holiday Inn & Suites Anaheim

Summary: With the amount of travel I do for work, I spend more time sleeping in a hotel than sleeping in my own bed. I wish I had more time to review all of the hotels that I've stayed at, some are more deserving of the highlights, but I feel this Holiday Inn should not be missed and here are the reasons why:  They are walking distance to Disneyland. (Uber XL only $8-$12 can fit up to 7 passengers) They provide shuttles from the hotel to the Disneyland Park. They can create a package for you here (see the front desk), or you can also purchase your tickets at the front lobby where you will see "Mickey."  You can't miss him! The hotel staff are really nice (probably one of the best Holiday Inn I've stayed at). The rooms are decent. However, I was told you can get special rooms with Disney
Manager Response: Dear Mr. Edwin R.,  Thank you for your kind words and for your lovely review. We are delighted to hear that you had a great stay at our hotel. Indeed, we take pride in what we do and we are happy to hear that guests such as yourself notice our work. We will share your review with our team members to continue with our awesome customer skills. Until next time, Cheers!  Kind regards,   Ramos A. Front Desk Manager Holiday Inn & Suites Anaheim

Summary: Excellent proximity to Disneyland and the boulevard. The shuttle from hotel to Disney front gate was wonderful!! New splash pad area was a hit with the grandkids and the pool was conveniently located next to restaurant/bar for easy access to food and drinks. Heated pool was nice for swimming late in the evening.
Manager Response: Dear Miss Mary Helen R,  Thank you for your nice review! We are happy to hear you enjoyed the Splash Park as well as the other amenities we have at the hotel. Hope to see you next time!   Kind regards,   Ramos A. Front Desk Manager Holiday Inn & Suites Anaheim

Summary: I have mixed feelings about this hotel. My initial impression, thanks to Luis at the front desk, was great.  In fact, everyone of their front desk clerks were friendly and responsive.  Another positive was the proximity of the hotel to Disney, which is walking distance. There was ample parking, and they have a splash pad that my 7 year old truly enjoyed.  While we did not spend much time in the room, it was our home for 7 days--a home with really crappy WiFi.  We stayed in 3106, and must say that the interior of the room was poorly maintained, and housekeeping was somewhat deficient.  In either case, it is clear that the hotel GM is not inspecting rooms regularly.  I am a hotel GM in Texas, have long loved Holiday Inns (my first front desk job was at a H.I.), but cannot imagine
Manager Response: Dear Mr. Victor A.,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. Management would like to assure you that your comments will help improve our overall service. If there is anything we can do, do not hesitate to contact the hotel. Once again thank you for your review.  Kind regards,   Management

Summary Heading: My now favorite hotel in Disneyland area
Summary: From the time we checked to when we check out, our visit was excellent. The staff at the desk, housekeeping and the restaurant staff were all, very friendly and helpful. We ate breakfast in the restaurant, every morning. The food was served quickly, was hot and was very good. The restaurant staff went out of their way to look after us and they would remembered us from one day to the next, even if they were not the ones waiting on us that particular day. I went down for breakfast one morning, already knowing what I wanted off the menu, but the menu changed that day. I mentioned this to our waiter and he said, tell me what you want and I will get it for you. We were very happy with our room and our stay here. I have made a note in my vacation file and will definitely be staying
Manager Response: Dear Wendy J,   Management will like to thanked you for your great review! We are happy to hear you had an awesome stay at our hotel! We will inform our colleagues about your review and once again thank you for taking the time to recognize our staff. See you next time!   Kind regards,   Ramos A.  Front Desk Manager

Summary: The front desk was amazing. During check in they saw that we had young kids (3 under 6) and would be going to Disneyland during our stay. They offered to upgrade our room to a Disney Themed Suite  for no extra fee. Our Kids absolutely loved the room and so did we. The location is great as well  just a short walk to Downtown Disney. They also have breakfast in the morning in which kids eat free. The front desk even offered to give us a late check out when they saw us returning from the park late at night.
Manager Response: Dear Mr. Steven A,  Thank you for your lovely respond and for taking the time to write a review! Management is pleased to hear you had a magical experience at our hotel. Until next time!  Kind regards,  Ramos A.  Front Desk Manager

Summary: We originally booked a room here because it was a great bargain and only one block away from Disneyland.  Very convient because there is no need to look or pay for parking at the disney parking lot. Once there we found the building was very clean and staff was courteous.  Beds and pillows are comfortable, and pool is relaxing for the children.  Highly recommend it!
Manager Response: Dear Olga G,  Thank you for taking the time to share your wonderful feedback on your recent stay with us.  Thrilled to hear that we made your trip memorable and that we could be part of that magic.  We enjoyed having you as our guest and look forward to seeing you on your next Disneyland trip.    Kevin Do Assistant General Manager  Holiday Inn Suites Anaheim 1240 S Walnut Anaheim, CA 92802

Summary: Thanks for the nice welcome and enjoyable stay at the Holiday Inns and Suites on South Walnut.  We had an anniversary getaway planned for our 25th, with three day tickets at Disneyland.  We had four nights within walking of the Disney Resort complex.  One morning we had breakfast in the restaurant, it was good.
Manager Response: Dear Carrcabin,  Thank you for taking the time out to share your experience on your recent stay with us.  It was our privilege for us to be part of your 25th anniversary and to have made it that much more magical.  We thank you for choosing us to serve you and hope to see you again with us in the near future.  Happy 25th Anniversary from all of us at the Holiday Inn Suites Anaheim!  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager  Holiday Inn Suites Anaheim 1240 S. Walnut Anaheim, CA 92802

Summary: Decided we wanted to go to Disneyland so we booked the Holiday Inn since we are IHG members - the location is about a .5 mile walk from Disneyland and is in a quiet location - this is the first time I have stayed at this hotel and will definitely return - we were upgraded to a suite on the top floor - now I am spoiled...

We booked this hotel as part of a vacation package, and it ended up being such a great find! The room was spacious, and had a mini fridge and a microwave. We stayed for 8 nights, and we honestly have no complaints. We walked to and from the Disneyland Park, it took us about 10-15 minutes to get to the free tram station, and then about 5 minutes on the tram to the park entrance. We had pizza from the hotel restaurant as well, and it was super delicious, and reasonably priced. We would definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: Dear Chelsea D,  Thank you so much for your generous words on your recent stay with us.  Super happy to hear your 8 nights stay with us was filled with magical moments from our hotel to the Magic Kingdom.  We look forward to seeing you again on your next Disney trip.  Have a great summer!  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager  Holiday Inn Suites Anaheim 1240 S. Walnut Anaheim, CA 92802

Summary: We spent 4 nights on our trip to Disney. The hotel was perfectly fine for older buildings. The rooms and lobby were current and updated. The bathroom in the room was very small but manageable. It was a 20 minute walk to the Disney back gate. Only down side to the hotels location was the lack of options for restaurants.
Manager Response: Dear Brent w,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review of your recent stay. I am pleased with your kind comments regarding our hotel. It is just regrettable that you did not fully enjoy the area. Let us assure you that we will continuously strive for improvement to make your future stays even better.  Sincerely,  Faith R Case Manager IHGService

Summary: Took kids and grandkids to Disney. Daughter booked this hotel and she made a good choice. Staff was very helpful and consultative. Very close to the park and they have a shuttle, albeit it is $5 per person round trip. Rooms were good, has a pool and splash pad. Restaurant food was very good and reasonably priced. We would stay here again.

this hotel will steal your belongings and not hold themselves accountable. do not use this hotel. the maids will steal jewellery and they allow domestic violence to happen and just moved the abused to and her kids to a different room and leave the drunk abuser husband in the same room allowing his to use their residence.   the general manager of this hotel will accuse you of lying despite you providing numerous facts of proof, and will be extremely rude to you on the phone, while she herself can barely put together a full sentence.    do not use this hotel it is not safe for your well being or belongings.
Manager Response: Dear lukegeddz14,   Thank you for your review regarding your recent stay at Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim, CA. It is regrettable you were not satisfied with the service you received. I would like to address this with you further. I have sent you a private message to obtain more information about your stay. I look forward to hearing from you and being of further assistance.    Sincerely,    Orlando A.  Case Manager  IHGService

Summary Heading: Very inhospitable. Charged me for apparent damage to the microwave.
Summary: I am really disappointed in the management of this hotel. We stayed here as a family for 5 days ( Disney trip) and I had my credit card on file. We used the microwave to heat up some bread and it accidentally burned. Someone from the maintainence came and helped us open the window. He came some time later and said everything is fine and closed the window. We cleaned the microwave and except for some slight yellowing that could have been easily taken care of, everything was in perfect condition. We left and they said we are good to go. I come back home and notice a 75 $ charge on my credit card. No notification for the charge, we were never called. I called the manager and she was very rigid and said that we damaged the microwave and they have to replace it. We used it for three
Manager Response: Dear Dear Anupriya S,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review of your recent stay. It is regrettable that some of our amenities and services did not live up to your expectations. I sincerely apologize for any inconvenience you may have experienced. Allow me to follow-up on your concerns and have the opportunity to regain your faith in our hotel. I have sent you a private message in an effort to obtain additional information.  I look forward to your response and be of further assistance.  Sincerely,  Faith R Case Manager IHGservice

Summary Heading: Great hotel and easy walk to Disney Land.
Summary: Ground floor room was great. Jose in the bar was so welcoming every night. We stayed 5 nights and was good length to cover Disney and Universal. Breakfast was more than you need for a day of fun. Big servings. Pizza at night was lovely. Staff were excellent. Easy walk to Disney or you can walk to the Disney car park and catch the trolley car for no charge. Rooms were lovely and clean as well. Pool was a hit with kids but we didn't have any kids but did have swim. Parking was great too right outside your room.
Manager Response: Dear Phillip G,  Thank you for your kind words on your recent stay with us.  We are glad are staff were able to be at your service and went above and beyond during your stay.  Jose will be excited to hear of the great feedback left for him.  We thank you once more and come back and see us again real soon.  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager  Holiday Inn Suites Anaheim 1240 S. Walnut Anaheim, CA 92802

Summary: We have stayed at this hotel a few times and I can tell you this. It's one of the easiest hotels to get to and from Disneyland if you don't mind a little walk. It's a easy 1/2 mile to the front gates of Disneyland and it's not very crowded when you are walking.  The rooms are cozy with a microwave and a little fridge which makes storing food for meals a breeze. It's nice to be able to make a quick breakfast in your room before heading to the park. And there's a really cute water park right next to the pool to cool you off after being in the Orange County heat. All in all its been a great spot for our family to enjoy the Disney fun!

We really enjoyed our stay. We found the hotel to be quiet and the room very comfortable and clean. We were given a couple of room options to chose from and picked a room on the 5th floor near the rear of the building. It was a good choice for a nice quiet night's sleep. Our only disappointment was the in room coffee, for some reason we only had decaf coffee. The walk to Disneyland is about 15 minutes. We took LYFT to get there and walked back in the evening. It felt safe.

We stayed here recently on a visit to Disneyland, we booked a pre-arranged package so we were not too sure about the hotel. We were pleasantly surprised, the staff were amazing and the rooms clean and comfortable. The in-room fridge and microwave were a great bonus and at no extra charge. The grounds were clean and well maintained, and the splash park was fun. The pool area although small, was clean and provided plenty of sun and shade options. This hotel also provided free WIFI which was wonderful as the last time we visited the area we were charged for WIFI at another hotel.  The restaurant was VVG with an amazing and accommodating staff, and kids ate free which was a huge plus for us and save $$ every day by eating breakfast and dinner at the hotel instead of the Disney

We recently stayed at this hotel for seven nights.   This is a great family hotel!    The rooms were clean and adequate, with fridges in the room.   Pool and grounds were clean and nice.  The thing that sets this hotel apart was the amazing, friendly, courteous and accommodating staff.  On several occasions staff went over and above to help us.  Dining room staff were absolutely wonderful!   Whatever management is doing in terms of training their staff is certainly working.   The food was very good, and really reasonably priced.  Special accommodations for vegetarian meals were no problem at all.  Even after a full day at the parks, we still preferred to come back and eat at our hotel!   The hotel is situated close to Disneyland, only about a 15 min. walk.   The ART bus that

This hotel has the cuttest rooms for the kids.we rented three rooms. For our family each was happy .we were taking my grandaughter to disneyland for her birthday she loves frozen so her familys room was frozen wall paper everything frozen she just loved it an we all enjoyed the swimming pool
Manager Response: Hello Krysheila99,  We are so happy to hear that your family had a great time during your visit.  Happy birthday to your granddaughter and glad she loved the "Frozen" theme suite.  We thank you and hope to see you again with us in the near future.  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager  Holiday Inn Suites Anaheim 1240 S. Walnut Anaheim, CA 92802

Summary: I thought because I booked a Holiday Inn hotel that it was going to be nice....wrong. We were given a 2 full size bed room after I booked a 1 bed room....this is on our honeymoon, no less. I was told I was a "flow" guest because I booked through hotels.com and that was all they had left for me. We settled in and tried to rest for a bit but couldn't due to the drilling and hammering in the room next door. The walls were VERY thin. We could hear showers running and toilets flushing. I questioned if the bathroom was cleaned because I found dark long hair all over the floor. The whole toilet was not secure to the floor and rocked every time it was sat on. The WIFI was horrible. I will NEVER stay there again nor will I recommend to anyone.
Manager Response: Dear katyre6,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review of your recent stay. It is regrettable that some of our amenities and services did not live up to your expectations. I sincerely apologize for any inconvenience you may have experienced. Allow me to follow-up on your concerns and have the opportunity to regain your faith in our hotel. I have sent you a private message in an effort to obtain additional information.  I look forward to your response and be of further assistance.  Sincerely,  Faith R Case Manager IHGservice

Summary: My husband said that he would stay there again.  I vote to go somewhere else.  Here are a few things that are note worthy: 1) Hotel is one block from Disneyland, but the entrance is not by the hotel so you still have a nice walk.  However, the "Minnie and Friends" tram (which is free) has a pick up and drop off location which will take you to the security gates of both parks. So you will only have to walk about 1/3 of the distance. 2) Rooms are small.  This is the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in.  We had two double beds and there was no floor space to put stuff. 3) Housekeeping is questionable.  However, if you can handle a little lack of attention to detail then it is doable. 4) They have a small spray park on grounds.  That was nice for my kid.
Manager Response: Hello gooutsideofthebox,  So glad you and your kids enjoyed the splash park.  The short walking distance to the Mickey and Friends tram is a huge plus for our guest along with the Monorail entrance at Downtown Disney if tickets are pre-paid.  We hope you would give us another chance in the future for your stay.

Summary Heading: We will definetely stay there again.
Summary: We stayed 4 nights.  Comfortable bed, extremely clean and the nights were very quiet for a good nights sleep.  Luis checked us in and was very personable and helpful. We kept our car parked at the Hotel and walked everyday to Disneyland, a 14 minute walk, was a well-lit and safe area.  We will recommend this to our Family and Friends and will also stay there for future trips.
Manager Response: Hello Autumn A,  We are super happy you had a great and memorable time with us while visiting the Magic Kingdom.  Luis would be delighted to hear of your kind words.  Thank you for letting us be part of your magical experience and we hope to see you again real soon in the near future.  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager  Holiday Inn Suites Anaheim 1240 S. Walnut  Anaheim, CA 92802

Summary: We decided to head here on a whim during lunch on Friday, we booked the hotel that afternoon and spent all Saturday at Disneyland before coming home Sunday. We arrived late at night, and the staff was quick to get us checked in so we could go to sleep before getting up early for Disneyland the next day. We were in a 2 double bed room, which I'll admit, the beds are smaller than the 2 queens I'm used to. They were comfortable though, and we got a good nights rest. The next morning, we woke up, and walked a mere 12-15 min to downtown Disney (it was just us 2, with no kids, so it may take a little longer with children). But the walk it self, was quick, and we soon found ourselves at Disneyland. The walk back that evening, was quick as well, the path was fairly well lit, and I never
Manager Response: Hello David,  We are delighted to hear of your amazing stay here with us.  Glad you enjoyed the peaceful walk to Disneyland as the short distance from the hotel to the Disney theme park always brings a smile to our guests.  We're happy to hear of the great feedback and that we could take care of you during your visit here.  We thank you again and hope to see you with us real soon.  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager  Holiday Inn Suites Anaheim 1240 S. Walnut Anaheim, CA 92802

Summary: Well....usually its really nice but this visit seemed to be plagued with problems.  First the fire alarm goes off while we are in bed asleep.  As we are scrambling to get out, there is a knock on the door and it is the management saying asking if everything is ok as the fire alarm is coming from our room.  I explained to her that we were asleep and they checked the smoke alarm and nothing was wrong that any one could see.    Next we asked for a late check out as we were going to walk to downtown Disney in the morning and check out late.  when we returned we found that they had locked us out of our room.  Which if it was an accident then I understand but to have the front desk clerk lie to us and tell us that we must have demagnetized the card key.  Really?  Both of them?  In a

My son and I recently stayed here.  We did a 2-day Disney adventure and needed a place to crash for the night.  This hotel is very close to the park and the fact that you can catch a shuttle to and from the park made it even better.  I didn't get to experience the full resort, since we were just there for one night.  The room was pretty good.  The bathroom was a little dated, but not enough to make me not choose to stay there again.  The staff was very nice. If you're looking for a nice, clean place to lay your head, then this hotel is a good choice.

Our family stayed here in April 2016. We booked this hotel because of the splash pad in case the kids didn't want to go to Disney one day. The splash pad is nice. It looks new.  The hotel was average, the rooms are very small. Pretty much what we expected of a Holiday Inn. The breakfast at the restaurant was really bad, and expensive. The walk to the park is really long. The monorail was broken, so we had to walk all the way through downtown Disney. Took us about 20-25 minutes of fast walking. Even if the monorail is working, it's still a pretty good hike to get to it. The hotel has a shuttle, but I believe it was $5 each way.   If you book this hotel, my main advice would be to expect a somewhat long walk to the park and do not go to the restaurant for breakfast.
Manager Response: Dear Monkeyfoo,   Thank you for your feedback regarding your stay at Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim, CA. We take our guest comments very seriously and always strive to provide comfortable and friendly accommodations. We appreciate your nice comment about the splash pad.  However, we‚Äôre sorry we fell below your expectation regarding breakfast and the monorail. We will address this concern. We take all reviews positive and negative very seriously, and your feedback will help us improve for our next guest or your next visit.   Sincerely,    Orlando A.  Case Manager  IHGService

Summary: Stayed here for 4 nights in April 2016. Excellent rooms and staff. Our problem was that we had specifically requested a hotel as near as possible to another hotel where we had family staying and this was just too far away. Rooms size standard large American, very clean with microwave, fridge and coffee maker (no kettle). The staff, especially Ron, were  very helpful in arranging a transfer to a nearer hotel within the group and Mike arranged a refund of our  payment via our travel agent. Also very good local taxi guys working from this hotel, Rafael & Fernando, twin brothers. They will take you anywhere, including shopping and Disney for a very reasonable fee and arranged a couple of day trips to Newport & Huntington Gardens - 2 places you can't get trips for locally. Just ask

Great Location. We stayed 3 nights here - 1 day we visited Disney making use of the shuttle service from our hotel, costing $10 for as many uses that day. But it was certainly walkable. Lovely big bed in the room, fridge, tea/coffee making facilities. The light in the bathroom took a little while to brighten up if it hadn't been used for a while so made it feel slightly dark and dingey at times. Good power shower. Everything lovely and clean. The pool isn't huge but could do a few laps. They also have a spa pool which was lovely and relaxing. Free towels for the loungers. The restaurant had a good choice of food and the breakfast buffet was worth the $13 pp. We got a taxi arranged by the hotel to Freemont train station so that we could visit central LA. Only a 10-15 minute taxi
Manager Response: Dear WheresNextT,  Thank you for your wonderful feedback regarding your stay with us.  We couldn't be happier to hear your stay with us was excellent and that we could meet your overall satisfaction.  We apologize for the dim lighting in the bathroom and know that it can be frustrating at times as you may know we are doing our part of being Eco friendly with energy saving bulbs.  So glad to hear you took advantage of the Los Angeles Walk of Fame while visiting Disneyland.  We thank you again for being our guest and we hope to see you with us again in the near future.  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager  Holiday Inn Suites Anaheim 1240 S. Walnut Anaheim, CA 92802

Summary: I didn't find anything wrong with our room and all the people working there were so kind. Even the people in the restaurant. We will be staying here soon again. We have stayed at the Disney hotel before and of course we didn't expect it to be just like it but it was a good alternative. Not far from Disneyland at all and the breakfast buffet was not bad at all.

Nice room, friendly service and great value. Perfect for families.   Only con was there was no Resturant in walking distance. The in house Resturant was great though and there was a bar.   A great value hotel for visiting Disney

Just joined Disney pass holders and wanted a nice hotel we can keep coming back to.  We found it with this hotel. It is either new or recently updated, very clean, generous sized rooms, and very nice, friendly staff.  Have no negative remarks regarding the hotel, but it would be nice to offer a shuttle to Disneyland and not the $5.00 each way bus ride. I guess no charge for parking evens it out?  Plan on going back on May 2016
Manager Response: Hello Linda S,  We're so thrilled to hear that you are now an annual pass holder and that you could share your magical experience with us.  Glad you liked the nice and comfortable size rooms to go along with our wonderful staff.  We thank you so much for choosing us and hope to be of service to you again in the very near future.  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager  Holiday Inn Suites Anaheim 1240 S. Walnut Anaheim, CA 92802

Summary: My daughters were pleasantly surprised to spend the night in the FROZEN suite! The beds were very comfortable. The room was very spacious! The staff was courteous and friendly! We will definitely stay here again on our next trip to Disneyland!
Manager Response: Dear Barbara M,  Thank you for your nice and generous words during your visit here with us.  We are so happy to hear of your daughter's excitement of the "Frozen" theme suite.  The staff would be delighted to hear of your kind words during your stay here.  We look forward to seeing you with us again real soon for your next Magical Kingdom experience.  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager  Holiday Inn Suites Anaheim 1240 S. Walnut Anaheim, CA 92802

Summary Heading: Great Value 15 minute Walk from Disney
Summary: This hotel is simply lovely. The people are friendly, the rooms are modern, and there is a nice restaurant on site, as well as a boutique with snacks and last-minute gifts. There is ample onsite parking at no extra charge, and the price is just right. We were able to walk to Disneyland in about 15 minutes by cutting through the Downtown Disney District. For people who require transportation, fear not, the shuttle comes often and costs just a few dollars per day. You are on the backside of the park, so there aren't many restaurants or shops within walking distance, but what this hotel lacks in neighboring amenities, it makes up for with style and personality. We visit the park every year, and while this was our first stay at the hotel, it most certainly won't be out last.

Summary Heading: Fine hotel; Great easy shortcut to Disneyland
Summary: Go to the carpark (The Holiday Inn carpark merges into its neighbouring hotel's Spring Suites carpark). Head out to the road and start heading right (down W Ball Rd), then take the first right onto a dead-end street that leads to the Disneyland staff carpark. Head for the big carpark structure, head up the stairs, then down an escalator and this is where you line up to catch the Mickey and Friends Tram. This is the easiest and quickest way to get to Disneyland from this hotel!   As for the hotel, it is totally fine. The hotel is in a few separate buildings which is a bit confusing, but other than that they do good room service and the rooms are perfectly serviceable.

The property overall was very nice and clean. The staff were very helpful and made our stay in California even better. Also only a short drive from Disney! I recommend this property to anyone traveling to the area!
Manager Response: Dear Tammy841,  Thank you so much for your positive feedback regarding your recent stay here with us.  We are very grateful of the overall satisfaction rating you gave in terms of our property cleanliness and service level of staff.  We pride ourselves in our guest satisfaction as that is our number goal in providing top notch customer experience.  We certainly do look forward to seeing you return with us on your next Magic Kingdom adventure.  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager  Holiday Inn Suites Anaheim 1240 S. Walnut Anaheim, CA 92802

Summary: Chose this hotel because it was close to the Disneyland Hotel Convention Center. I was there for 4 nights and it was a pleasant stay.  There is a small fridge, microwave, and single serve coffee maker in the room.  The rooms are a bit dated but clean. Apparently there was a plumbing issue (evidenced by the stench) because the water had to be shut down for 1 hour on two separate days. The bathroom/shower is very small and the vent sounds like an outboard motorboat. You have no choice since the vent and lights are connected by one switch. The front desk personnel upon check-in were friendly and efficient. They even called my room to make sure everything was ok.  Jose in the bar was super friendly.  Food in the restaurant was decent.

Holiday Inn Anaheim  We stayed at the holiday Inn for 3 nights. The location was great, close to Disneyland and the highway. There is a shuttle bus that pulls up right outside the hotel for a small fee. The shuttle leaves before the gates open and last shuttle back to the hotel is 12:30am. So you don't have to worry about missing anything. This hotel was slit cheaper than the ones in main gate... It was literally a 7 minute bus ride to the gate.  Hotel Parking is free onsite. The room was spacious and clean. It had all the ammenities needed and if you have forgotten a razor or toothbrush they will supply complimentary. There is a restaurant on site that does a killer pizza! All of the staff we encountered were very lovely and accommodating. We purchased our Disneyland tickets

We stayed three nights in a Star Wars themed suite. The proximity to Disney is fantastic. With that said, the distance to walk to to the parks is not trivial. There is a shuttle bus that stops right at the hotel entrance and Disney Transportation Center every 20 minutes or so. After walking to and from the park once or twice, the shuttle was well worth the fare, even for a family of 5. You can get a daily pass from the hotel desk that should be cheaper than just buying a one-way fare in the shuttle (or so they told me).  The only issues we had were that the bathroom was very dated and felt small. Also, our room was adjacent to the pool and is very loud, especially when other guests are up very early or out very late.  Overall a positive experience!

We have stayed at this location the past 3 times we have been to Disneyland and we love it! Being a Platinum member we have been upgraded to the themed suite which my 2 year old daughter loved. The suites are great in that we have a place to store a few groceries for breakfast and milk for the little one.   The hotel is located right behind the Mickey and Friends parking lot and it is about 1 block away from the entrance to the Disneyland grounds. Once entering the Disney property you can walk to the Disney and Friends lot to take the tram or walk through Downtown Disney to the parks. We found it much easier to just walk all the way  vs taking the tram. It was too much if a hassle waiting for the tram and folding/unfolding the stroller. All in all, it takes about 15 mins to get

They say they're one block away from Disneyland. If you're driving, that's probably true. If you're walking, though, it's quite a bit more than a block. Not that I mind the walk, but I wanted to throw that out there, in case the proximity is appealing to any Yelpers.   We stayed two nights over our anniversary weekend. We chose this hotel because we could bring the beagles with us, and because it was within walking distance (it really is just over a mile from Disneyland).   They have a private parking lot, for which they charge $10 a day. Within the parking lot is a small grassy area complete with doggy poopy bags and a trash can. Those both came in handy during our stay.   The hotel seems a bit dated, but at least it was pretty clean. We were given a room on the third floor,

We stayed here for two nights at the end of January, in one of the themed suites. We usually stay elsewhere but I had points that I could apply to this stay. The furnishings are slightly dated but overall it was a nice experience. The staff is definitely the highlight here. They truly embrace the "magic" of Disney and go out of their way to make guests' experiences unforgettable.
