In terms of distance to Disney -- it is further than other properties we've stayed at but it's still a pleasant walk through Downtown Disney. The Mickey and Friends parking garage is near this hotel as well.

My husband and I come often to this area to go to Disneyland.  I cannot recommend this hotel, because the room we stayed in was unacceptable.  The room was dark and dingy and had a musty smell, The carpets were dirty, the toilet had no actual seat cover, you know the part where you can put the top down?  The bed was hard and lumpy and the free wifi didn't work.  When we arrived back from Disneyland at around 6 pm, the room had not been tended to, we had to call the front desk for fresh towels.  Steer clear of this hotel
Manager Response: We regret that we were not able to fulfill your expectations and we would like to offer our most sincere apologies for the inconveniences caused.   We would like to acknowledge that we have a very strict control of all issues reported and regarding this particular matter.  The proper department heads have already been informed and have been addressed.  We do hope you would give us another try in the near future at your next Magic Kingdom trip.

Summary Heading: Good value, easy to get to Disneyland
Summary: Our stay: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights over spring break. When booking I was looking for good value close to Disneyland, and a pool.  Rooms: The room we had was just fine. Comfortable bed and pillows, mini fridge, and coffee maker. Clean and functional bathroom. The air conditioner and fridge were very loud, so I just unplugged them overnight.  Staff: Most of the staff were very friendly and helpful. The one exception was a man at the front desk. I asked him to call me a taxi to take me to a car rental place, and what arrived was his ‚Äúfriend‚Äù who had a town car service, who charged a $12 flat rate. I wondered if I was being ripped off but was in a rush so didn‚Äôt worry. I realized I was being ripped off when the return taxi trip (called for me by the helpful staff at

Summary Heading: A Little Gem with Great Service
Summary: This hotel has become our local go to hotel. Going to DLand at least twice a month can be very pricey, if you stay on property. Plus DLand Hotel and Paradise Pier are a little closer and are about 3-4 times more expensive. One can use the BART system if their party does not want to walk. We actually enjoy the walk to step off our DLand calories. The walk can be tiresome, however as mentioned you have alternatives. The staff and management cannot be any nicer. They appreciate costumer loyalty and truly have a genuine passion for their hotel. We have been staying since Aug. and it is the same smiling faces greeting us ever since. Our daughter loves to color and they always offer a coloring page. When she returns the page to the front desk she is offered a prize. The rooms and
Manager Response: Dear airblue1,  Thank you so much for the fantastic review for your recent stay with us.  All of us couldn't be happier to hear that we made you and your daughter stay that much more special.  Our staff take great pride in providing excellent service to all of our guest.  Thank you again for being our guest and we look forward to seeing you real soon.  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager Holiday Inn Suites Anaheim

Summary: I booked this hotel bout 3 months ago because we planned a Disney trip, I was thinking bout Disney resort but after looking at the pictures and rates I wasn't planning on paying $500 a night for a 3 star hotel just because there's a Mickey plush on the bed and Disney decorations so I looked around and found this holiday inn and I liked pictures,reviews and rates also that they are pet friendly. Upon arrival after 5 minutes check in we got our room great customer service I been to a few hotels and I was impressed by how smooth everything went. Next day we went to Disney is only 10-15 minutes walk depends how fast you walk, we went,came back,and went again at night. I'll probably have holiday inn, in my hotel preferences list, I was greatly satisfied with it.

the hotel had all we needed. Location was great as we could easily walk to Disneyland and Downtown Disney.  The restaurant was good. The staff were great with the children and there were tvs in the booths. Children eating free with adults was a bonus.  The pool wasn't huge but safe for children. There was a small hot tub. Lots of towels were provided there but they could have been bigger.

We stayed here for three nights to go to Disneyland and visit other LA attractions. The room was nothing special, but the staff was friendly and helpful, and they definitely seemed to work at being a ''Good Neighbor'' hotel to Disneyland. It took me a little bit of effort to figure out how to do it, but I figured out how to walk to Disneyland from the hotel. There was also a bus that came by pretty regularly. We wound up taking a cab back to the hotel at the end of our Disneyland day, because there were lots of people waiting for buses, and you know - we were tired.

We had a wonderful 3 night stay, the rooms were great, facilities fantastic, pool, restaurant, bar, family rooms are Disney themed and decorated, fifteen minutes walk from downtown Disney and a shuttle bus also operates to the main Disneyland entrance.  Rooms have a refrigerator, coffee machine with coffee sugar and creamer, iron, microwave, but no safe.  The beds were really comfy and spotless, the hotel is in a quiet area, a petrol station and grocery are 2 minutes walk, restaurants are a 10 minute drive.  Great staff, great facilities for children, the only drawback was having to pay for parking at $10 per night after paying $90 per night for the room!

Other reviews led us book this hotel.  I think they were delusional. The rooms are dank, dingy and smell bad. The elevators were half in service. The outside door took two of us to pull it open, it was broken. The pool is very small and in the shadows. The waterpark is lame, for babies only.The distance to Disney is grossly understated, it takes a lot longer to walk there.  We will not be returning this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear sarahw0814,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your stay with us. We would like to apologize for falling short of your expectations regarding our room condition, facilities and location. We give the utmost importance to our guest comments as they help us improve and continually provide the best guest experience possible. In addition, we have sent you a private message to obtain more information about your stay.  Again, our apologies for the inconvenience and we hope to have another opportunity to provide you a much better experience.  Sincerely,  Joel A Case Manager IHGService

Summary: I stayed here last week with my bestfriend because we had to drive to downtown LA and didn't want to drive there coming all the way from San Diego. We liked the hotel, it's in a quiet area althought Disneyland is so close by. We arrived at 11pm at night and the lobby was still busy with a lot of people, I think most of them came from Disneyland. We liked the room we got, it was a one queen bedroom and the A/C worked well. The only thing to note was the TV, we came so late that we didn't bother turning on the TV but in the morning when I wanted to watch the news, the TV wasn't turning on. Too late to complain anymore as we were leaving that same day. The only other thing that I didn't like was that they don't serve complimentary breakfast and they charge $10 for parking. So much

The location of the hotel is great but that is about the only positive thing I have to say about it. The carpet in our room was sticky and there was mold all over the bathroom which looked like it hasn't been upgraded since the place was built. I did enjoy being able to walk to Disneyland but would rather stay somewhere else in the future.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback regarding your recent stay with us. We apologize for the cleanliness issues you encountered and we assure you our staff is committed to improve in this area immediately.  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: A little bit Dated but Hotel staff awesome
Summary: rooms were a bit dated, but hotel staff was awesome! we checked in super early and aroom was available so they let us in. Restaurant had good food and again awesome staff..give you extra coffee in a "to go" cup for the shuttle!..First pick up and drop off of shuttle is great!

Traveled to Disneyland last year and chose this hotel considering the price and distance to Disneyland Parks. The AC was not working properly in my room, despite asking to the Front Desk to have it fixed the next day during my absence, when I was back to the room, still had trouble in turning on and off. I used to come back to the room late night after spending all day in the park, I was feeling tired, so I just left the AC unplugged and decided not to bother with it. The front desk service was okay, didn't go beyond my expectations but I had the answers for my questions. Nothing to complain about room cleaning service and liked the bath amenities (bath & body works). To be honest, next time I go to Disneyland would try another hotel closer to the parks. It is within walking
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time time to let us know about your recent stay. We apologize for the problems with the AC in your room and we appreciate you letting us know about it so we could fix it. We do hope you consider staying with us again in the future  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: I was hoping for a better experience after reading the reviews.  I think they were based mainly on the location to Disney, but not on the quality of the hotel itself.  My room had a smell that I just couldn't get past.  Although clean, the smell was forever lingering.  I'm also not impressed with just the overall condition of the hotel itself from the lobby to the rooms.  I was not able to find another hotel in the area, but I'm not sure that I will ever come back to this location.  I would rather drive a distance to get to Disney.  This one is not worth the proximity.
Manager Response: Thank you for your response and I do sincerely apologize for the issues you encountered.  I assure you the issues have already been corrected and we do hope you consider staying with us again in the near future.  Kevin Do  Assistant General Manager

Summary: Nice family hotel close to Disney. Restaurant had good selection. Kids eat free off kids menu. Nice pool and hot tub.  Staff very helpful. Gift shop in site. Enjoyed our stay at Holiday Inn & Suites Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Good family hotel and close to Disneyland
Summary: My wife and I took the kids to Disneyland and stayed here.  Very close to Disneyland and very comfortable.  Enjoy the breakfast at the hotel before you go into the park, kids eat free and the price is reasonable.  Would stay here again.

if you are staying at Disneyland is this a good location.  Just down the street from Downtown Disney.  Rooms are overly themed with Disney.  So if that's what your doing kids will love it... for a business meeting it was a little over the top.   There is a water park for little one at the hotel and the restaurant breakfast was ok, food was not hot at 7am.

This hotel was perfect for visiting Disneyland.  My husband and I took our 2 girls (5 and 7 years old) and it was very family friendly.  The moment you walk into the lobby there's a tv with kid size chairs playing Disney movies to distract the kids while you check in and get organized. We had the Fairy Suite which the kids loved - it has a separate bedroom so you can have a drink or watch tv after the kids go to sleep.  The fridge and kitchen area were great - we picked up milk and cereal for quick and easy breakfasts.  You could also see the fireworks right from within the room. The kids loved the pool - it was super warm and with February temperatures easy for them to enjoy. Disneyland is a good walk from here - it is definitely doable but it took a while and we were really

Mostly friendly customer service, the ladies who clean the rooms were very nice and helpful. The restaurant was very nice and kid friendly. Would suggest different wall colors given kids dirty them next to the booths. Only issue I had were with the gift shop ladies. They seemed a little snotty and weren't very helpful or attentive. Also the bus to the Disney parks I wasn't told what route it was and almost boarded the wrong one. Loved this hotel and will most likely come back to this one. Location is great. Away from the loudness and big crowd from Disney parks yet super close.

Summary Heading: A Family Hotel and close to Disneyland!!!
Summary: Thank you Jonathan (Front Desk) for making my stay at the Holiday Inn a one to remember.  Thank you for going above and beyond. Had a great customer service experience. I was here for business but I will definatly return with my family for our next Disneyland vacation.   Pros: Close to Disneyland              Customer Service is Excellent            Parking             Cons:  Rooms need an immediate update             Gym needs an immediate makeover

Unlike other Holiday Inn Express properties, this location does not include any sort of breakfast with the room. That said, the location is great, close to the Disneyland Hotel and Downtown Disney. The staff is very helpful and the rooms are clean and comfortable.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the Holiday Inn & Suites Anaheim. While the limited service Express hotels include breakfast, we have a full menu for breakfast, lunch and dinner along with a lounge. We also have some great breakfast inclusive packages that are a great value. Also, all kids 12 and under eat free with the adults here.  We are glad you had a good stay with us and we do hope to see you again the next time you are in the area.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: VERY VERY PLEASED! WE WILL BE BACK! CLOSE TO DISNEY!! RECOMMEND!
Summary: From the beginning of booking our reservation for a 5 night stay, we were impressed. We are Spire Elite members, and everyone, especially the Manager made it possible for us to utilize points on a very busy weekend and made room for our family. Before we even made it to the hotel we were impressed. Upon arrival the front desk was very friendly and helpful. The hotel was very busy, and they handled it with ease and grace. They upgraded us to a suite (Star Wars) which was a nice touch and my husband and our 17 year old exchange student were so happy about the room! Our 4 year old daughter cried haha ;) Overall, we were more than pleased with the upgrade to the suite and how they treated our family. The Cleaning Crew were happy to help with anything, and provided extra towels and
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your comments. We are thrilled you had a good time here at the Holiday Inn & Suites Anaheim. Please come see us again soon!  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Quite yet very close to Disney
Summary: Went for the RunDisney star wars event and although there is the ART bus, it was close enough to walk to the RunDisney event.  Great view of the fireworks each night, and very quite otherwise.  Hot tub was really good.  Pool was open but the "splash park" was closed at the time.  Rooms a little small, but clean.  If you had kids with you it could get cramped and parking is $10/day.  Hotel staff very helpful and polite.

The hotel is family-friend and has a large outdoor pool, hot tub and gated kids' waterpark. What I really like about this hotel is that kids eat free every morning and evening at the on-site restaurant, which has quite a decent selection of items. There really isn't much around this area unless you take a taxi (about $10 USD) or transit to Anaheim Gardenwalk, where they have Cheesecake Factory, Bubba Gump Shrimp Company, P.F. Chang's, and California Pizza Kitchen -- among other restaurants. There is a gas station about a block away from the hotel so you can stock up on snacks/drinks there, and in each room there is a mini fridge and microwave. The Disneyland and California Adventure gates are about a 20-minute walk away (while the hotel's website states: 1blk/Disneyland and that

Summary Heading: Great place to stay with kids!
Summary: Rooms were clean, even under the mattresses and behind the dresser and nightstand. I always check for cleanliness in the areas that you can't see. The staff was very knowledgeable about the area and, of course, Disneyland. The pool was very warm (this is a good thing on chilly nights), the hot tub was very relaxing. I liked that they provided beach balls to play with in the pool. They also have a splash zone for kids to play in. This was the only downside. The sensor wasn't working for the water to come on in the Splash zone and after phoning the front desk for assistance, we were told someone would come by and help. 30 minutes later we decided to go to the pool since no one had shown up (this was around 7:30 pm, splash zone closes at 9). If this feature worked or someone would

We were happy with our stay as it was very convenient to Disneyland.  The room was clean and quiet.  We were on the second floor which was easily accessible by elevator or stairs.  The wi-fi password changed without us knowing which eventually required a call to the front desk.  The only real negative was the $10 per day parking charge.

The hotel was clean and nice and for the money and the little time spent there it was good. It is a little bit of a walk to Disney; our kids did ok, they are 7 and 9. Our blow dryer didn't work which they fixed promptly and the coffee machine had not been emptied from previous people. There were some minor things overall but I would stay there again for the price. If your looking for Disney themed places this would not be the hotel for you.
Manager Response: Thank you for feedback. We are very sorry for the problems with the hair dryer and coffee maker. My housekeeping staff has assured me they are making great efforts to ensure this does not happen again. We do hope you will come see us again the next time you visit the Magic Kingdom!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Great -as all Holiday Inns are- amazing comfortable bed and pillow! With family friendly water slides and pools, i don't have kids but figured out it would be a great spot for summer to rest a little from busy Disneyland. Shuttle to and from, only 4usd!

I had to be in Los Angeles for business towards the end of last year and thought that I would treat my long suffering (because of my frequent absence on business) family to a trip to Disneyland while I was in town. I was initially going to use points (I have many in spite of using them frequently) but the nearest IHG hotel to Disneyland - Holiday Inn and Suites - was such bad points value I decided to pay for the stay.  After a very long flight with a three year old I was looking forward to checking into the hotel. As it was just before 11 am our room wasn't ready. The gentleman handling the check in acknowledged my IHG membership (but not Spire Ambassador membership), gave me a choice of some points or drinks vouchers and then - because it was early - offered me a downgrade to
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about your recent stay with us. We apologize for not performing up to your expectations. We do take all comments to heart and are committed to improve every day.   Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Very decent hotel for the price
Summary: I have no complaints about this hotel. The room was great, and we spent a lot of time in the pool! It was within walking distance of Disneyland and restaurants and gas stations. The van for the shuttle was awful, none of the seatbelts worjed and were all broken. We chose to walk instead. All in all, a good hotel!

We chose this location due to it's proximity to Disney (only .5 mile away).  We were there over New Year's but the hotel was still very quiet.  At no time did we feel unsafe being here.  In fact we were coming and going well after midnight without any issues.  Definitely a great bargain if you are looking for close to the park, comfy rooms and quiet!

Summary :   - Pretty decent hotel stay for our first trip to Disneyland (Yay! Excitement!) - Family friendly hotel - Comfortable and enough parking spots - 15 mins stroll to Disneyland - Delicious breakfast - Friendly staff

Summary Heading: Nice but not 1 block from Disney
Summary: We chose this hotel after much internet searching. What clinched it was a review that said the hotel was next to the Disney parking structure where you could catch the tram to the park. While technically correct there are walls in the way and it would have been longer to walk around to the tram stop then to walk to the park. The walk is pleasant, safe and about 15-20 minutes. This is okay in the morning but tough after a long day. I dont know why they don't have a shuttle. If they had a shuttle I would recommend this hotel above others in the area especially for couples and families.   Otherwise the hotel/rooms are clean, staff is competent and friendly, and restaurant is decent. The small gift shop has souveniers and some much needed Advil. They have themed suites which sounded

The location is great. You can park (only $10 a day) and walk to Disnyland. Staff is so kind and welcoming from the front desk to the restaurant and bar to housekeeping and groundskeepers. It's affordable which helps make an expensive Disneyland trip easier on the pocketbook. The pool, spa, workout room and kids water Splash Zone are well cared for and easily accessible from each building on the property.  Ready to take the family to see Disney? Really...stay here.

My family and I are still grieving for loosing my mom, so we decided to check-in in this hotel and have a little Christmas celebration at Downtown Disney. Jonathan ( front desk) was very indifferent towards us. He was avoiding eye contact and was unhelpful. It was already past 3:00p.m. and he can't give us an idea on what time the room will be ready. After waiting for ten more minutes, I approached Leslie ( front desk), and she told us that the room is ready. We got an update and two-free-drinks after we complained about Jonathan. Our stay is not yet done, hopefully the rest of the stay will be merry.
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about your experience at check in. I have discussed the importance of keeping guests informed as to the progress of getting their room ready for them to check into. Thank you for giving me the opportunity to address the issue with my staff.  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: I am a Spire Level member of IHG and because of that I try to keep my loyalty with them at any possible time , this is why I choose the Holiday Inn , at arriving although I had prepaid and arrived at 3.30 PM , 3.00PM being the check in time , our three rooms were not all cleaned and ready , now arriving after over 20 hours of flying time with young children and having to deal with an 11 hour time difference is awful , now the rooms are not ready shows a lot of lack of sensitivity and respect , someone who had already paid and has no choice ! Anyway we did get to our rooms which were not bad but the mattress was no very comfortable and being near Disneyland you would expect the rooms to attend to you children , no way my youngest who was crawling was getting carpet burns from how
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your stay with us. We are very sorry about the delay in getting your rooms checked in. We do try our best too get multiple room reservations under the same name close together and sometimes this causes slight delays. We are glad Michael was helpful to you and we do hope you would consider staying with us again in the future  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: The best thing about this hotel is the location. Attempting to park at Disneyland makes me crazy. I was more than happy to walk 15 minutes to get to and from the park.   This property is a little dated. We were only in our room to sleep, so it wasn't an issue. Had we spent more time in our room, I might have been bothered, but we were so busy, I don't think we even had a chance to turn on the tv.  This hotel is pet friendly which is great unless you have smelly dogs. I'm not sure what the deal was, but the two dogs across the hall from us were so pungent that we could smell them in our room. This isn't really the hotel's fault, but something you should be aware of as a guest.  All in all, we had a pleasant two night stay.

Summary Heading: Top to bottom... great staff, great location, great price
Summary: The front desk went far and beyond the call of duty. Check-in was quick and painless. The room was clean, spaciius, and quiet. Shuttle to disneyland costs 5 dollars for all day use. You can buy tickets for Disneyland at the front desk. Very convenient

Stayed three nights.  About a 15 minute walk to Downtown Disneyland. Room and hotel were clean; comfortable bed, quiet and staff was friendly and helpful. Quick to respond to questions; restaurant brought us a plate of hot hash brown potatoes when we let them know that the heat was out on the serving dish. Reasonable prices, no surprises and would definitely stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the Holiday Inn & Suites Anaheim. We are glad you had a good time and we look forward to seeing you again!  Best Regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: We stayed for 3 nights in this hotel.  15 to 20 minute walk to Downtown Disney or 10 minutes on the very reasonably priced shuttle bus that leaves from the front of the hotel.  We booked a suite and was "upgraded" to a Frozen themed suite where everything was Frozen from a mural on the wall, various poster prints, bedside light, rubbish bin and a radio alarm that played Let It Go at the press of a button.  Great if you like that sort of thing.  The sofa bed was uncomfortable. and was glad I was only in it for 3 nights, any longer I would have booked another room.  The bedding was clean but very worn out with holes in it.  Behind the Frozen Prints the room is a little tired and could do with renovating.  Nice swimming pool, staff were freindly enough.  A little strange that the

For a somewhat impromptu early-December trip to Anaheim, we booked the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites through a Priceline Express Deal. On all previous trips, we stayed along Harbor Boulevard in hotels that were within a short walking distance from the Disneyland and California Adventure main entrances, so staying on the opposite end of the property was a slight concern, at first. But come to find out, it wasn't an issue whatsoever.  This hotel is located on Walnut Street right next to the massive Mickey & Friends parking structure. Since we were already paying $10 per night to park at the hotel, we certainly didn't want to pay an additional $18 or so to park in the structure to go to the parks. On our first night, we decided to walk two blocks down to the Disneyland Hotel and have

Hotel was nice. Restaurant served 10oz steak ;). Restaurant staff was friendly. Remember to order pizza when you are staying there...Microwave in room.   Walk to disneyland takes approx 15 minutes or you can hop on the shuttle.  Would visit again and stay here.
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about your stay with us. We are glad your daughter's birthday went well. Come see us again soon!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Just an easy 15 minute walk to Downtown Disney and the "secret" Disneyland entrance! Easy access to the freeway for exploring Southern California.  We were in Laguna Beach in 35 mins.  Rooms are a bit tired, but clean, as we expected around Disney.

We spent very little time at the hotel. We arrived after midnight, got to our room, had a comfortable bed, and slept well. We were allowed to leave our car in the parking lot, the front desk stored our luggage, and we walked to Disneyland that morning. (About 1 mile.) There is an outdoor play area that looks like it has water features, but we were not at the hotel during peak daylight hours.
Manager Response: We are glad you had a good time during your visit to our Holiday Inn & Suites Anaheim. Come see us again soon!  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Dated Property But Good Value Within Walking Distance To Disneylan
Summary: Always hard to give above average when employees are excellent.  This property and it's rooms are just average.  I guess the age of the property has something to do with that.  We were upgraded to the "Frozen" Suite.  Larger two room suite with some less than average "Frozen" decor.  If we were to of paid extra, I would of been upset, but our 8 year old daughter thought it was the 'bomb' and that is all that matters.  Dollar for dollar, still a good value since you can walk an easy 10 minutes to Disney.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are very happy your daughter liked our Frozen themed suite. We do hope you visit us again soon!  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: I traveled to San Diego from Virginia on business and then flew my 11 year old daughter into John Wayne to spend a couple of days in Disneyland with me for an early Christmas present.  The staff at the hotel was superb!  Being our first time in Anaheim, all of the staff was more than eager to help us get acquainted with their hometown.  We ate at the restaurant several times and the food was good, staff super friendly, especially Princess.  Each booth has it's own tv with satellite so my daughter really enjoyed that.  The hotel room was clean, comfortable and for the most part quiet.  The walls are a bit thin to the outside so we could hear people playing in the pool and running around, but that was during the day and at night it was very quiet.  The beds were very comfortable.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments. We are thrilled you had a good time here at the Holiday Inn & Suites Anaheim.  We hope to see you again soon!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Good room, we got a great price on a package deal. Restaurant was good and the staff were great. Quick walk to Disney was nice. Have stayed at other hotels around resort, will stay at this hotel again for sure next time we go back to Disney. Don't use "Prime Time Shuttles", they forgot to pick us up, didn't care and left us stranded, almost missed our flight.

We stayed here based on the reviews we read. We won't be back. This hotel is tired looking. Loose tiles in the bathroom with some sort of mold growing along the tub. It was close to Disneyland this was its only perk. The front staff wasn't very helpful or care less about your stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about your stay with us. We apologize for the condition in your bathroom. We do our best to make our hotel as perfect as possible but we obviously fell short in this case. We do hope you will give us another try in the future.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Ten to 15 min walk to Disney! Doable....
Summary: We were not sure about the proximity of this hotel to Disney. After booking,that first night we did a trial run to prepare us for the next's days adventures.  ( We are very serious Disney Freaks). The walk was 12-15 min and the front desk will give you a map to find the way, it's pretty easy and puts you past the Disneyland hotel and ends up in Downtown Disney by the  Rainforest Cafe! We walked to, in the morning, cause we were fresh, the end of the day something different. You can pay 5.00 for the shuttle to and from. We chose to just take the shuttle at night for 3.00 per person and you can pay right on the bus as you board.  Much easier when your tired.  The room  was pretty nice, and clean, (must have that). Stayed on the 4th floor and you can buy your Disney passes at the

We stayed here for one night.  The hotel was very clean, nicely decorated, and the toilet/shower room was a bit small.  The staff was very friendly, professional, and deserve a 10!  I would recommend for those looking for a one-night stay or a family on a budget.
Manager Response: Dear arualpalm,  We would like to extend our appreciation for the candid feedback that you have provided. We are happy to hear that you that you appreciated our hotel and our staff service. We value your comments. This is a continuous process as we strive further in making our product and services from good to great.   We look forward to welcoming you again in the near future.   Sincerely,  Christian C. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: Everything seemed great upon booking our reservation, but what a horrible experience.  4 Adults and 5 kids (12, 4yr,3yr,2yr,and 3 month old) traveled to Disneyland, we were super excited with the 2 Bedroom Pixar Suite we booked and a standard 2 Queen room for our entire family.  However, no one told u we were booked in two separate buildings because one building is all suites and the other standard rooms.  That was the first problem.  Because of the inconvenience we were discounted $40 per night on one room.  Then the second day we discovered there were roaches in the two bedroom suite.  Maintenance man explained it was normal that they come from the drain.  Gross! This should not be normal anywhere for any reason.  We were offered to spray the room for the roaches which we
Manager Response: Dear Ivette6969,  Thank you for staying with us and for writing such a candid and detailed feedback about your stay. We value each review as this will allow us identify the areas that may benefit from our additional attention. Thank you for noting the service provided by Jose. Your kind comments are well received and shall be passed on. On the other hand, I am very sorry for the issues you had with your room accommodations. The cleanliness of our rooms and our property, in general, has always been our main priority and I regret letting you feel otherwise. I also apologize for the maintenance issue with the sink and curtains and it is disheartening to know that your experience with our General Manager was not as pleasant as I would have hoped. I have taken note of your valuable comments and will use these to monitor and improve the quality of services we offer to our guests in the future. In addition, your feedback will remain on file at the IHG corporate office for use in periodic evaluations of the hotel.  Again, thank you for your comments and for choosing us for your lodging needs.  Sincerely,  Ingrid V. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: Was a bit hesitant in booking as wasn't sure what it'd be like in the area, was very pleasantly surprised, we also had a meal in their hotel which was very nice. The car park was easy to navigate and many easy to locate services nearby the hotel. Was an easy walk to Disneyland even though they do offer a shuttle we decided to get some exercise, was also a good spot to see the nightly firework from, we enjoyed our two night stay

This Holiday Inn is like the rest with the room service and housekeeping but the view of the firework shot at 9:30 pm is off the hook!! Clean pool and spa, weight room and business center are standard. The staff...i only meet the night person Shawn, that guy was awesome!!! helped me with just about everything i needed. Didn't have to worry about my car because they have on-site security to patrol the parking lot. All in all it was a great stay.

Few long blocks to Disney. Clean hotel. Nice staff. Pool and water play area but there was too many other things to do. Downtown Disney was so close. Breakfast in hotel was great. The server was so nice and the kids loved the buffet.

This was a great hotel.  The staff was friendly, excellent service and very knowledgeable of the area.  It was convenient to Disney Downtown; the the monorail to Disneyland;  it is a bit more that 1 blk; but a beautiful walk.  The bathrooms were a little small.  The theme rooms were a hugh hit with everyone in the family; should look at making for rooms with this small touch; of Disney

First off, I have to say the staff were top notch. Everyone was friendly, and helpful.  However, even though this hotel had a refurb I 2012, it looks very tired.  I wish housekeeping didn't find it necessary to use so much room deodorizer.  In this day and age, hotels should aware of scent sensitivity.  I purposely put a do not disturb sign on so they wouldn't spray/sprinkle more on the carpet.  Also, the fan in the bathroom was extremely noisy, as was the in-room air conditioner.  I'm lucky if I got 3 hours sleep despite going to bed before 8 pm. AND after taking 3 sleeping pills!  The water pressure in the shower is excellent.  The rooms were very clean.  I guess I can't complain too much as the rate was great.  However, next time will pay the extra to stay at the Mariott.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay with us. We are very happy our staff services were enjoyed by your party while you were here. We do apologize about the noise issues in the room. Our staff will continue to work diligently to ensure all rooms are in good working order.  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Familt Stay on a Visa rewards program.
Summary: This is a nice hotel for those looking for something a little more cost efficient, but yet still nice. It is in no way one block from Disneyland unless you mark a straight line, but I would still doubt it. The convenience of the Anaheim Resort transportation shuttles (A.R.T.) makes it much more simple. It's only $5 a day for unlimited usage. The restaurant wasn't too bad either! There is an outdoor pool for those who would like to take advantage. The service was decent.

We stayed as part of our Disneyland trip in the first week of November 2015.  The hotel was great for us. All staff were friendly, the restaurant was good for a quick meal, and the pool was fun for our daughter (4yrs). Disneyland is a quick 20minute walk through a nice residential area, or a quick shuttle on the ART system. The rooms week modern and very clean, the bathrooms a little small due to the sink and vanity being seperate.  We have stayed at Parsdisr Pier, Clarion and the Hojo, but actually have preferred this hotel. No complaints for what we paid, and we will stay again!

Summary Heading: I really wanted to like it.
Summary: I really wanted to like this hotel. It's in a quiet residential area, not overly far from the Disney attractions. The landscaping in front of the hotel, lots of Bird of Paradise flowers, is very welcoming. It's a great hotel for families, and I saw many at the hotel. The staff were all pleasant and did a good job. The room is where I had issues. The room itself was ok, but I hated the tiny bathroom. At nearly 6'2" I found it a bit of a squeeze. And while I appreciate the conservation measures, the low energy cf bulb takes a long time to light fully. Great at 3am when you've gotta go, but dark and uninviting during the day. I resorted to leaving it on during the day, so much for energy efficiency. The toilet was turbo, but the shower was lo-flow. That annoyed me. Yes, it's a
Manager Response: Thank you staying with us and posting your review. We do apologize for the problems you encountered and we will continue to strive to make improvements to our hotel each and every day. We do hope you will consider staying with us again.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: We are seniors and some times plan on an overnight when a day trip seems to taxing.  Recently we stayed at the Holiday Inn in Anaheim.  It is right smack next to Disneyland (although a walk to its entrance is about 15 minutes).  They, I am told, have a shuttle for $5.  Check in was okay.  We were offered some points or a couple drinks for our Platinum membership in Priority Rewards.  Our room, which we had asked for quiet, was right smack next to the pool, room 5104.  Our window was a 2-3 from the lounge chairs!  It was not quiet.  The room itself was quite large and filled with DISNEY reminders everywhere.  About 9:30 all hell broke loose as the fireworks at the Park started.  They lasted about 15 minutes and shock the room.  The pool closed just after 10 PM as posted and it
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us! Yes the fireworks are pretty loud but are spectacular to view from our parking lot or on the balcony above our pool. We are looking forward to hosting you again the next time you visit the area!  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Hotel Good - Restaurant Not So Much
Summary: We traveled from Alberta, Canada for a week long Disneyland vacation. A couple of weeks before our arrival at the hotel I called to confirm our booking - the agent said that everything with our reservation was in order; the dates, the room type, etc.  We arrived to the hotel around 11 at night with an exhausted five year old and they could not find our reservation... After about 20 mins of 2 agents trying to figure it out, they told us that we were booked for the wrong dates (weird, I had confirmed everything and we booked it all through WestJet Vacations) but anyway, we finally got up to our room.   The room itself is clean and well equipped but very, very cramped. The good news is that we barely spent any time in the room, but it is soooo small. No room around the beds - at

We have stayed at this location before and it has always been a pleasant hotel stay. They have added a small water park for everyone to enjoy as well as small cabanas by the pool. The staff is always friendly and helpful. The restaurant and bar area are clean and a great place to grab a bite to eat as well as a beverage. The gift shop/ mini market are fantastic. The prices are reasonable, they have water, milk, ice cream, snacks, personal needs, as well as a lot of souvenirs for all ages. Once again a great stay, needless to say when we are in Anaheim we will be back again. I almost forgot! Out the door to the parking lot, you have an amazing view of the fireworks from Disneyland every night.

This hotel was an ideal spot for going to Disneyland. Although it isn't exactly the closest it is definitely within walking distance to the park and offers transportation from the hotel to the park itself. The hotel was very clean and updated. And the staff was very accommodating and helpful with everything we needed.

15 to 20 minute walk to Downtown Disney. Wait for the ART shuttle can be 40 minutes. Pool and Hot Tub are ok. Our sink plugged on the second last day of our one week trip, we called down to have it fixed but no one came to fix it. upon checkout I mentioned it again but they really didn't seem to care. The restaurant food is good, but a bit expensive (Breakfast). They make a good Pizza that is reasonably priced
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about your recent stay with us. I apologize that we didn't handle the problem with the drain. We are better than that and our staff is disappointed they let you down. We will do our very best to ensure this does not happen in the future.  We do hope you give us another try the next time you are in the area.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: I stayed two nights to go to nearby Disney parks (it's about a 15-minute walk). The hotel is quite large and you actually get a map to find the way to your room and it can be quite a trek to get there.  Unfortunately housekeeping seems to be fairly slow there as I returned to my room at around 3 pm the first day and they hadn't come round yet. Also when I arrived housekeeping staff left there tools all over the hallway so I had to step over a vacuum cleaner to be able to get to my room.  Overall it's a good hotel, especially because of its proximity to Disney and the fair pricing for overnight parking of $10.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay with us. We apologize your room wasn't cleaned by 3pm. Our room cleaners service rooms up until about 4:30pm each day. If any of our guests need their room serviced at a certain time of the day we are more than happy to make that happen. I have also addressed the issue with the hallways being partially blocked by equipment and have a gotten a commitment from our staff that this will not happen in the future.  We do hope to see you again soon!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Our family frequently travels to California to visit Disneyland (we love in Florida and have the Florida/California pass for Disney) and typically stay here. An easy 10 minute walk to the park (no hills, nicely maintained sidewalks) even for smaller children. Amazingly attentive staff, clean rooms with many amenities travelers enjoy having at their disposal (fridge/freezer, microwave) and very comfortable beds.  The pool area is clean and fun to relax at, at the hotel restaurant is spacious with a wide menu and full buffet. Would happily recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to the area.

Summary Heading: plain jane hotel - not for business travelers
Summary: Room is nice, bed is comfortable, housekeeping service good.  BUT no nice suites available for spire elite member upgrade, and the bartender service is abysmal.  They certainly do not understand the grind of the business traveler... too young, and too stingy, the bar/restaurant manager seems extremely tense and ...busy (flying back and forth around the restaurant in squeaky shoes), resulting in an atmosphere that is not a relaxing place.  It seemed clear that bar staff were in fear for their jobs if one thing was out of line.  Although this HI is close to where I am working, I won't be back here.  Buena Park or Fullerton locations were much more relaxing.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your stay with us. We do our best to upgrade our valued Spire and Platinum members but we can't guarantee that every day due to being a very busy hotel adjacent to Disneyland. I do apologize for the way our bartender was perceived and I assure you I will address that with her. We do hope you would consider staying with us again in the future.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: We stayed here for our anniversary trip this last weekend (10/15-10/18) and I have nothing but great things to say. The staff as attentive, kind, and welcoming every time we saw them, and Anna went out of her way to make our trip EXTRA special. The Onyx restaurant was really good, conveniently located, and the bartender was nice and made great drinks. The ART shuttle that takes you to and from Disneyland is so easy! Keep in mind though, you can only buy one day passes at the hotel, multi-day passes need to be purchased at an ART kiosk. We were also surprised with free in-room wi-fi! We will absolutely be back, and also tell all of our friends and family about this great hotel find!

Great hotel for a Disney Gateway! This is the best location if your going to visiti Disneyland, walking distance to the parks. Big rooms, available parking area no fee! Coin laundry, you don't need to travel with a lot of clothes, reserve space for shopping!

The hotel is within walking distance to Downtown Disney and the theme parks. It is on the west side of the park opposite from all the other hotels and restaurants, just north of the main parking garage. The hotel has a shuttle that can take you to the parks and it is also on the Anaheim Rapid Transit route as well. There are no restaurants around the hotel, but the hotel has a good restaurant (see review of Onyx). It is a good choice if you want to escape the masses after a day at the park. We had a comfortable room overlooking the pool and hot tub with two double beds. Our room had both a refrigerator and a microwave for added convenience. The staff was friendly and helpful. The wifi was free and worked well.

Overall, the stay was very nice. We stayed there for four nights at the end of September for a family vacation. We stayed  in one of their Frozen themed suites, and it was very cute.   I was disappointed that the website advertised that the beds were queen sized, when they clearly were not. I have a queen size bed at home, and this bed was not as big as mine. Also, the bedding they have on the beds is exactly the same as the bedding my daughter has at home, and I know for a fact it does not come in a queen size set.   The amenities in the room were nice. There was a small kitchen area. Equipped with a mini fridge, sink, microwave, and some simple disposable utensils.   I did have some issues with the hotel though. First, our fridge was not working. So we called down to have
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We do apologize for the service problems in housekeeping and at the front desk. I assure you we have addressed these issues and are making every effort to make sure these things do not happen again. Also, our queen size beds are 80 X 60 which is standard for queen beds.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: this hotel is within walking distance to disneyland, it is a very pleasant place to stay with a great pool area nice bar and restaurant , we found nothing to complain about and really enjoyed our time there. the staff were all enthusiastic and polite and helpful, if we ever go back to that area we would not hesitate to spend further time there.

We really enjoyed our 5 night stay at this hotel with our son and his family. The rooms were clean, quiet and comfortable. Their children, 2 and 4yrs old, loved the pool and the water park.  All the staff were friendly and helpful but especially in the Onyx restaurant.  The TV in the booths made the short 10 minute (or less) wait for our meals to arrive after ordering a relaxing time.  The meals were filling and tasty and also a good value.  The children loved what they ordered which if you have children you know doesn't always happen.  The ART (shuttle) comes right to the hotel door every 20 minutes which we found convenient.  We did walk as well and it took us about 25 minutes to Disney main gate.  This is not a five star hotel but I give it full marks because it is a fun,

We stayed here for 3 nights while visiting Disneyland. It was an easy 10 minute walk (no hills or anything). I love Disneyland and have been there more times then I can count - I usually stay at the Disneyland Resort. We were looking for a cheaper option this time around, but not skip too much on quality - this did not disappoint! Very nice staff, SUPER comfortable beds, very clean room! The bathroom was a little dirty (not terrible) and the ceiling in the shower was a bit low. Besides that this hotel was very convenient! We would stay here again.

We took our 3 year old granddaughter and had a Great time, you can see the Disneyland fireworks right out your window it was great.  We stayed for 5 nights. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Short walk to Disneyland and a short drive to Knotts Berry Farm.  We loved this hotel and will stay their again our next trip.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and for staying at the Holiday Inn & Suites Anaheim. We are glad to hear you had a good time and we hope to see you again soon!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Good value and easy walk to Disney parks
Summary: We were  pleased with the value offered by this Holiday Inn. But, mostly it was it's close proximity to the park entrances that we appreciated. The short 15 minute walk led us along a safe and attractive route onto Disney property. Then past the Disneyland Hotel, through Downtown Disney and then to the entrances to both Disneyland and DCA. The included breakfast was appreciated. An adequate buffet. It always surprises me to find that a hotel charges a parking fee after not seeing it mentioned anywhere during the reservation process. We would stay at this hotel again, but would research other close by options now that we are familiar with the area around Disneyland. I noticed that a brand new Holiday Inn Express was coming on line also a short walk from the parks.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the Holiday Inn & Suites Anaheim and for posting your review. We are glad you enjoyed your stay!  Best Regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: This hotel is older,you can walk to disneyland in about 15 minutes so you can save on parking, rooms are small especially the bathroom are aircondition did not work real well which was a problem because it was 100 degrees the swimming pools looked nice but we never had time to try them
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your review. We apologize for the air conditioning issue. Our units usually do a great job cooling a room. We do hope you choose us again the next time you are in the area.  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Just recently stayed here with our school group. Rooms where clean with comfy beds good aircon could do with a bathroom upgrade but still fine. Pool area is great. Will definitely bring our group back here. Feels safe with cards for entry on all spaces

Summary Heading: Proximity to Disneyland and good B‚Äôfast (not free) ‚Ä¶
Summary: We Stayed in this hotel for 2 nights after the hotel we booked didn‚Äôt turned out as we expected (One of the reputed hotels). Since we had to book last minute, the rates we paid were too high as compared to the amenities provided. The front staff was not helpful at all, they couldn‚Äôt even find me in their reservation. I believe the guy on the front-desk was on training and had no clue of what I was talking, he had to go inside and consult with someone for every question of mine. I booked the hotel under Disney‚Äôs 60th anniversary plan and I was provided a 60$ meal voucher (Getting the voucher was another story ‚Äì I had to spend 30 minutes and talk to their manager on duty to get the same). The breakfast was good and the servers were very nice, my daughter loved the d√©cor and the TV
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know how things went with your recent stay with us. We sincerely apologize for the response of our front desk staff and I assure you we are working diligently to not let this happen again. We also just finished upgrading our free Wi-Fi service to fiber optics and this is working beautifully now. We do hope you'd give us another try the next time you are in the area.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: We booked a stay here for 2 weeks. First upon checkin we were greeted by friendly staff that had us checked through promptly.  We found the room most adequate for our stay. It was very clean with modern furniture, comfortable  bedding, good sized refrigerator, microwave oven, single cup coffee maker.  The bathroom while a bit dated was clean and functioned well. We had the Buffett breakfast one morning and found it only ok, Otherwise ate in other local restaurants.  The hotel doesn't have it's own shuttle to Disneyland but there is a local ART bus that pulls up out front of the hotel to Disneyland and return for fee. If you want to walk, then at a leisurely pace its flat ground and takes 25min to the entrance of Disneyland theme parks. If there was any negatives, the pillows

My family and I stayed here for one night.  We are platinum members and used our annual free night.  When we checked in, we were told that we could receive an upgrade. Yes, please!  We were given a room on the fourth floor and a suite, with a kitchen, large sitting room, and a connecting bedroom w two queen sized beds.  Room was very quiet and nestled in the back of the property.  There was a nice outdoor pool and a relatively new splash pad.  we were impressed and would consider staying at this hotel again in the future.

We stayed for 10 days and it was just what we needed. We walked to Disney. It's about 15 minutes which was totally fine for our family. The room was great, clean, had a fridge. Wifi worked great. We didn't eat at the restaurant so I can't comment on that but I did notice that kids eat free when with a paying adult. We had free parking which was awesome. The kids loved the pool. Housekeeping service was great. Would definitely stay again. Awesome value.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay- walking distance to Disneyland
Summary: We planned a somewhat last minute trip to Disneyland. We chose this hotel because it looked nice and was close. We really enjoyed it. The pool and splash pad areas are.really nice. And there are pool towels provided which is always helpful!!!  The room we stayed in was fairly standard but with a microwave and fridge.  The front desk was very helpful when we had questions. The walk to Disney took us about ten or so minutes.  The restaurant in the hotel offers free meals to kids which was very nice and helpful to the budget! There is a charge for parking. All in all a great place to stay for the cost. I will probably be back!

My partner and I stayed here, this was my second time in this hotel and my partners first. We loved it! first class service. The rooms are spacious, beds are very comfortable just like I had remembered, everything in general is clean and has all amenities necessary for a comfortable stay. One of the highlights is that it is just one block away from Disneyland and that's fantastic considering we spent three whole days there so just walked from there. restaurant is nice, and waiting staff are considerate and lovely.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel within easy walking distance to Disney
Summary: I've now stayed at this hotel twice.  This is a nice clean hotel with a nice location.  It's  a bit removed from all the hustle and bustle of the hotels on the other side of Disney sitting across from a residential neighborhood.  That's both a good and bad thing in the sense that you don't have all the food options that you would get if you stayed on Harbor.  The hotel is a short walk from Disney and there's always the shuttle if you don't care to walk.  You enter through the Downtown Disney area of the resort, so the lack of food nearby might not be as big of an issue.  One possible negative is that the fireworks are very loud and they seem to be shot off from somewhere behind the hotel.  If you're at the park, obviously that's not going to be a big issue but if you're in the

Very convenient walking distance to Downtown Disney, then hop on monorail for Disneyland.  Hotel clean and even with all the kids, it was quiet.  Bed was very comfortable, but pillow didn't work-- way too squishy.  Staff friendly and attentive.

I stayed at this Hotel because of the Price and Location to Disneyland. The rooms are very nice, kept up and clean. All of the personnel are very friendly and pleasant to be around. The gift shop sells big bottles of water for 99 cents so pick some up before going to Disneyland which sells it for $2.99. The caf√© has a good selection of items and a decent buffet. You can walk to Downtown Disney in about 20 minutes or less. Parking is on site for $10 per day. I will stay here again.

My kids loved it swimming pool was awesome We booked pirate rooms my boys where jumping on the bed for hours. The price was ok but depends how many days your there. It was close to Disney world that's a plus. Overview great hotel for family's and friend. Definitely recommend this hotel, bye. ;)

The room was very welcoming and felt more like staying at home than a hotel which i enjoyed, was very quiet at night and great price. Breakfast was continental so shouldnt expect much but was nice. also had great wifi so was nice to be able to come home an watch some netflix before bed. Staff were very friendly and helpful for planning our trip to disney, would advise taking there shuttle bus to disney than driving, way cheaper than paying for parking at disney. location was perfect would stay here again.

The staff was friendly and the restaurant had great food! Also the front desk helped us arrange a ride to and from Huntington beach with a wonderful tour guide! Our beds were comfy and my son loved the pool! Disneyland was a short walk away & it was nice having a gift shop at the hotel to buy family members a last minute souvenir. Best vacation ever!

I thoroughly enjoyed my week long stay at this hotel.  Staff were friendly and helpful, the room was clean and comfortable, and the restaurant provided well prepared meals at a reasonable price.  I would definitely stay here again, and recommend it to my friends.

Summary Heading: As an alternative to Disney it's Alright
Summary: So we  couldn't get into Disney with the Diamond Celebration.   I called and they booked us into the pirate 2 room suite.   The pictures speak for themselves the prices were decent.   I will say I thought it was slightly over priced.

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland, and themed suite a hit with our kids!
Summary: We stayed here earlier this month on a trip to Disneyland. We had a great experience. It was within walking distance to Downtown Disney and both parks. It was quiet at night, the splash pad was great, and we loves or suite style room! We picked a themed room (ours was Mickey and Minnie, but they also offer Frozen, Star Wars, etc), and our kids loved it! The suite style was large and comfortable, and provided somewhere for us to hang out in the evening after putting our young children to bed. We would definitely return in the future. Only thing that could be improved is elevators - few and far between which is hard when everyone trying to leave in the morning to go to parks (and we had strollers so stairs were not an option).

This hotel was great!  It is within walking distance of Downtown Disney where you can hop on the monorail to take you right into the park.  Convenient as you do not need to use your car once you are at the hotel. Nice pool and hot tub.

This hotel was everything we could have asked for. We were able to walk to & from Disneyland everyday.  It was extremely convenient that it had a restaurant.  We would eat brkfst before we left & eat dinner when we got back. The bartender, Jose, is amazing. He was great with conversation & made u feel like u were his only customer. My 3 yr old daughter loved the splash park, but also spent some time in the pool. The only down fall was parking was $10 a day. When looking for hotels, I looked for "free parking", & it listed this hotel. It wasn't a big deal, but just thought I'd let others know. :)

This is a clean, modern facility with a pool and an outdoor water park (small) for kids to enjoy.  The support staff (housekeeping and maintenance) is outstanding, but we found the front desk staff to be not so friendly.  In fact, when we called back after the stay to inquire about a charge we never got a return call even after calling three times.  The restaurant is okay - food isn't bad and is much more reasonable than it is at or around the theme park.  Hotel offers free wifi, but don't expect a strong signal or blazing speeds.  The best feature of this hotel is its proximity to Disneyland - we found it more convenient to walk than to wait for the shuttle service.  You can walk from the hotel to Downtown Disney in 12 to 15 minutes.  You can then grab the monorail over to
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about your stay with us. I apologize for the front desk issue and I assure you it is being addressed. We do hope you stay with us again.  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: The location is a plus. We could walk to the park & view the fireworks from the parking lot.  The overall hotel is maybe a C grade for other options in the area.  The resturant had much to be desired.  They could do better all the way around.
Manager Response: Thanks for your review. We strive every day to do our best and we obviously fell short of this quest during your stay. I assure you I have shared this with our staff and we are committed to continue to improve.  Thank you!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Clean and with friendly staff. .excellent value..nice rooms. Internet - wifi- service was very good.  I highly recommend this hotel..I booked it through Southwest Airlines vacation..I randomly picked a winner!!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We are very happy you had a good time and we hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Good value for money, short walk from Disneyland
Summary: We spent a couple of nights here and were impressed with the staff, location and cleanliness of the hotel. It's 15 mins to Disneyland and a fairly pleasant walk. We were well looked after throughout our stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We do hope to see you again soon!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: This hotel was chosen due to its proximity to the Disneyland. The "proximity" appeared to be 0.7 miles which took us 15 minutes of walking to the Monorail entrance (we had our tickets purchased in advance on the internet) or 20 minutes to the main entrance. The pool is nice and it's open till 22:00. The buffet breakfast is just OK. The internet is terribly unstable and slow - unless you go to the lobby. The pool is nice mainly due to its availability till late hour (22:00). All the rest is just ok.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing our hotel. We are in the process of upgrading our Internet service to fiber optics very soon. Our location is very convenient to both Downtown Disney and both theme parks and we do hope you choose us again!  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: The best part bout this hotel was the convenience to the Disneyland, California Adventure, and Downtown Disney.  Parking was $10 per night and breakfast was extra as well.  Spent 2 nights here and the customer service was not up to my standards.  I thought I had all of my reservations pre paid but they said this was not and the staff was very unhelpful in determining whether I had already paid for the stay or not.  As it turns out, I had not but The front desk staff could have helped me more than saying you are own your own to check other reservations.  Rooms were okay and the pool was nice.  Only plus was the convenience to the parks.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your review. I do apologize for any mix up with your reservation. We do hope you will choose our hotel the next time you are in the area.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Just returned from staying here visiting Disneyland for our sons birthday. After a mis understanding in communication prior to our visit to arrange for our room to be decorated with Birthday balloons and for my son the have a birthday cake.... The manager and duty Richard went out of his way to ensure our room was filled with balloons and my son had a birthday cake - his favourite; chocolate.  Thanks for everything!  Hotel is good value and close to Disneyland. Food pretty good too!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are happy we were able to make your stay with us enjoyable. We hope to see you again soon!  Regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: This place was ok,  First off the staff from the front desk to the hardest workers (housekeeping/maintenance) were very friendly.  We were always greeted with a smile.  The room was very clean and the refridge/microwave made things easy.  The kids loved the splash pad and the pool.  The pool seemed kinda murky to me but could of just been from sunscreen.  Now the negative.  My husband got stuck in the elevator in building 4, he got in pressed the floor and it rose about 5 feet and stopped.  He tried the other buttons to no avail.  He used the phone and contacted maintenance who did respond quickly and eventually he was freed from the elevator.  Our family chose to use the stairs the remainder of the trip because the elevator seemed to not work right, which for a 3 and 4 year
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We do apologize for the malfunction of the elevator. Our elevators are up to date with the state inspections but the state is notoriously behind by several months in sending out current certificates.  We thank you for your business and do hope you will consider us again in the future.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Not a bad and close to Disneyland
Summary: We had a suite room on the top floor which was very spacious with 4 adults and an infant. We had a double room (two queen beds) which was a bit odd - would have preferred separate rooms but this is what we booked so not the hotels fault.  The suite has basic facilities - small coffee maker, microwave and a fridge.  The hotel was neat and clean and the pool was kept clean also.  The restaurant offered basic meals - nothing flash to write home about but what you would expect.  It's a short walk (about 10-15min) up to Disneyland Downtown - which you can access the Disneyland parks from also. The Disneyland monorail is there also.  Optionally for $5 a day you can purchase an ART bus ticket from the hotel. The bus stops out front every 20min. The ARR buses also provide access to
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us. We are glad you had a good time. We do hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: To increase the star ratings, these improvements are needed- at minimum:  - Upgrade key card system for room entry ; card reader consistently failed. Front desk explained it away as a battery issue .  *****When a hotel is a large and long property, the last thing a guest desires , when burdened down with luggage at night, is to lug everything back to the front desk to have keycards re-made that hopefully work.  - It's 2015; there are more efficient means of identifying a guest's vehicle than to give him a slip of paper and make him walk the 200 yards back to his car to place on dashboard - seriously ? Write down the guest's vehicle make/model/color/plate# - whatever, and put it in a ...what is it?  Oh a computer!
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your feedback. We do apologize for the shortcomings and I assure you they are being addressed. We do hope you would consider staying with us again.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: NOT close to Disneyland and dated rooms
Summary: I booked thinking this was closer to Disneyland than it was. It was a very long walk for my nine year old, especially after a day at the parks. I saw one review saying it's 10 minutes...it isn't, more like 25 minutes. You have to walk through Downtown Disney. The price isn't really good for what you get...we stayed in a Tinkerbelle suite. The beds were comfortable and the extra room good for our family, but one of the comforters was dirty, a used towel was left behind a door (from previous guest) and the room needed updating. For example, some of the wall decals were coming off and you could see on the wall where the old headboards were. It was nice to see the fireworks from the hotel and the restaurant staff was VERY helpful and nice.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your comments. I assure you we are approximately a 15 minute walk to the park entrance in Downtown Disney next to the monorail stop. We do hope to see you again.  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Comfortable stay at a reasonable price
Summary: - Location is good for Disneyland, there are shuttle to disney - drive to Disneyland was about 10 minutes - just to get to the parking lot - Comfortable bed - spacious room and bathroom - I don't remember paying for resort fee, but the price was quite low when I booked this with an airline package - I would stay here again - if my main purpose of the trip is Disneyland

The property as such is 3.5* but the service, cleanliness and overall presentation must be acknowledged. Amazing check-in service by Krystal! We got an upgrade, room was swapped to one that was ready for us. Room doesn't have much of a view, but easily overlooked for large suite and fabulous bed. Thanks team...will definitely recommend.

Rooms are big and very clean. The restaurant has a great buffet selection for breakfast. Ten minute walk to Disney and California Adventure. They also have a shuttle going out every 15 minutes for an extra charge, but the wall is really nice!  To be honest we would go to the hotel just to sleep. Beds are very comfortable. Dinner selection was a little limited but there are tons of restaurants by downtown Disney so grab dinner before going back to the hotel. Good family hotel for a Disney vacation.

Summary Heading: Amazing hotel staff and easy walk to Disneyland
Summary: As a frequent business traveler it is always refreshing when the hotel staff are "happy to see you" especially when doing business or vacationing at the "Happiest place on Earth" aka Disneyland. The front desk gals, Mayra, Gloria and hotel manager, Robert went out of their way to grant my requests for my room preferences including a complimentary upgrade and a special on parking and breakfast and complimentary beverage coupons for my husband and me. Breakfast, by the way, was OUTSTANDING! Made-to-order omelettes with fresh ingredients like mushrooms and avocados--or you could choose the buffet option which was quite exceptional as well. The restaurant staff were just as terrific as the front desk staff--by the third day, our server, Alex, knew my omelette preference and had it

I stayed at this hotel for a few days. It was the worst few days ever. On arrival the staff didn't even help us with our luggage. They just stood there. The wifi didn't work. It was hard to get any sleep since our room was close to the Disneyland theme park.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We do apologize for your subpar experience and we assure you we are doing our best every day to constantly improve our service level.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Don't waste your money and time
Summary: I had booked 3 rooms for my family and I for a span of three nights. Having kids between the ages of 3 and 7, I was happy to read (which is also part of their hotel title) that it's 1 block away from Disneyland and right in front of it's entrance. I can tell you now that is a complete farce and hoax. It's good 25 minutes walk if you are a brisk walker and atleast 45 minutes or more with kids.  As for the rooms, pathetic at it's best. Starting from the carpets that haven't been shampooed for years, that the moment you walk on them bare feet, they are sure to get dirty worse than walking bare feet on the streets. No security safe so make sure you have a lock on your bags. The ACs are from the 80's individual ones that are so loud that you have to force yourself to accept and sleep
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know what happened on your last stay with us. We apologize for the WiFi issues and we assure you we will be bringing in Fiber Optics very soon to our hotel. As far as the distance to the park entrance we are an easy 15 minute walk to the Monorail stop in Downtown Disney and the park entrance there.  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Great base camp for the Disneyland
Summary: If you're coming to Disneyland this is both convenient and cheap - I'd be willing to say far more convenient and significantly more affordable compared to a stay at a Disney resort. You're about a 10-15 minute walk to Disneyland along the street and no major intersections. Timed it at 9 minutes from hotel to the tram with a brisk walk carrying a 4 year old on my shoulders.  There is a convenience store in the hotel that has just about everything you'll need and it's not overpriced - bottles of water for $1. There is also a laundry room on the 3rd floor that was super helpful after our long trip. It's $2 to wash and dry and $1 for the detergent. There is a change machine that will break $1 or $5 into quarters that you'll need to operate it.  Our room had a refrigerator as well as
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your review. We are glad you enjoyed our location and amenities. We do hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: For a one night stay, we did not spend the money required for a stay at one of the Disney hotel/resorts, and this was a good alternative. It was cheaper (although still not cheap), and still close to the parks. We were able to walk to the tram in 10-15 minutes. The room itself was fairly good. It was not quite as nice as some of the other places we stayed recently (the A/C was not connected to a wall thermostat, so you still had to select high/med/low on the unit itself), and the light in the bathroom was a little funky. But otherwise it was nice. They also have a really fun splash pad that the kids enjoyed, as well as a separate pool/spa. They do not offer a free breakfast. There is a restaurant, but we did not eat there. My in-laws did manage to find a place outside (possibly

Summary Heading: LONG Walk to Mickey's House, BUTT Great find in Anaheim
Summary: Living locally we have the pleasure of trying out different Anaheim hotels. To give some credence to this review I will list a few, Disneyland Hotel, Grand Californian, Howard Johnson, Candy Cane Inn and two different Best Westerns. Soooo we found a great price for a one nighter at this particular Holiday Inn. First, I am going to tell you that the walk to Disney main gates is decently far, however you do have options, you could walk to the tram or stop at the Monorail system if you are going to Disneyland. It took us about 30 plus minutes to get from DCA to the hotel around 9pm. But the walk is totally safe could be harsh after a looooong day at the parks. During our one night, two day stay we walked it 6 times total. So please do not think you are going to simply walk one

This hotel was nice enough; needs somewhat of a facelift, as the wallpaper in bathroom was peeling, etc.  Price was a bit high in my opinion.  The hallway smelled like bug spray to me.  I never saw any bugs but the smell bothered me.  It is walking distance from Downtown Disney... about 15 minutes to walk to Downtown Disney and then another 10 minutes or so to get to entrance of Disneyland.  They do not offer a shuttle to Disney.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We are always working diligently to keep up with wear and tear issues and thank for letting us know about your room. There is a city operated shuttle to the park and surrounding areas that stops right at our front door every 20 minutes or so. There is a fee but it is very reasonable and tickets are available at the front desk.  Thank you!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Within walking distance of Disneyland, but with all the walking you do IN Disney, I recommend getting the Anaheim Resort Transit pass for the length of time you will be there. Room was spacious and would work for a family of four.  I was alone, as daughter and family were in the park.  Toilet and tub/shower separated by door from dressing area. Staff pleasant. There is a splash pad kids would love. My  only complaint was that I hung my towels as requested to help conserve water. The maid changed them anyway. What was up with that, Holiday Inn?
