Our original hotel oversold and moved us to the Holiday Inn. The staff was very helpful and wanted to make our stay excellent. They really felt bad for us and went out their way to everything as stress free as possible.

Front desk staff was pleasant both checking in and out. I chose this hotel because I thought we were going to Disneyland but we went to LEGOLAND instead. Rooms were average and comes with a refrigerator and microwave oven. Plenty of parking spots and was able to parked near my building. There were swimming pool and children water park in hotel, not too fancy but at least they have them.

Summary Heading: Adequate but not what we expected
Summary: This was not as expected - scruffy motel style room with plastic cups and plates. Expensive as is all Anaheim. Very convenient for Disney but still had to drive due to road layouts - could see hotel from car park!! Very basic accommodation - would stay outside Anaheim next visit and travel in as this is third hotel in this area and all not very good!!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us. We believe with our location and amenities, such as a Splash Zone for kids and refrigerators and microwaves in every room, make our hotel the best choice when visiting the Magic Kingdom.  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: I had a great stay here, easy access to the convention center and walking distance to Disneyland. Friendly staff, good restaurant, the jacuzzi was a life saver after walking all day. Beware of Disney's fireworks display every night, it's right next to the hotel üòâ

Stayed here for 4 nights. I was a nice and clean hotel. The walk to the Disney Tram was about 8 min. Super easy walk. Showed up an hour early from check in and they were able to check me in early. There is plenty of parking. Even at late at night I was able to park 2 spots from the door. Check out the gift shop. It's cheaper then buying souvenirs at Disney. Would stay here again.

Should not be rated this high!  Not worth the price!  Not clean , smelly, service was very poor. The  reserved room was not what we got.  We had to sleep family on multiple cots because they did not have another room with what we had reserved available.
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about your stay with us. According to our records we checked you in to the exact room type you reserved. If there was confusion at the time of booking please accept our apologies and please feel free to call me directly at 714-535-0300 to discuss this matter in more detail.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: We stayed here during our trip to Disneyland it was just a few minutes away, room was clean, staff was friendly and food taste good. Bus to and from disneyland comes around every 15minutes, they also sell souvenir items in the shop.

This hotel is great. Very close to Disneyland, a 10-15min pleasant walk max. Plenty of parking space, nice and friendly staff. If traveling with a family then book a suite. Brilliant room, plenty of space and excellent for a relaxed holiday.

Summary Heading: Decent lodgings for a family trip to the Magical Kingdom
Summary: Typical older Holiday Inn. Different layout and we had to go through a keyed gate, keyed door to the hallway and then our keyed room door. A little inconvenient, but perhaps good for security. The 2-Queen bed room we had was tiny. Very little room to maneuver from the end of the bed to the TV cabinet.  It has a mini-fridge, ironing board, iron, blow dryer which are all nice ammenities. The beds were decent. The thermostat seemed to have a cut-off range of about 10 degrees, so it was either warm or cold most of the night... Bathroom is an intelligent layout with the shower and toilet in one room and the sink basin and mirror in another meaning two people can be getting ready at the same time. The hotel is .94 miles from the center square of the two Disney Parks meaning its a 20
Manager Response: Dear Matt H,  Thank you so much for your review of our hotel.  We work hard to make your your stay comfortable and pleasant so we are pleased to note that you were satisfied with the room amenities, quality of bed, nice bathroom layout and good location of the hotel.  It is regrettable that you were let down by the room size and key operated gate and rooms.  Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience these issues may have caused you.  Your comments have been forwarded to the hotel management and we are confident they will take necessary actions to improve our guest satisfaction.  We know you have many choices when it comes to lodging and we hope you will continue to choose IHG for your travel needs.  Sincerely,   Lera P Case Manager  IHGCare

Summary Heading: Second time just as great as the first
Summary: This was the second time we stayed at this hotel and I have to say it was great. My son loves the splash pad. It is so close to Disneyland and the staff was super. Everyone was so friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and as comfortable as a hotel bed can be. We ate at the restaurant inside the hotel and it is nicely decorated with kids in mind. I love the seating arrangements with the TV's. The food leaves a little something to be desired but overall it was good. Cant wait to stay again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments. We appreciate your business and hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: I've stayed at this property several times for business, but this last stay was a family vacation. Positives, Service was good from everyone I encountered, breakfast was good and delivered quickly, the room looks recently renovated, comfortable enough, microwave and fridge, and the property is well taken care of. Also, they had a pool and a splash pad that the kids were super excited about. I was not not excited about the pillows, paying for parking ($10 a day), and the wall/window unit AC. When I stay here alone, those last things annoy me much more did they did this last time, but the family had such a good trip and time staying here, they were pretty minor.

Stayed here with a friend for just under a week back in April. We booked it through Westjet Vacations, and our room reservation was correct when we checked in. Sometimes you never know when you book it through a third party company. The staff were very friendly and advised us on the best way to get to the Disney parks. The room was very clean and comfortable. The pool area was great too! The only negative things I have to say is that the hotel is about a 25 minute walk to the Parks, there were no safety deposit boxes available all the time I was there, and the bathroom (separate toilet and tub/shower bit) was a bit cramped. Overall, very good hotel, but it's a bit off the beaten track!

I picked this place due to the location but I think its slightly misleading.  its more than a block walk to the gate of Disneyland.  With a very tired 7 year old it was a pretty painful walk on the way back from the park. I was told we could have taken the shuttle but I didnt know where it picked up from and the whole point was to not spend money on transportation.  The staff was friendly upon check in. The room wasnt the greatest.  The room was very warm when we arrived but soon cooled down after turning the air up. The bathroom door wouldn't shut very well and the bathroom was very small. The beds were okay and the place was clean. We checked out the splash pool which my kids said was neat but they were too big for it so we ended up in the pool which was nice. Check out was
Manager Response: Thank you very much for letting us know about your stay with us. We are disappointed our opportunity to thank you for your business at check out was squandered. I assure you I have shared this comment with our staff and that will make improvements. We do appreciate you choosing our hotel and we hope to see you again.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: In my opinion, this hotel is average. Booked this hotel less than a week before we took a trip out to Disneyland for visiting family memebers. Hotel is right behind one of the Disney parking lots so it's a pretty close walk but it will take some time. It is about 3 full blocks before you get to Downtown Disney. If you have tickets to the park in hand, you can take the tram to shorten your walk/exercise. If not, you will have to walk through Downtown Disney to get to main gates.  Pros: Very friendly staff Shuttles are available 3 blocks from Downtown Disney Early parking allowed if space is available which same parking $ from Disney. Mini water park for kids to play in the middle of their buildings  Cons: Bathrooms are a bit dated 1st floor rooms only have a light curtain for

We stayed here for 2 nights.on arrival the check in staff were excellent. Room was large and clean, TV , fridge , wifi and good parking. We used the pool area and it was good. Toiletries were not replaced but on asking they were sent up to our room. We would stay here again.

I recently stayed at this hotel with my family (2 adults, 2 kids) on a recent holiday to the USA.  The room was clean and tidy as you would expect to receive from the Holiday Inn brand.  The hotel is about a 15 minute walk to Dowtown Disney and another 10 minutes walk to the Disneyland / California Adventure World entrances.  I understand they offer a shuttle service but we were prepared to walk.  Breakfast was buffet style and satisfactory.  We had one dinner at the hotel which was OK.  There are no restaurants in close walking proximity to the hotel but there is a gas station next door that sells snacks and drinks.  Downtown Disney has plenty of restaurtns to choose from.  We did not use the pool but it looked good.  Staff were friendly and helped me purchase tickets and

Summary Heading: Good customer service, large sparse room
Summary: We stayed in a family suite, which was very large, but the setup left it rather sparse. The kitchenette was more like a bar. Besides the microwave, there was nothing to cook with - no toaster or stove. There was also only a small bar fridge. This was a bummer after we went grocery shopping before seeing the room. That said, it was great having lots of floor space, which is a rarity for hotels. Our kids enjoyed the pool - as did we, except for the other kids we ended up looking after who were left unattended by parents. The people who worked there were always helpful and friendly to us.

Summary Heading: a good find in Disneyland area
Summary: The hotel is extremely close to Disneyland (downtown). The Disney parking is only separated by a wall so you can see the cars circling in the parking structure from your room if you are on that side.  It's a very busy hotel especially in weekends and holidays. The hotel staff are doing their best to keep things move fast. Awesome people.  Parking fee is very reasonable. Breakfast selection is limited but the restaurant itself is very family friendly, featuring in-booth TV and Disney decoration.  On the downside, the bathroom is quite small and old. AC unit can be noisy.

Summary Heading: Great property walking distance from Mickeyland
Summary: This hotel only needs a shuttle and it would be an excellent choice. We liked the service, the room and the restaurant/bar (really good) but we were dumbfounded to find out they don't have a shuttle to Disneyland. The distance is not long enough to drive (you'd have to park at Disney's lot and take their shuttle) nor short enough to be a good start of the day. We ended up walking there in the morning and taking an $8 cab ride back to the hotel at night. Don't get the logic of not having a shuttle.

The customer service at this hotel was awesome!  I've worked at many hotels over the years (Marriott & Embassy Suites) and I was very impressed with every employee I came across.  The rooms were clean, the decor was updated, and the breakfast buffet was great.  I liked that there was free wifi in my room, a gift shop with snacks, restaurant  in the lobby (kids eat free), an outdoor pool, an outdoor kiddie water park, laundry room and disney movies playing in the lobby.  The only thing I didn't like was that they charged to use the business center.  I was happy to see they had a computer for printing boarding passes that was free though (didn't help me much with my work).   The hotel is on the back side of disney, so you can pay $5 per person per day for unlimited shuttle service

Summary Heading: Nice Stop on Trip to Disney
Summary: We stayed here because of the location and good discount on the room. The hotel is basically a ten-minute walk from Downtown Disney. This is a steal given the Disneyland Hotel right adjacent was going for $600/night and we paid $119.   Things are new and very clean. I didn't care for Housekeeping who knocked on my door at 8:30 AM. I also thought it is outrageous that a 500 ml bottle of water is over $3 but I guess it is a tourist area. They also charge $5-$10 to use their shuttle to go to the Park and they charge for parking. I didn't use either so I have no issue with that but I do recommend the walk even if it is hot.

This was a "studio" room, which included a furnished kitchen, computer desk with free wi-fi, breakfast nook, love seat and chair for TV viewing, a nice king size bed, with a separate bathroom and dressing area.  Also included was a very tasty buffet breakfast which would please a vegan or a carnivore.  This would be a great choice for families visiting the  theme parks in the area.

We originally planned to stay with friends, however they informed us three days before our trip their parents might be staying with them too and there won't be any room.  So we had to find somewhere else to stay at the last minute.  Fortunately, the rates for Holiday Inn Hotel and Suites Anaheim was decently priced and only a 20 minute walk from Downtown Disney.  The room was alright and the housekeeping staff did an excellent job cleaning our room, though we only asked for service a couple of times.  Only thing was there wasn't a mini-fridge or a microwave.  We mostly spent our time out of the hotel at the parks, since it was the opening weekend of the 60th Anniversary Diamond Celebration.  We didn't use much of the amenities, but there was a really cute splash zone that we
Manager Response: Hi there! Thanks for your review. We are glad you had a good time. I'm not sure when you stayed with us but we have had microwaves and refrigerators in all of rooms as of about 3 weeks ago. Please come back the next time you are here to check it out. It's a great convenience to our traveling families when they come to visit the Magic Kingdom.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: We stayed here in February.  Nice hotel, friendly staff. The rooms are fine although the bathrooms could use some updating.  We chose this hotel for the great price and it was dog friendly.  The walk to Downtown Disney was very easy!

My 2 boys and I stayed here recently and I was won over by the front desk personnel.  I originally booked my room on Priceline and thought I had double occupancy.  When I originally tried to check in, I was told by a snotty front desk clerk that I would be given the worst room available since I booked with Priceline, which was only a single double bed.  Needless to say, someone was going to have to sleep on the floor.  Later that night when I actully checked in, I spoke with a very competent young man named Luis.  He made sure my room for this first night included a roll away bed so no one had to sleep on the floor.  He then worked on getting me a better room for the rest of my stay.  He was very diligent about getting my family what they needed.  He worked with his manager Roy

Summary Heading: great place to stay for Disneyland
Summary: We loved this hotel and are planning a return trip to this hotel when we return to Disneyland next year. Clean room 1 block from Disneyland short walk safe area.  The check in was easy had no complaints and the room was large enough for 2 people.

Carpet was filthy, I always wear my white socks on hotel floors b/c I know this is usually the case, however they were blackened after five minutes of walking around yuk! The bathroom floor also had hair and dirt in corners (someone else's). I was there on business with no kids so I didn't care to move but these conditions were less than pleasant and were like that the entire week. The poolside bar of very nice, however the wait for food was bad (thirty minutes) and incorrect order received so forget food. There's NO complementary breakfast (even coffee and a cookie) and NO lunch offered. For early business travelers this STINKS. The maid are way to noisy also for hours! Kids from Disneyland and business travelers on break need a nap!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We do apologize for the housekeeping issues and we are doing our best to ensure these issues do not arise again. We are open for lunch until 1pm daily. We do hope you would consider giving us another try the next time you visit Anaheim.  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Hard to stay closer to Disneyland for the price
Summary: I booked this hotel based on it's price and proximity to Disneyland. It turned out to be a good choice, especially since all I wanted was a place to arrive at late, sleep, and check out before getting to Disneyland at opening. Here's why this is a good hotel for that:  - Breakfast served early, starting at 6:30AM (maybe even 6) - 10 to 15 minute walk to Downtown Disney - friendly and helpful staff  Breakfast is good, and not too pricy. Plus kids eat free if they order off the menu instead of getting the breakfast buffet.  The hotel will also let you park your car in their lot all day for a fee. If you need to take a shuttle, it's  cheaper and will probably be faster to park in the Disney lots and take their shuttles.  (As for the shuttle, we waited 20 minutes for it, and then it
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your review. We are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay with us and we hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: When visiting Disneyland we always stay in this Hotel.  I had been storing medication on the air conditioner to maintain the temperature.  Housekeeping saw this and next thing you know we come in at night and there's a refrigerator in the room...  This was a wonderful and very thoughtful action on part of a wonderful hotel.
Manager Response: Hi there! Thanks for your review! We do now have 3.5cf refrigerators and microwaves in all of our rooms. We do hope to see you again in the future!  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Just mom & 3 teen daughters, celebrating bday at Disneyland for 1 day/night.   First time staying on this side of the park near downtown Disney parking lots, out of 6 visits..I liked this location being across from residential &  not surrounded by other hotels. Also, you cut through the Disney parking lot & can access the monorail by Rain Forest caf√© which saves walking time.   We arrived way before check-in time & the great staff let us park our car & started our quick check in process, so when we came back, we could just pick up our keys & go straight to our room. That was so nice coming back tired from the park.   The package, $118/nt +tax, I booked included a large pizza from the restaurant. We opted to take it when we checked out & it was great! A huge pizza, 2 to-go boxes

From check in to check out your staff was very helpful and courteous to our whole family. The room was clean but dated. Great location to Disneyland we choose to use bus service got all day pass for only $5. A person was a great choice after a long day of walking and them driving. Would visit this location again for future vacations.

Great location and very friendly and helpful staff. Restaurant is good value and has TV for kids and has a bar   Room was good with fridge and microwave. There is a little shop for most needs 10 minutes walk to disney down town. great for kids with pools and water play area for the kids.  Its a little older but very comfortable. And many thanks to the staff for going to great lengths in finding my lost reading glasses

Beds were clean,but the room had a musty-mold like smell. I think it was from the AC unit. Revovated buildings,some nice parts but also some shoddy work,like with the wallpaper. Avoid the restaurant! We got the breakfast package and regretted it. The restaurant staff was not friendly and the restaurant was filthy. They served us coffee in a mug that had someone else's  lipstick on it. The booth was dirty and stained, the table smelled like someone cleaned it with a moldy rag. Dennys is down the street I recommend eating breakfast there. The only reason we stayed was because we prepaid, and so the room was not refundable. We got in a day early and stayed at the HI on Manchester the night before. By far the one on Manchester was the better HI in the area, stay there instead.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your review. We apologize for our performance in the restaurant and we assure you this is being addressed and fixed.  We do hope to see you again in the future.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: What a great location...so close to Downtown Disney.  I walked from the Holiday Inn on Walnut Street to Downtown Disney in 12 minutes ...I am 80 so younger folks will make it in 10 minutes.  There are lots of restaurants there and a really nice movie theatre.  The hotel is great for all ages with a nice pool and a Water Park for the kids.  Rooms are good size and the beds are so comfortable.  Staff was very helpful.

We just returned from a stay at this hotel. I couldn't afford to stay at one of the three Disneyland resorts on this trip but the holiday Inn and Suites didn't disappoint. for what we paid we were more than happy. The restaurant food is OK but kids eat free (if an adult orders a main course) so that is a huge bonus. NOTE: Kids don't eat free if you order room service from the restaurant. The pool is heated and was a really nice temperature and my three year old loved the splash park. There's a Disneyland gift shop in the hotel for souvenirs and snacks and a gas station on the corner for extra snacks and drinks. Our room didn't have a microwave or a fridge which was a drag but on the last day they were delivering little bar fridges to the rooms so if you're travelling after today

The hotel was comfortable. Reception was polite and allowed for an early check in on request as my wife was down with flu. Rooms were comfortable but the wifi was on the slower side. Breakfast spread was concise but covered all we needed. The bet was the location of the hotel - a cool 10-15 min walk to Downtown Disneyland and enter the parks through the Downtown area. The ART drop offs were more of a bother and was not worth the money or wait. Overall a tidy experience.

Have no complaints at all.  Stayed there last weekend with my adult daughter for our trip to Disneyland.    Very close to downtown Disney (10-15 minutes) and the parks (20-25).  I have a bad knee so we "splurged" for the Anaheim transit bus--$5 per day for unlimited access.  It picks up at hotel & takes you to Disney entrance (it runs for 20 minutes past park closing time) Since we are priority club members we were offered an available suite.   We were in the Princess Suite----any one with little girls will be in heaven.  Just beautiful--spacious, clean, comfortable...Princess everything :) Staff was very helpful, especially Krystal--she was wonderful !  Thanks again !

We have been in touch with IHG CARE and they have been quite gracious. This local Hotel however had not responded to calls, or emails regarding items we had left behind. Understood this happens all the time-- we are fully aware.  We called within hours. The issue is not the items but lack of response by the hotel management even after IHG CARE  contacted them. It's a locally owned hotel apparently they don't care they get so much #Disney business.   The Hotel is clean enough,  the beds are comfortable enough, not all rooms but we  been in rooms with very odd layout and if a person gets up to use the bathroom at night you get blinded by the light. Just a heads up on that.   The front desk employees were pleasant enough and very helpful when checking in etc.    Our main issue
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. I understand Jennifer from our management team has been in contact with you and the situation was resolved. We do hope you would consider staying with us again in the future.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: A friend and I visited this hotel in mid May with the purpose of visiting Disneyland.  The front desk staff during all times of day were helpful and friendly. They all were able to clearly explain to us any questions we had regarding both the hotel and the Disneyland parks.  The room we had was clean. The decor was a tad on the older side but nothing to complain about really. The room was a good size for the two of us (both adults with 2 pieces of luggage and backpacks each).  The location to Disneyland in our opinions was key! Downtown Disney was a 10-15 minute walk (which was nice because we could drink and go out and not have to worry about a cab or ride back). For families, yes, this walk may be a bit long especially after a long day at the park, but for us it was great!  We

Summary Heading: Great Location, Pool and Water Park
Summary: Close to Disneyland.  The pool is nice and there is a water park for the younger kids. Staff was very courteous and helpful. Pricing was competitive to the area.  Would definitely stay again. Very quiet, good nights sleep.

Location , location, location. If you are going to Disneyland this is the place to stay. Hotel comfortable enough - friendly atmosphere. No in-room safe but safety deposit boxes available. Easy to arrange coach to Universal.

Summary Heading: Close to Downtown Disney but a bit past its prime.
Summary: The hotel is older.  My bathroom door wouldn't close, the hallways are narrow with low ceilings. The room was clean and the beds were very comfortable.  It just seems like its past its prime and I am not sure they could do anything to upgrade it.  If you are on a budget and this hits your target it might be a good deal; but, if you are looking for a nice resort style hotel; this is not the place.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay with us. We are glad you found our rooms clean and comfortable. We are sorry about the bathroom door. We do our best to maintain our property and we will get this fixed. We do hope to see you again sometime in the future.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: If you're looking for something affordable and within walking distance to the Disney Parks, this is it. it's about a 10 minute walk to Downtown Disney, and both parks are accessible through there. If you want to get a late bite to eat like we did, it's really nice to be able to walk into downtown disney, especially with some places being open until 2am.  Our room was very clean, maybe a little dated, but we were very happy with it. The free wifi was a real bonus (we were confused about whether or not the wifi was in fact complimentary, the website didn't really make this clear, but we were pleasantly surprised).   One thing to note; if you're like us and planned on packing meals to take into the parks so you can avoid buying all your meals there, it's a little tough with this

I have mixed feelings about this hotel but would stay here again. The best feature of this hotel is its location. Great distance to Downtown Disney and the parks, about a 20 min walk. We came down for the Tinkerbell 1/2 Marathon, which the start line was right down the street from here. Cab ride will only cost you about $10 to the park entrance, and $8 if you take it from Downtown Disney (Be weary of shady cab drivers preying on tourist, know the way to the hotel, this is a less than 2 min ride to the hotel. One guy tried taking us all the way around the parks to run up the meter). The downside, the rooms and bed are TINY. We had 4 adults in the room and felt like we were on top of each other, and the bathroom was near claustrophobic. Housekeeping comes very late in the day, one
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your stay. We are sorry you found your room to be small. We do have 300 square feet in our standard rooms and these are some the largest rooms in the area. We are glad you found our staff friendly and we do hope you would consider staying with us the next time you are in the area.  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: This hotel is very clean and had great accommodations. The price is very affordable while not sacrificing on quality. It is about 1.5 blocks walking to Downtown Disney which leads you into the parks. Highly recommend this hotel if you're looking for an affordable but close hotel!

this was a great hotel is very close to Downtown Disney and Disneyland. The staff was extremely friendly and very helpful in all matters the restaurant serves great food the pool area was fun for family members. loved the news theme rooms it was fun and exciting to watch the children be excited over the room beds are very comfortable.

I booked a room via Priceline. It was one of those Express Deal booking that one doesn't know which hotel they're getting until it's booked. I was hoping it was going to be a Hilton or a Marriott but got Holiday Inn. When I checked in, Ricky, the front desk staff was very helpful along with the other front desk staff.  I asked to have my room changed and they did it quite quickly. The customer care service was exceptional and outstanding. I'll stay there again if I'm in the area.   Andrew K.

Summary Heading: See the back side of fireworks!
Summary: Being a Platinum Elite member with IHG the corporate entity for Holiday Inn Group.  When ever I stay at one of their hotels I usually get upgraded to a junior Suite. This stay I got upgraded to a full suite on the top floor way cool!  I stay here often for work and when i do the family comes down we live an hour or so away from here depending on the traffic...ha ha traffic in LA? they camp out in my room and go to Disneyland while I'm out visiting dealers during the day, then we all go out and eat and go back to the park for the  the evening festivities (we have season passes)  The staff here is so nice and very helpful. the same people own this property as the Oceanside one i like to stay at too.  The Onyx restaurant inside the hotel has a quaint little bar too, the bartenders

Summary Heading: Within a 15 minute walk to Downtown Disney
Summary: My family of 4 (children aged 6 & 7) just returned from this hotel and it was a good value, considering its proximity to Disneyland. We arrived before 1pm on our scheduled arrival date and they had us in our room within 5 minutes; service was prompt and friendly. Our room was older, but still clean and well-kept. The air conditioner runs loudly, but it does offer a good white noise to drown out any other sounds of the hotel; we heard none! The wi-fi is practically non-existent; we were given the password, but couldn't connect at all. The weather wasn't warm enough to make use of the pool, but it looked decent. We ate at the restaurant for one breakfast and the food was average, but with the kids eating free, the price couldn't be beat. After one day at Disneyland, I learned to

I booked a room with a choice of beds and choose 2 queens, we got to the hotel and was told that they only had a double  bed. The problem is there is myself,  my wife and my son. One bed seems a bit small when I paid for a room with two beds.  The lady at the front desk was rude and told us maybe they had a roll away but no garentee. Don't stay here.  We had a good day at Disneyland or this would have completely ruined or vacation.
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know what happened. Could please contact me at 714-535-0300 so I can research your reservation? If we've made a mistake, I would like the opportunity to make this right. We do have several options when booking a room including one that does not guarantee room type at the time of booking but if you booked a specific type of room and didn't get it I will make it right.  Thank you in advance for this opportunity.  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Good value, pleasant, only one negative.
Summary: I stayed here with my young daughter for 2 nights to break up a long journey and to go to Disneyland. Pleasant hotel, efficient checkin and checkout. No fuss. Daughter loved the swimming pool and spa. Happy that kids meals were free in the restaurant. Room was simple but large (two queens). The walk to Disneyland was fine 15-20 minutes but that might be different when it's hot. Staff were friendly. The only negative was the Internet. Painfully slow to the point where we have up trying to look at the Disneyland photos online or downloading a map. There is only one possible reason for slow internet these days and that is the hotel is not prepared to shell out for a bigger pipe. Hard to believe in this day and age. Seems more like the 2000's...!
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your feedback. We do apologize for the Internet problem and we are taking the steps to upgrade our service as soon as possible.  We are glad you enjoyed the rest of your stay and we hope you choose our hotel again.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: I thought long and hard about this rating but breakfast was so uncomfortable for us every morning. Our booking had breakfast included but to our disappointment although there was a nice buffet our 3 young kids could only eat from a children's menu which had a very small choice and left them leaving hungry each morning. It was uncomfortable for us as they could see what we could get from the buffet and when we offered some food to them we warned abruptly by the waiter we would be charged in full for it. This led to 3 unhappy kids each day and left is feeling like we were being watched and just not enjoying the stay. It was a pity as the staff and rooms were really nice, the pool and splash zone were great for the kids an the hotels location was superb for Disney!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay with us. As with all Holiday Inns, it is a real value for families that kids eat free when accompanied by a paying adult. Our menu selection on the kids menu includes Mickey Mouse pancakes with bacon or eggs cooked to order with bacon or oatmeal, fruit and yogurt or cereal with banana. And your choice of juice or milk. We apologize this didn't fit your needs. We do hope you choose our hotel again the next time you are in the area. We greatly appreciate your business.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: The Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim is a wonderful place to stay. We met my Wife‚Äôs family for a 3 day visit there and had an excellent time. We loved that the swimming pool is only 3.5 ft deep at the ends and 4.5 ft in the middle. It‚Äôs just right to enjoy with our 5 yr old nephew and 3 yr old niece. And they enjoyed the ‚ÄúSplash Zone‚Äù even more (if that‚Äôs possible). We prepaid for a King-bed Suite which was perfect. In the bedroom portion, we appreciate the huge, comfortable, bed, fresh linen, and clean bathroom with plenty of fresh towels. The spacious other roomy was perfect for the family to visit, with a couch, counter, sink, TV, fridge, and microwave. Our suite was on the 6th floor (Top) of Bldg 3 and the peace and quiet was superb. Each evening we watched the 9:30 pm

Great hotel for the family.  The beds were nice. Walking distance to Disneyland or a $10 cab ride back from Downtown Disney after a long day at Disneyland.  So glad I booked this hotel.   The water park and swimming pool was great for the kids.  I definitely recommend this place.  I am an IHG Platinum member for Holiday Inn and I travel a lot for work and rarely do I find a hotel that I can absolutely rave about.  Will definitely stay here again.

We were pleased with the location being just a fifteen minute walk to Disneyland and the area felt very safe. Ate at the restaurant a few times and particularly  enjoyed the convenience of the buffet breakfast  when we were in a rush. Provided you with take away coffee and good service even when busy. Cheap Pizzas and room serivice was quick too! Quite far from other restaurants as you need to get to downtown Disney so pleased with their reasonable menu and prices. Rooms were serviced fully and staff always friendly and helpful. Liked the pool area especially the cleanliness despite the large numbers using it.  Cheapest hotel for our USA adventure by far and definitely good value for money.

This was a really good choice for an affordable hotel walking distance from Disneyland. The rooms were a little tired, but the property was very nicely maintained.  The staff were excellent and very helpful in planning outings. The restaurant was also surprisingly good given my past experience with hotel dining.  The Restaurant staff were particularly good.  All in all a very good deal and nothing bad to say about it except one instance of spotty housecleaning.  You can watch the fireworks from their roof deck

After staying at overpriced, noisy hotels close to Disneyland hard by the noise and traffic of the main streets, I found this gem which is almost hidden, yet so close. It is behind the Mickey and Friends Parking Structure and driving out of the Park it seems like miles away but is in fact only a 10 minute walk to Downtown Disney. The walk itself is incredibly pleasant, an oasis in the middle of Disney madness. The suites are as good as any in the area and they beat the Disneyland Hotel's by a wide margin and for half the price.

This was our second stay at this Holiday Inn.  The hotel portion was the same pleasant experience with quiet rooms, good beds, good pillows, and friendly hotel staff.  They have a great splash pad for kids, and a nice pool.  We appreciated the easy walk to Disneyland via a quiet neighborhood street as compared to the walks along Harbor Blvd.  And you can ride the Mickey garage shuttle once you reach it, although it probably only saves a few minutes.  However, the breakfast dining declined since last year into a miserable experience.  If I order an omelette with cheese and peppers, I don‚Äôt want more green peppers than eggs - it‚Äôs gross.  And I don‚Äôt want the peppers cut up so large that I need to use a knife myself to cut them into less than whole-bite-size pieces.  If I order

Spent two nights here while visiting Disneyland. The. Rooms are nice, clean and spacious. The restaurant and room service was great and reasonable. They have a pool and a splash park for the kids. We left our car here and took a shuttle to Disney which was reasonable and convenient, it dropped us right at the gate. If we come back we will definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great Service For A Great Trip
Summary: Usually I will go to very quirky hotels or kind of chain hotels. I expected holiday inn to be just another chain hotel, but it was so much more. The service was great as was the location, we walked in and out to Disney almost every day and it was no hassle. The location was so great we could literally go most places in southern California. We even drove up to San Diego one day - it was about a 2 hour drive there and 2 hours back, but in America thats not long. The hotel had a gift shop, which of course had expensive Disney prices but it also had snacks that you could just buy right before you left as well as nescities. They were able to cope with a group of 31 kids in rooms with above average service...

The location is amazing! Right around the corner from Disneyland. My kids love, love, love the mini water park and the heated pool. Daddy loves the cocktails and the jacuzzi. We have now stayed here twice and I think we have found our perfect sleeping solution to compliment our Disneyland annual passes.

Summary Heading: When "magic" reaches a whole new level...
Summary: Our travel agent had booked our room for us as part of a special vacation for my daughter who was born with a disability and our family. We arrived exhausted, hungry, and in a complete daze. The Disney themed lobby was the perfect welcome for us! Front desk was gentle and so efficient gliding us thru check-in. We started to our room to only be greeted by management, and explained that there was a little surprise awaiting us! WE HAD BEEN UPGRADED as a extra special way to honour our daughter. The Mini Mouse suite was SPOTLESS!! And trust me. I look. It was spacious and MORE than comfortable for our group of four. After a few tears of happiness and excitement, we  realized we were STARVING and thankfully they had the PERFECT restaurant to eat!! Two adults meant 2 kids are for

My 16 year old daughter and I stayed here as part of our mother/daughter trip to Disneyland. The room was very nice and clean. We were one room away from the elevator, but it was very quiet. The beds were extremely comfortable. Towels super fluffy. The staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel does not have a complementary breakfast, but it does have the Onyx restaurant and the food was very good and cheaper that what we paid at IHOP on the other side. Kids eat free. (Not sure the ages that applies to.) It was nice to have a quiet start to our day before we hit the crowds. The pool looked super nice and although we didn't utilize it, we saw families enjoying themselves. You may have a refrigerator and/or microwave in your room for a fee. There is a convenience store a few steps

Summary Heading: good, clean rooms and decent sound proofing; close to Disneyland
Summary: We found the room quite clean and comfortable. Multiple types of pillows made available without request. Sound is decently dampened, but the doors can slam if neighbors don't hold back. The walk to Disneyland is decent, but can feel longer than staying on the South side since this walk requires walking passed the tram pickup area for the parking garage (and there is no shortcut from the back of the property which would be really nice). Front desk staff were super friendly each time we interacted. Overall, the price was very nice and we would stay here again.

Stayed for 5 nights. Room had two double beds, barely any room left over to walk around. Housekeeping did a very poor job, shampoo just thrown on counter, didn't vacuum the room, threw toilet paper on the back of the toilet instead of putting it on the EMPTY rolls.  Breakfast was good at the restraint, but a little pricey.   EVERY night you could smell marijuana smoke. All thru the halls. They make you sign a form that charges cigarette smokers a outrageous fee to clean the room, don't understand why people are allowed to smoke pot.  Not the type of environment I would want to take kids to.  No WIFI, they kept blaming it on the provider.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your review. We apologize for the problems with housekeeping and we assure you they are being addressed. Also, we do not allow smoking of any kind in our rooms. Those that are identified as doing so will pay assessed a $250 fee. If we identify any illegal activities in a room we also call the Anaheim PD.  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: My daughter and I spent 6 nights here over Spring Break at Disneyland. We loved the hotel. The room was clean, spacious and quiet. The restaurant was very good and kids ate free. Good food and reasonable. We swam at the pool, but the jacuzzi was being renovated so it was closed. They were jack hammering it our first day at the pool and it was very noisy and dusty. The hotel felt bad and brought out complimentary slush drinks. Otherwise the pool and splash park were very well kept. We found the staff to be exceptionally friendly, from the front desk, restaurant, cleaning and maintenance and the gift shop, we were always treated very well.  The location to Disneyland is very good too. Not a bad walk for a 7 year old in the morning but I would suggest a shuttle ride home after a

From the moment I entered into the lobby Javi behind the counter greeted me and was very very helpful. The next morning, Lupe, in the restaurant was extremely attentive. The room was clean. The air conditioner was a little dated however it worked great! The room was clean and comfortable. There was one thing and that was there was some hair left behind in the tub and sink. Otherwise I would have given it an excellent in cleanliness.

I always assumed that when staying in  a hotel my room would be serviced daily, bed made (changed every third night) vacuumed, toilet sink and bath cleaned and tops dusted but not at Holiday Inn Anaheim (1 BLK/Disneyland), no here, the bed is changed only on request and the room is only cleaned before you arrive.  Yes, possibly I do expect too much but I'm not paying hostel prices and they do call themselves a hotel. I put the sweet little card on the bed on the third day to ask for the bed to be changed, well was it? of course not, had to go the manager and request it and he wasn't too upset that I needed to ask. Breakfast was typically American, quantity but not much quality although the fruit platter was fresh and tasty and they even got me in plain yoghurts on my request.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We service all rooms daily during a guest's stay with us. We also offer an optional linen and towel re-use program here in order help with the water conservation efforts here in California.  We do hope you consider staying with us again.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: For my first time staying in this hotel I was pretty impressed by all that it had to offer. It was just a short walking distance from Disneyland and there is a bus that even takes you all the way there if walking is not an option. The breakfast was good and the rooms were in a well kept environment. Very agreeable and I would very much like to go back.

I just returned back from a convention in Anaheim, and chose this hotel because I thought it would be close, but far away for me not to be in the crowd.  I was pleasantly surprised with this property.  I found it to be very clean with excellent service.  I was upgraded to "The Pirate Suite," which was fine.  A few of the rooms have a theme, and while I did not have kids, it was different.  The room was very spacious, and took care of all my needs.  My room had a kitchenette, and a secondary room where you could sleep.  My experience was very good.  The most exceptional things I found were the service and the food area.  There are really not any eating places close, so I chose to have all my meals at the hotel. The food was excellent, varied, and affordable.   They have a

this is the 2nd time I've stayed here, booked through priceline. The rooms have a mildew and musty smell. The rooms were small, and the bathroom is TINY. Although it's close to the parks, 15 minute walk will not stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are sorry about the shortcomings you found in the room. Most people enjoy the commode/tub room separate from the vanity area. With our location 12-15 minutes from the park entrance at the Monorail stop in Downtown Disney, our location can't be beat.  We do hope you give us another try.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Adequate hotel, we chose to upgrade ($60 a night) to a family suite which was a good choice as the standard rooms are pretty small especially if you have young children that need to nap or go to sleep earlier. Didn't mind the upgrade fee as we bid on our room on P.L.   Beds were comfy and the suite gave us plenty of space.  Be prepared to pay extra for parking and be aware the wifi sucks. I mean sucks like dial up. I was trying to get a bit of work done online and I either couldn't connect, got kicked off the connection or connected slow as molasses. Better wifi in the McDonalds parking lot.  The building we stayed in #3 sixth floor was older and a bit noisy, especially the plumbing. Every shower and toilet flush from above was fairly loud. The elevator was tortuously slow but
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your review. We apologize for the shortcomings in the WiFi and are taking steps to improve that as soon as possible. We are glad you liked the suite. It is a great value for a family. Sorry for the plumbing noise. You were on the top floor of the building and those rooms usually are very quiet. We do hope you come see us again in the future.  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Like a smaller version of the Disney Hotel (GREAT STAFF)
Summary: I had booked this hotel on expedia.com for 2/27-3/1 and boy of boy did they mess up my reservation. Thankfully the front desk staff (Robert the manager) was wonderful and able to get me into my two rooms. Even though the mistake was not theirs they were kind enough to make my stay the best it could be. The rooms were clean and accommodating. there is a restaurant that has some cute Disney decorations and TV's at the booths food was good. I do believe they have some decorated Disney theme rooms as well but for an additional price. There is a fun splash pad for the kids so I cant wait till warmer weather to come back. The location is great and there is a shuttle that will come by every 20 minutes to take you to the Disneyland park if you don't want to walk, just $5 all day long

This was a very nice holiday inn. They have a Disney theme and even some Disney decorated suites. I was given a very nice suite as a upgrade and the room was great. The staff was very nice. I would definitly stay here again

Nice view of the Disney themed scenes throughout hotel which is less than a block away!NO free breakfast so plan to go next door to " el burrito" or you can spend a pretty penny at hotel lounge for breakfast. The rooms are clean, the groundskeepers and maid staff were incredibly helpful and pleasant

Summary Heading: Great Location if you're going to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here during the Star Wars Marathon Weekend January 16-18.  This location is a short walk to the Disneyland resort.  We was my wife, two sons and I in one room.  We enjoyed the restaurant, splash pad and gift shop during our stay.  The rooms are average size, but very nicely decorated.  The beds are comfy and styling is modern.  We had a dinner and a breakfast at the in-house restaurant.  The food and service was great.  We took advantage of the booths that had their own televisions in them.  We will be staying here in the future and would highly recommend as an alternative to an on-property Disney hotel.  The walk is very short to get to Downtown Disney and the parks.

I  stayed I the Prate 2 bedroom suite with my husband and my son and his wife. The room was great, would be perfect for a family. The restaurant was well priced and the room service excellent. It was only a 10 minute walk to the Dusney tram.

My boyfriend and I stayed here last weekend. I thought the hotel room was very clean and quiet.   Its a close walk (about 10 min) to Downtown Disney. I just wish this hotel had a continental breakfast and free parking included. $10 daily parking was cheaper than parking at Disneyland though.

We needed a quick place to stay overnight. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Our room was downstairs -- since I am not able to climb stairs. It was clean, very quiet, and roomy. I appreciated having breakfast there with good food, great coffee, and friendly staff to clean up.

This hotel is nice, clean, & quiet. I loved that we could watch Disney fireworks from the parking lot! Service was outstanding, everyone was very friendly .  Only reason I didn't give it an excellent is the fact that the restaurant was kind of dirty. They were busy, but maybe could have had more help during the morning rush wiping off tables, chairs, booths, & sweeping.

We stayed here for 3 nights. The hotel was decently maintained and could use a few renos.  The restaurant was amazing and so afordable.wewould stay here again. It is üòÑ10 minutes walking to downtown Disney.

I was at Disneyland on business and found this hotel on Priceline for a good deal. It is kept up nicely and very clean. Also found the hotel to be quiet. I had a king room that was decorated nicely with a comfortable bed. It has a restaurant and bar inside that seemed pretty full. Only thing I did not like was the additional parking charge.Lots of restaurants a few blocks away and maybe 2 minutes from Disney.

Our children were flying in and we were driving in for 3 days at Disneyland. We decided to drive in a day early so we would be sure to be there when the  kids arrived.  Since the Holiday Inn was just 1 block off property, we decided that would be perfect.  We checked into a beautiful king suite that was very comfortable, nicely decorated and quiet.  We had added on the breakfast, the buffet looked appetizing but we ordered from the menu, which was fast and delicious .

We were very fortunate to be able to upgrade to a 2 bed 2 bath suite when were arrived for our stay.  Front desk was very helpful and it was well worth the additional cost.  We walked into the Monsters Inc living room.  Decorated with Boo and Sully lamps.  Very Whimsical.  Had a great view of the pool., but no direct access from the room.  To the left when you walked in was a small kitchenette which we did not utilize.  To the right were the doors to the kids Toy Story room with a big Buzz Lightyear nightlight hanging on the wall.  They had a counter with a sink(? 1 or 2 cannot remember) and door to the tub and toilet.    Across the living room is the large king bed Cars room.  My husband would prefer to see a big Go sign on the mural rather than the large Stop sign that is
Manager Response: Thank you very much for taking the time to review our hotel. We are thrilled you liked our two bedroom two bathroom suite. We have  three other two bedroom suites. One with a similar theme of the room you stayed in, one with a pirate theme, and one with a princess theme in one bedroom and a Disney movie theme in the other (one bathroom in this room). These rooms are great for big families to call home while they visit the Magic Kingdom. We also have several one bedroom suites that have Disney inspired theme decorations such as Star Wars, Pirates, Fairies and various characters kids love.  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Good value but that's where it ends.
Summary: I am a frequent business traveller and i will admit I am picky about cleanliness in hotels.  When you spend as much time in hotels as i do these things matter.  If you are looking for a hotel that is close to Disney and offers value for the price, this would be a reasonable choice.  however, if you are looking for a hotel which is clean on top of that, this is not your place.  The hotel is very strangely designed.  The walls are paper thin and in our room I found someone else's elastic hair band and bobby pins on the floor, as well as their hair in the bathroom.  We were staying there for one night only so I didn't complain, but this hotel is not in keeping with Holiday Inn standards.  I would not recommend it nor would I stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We have discussed the housekeeping issues with our staff and they are embarrassed your room was not right when you checked in. We assure you we will not let this happen again and we do hope you'll give us another try.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: I just stayed 1 night and will NEVER return! horrible experience.  let me start by when we checked in, they didnt swipe the room keys properly, so when we tried to get into the back doors and our room we could not get in. in the hallway it smelled like weed, really badly. we had to go back to the front desk and get our keys fixed, and mentioned to them that it smelled like weed. all they did is came up and sprayed air freshener, which made it all worse!!! When we returned from disney in the evening it once again smelled like weed, and we called because this time we could smell it INSIDE our room! not ok! all they did was come up and say we can smell it but we dont know where its coming from! knock on all the doors an investigate! they INCONVENIENCED us by moving us to another
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know what happened during your recent stay with us. We sincerely apologize for what happened. It's a shame when a guest performs illegal acts in one of our rooms that negatively affect good guests like you. It took us over a day to determine the exact room this occurred without bothering other guests with do not disturb signs in the area of that floor. I assure you Anaheim PD got involved.   Again, our apologies.  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Still the best near Disney hotel for a value stay
Summary: Never disappoints me. Great value stay with the real benefit of being so close to the Downtown Disney shops and eateries. Terrific staff always go the extra mile for me and this makes it always a special stay. Older but clean rooms with nice outlooks and away from the massive crowds. Shuttle at the front door to Disney but the walk down Walnut into Disneys back door is still the best. Thanks to the team for another great visit.

Upon walking up to the lobby it is a small lobby compared to other major hotels. Although it is clean and the staff is very nice. The room and the bathroom were clean and no problems with housekeeping every time they cleaned our rooms. The great thing about this is most definetely the location. Minues the traffic you may run into it is so close to disneyland driving!
Manager Response: Thank you staying with us and for taking the time to write a review. We are glad you enjoyed our hotel and our location and we hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: So close to Disneyland you can walk.
Summary: About a 15 min walk to downtown Disney if you want to save the $17 parking. Hotel has a cool bar and great food. Bar even has a happy hour and prices not like a normal hotel bar.   A good choice for a quick trip to Disneyland.

First time visiting the states and chose this hotel after research purely for convenience regarding Disneyland. Average hotel but fantastic price, decent room and friendly reception staff. The location and transport to Disneyland was fantastic and easily accessible. The Disneyland bus picks you up directly from the hotel, and you arrive within 10 minutes. The restaurant attached to the hotel wasn't great, the staff clearly didn't want to be there and the food was average. However I would stay again but I would probably eat out. I do recommend this hotel if you are planning on visiting Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your review. My apologies for the restaurant performance and I assure you this will be corrected. We hope to show you that improvement the next time you stay with us. Thank you for your business!  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Just wanted to applaud the staff at the Holiday Inn. We traveled and stayed at the hotel 2 years ago and they were great... we recently sent our friends to Disneyland as a surprise. The hotel went above and beyond to accomodate our situation and gave the family breakfast on them. The hotel has been renovated and great for the price you pay. Thank you

Summary Heading: Good location, friendy staff, need to check the rooms
Summary: When you're from out of town and only in Anaheim to do Disneyland, this is a good place to stay - especially if it's for a few days.  Location: This hotel is about ten minutes from the entrance to both Disney's California Adventure and Disneyland. There are a few take-aways, restaurants and bottle shops nearby.  Amenities: This hotel has a swimming pool, spa, outdoor dining facilities,, bar and restaurant. There is also a laundry and gym (Iused neither, so I can't comment). I recommend breakfast downstairs before starting at Disneyland. There is a bar fridge that is empty, the TV choices are reasonable. Coffee machine is good. Free, good wifi. The front water display is amusing and attracts attention.  Accessibility: Only one lift which takes a while to arrive sometimes.  Rooms:

Summary Heading: Good value, close to Disneyland, families
Summary: This hotel is about as close to the Disneyland entrance as you can get and NOT stay in a Disney hotel.  That said -- if you CAN swing it -- DO stay at a Disney hotel.  The quality is much better and the experience is much better.  You will be able to SEE Disney "stuffies" (they walk around those hotels and eat with you at breakfast). You are closer (great when the kids are tired) AND you can often get INTO the parks an hour earlier than everyone else. They have special entrance ways OR momorail passes that take you deep into the park -- so you can ride extra rides, etc.  Worth it.   Back to THIS hotel -- its a classic "near Disney" hotel -- probably built originally in the 1950s or 60's and been refurbished several times. It's still tired. It's still just a hotel. I came with
Manager Response: Thank you for taking valuable time to review our hotel. Our location, staff and facility are appealing to a wide variety of guests visiting Anaheim. And yes, the little ones simply love our new Splash Zone!  Please come see us again soon!  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: This hotel is the furthest location from the entrance to Disneyland that we have stayed, however, you can come out the hotel, turn left and walk through the Magic way carpark through Downtown Disney and get to park entrance within 10-15 minutes. Good if you have push chairs for small kids but don't recommend if your kids are tired. The Hotel has a bus service, buy tickets in gift shop for $5 for the day pp. Bus route 11 comes about every 30 minutes and takes about 15 mins to get you to the front entrance of the park.  We were in a suite disabled accessible which we did not need and the set up was a bit awkward honestly. Main bed fine but extra beds came with thready blankets, the windows were filthy and decor very warn. Kitchenette is nothing more than a Microwave, fridge,

This hotel was so beautiful, the restaurant was so pretty and awesome..love the TVs in the booths...the people who work there are so friendly and the service was amazing...loved the room except they should have balcony's and so convent right next to disney!

From the welcoming check in to the short walk to Downtown Disney this hotel was an excellent choice. Being a short distance away from the resort area, it was quick and easy to get around without the traffic that S Harbour drive has. The room was clean and the bed and pillows comfortable. Overall a great place to stay and I will be returning to this hotel the next time I visit the area.

We had a comfortable sleep...15 minute walk to the disney parks. After a long drive we were greeted by wonderful staff. Mayra and Krystal were very nice and very helpful! I think that's a great start to a stay when the staff is very friendly and helpful.

Summary Heading: Great value with top notch service
Summary: I stayed here for two nights and this hotel is great for the value.  The rooms seem recently updated and everything was very clean and well maintained.  It was close to the park and we could walk to Downtown Disney in 10 minutes.  I arrived very early and was able to get the paperwork done and park the car to head to Disneyland for the day.  Each time I walked past the desk during the stay I was met with a genuine smile and greeting,  I had to leave very early at check out and left my fairly expensive camera in the room.  When I returned home and noticed it missing, I called and they were able to locate it.  The little things matter and the guest services at this hotel are impeccable.  The only suggestion for improvement would be making the buffet breakfast a little nicer or

We got a deal on a website & single KING-sized bed, but when my wife & I arrived we had a room with 1 queen size bed. I talked to Gary the front desk & they gave my room away to someone else because we used an outside website to reserve our room. Gary could not explain this policy & advised me to call the site to receive a partial refund since the room I requested cost more.   We got up the next morning and talked to Tom Van Winkle and he was very nice and extremely helpful with the situation.   We stayed there for 5 nights.  We were very pleased with our stay there. The only thing we were a little disappointed with was the 1st night.  We enjoyed our stay there and  we will definitely be staying there  on our next Disneyland trip!

Summary Heading: Disney Land week of Nov 29/14 to Dec 5/14
Summary: My wife and I took our 19 year old and our 15 year old to Disney land first week in Dec 2014 and stayed at this Hotel. When we arrived the room was ready. We stayed in a suit with two queen beds and a pull out sofa it also had a bar fridge and microwave . Pool was open kids used twice I did as well  it was warm we all loved it . the weather this Dec was not so good rained on the Tuesday so we only had four hours at the park. The walk to the park was short 10 to 15 min right to downtown Disney. I f you want to eat at the rainforest caf√© make a reservation on the walk past in the morning going to the park. there is a shuttle from the hotel to the park cost is five bucks shuttle number 11 it was great after a long day at the park this hotel is the first drop off leaving the park.

We stayed here for 7 nights during the first week of December in a Queen Suite on the top floor of Building 3.  It was our first trip to Disneyland.  We chose this hotel because they offer a suite and were the only hotel in our price range to offer such a large room.  Our party consisted of my husband and I, 2 kids (eight and three) and my mom, plus more family in the 5th floor.  We couldn't be happier with the room, staff, location and restaurant. The room was clean and spacious and the beds (even the fold out) were really comfortable.  Considering the number of families in the building we didn't hear anything once the door was shut.  Our room faced the parking garage but we had a great view of the fireworks from the window at the end of the hallway.  The pool was heated and

Me and my friend booked seperate rooms.  The check in time was supposed to be 3:00 however, they supposedly only had one room ready at that time.  After 30 minutes we decided to bug them again and then they found us both a room in the same building.  There are multiple buildings at this location.  The buildings are old and the rooms are old. When we entered the building for our rooms it smelled like they just sprayed 10 cans of Lysol.   After that smell went away both of our rooms smelled like they had been flooded with water.  There was a mildew smell that did not go away.  I highly suggest for them to do some remodeling here.  Another thing was that you had to use a card to enter the building which would have been great however the door at another entrance of the building was
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post a review. Our check in time is 4pm but we do our best to get early arrivals checked as soon as possible. I do apologize for the conditions you experienced and we are doing our best to not let this happen again. I'm glad you enjoyed our food! We hope to see you again another time!  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Clean and spacious accommodation in a good location close to Disneyland. Walking is approx 15 mins. Quite location with good amenities. Great buffet breakfast and Dinner menu. Room was well maintained and clean. Staff were helpful and always available. Not a lot to do around the location and a car is required for everything else apart from Disneyland.

We had checked this hotel out in the past and planned to stay here for four nights during our Disney trip. This time around, and maybe due to a late arrival and that the hotel was very full, I did not get a very good first impression. I remembered the hotel grounds as clean. When we walked in, the carpets and floor in general were littered and there were stains throughout.  They do charge for parking on hotel grounds. Additionally, the hotel is not close enough to Disney to walk there and back with small children. I had been shown a very nice room in the past. This time around, our room had freshly stained carpets, no fridge/microwave (this is something we expect at hotels we stay at) and the air conditioning unit was loud. I could not bring myself to want to stay here for four
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay with us. We appreciate you letting us know how we can improve and I assure you we will. We do hope to see you again in the future.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Good Place to Stay for a Disney Visit
Summary: I was with my youngest son visiting the local attractions. I booked this hotel because it offered a free breakfast is very close to Disneyland and was reasonably priced compared to other hotels in the area. There is a parking fee of $10 a night, however it is offset by the parking fee at Disney which you can avoid by taking the local transport system. Ask about this when you check in, it's very convenient. The hotel has ample parking, a nice spacious lobby and really helpful front desk staff. We arrived in the middle of the night and greeted by Gary, really friendly, really helpful and provided us with all the information we needed. The room was clean and while a bit on the small side provided us with everything that we needed. The beds were comfortable and had the usual

Chose this hotel due to it's proximity to the Start/Finish line of the Avengers 1/2 marathon.  A short 5 min walk and you are on the Disney property.  Not must to see from the hotel as it is directly next door to the huge Mickey & Friends parking structure.   Check-in was fast and friendly but 1st room we were assigned smelled of mildew.  We were moved quickly to a room that smelled much better.  Hotel can be loud when full of teenagers (as it was during our stay) but otherwise, no complaints.  Simple room, simple amenities, not much around other than Disney.  Did not have a chance to eat at the restaurant but the pool and water play area looked fun. Would definitely stay here again when visiting Disney.

Summary Heading: Comfortable, convenient, but room cleaning needs work.
Summary: Standard fare hotel.  Nothing special nothing bad.  AC noisy.  Cleaning service did not clean to our satisfaction.  Our grime I can live with, but some strangers - NO.  Standard shaped rooms, with standard beds, standard bathroom, again nothing special but nothing bad. Location was selected for distance from Disney.  You save considerably compared to the cost of one of the Disney lodges, so can't complain much - It's CHEAP to stay at the H-Inn.   Parking is 10/day extra.  (You could either argue it's a good deal but a hassle - you save from avoiding Disney parking - it would be much easier if they just tack on the price to the daily rates).  Conveniently sells tickets to D-Land.  Monorail can be used if you have tickets.  Saves some walking distance - except It Never Rains in
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are glad you enjoyed our location and we do hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: We had a standard room with two queen beds for 3 nights.   The hotel was super quiet and clean. Beds comfortable. The check inn staff were lovely. We could see the Disneyland fireworks out of our window at night. The restaurant was good (MASSIVE portions) and relatively cheap compared to the general area.   There is a reasonably priced shuttle which frequently picks up at the hotel and goes to Disneyland - we didn't discover this until late in our trip but enjoy walking anyway so didn't mind too much. The walk to Disneyland is pleasant but not short - at least 15 min to the monorail, maybe 20-25 to the park itself.   Things to note are perhaps that the standard room doesn't have a fridge which may bother some people. There are also not a lot of shops in the vicinity. If you are

This Holiday inn (on S. Walnut street) is a mid range hotel whose main feature is that is it "1 block from Disneyland". Having said that - it is a large block - it takes about 15 - 20 minutes for the average family to walk to the park entrance.   The rooms are reasonably priced and they have a few larger suites as well that give you more room to spread out in. There is a nice water park for kids to play in outside if the weather is appropriate.  The rooms were decent and clean, although the hotel itself is probably getting close to needing an upgrade.  We stayed in a kitchenette suite. On the web, there are few photos of this part of the room. There is a microwave, small fridge, coffeemaker and that is about it. There are no utensils, plates, or other kitchen amenities supplied.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing our hotel and for letting us know how things went. We do have plates and utensils available upon request for any of our guests. The monorail stop in Downtown Disney is a 12-15 minute walk from our hotel. If you already have tickets or are a pass holder this park entrance is the best way to go to Disneyland. We hope to see you again in the future!  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Was going to stay for a meeting, but had to cancel.  Sent son and his girl-friend who decided to enjoy Mickey's Halloween at Disneyland.  Hotel was more than accommodating with allowing him to take my place.  Staff were perfection as and hotel was "awesome" and clean.  Definitely a great place to stay if visiting or business.

Summary Heading: Ok hotel but too far to walk
Summary: Front Desk when checked in not very helpful with info on the area [food, transportation etc].    If to do it again Id stay for lower price as still had to pay to park at Disney.      It was pretty far to walk and when you know your walking all day at Disney you cough up the $17 to park.     Run down hotel.      When we checkin lots of empty rooms and they gave us a double bed to share.     I called and got that changed.      Id save ur $ and stay farther away.      Nothing special and also had to pay to park $10 per night.
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about your stay. I am sorry you thought it was too far to walk. There is a monorail stop that ticketed or pass holder guests can enter Disneyland from Downtown Disney. This is an easy 12-15 minute walk from our front door. We do hope you would consider staying with us again.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Decent choice but nothing to write Mickey about
Summary: It was a 15 minute walk from the Disney entrance, so the location is not bad. The room was nothing special. The whole hotel was nothing special. A totally average place to stay. If you want average, opt for this property.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. Our location is great and our rooms are fresh and clean. With our new Splash Zone for the kids and a great restaurant we are the perfect choice for visiting the Magic Kingdom.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: So many Disneyland hotels were crazy expensive.  This was a nice hotel with a decent price.  The shuttle is $5 to take you to and from Disney every 20 minutes.  You could walk, it seemed like an easy 20 minute walk.  It was a very clean hotel, with a decent restaurant.  The staff was very nice, cute gift shop and overall a great stay.  I always hate when hotels charge extra for parking.  Just my two cents...10 extra dollars a day.  But the value of the room was excellent.  Recommend staying here if you're going to Disney!

This is a pretty decent hotel in a good location, close to disney. It had everything I was looking for in a hotel for my family, for a couple of nights. I even used the gym!! Breakfast was decent. We walked it to disney within 10 minutes, nice and leisurely walk too.

What a great value for money hotel! It is so close to Disneyland and a bus picks up and drops off at the hotel door! This bus runs every 20min from Disneyland :) The hotel was very clean and enough room to stop over for our 2 night stay. I was very impressed with it's location, service and the rooms.  It's no 5 star but it's the perfect place to stay when visiting Disneyland

This property is literally around the corner from the parking structure to Disneyland. There is a $10 per day parking fee which beats the Disneyland fee of $15 per day. It's a 10-15 minute brisk walk from the hotel to the tram at the parking structure to get to the theme park.  The room we had was spacious to fit my family of 5 in one room. The bathroom was bit tight but sufficient. The room did not have a fridge or microwave which was a bit inconvenient. We picked up a small foam cooler to keep our water cool during our 4 day trip.   The property is quiet and comfortable. The AC worked fine and wasn't too loud. The elevators were FAST! It wastes no time closing and moving us up and down. We were in building 4 which was nice as the parking was near the door and elevator.

Summary Heading: Great hotel to stay at with the family
Summary: My family of 5 loved it! Kids loved the splash zone, pool and restaurant. Kids eat free at the Onyx restaurant which is located in the hotel. We stayed 6 days and enjoyed the breakfast menu each day. We checked in late and they gave us a smaller room than I had booked, but they were sold out so I had to wait another day to move rooms. The 2 Queen room was nice, beds were comfy and clean.  The staff was nice, professional and restaurant staff was fast. We booked thru getaway today and got a great deal! I would definitely stay again. Overall experience was great! The walk to Disneyland was about 15 minutes with the kids. My husband walked it by himself in about 10 minutes. The Anaheim shuttle was available and they run every 20 minutes. Only negatives would be no in room fridge

Summary Heading: Charged for room that I have redeemed IHG points.
Summary: At checkout, I found out that the Hotel made some mistakes in billing and I spoke to the Manager on Duty immediately. She agreed that as I used my IHG points for my entire stay there should be no further charges on our room.  She assured me that the only charges would be the Disneyland tickets and meals at the Hotel.  Later on, I double checked with a front desk staff while waiting for the taxi, he also told me that the charges were taken off.  However, I have discovered these charges on my credit card statement several days later.  You will not miss the big sign station at the entrance that 'Disneyland Tickets Sold Here'. But you need to look carefully! You gotta read the fine prints in those tiny handouts. They do not list prices of other passes. They only have Hoppers.
