Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know what happened during your recent stay with us. We sincerely apologize for the error and the delay in getting it fixed. I have followed up with my staff and the credit for the erroneous charge has been made. We have also dedicated ourselves to make sure this does not happen again.  Again, my apologies for this mistake.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Close to the Park and Convention Center
Summary: Park hotels were all booked so chose this hotel for it's close proximity to the park Hotels/convention location, 8 minute walk.  Staff was friendly and helpful. We ate at their restaurant for 2 breakfasts and 2 dinners, staff were great, food was ok for the price and convenience . Room was basic no fridge or safe, bathroom was small with pealing wallpaper/plaster in shower/toilet room, no towel racks in the bathroom by the sink! Rates were steep, but it's the location.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your experiences at our hotel. Our staff is working diligently to improve the condition of our bathrooms and we do hope to see you again sometime in the future to see our improvements.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Long walk from Disneyland After a full day
Summary: I was happy with the hotel, undated (reno) and clean. I am a little confused with the statement with one block from Disneyland as it was far.... So far we had family pick us (rental car) up as they were staying across from D-Land.  The only other concern is I locked myself out of my room. Housekeeping was a few rooms down cleaning and spoke no English, so they could not help me at all. It is important to me that all staff can speak and understand English as if there was an emergency communication is not a concern.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience with us. We are a short walk (about 12 minutes) to the monorail stop and the park entrance there. We apologize if this was deceiving but it is a better walk than many hotels on Harbor south of Katella. We hope to have you back the next time you are in the area.  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Charged us for things we did not buy.
Summary: At checkout, we were told we had a balance owing for meals purchased at the hotel and for shuttle passes.  I explained to them that we did not have any meals and did not purchase passes. They told me that the charges were taken off and my balance was 0.  But two days later they charged my credit card.   Bad enough that the room was not worth the $220 a night we paid, but then they charge us for things we did not buy.
Manager Response: We apologize if there were any charges that were not valid. I would appreciate a call so I can fix this for you. Please call the hotel at 714-353-0300 and ask for Tom and I will personally take care of the issue.  Thank you,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: I would stay here again while avoiding the restaurant
Summary: When I scheduled this trip I was kind of nervous because of what I've read on Tripadviosr.  I've stayed at the Disneyland Hotel and various good neighbor hotels.  The Disneyland Hotel is pretty expensive and waiting for the sometimes crowded ART can be a pain so based on the location of this hotel, we gave it a try.  As others have said, the 1 block to Disneyland is a LONG block and even then, you're at the corner of the street that takes you to the street that takes you to Downtown Disney so the 1 block to Disneyland isn't true.  With that in mind, it's about a 10 - 15 minute walk to the Disneyland parking shuttle.  You can board the shuttle and save about a 1/4 mile of the walk to the Disneyland entrance.  Check in was smooth, parking fees were included in the Disneyland
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. I am very sorry about the buffet and I promise we are striving to improve our consistency on our breakfast buffet.   We are please you had some good experiences in other facets of our hotel and we do look forward to your next visit.  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: This hotel is a very basic hotel, but it does provide you with an opportunity to have an affordable option while going to Disneyland.  It's about a 20 minute walk to get to the entrance to the two parks... (about 10 minutes to Downtown Disney, and then 10 minutes through there the gates).  The rooms are dated and basic, but if you just want a place to lay your head, it's fine.   One downfall is that there aren't really any restaurants nearby.  They tend to be more on the south side of the park.  Definitely not a 'destination'...but if you're looking for a decent and affordable place near the parks, this can fit the bill.

Location is not far from Disneyland. A Bus is working to Disneyland just in front of the Hotel. Daily fee for the Bus is 5 USD and you need to buy the tickets from the hotel. Hotel Bar is closing at 23:00. Reception is polite but can not respond to many of your requests. Very old hotel and very old furnitures. Breakfast was below my standart. Parking lot is quite big and easy to get in and out. Not a special hotel and the price is far too high for the service
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and for choosing our hotel during your recent visit. We are constantly looking for ways to improve and I assure you your comments will help. We do hope you would consider staying with us again in the future. The furniture in our rooms are about a year old, our pillows are new and a very luxurious compliment to our pillow-top mattresses,  we have new Splash Zone for the kids and we are a short walk to Downtown Disney and the park entrance there.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: I stayed here as I was attending a conference at the Disneyland hotel Convention Center.  HI hotels and suites is about a 10 minute walk to both the Disneyland hotel and down town Disney.  I found the beds to be very comfortable and there are enough pillow options, so you can find what works for you.  Overall the rooms are adequate but the bathrooms are very dated and small.  Overall not a big deal but there definitely lacking compared to other hotels.    It's obvious that this property recently renovated the lobby, and hotel restaurant as they look considerably more modern than the rooms.    Overall,  its a good spot to stay considering the price,  if you are doing anything at Disney.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! It sounds like you had a good time here in Anaheim. We are sorry our bathrooms were not to your liking. We do get many positive comments about having the vanity separate from the room with the commode and shower. We do hope you come visit us again soon!  Thank you!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Clean rooms good service fairly close to the parks. Staff was friendly and helpful. Pool and hot tub were clean , decent food in the restaurant Would stay again for sure. Was nice to have good working air conditioning
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments! We are glad you had a good time here at the Holiday Inn and Suites Anaheim and hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Good rates and shuttle to Disneyland make this easy for families.
Summary: Taking little ones to Disneyland is hectic enough. The hotel is supposedly a block away from Disneyland but it is a very, very long block. The frequent, inexpensive shuttle from the hotel is the way to go. The breakfast is quick, the hotel rates are among the lowest for the area and the hotel staff is Disney cheery and helpful. I gave it four stars instead of five only because we have had intermittent internet each time we have stayed here. If the internet was iffy only one time, such as when there was construction in the area, I would disregard it, but it has been that way a number of times over a number of years. It may work. It may not. If that is a deal breaker, this is not your hotel. If spending the money at Disneyland rather than the hotel and making your trip as easy as

I took the metrolink down coming back from virginia. I decided to go to Disneyland never been. I'd booked a room here from hotwire, and I get here the front desk the manager took me he was very professional and doing his job gave him a card and my identification. There was a 50.00 hold I did not have it on my card. I did not know. So he asked me do I want to call hotwire and get my money back. Kinda had me up set i came in from virginia I had cash. So he called a cab and I put money in my account. I came back and they put the hold on and gave me my key for my room. The room was nice I did not like the smell it smelled like someone had been smoking previously besides that everything else was up to par. I walked around I love the kids water area that was nice. I like that they had
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay with us. We apologize about the confusion at check in. We require a valid credit card and a $50 deposit on that card at check in for all of our guests. We are happy everything went smoothly after that and we do hope to see you again the next time you visit Anaheim.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Close to Disney, Clean and Comfortable!
Summary: Clean, well set-up, efficient!  It's not top shelf, but it's not low end either.  Comfortable and modern room.  Easy to access.  Easy access to the Park, with Downtown Disney a ten minute walk down the street.  Front desk staff is very helpful, attentive and friendly!  Facilities are all nice.  Avoid the in-house Onyx Restaurant - terrible food and rude staff!  Aside from the restaurant issued, we'd stay here again - this is a good alternative, and much cheaper, if you cannot get a room at one of the on-park hotels. Recommended!

Very friendly helpful staff, decent rooms (nothing extra but more than decent) and I had read a review that said the beds were uncomfortable. I was worried but I shouldn't have been. Might have been a bad bed in that guests room but mine was the most comfortable bed of the entire trip. They had 2 kinds of pillows (oh thank you magic pillow people). The only thing I would change (and such an easy fix) is an extra towel rack for your hand towel in the sink area. The restaurant has a buffet and menu so for us toast and coffee eaters we aren't paying $13.99 for breakfast if we don't want to. Handy shuttle ($5.00 for the day unlimited trips between Disney and the hotel )but we never used it as it's such an easy walk to Disneyland. Lots of parking for a nominal charge. No complaints

3 of us stayed here for 3 nights. it is average hotel, was clean. we did not get to use the pool but it looked nice. it is within walking distance to Disneyland, about .7 mile which is a little long after walking around Disney, but we walked to parking lot and took the tram so that helped. there is ART bus and you can get a day pass, it comes every 2o minutes, but with wait times can take up to 3o minutes to get back and forth so we mostly walked. there is no fridge or breakfast included, I preferred staying at Anaheim Desert Inn and Suites.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and for writing a review. We much appreciate all the feedback we can get. With our great location and facility, including our new Splash Zone, we are the perfect place for a family trip to the Magic Kingdom. We also have some fantastic breakfast inclusive rates available so we do hope to see again here sometime soon.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: My Boyfriend and I stayed at the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites back in February and we had the best time! We both love Disneyland, which was the purpose of our trip, and we felt like this was the perfect place for us! Having been to Disneyland over 10 times I have stayed at many hotels and this one tops my list!  It it the perfect distance from the park, close enough to walk and far enough away that you don't hear the loud noises from the park.  It is for sure not a block away, more like 5-10 to downtown disney and another 5 to the main gates, but it easy and enjoyable.  If it is feeling a little long you can hope on the parking tram to take you to the main gate and back or get on the monorail at the downtown disney location and it will take you right into Tomorrowland! Just a
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are thrilled you had a good time at our Holiday Inn and Suites in Anaheim. We look forward to seeing you again in January!!  Best regards!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: We stayed here for 5 days as we explored the Disney Parks and Universal Studios.  Arrived in the late afternoon on Sunday, 9/21.  The lobby is small, but cute.  Very nicely decorated and clean.  Check in was very fast and easy.  The front desk clerk was very friendly and helpful.  We were in Building 4, which is toward the back of the property.  There was a lot of available parking close to the building.  The property was nicely maintained.    We initially had a little trouble opening our room door, but after a few more tries, we finally got it.  Throughout the stay, I've noticed a couple of our neighbors having the same issue.  Once in the room, I was pleased with what I was walking in to.  The room was spacious, furnished with two comfortable queen sized beds, a large desk

The lobby is very nice.  We arrived at 8pm on a Friday night and the place was hopping.  Check in was fast and they got through the customers in a quick and organized way.  They did explain there was a $10 per day charge to park.  I have stayed at similar quality hotels around Disney before and never been charged, seemed like a rip off.  Our room was in what I will guess was an older.  Clean and well appointed but seemed a little musty smelling.  The beds were comfy.  The air conditioner was a little loud but did its job.  Plus the noise of the air conditioner drowned out any noise from the Disney parking garage.  I did not like the set up of our room.  The sink and mirror for the bathroom was right next to the bed and not behind a door in the bathroom.  This is problematic for
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay with us. We apologize for the shortcomings in service you encountered. I assure you I have addressed the issues in the restaurant with the Food and Beverage Manager.   We do hope you will consider us again on your next trip to the area.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Everybody wants to stay at a Disneyland hotel, but let's face it... those properties are expensive. For less than half the price of Disney's least expensive offering, we stayed at the Holiday Inn on S. Walnut. Our room was clean and well maintained. The staff was friendly and helpful. And it's a very convenient location. The restaurant is decent, and there's a small bar that keeps good hours.  There's a nice pool, a small, well-kept exercise room, and a shop that sells souvenirs, sundries, and a few food items. Even with our room almost directly overlooking the pool, we didn't have a problem with noise.  It's a stretch to say this Holiday Inn is "one block to Disneyland." It's a good mile to the park gates. There's a local bus option, but we found it faster to walk than wait and

Stayed here many times and it is very good value for money.  Family friendly hotel with swimming pool and splash park for the kids.  Room was serviced nicely each day.  Good restaurant with large portions.  There are 4 buses an hour to take you to Disney parks which run until 30 mins after parks close.

This hotel is clean, and the staff was very friendly.  I would have given it 5 stars except for the fact that the beds were very, very hard.  Good thing I was exhausted or I'm not sure I would have slept.  Since going to Disneyland tends to make someone very tired, I'm sure this would be a good option if at the park all day.  Then you could just fall into bed and pass out, thereby leaving the hardness of the bed a moot point.  Cute soaker area for little kids.

The Holiday Inn Disneyland exceeded all of our expectations.  All of our needs were met and then some.  The staff was helpful and very friendly, the room was delightful, the restaurant had a great menu and fast service.  My favorite was the comfortable bed and luxurious pillows.  I will go back next year.

Summary Heading: Clean, attractive, and convenient to theme parks.
Summary: This hotel has an attractive interior that looks recently remodeled. Rooms are very clean and comfy. On site restaurant. room service was efficient and actually tasty. Bus transport to theme parks is reliable and excellent. Friendly staff. Would stay here again.

The best thing was that the room was available at 10am when we arrived after a long 18 hr flight from New Zealand via Australia. The front desk staff were welcoming, helpful and polite, a nice change from previous experience in some big US hotel chains.   The hotel was good for distance to Disney, a bit more than 1 block‚Ä¶ about 15 ‚Äì 20 mins walk to the main gate. The good thing was that the hotel is located next door to the Disney parking building so you can take the free parking shuttle tram from the main gate to the parking building and then it‚Äôs not such a walk.  The hotel overall is getting a bit old and a bit tired, the rooms are small but the housekeeping staff were pleasant and helpful, and the beds were good, and really it‚Äôs just a place to sleep after a full on day at

Great value family hotel for Disneyland Park vacations.  Older style but good clean and well kept rooms, good staff and location make this a winner.  Thanks to the staff for a great family holiday.  Regular shuttles to the park or 10 minute walk and enter the back side of the park.  Highly recommended as a good value for money holiday, thanks.

perfect location with a short walk to downtown Disney! love being this close with out the huge crowds! Feels far away from the congestion but your so so close to all the action! Very quiet rooms and good price for the location

The bathroom definitely needed a little more updating, but overall the room was very nice. The pillows were comfortable and the sheets on the bed were clean. The best part is you could walk to downtown Disney in about 10 minutes.  There is a shuttle, but you have to pay (unless you're running one of the Disney marathons/runs). Also, you have to pay to park your car there overnight.

Summary Heading: Good Hotel, Close to the Park
Summary: The good:  The staff was always friendly and willing to help.  The room was clean and ready when we showed up.  The shuttle ($5.00) picks you up right at the front door and drops you right at the Disneyland parking lot.  This was a nice convenience, but they also said it was about a 15 minute walk to the park just for reference.  Breakfast at the Onyx restaurant was good.  They never did have the buffet while we were there, but the omlets were good sized and stuffed.  The Bad:  They charge something like $10 a day for parking which to me is basically just another way for them to make money.  It's not like they are in a thriving metropolis or something where parking is expensive.  They've got a big parking lot all the way around the hotel, not a garage, just a paved lot, and they
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of the Holiday Inn and Suites Anaheim. We are glad you enjoyed our hotel. We do charge for parking as do most hotels in the area. However, we have about the lowest charge around the Disneyland Resort of any full service hotel. Many charge $14-16.  We do hope you will consider us again the next time you visit Anaheim!  Thank you!  Tom Van Winkle General Van Winkle

Summary Heading: Running event at Disneyland, stay here!
Summary: Stayed a couple of nights during a Run Disney event weekend and this hotel is situated perfectly for the start/finish lines and for the Expo at the Disneyland Hotel.  The walk to the start/finish lines is about 10 minutes and just a couple of more minutes to the Hotel especially if you're in one of the buildings on the South side of the property.  It may be a bit more of a walk to the actual entrance to Disneyland and California Adventure but there is an Art shuttle stop at the front entrance.  Splash pad was a hit with the little one also.  Overall a great value property for a Disneyland area stay.  Could use a refrigerator in the rooms though.

We stayed at the Holiday Inn in Anaheim in August 2014 with our adult son who uses a wheelchair for mobility.  We stayed in an accessible room that was spacious, had a fridge and microwave for us to use and a large wheelchair accessible bathroom.  The hotel provided us with a shower chair for our son and he was able to manage with independence.  The hotel is located within a short distance of Disneyland and a shuttle bus picks up at the hotel every 20 minutes.

Perfect location to explore SOCAL. Walking distance to Disneyland, and easy access to I5 north and south.  We stayed here 8 nights 3 times over the last 5 years. This time we checked in first to one of the older wings and the room smelled like mold. front desk reallocated us right away to another room which was fine. Even though the rooms are average at best, there are larger than most in the neighborhood, offering comfortable queen size beds which are the most important when you do the full day track with family at Disney. The breakfast is outstanding quality and value, as long as you order from the menu. The staff is friendly and the security measures make you feel safe at all times.  I will be back again for the overall value and convenience.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay with us at the Holiday Inn and Suites Anaheim. We are very sorry you had to change rooms after you checked in. I assure you that was an anomaly and has been fixed. We are very glad you enjoyed the rest of your stay and we hope to see you again the next time you visit Anaheim!  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Needed a one night stay in the area, so did some checking online and got our room for an amazing price! Great room with comfortable beds. We didn't use it, but they had a cute splash pad for kids. We walked to Downtown Disney in the morning. Not too far, but a nice walk. With the great rate we got, we would definitely check this hotel out and stay here again when we are in the area!

The room was spacious and clean.  I found everyone very helpful and polite.   The walk to Disney was longer than I expected, but enjoyable.  the pool,area was clean and comfortable. I would stay here again when visiting Disney.

Stayed there for 4 nights. The rooms are dark and noisy. The toilets of the pool area were really dirty. Service was a disgrace. I was on my own with my young children and on 2 different occasions the staff just couldn't help with luggage even though I had my 2 year old sleeping in my arms ...I   had to leave him sleeping on the lounge in the front desk area / couch supervised by my oldest "5 year old" to drop off bags  in the room and back for  the kids ... The restaurant staff of the morning shift never had a smile on their face . Obviously they don't  get paid well as they were  rude and careless of service. The manager was rude too. The restaurant closes for lunch which is really inconvenient.  Watch for your credit card as on my return home they charged me 28 dollars
Manager Response: I appreciate you letting me know about your recent experience here. I assure you I have shared this with my entire staff and they are also deeply sorry we let you down with the service we gave you.  I should point out that we are open for lunch daily from 11:30am to 1pm. If there is anything I can answer regarding the $28 credit card charge you mentioned please do not hesitate to contact me directly.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: A couple of issues but overall fine
Summary: We were not here for a Disneyland vacation so I can't comment on that except to say that it seems quite a distance from the park to me. We were unable to check in any earlier as they were quite busy but the front desk person was very kind and assured us that our room would be ready at 4pm.  We ended up not being able to actually get back to the hotel until nearly 10pm due to our circumstances...not the hotels and were given the handicapped room which had a king sized bed in it and was on the ground floor.  It was quite a distance from the hotel lobby though and would be difficult to maneuver had we actually had any disabilities.  The room was very clean and spacious. I am a picky mattress/sleeper and found their beds to be very comfortable.  We did have a big issue with the A/C
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about your recent experience at the Holiday Inn and Suites Anaheim. We are very sorry about the A/C malfunction. Please let me know if I can be of service to you on your next trip to the area. We do hope you will come see us again!  Sincerely  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: The hotel is family friendly and has a play area for children.  The buffet provides both cold and hot food.  Located conveniently close to Disneyland, this hotel is a comfortable place to retire at the "end" of a day of holiday fun.

We just got back from spending 5 nights. Overall it was a great stay. It's a slightly older hotel, friendly staff, we ate breakfast there 4 out of 5 mornings and ordered from the menu and the buffet - all good. Seating in the restaurant could do with a bit of a clean but must be hard to keep fabric clean with the amount of kids that stay:) pool was good too, we didnt use the new splash zone as my son is 10 and preferred the pool and not tub. It is not one block from Disenykand, or it's the longest block you have ever seen! We walked the 15-20 to Disenyland ever day, use the monorail entrance if you can, it will save you walking and avoid the crowds at main entrance. One day we took the Art bus which worked out great, $5.00 for all day use/ $3.00 for kids, runs ever 20- 30 mins.

Summary Heading: Bummed out by closed kid zone.
Summary: Nice hotel very easy access to Disneyland. The kid zone was a big selling point for our stay unfortunately it was closed for repair during our visit which was a big disappointment for the kids. The pool and jacuzzi were nice but average. The thing that stands out most about this stay was the friendly service. Our front desk person Sean in particular was very accommodating and helped us quickly resolve a billing/room rate discrepancy without any hesitation.

Overall, this is a great and affordable property.  Only downside is the absence of ice machines, at least in building 3.  Also should keep in mind that you cannot turn left into parking lot unless you want to break local traffic laws.  Best bet is to exit the 5 freeway at Katella, not Harbor, and go west on Katella to Walnut, then go north to hotel.  Room was very clean and inviting, with plenty of comfortable pillows. 5 mins to Disneyland parking and 10 mins to Angel Stadium.

We got a Minnie theme room and we also got a room that can see the fireworks at night time. We should have stayed here longer than staying at the holiday inn walk of fame. My daughter loves it so much here. It's close to Disney (though it's not the closest hotel to disneyland). The service was great and Thank you for the experience.

We stayed here for my daughter's softball tournament. The hotel was clean and the staff were friendly. The hotel was walking distance to downtown disney. It may be too much of a walk for very small kids, but easy for teenagers. They also had a shuttle service. This hotel will be one step up from what you would expect.

Summary Heading: perfect place if you are going to Disnelyand
Summary: this hotel is perfect if you are going to spend 1 or 2 night around Disneyland. The locations is AMAZING and the rooms are spacious and clean. We didn't use the pool or the restaurant but we had 2 great nights of sleep after a looooooooooong day at the park. I will stay here again and will recommend to my fiends and family for sure :)

I stay here July 31- August 2 with my son, sisters and niece. We booked a two room suite and were so excited to get the Pirate Suite. My son loved the new splash pad and the pool was so nice and warm, we could have stayed in it all day. I'm so glad I stayed at this Holiday Inn and Suites. I'm a travel agent and I would defiantly recommend this hotel to my clients.

Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights when visiting Disneyland. Although it is a (big) block from Disneyland, a regular hotel shuttle bus takes you there and back all day and some of the night. Close to a fabulous target that sells everything and many restaurants and cafes. Kids all enjoy their own themed room with bunk beds. Grounds are beautiful, rooms are clean and staff are friendly. You can book tours and visits to local attractions from the hotel lobby. Very good value. We could see the night time Disneyland fireworks from our room.

Stayed here a few years ago still a great hotel for kids we stayed in a suite with pirate theme if you have boys I think they'll love it we had all girls and they was impressed Easy walk to disneyland feels very safe to walk early morning or late at night  Restaurant is cheap to feed family as kids eat free with an adult breakfast was allways good staff very helpful My only grumble was the suites was upstairs with no disabled access so take this into account when booking  We would stay again

I stayed here for a week with my daughters to visit Disneyland and other attractions in LA. We enjoyed great service both from reception and the restaurant staff. If I am in the area again, i will definitely stay here again.

We stayed just a couple of nights as part of a tour. We requested a change of room and were immediately given a choice of two. The new room was ideal for us.   The breakfast needs better organization. Really long queue to get into the restaurant, even though there were empty tables. The breakfast was ok.  The reception staff were really helpful and friendly.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your feedback. We are glad you found our staff helpful. We also do our best during busy times in our restaurant but we do apologize for your wait. We'll keep looking for ways to improve in this area. We hope to see you again the next time you visit the Magic Kingdom!  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Stayed here for 8 nights from July 15-23.  Walking distance to Disneyland was okay.  Not many amenities in the area though.  No shuttle provided.   Fernando at the front desk was very helpful.  We were originally given 2 rooms on the 1st floor facing the parking lot but he was able to move us up to the 4th floor which was much better.  He also allowed me to use his computer to check in and print boarding passes but, again, the hotel should have a working computer and printer in a business center for this purpose.  The restaurant food was good and a good deal as we were travelling with our daughter and her family so the 2 children ate for free.  The food and service was very good.  Our biggest issues were with house keeping.  On the Thursday we were out from 6:45 am to 4:30 pm
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about your recent stay with us. I apologize for the housekeeping issues and I assure you this is not our normal procedure for cleaning our valued guests' rooms. We do hope you would give us another try to see our improvement and to experience the Holiday Inn and Suites Anaheim and our wonderful location.  Thank you,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: We stayed here last week (July 16-20).  The staff was super friendly and our bedroom was clean.  The bathroom, on the other hand, smelled like old wet rag and morning pee.  We were in town for a dance competition at the Disneyland Convention Center.  The walk to Disneyland took about 10 minutes from the hotel.  After a long day at the park (18 hours), the walk back felt like an hour.  The hotel is 1 block away from Magic Way and is behind the parking lot.  If you are not at Disneyland during the fireworks, you will hear (not see) them from your hotel room.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback regarding your recent stay with us. We do apologize for the housekeeping issue and rest assured we are ensuring this doesn't happen again. We are glad you enjoyed our location and we do hope you will stay with us again.  Thank you,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: We have stayed at this hotel before, so I thought I knew what I was getting.  I was WRONG!  We stayed here in mid-July.  The shower/bathtub backed up filling up the tub after the first person took a shower.  I called the front desk; they said they couldn't do anything to help.  The next morning I went down to the front desk to get a new room.  They said they couldn't do anything until all rooms were cleaned, so we had to wait till late afternoon, and leave Disneyland, to get a new room.  Then, in the next room, the toilet broke in the middle of the night.  Also, the beds were OK, but not as comfortable as other hotels, in just less then a year the beds are worn and uncomfortable.  This hotel is behind Disneyland, so you will hear the very loud firing of the fire works without
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to let us know how your recent stay with us went. I do apologize for the plumbing issue. Rest assured we are frustrated this happened and we always do our best to fix all issues that come up in an expedited manner. We have one of the best spots to watch the fireworks at night and while they are quite loud they are spectacular from our parking lot.  We do hope you would try us again the next time you are in the area.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: The staff was friendly.  However, I would not stay again for several reasons.  First, there were several issues with the room.  The tub and sink backed up every time we used it.  The bathroom door was not adjusted properly, so it was very difficult to shut.  The entrance door broke and it took 30 minutes to get back into the room, while my tired family waited in the hallway.  Second, the WiFi password given to me was misspelled on the card the front desk provided.  When I ask for help, I was told to call tech support.  Finally, I asked the front desk not to charge my card for parking, because I wanted to pay cash.  They agreed and proceeded to charge my card anyway.  Third, if you are going to Disneyland there are comparable hotels much closer, which makes the walk longer than
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We do apologize for the problems you encountered. I assure you I have addressed them with my staff and we are doing our very best to ensure these things do not happen in the future. We do hope you would give us another try to experience our hotel again.  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: We stay there for two nights for Disneyland. We booked the two-bedroom suites. The room is really cute: one is filled with toy story and the other features Cars. I bet kids will love them. However, the amenities are really bad, seems they try to use the cuteness to cover the poor quality. Living room is ok but the bathroom is just too tiny. Anyway, the location is not really good: need to walk around 20 mins to Disneyland and there is basically no restaurant nearby. P.S. There are two holiday inns in the area so be sure you drive to the right one.

Summary Heading: Our sleeping spot while visiting Disneyland
Summary: I can't tell you about the pool, the restaurant, the splash pad, or much else about the hotel as the family would get up early, walk to Disneyland, and come back and crash at night for 3 straight days.   We had a double queen suite with a sofabed, so it was perfect for the larger family, and that is why we stayed there.  There was a little kitchenette area, so we kept food and drinks for breakfast there, and while we would have taken a meal to disney, we pretty much didn't want to take the time to prepare as we would hit the hotel exhausted.  It was quiet, clean, and my only issue was when we were using the sofabed, housekeeping would strip it, but not put sheets back on, so we would have to do that.  I would have been fine with them not touching the sofabed.  The walk to Disney

we recently stayed at this hotel for a quick visit into Anaheim...we were close to the Disneyland Resort but it sits in the back side of the action...we arrived around 2pm but would not let us check in until 4pm...we had traveled for 8 hours and we were tired...our room was comfortable and clean...I think with the many option of staying around Anaheim I would not pick this hotel again...
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about your recent experience with us. We do try to accommodate as many early check in requests as possible and we are sorry you had to wait until our normal check in time of 4pm. We'll continue to strive to accommodate all of guests with this and we would love to have you give our hotel another try.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Good location and service was great!
Summary: I stayed here with the family while on vacation. Hotel is walking distance to Downtown Disney and Disneyland. Staff was great. Very accomidating and helpful. Special thanks to the Assistant Manager who helped us out with changing our hotel accomidations; and at no charge.

Summary Heading: Older hotel .. But good value and clean
Summary: This holiday inn is older and lacks many of the nice amenity the newer holiday inns provide. The location was great and the value was very good. The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The splash area did not live up to the pictures... And the pool area was old.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay with us. Our Splash Zone is getting great feedback from our guests and we've added cabanas and colorful chairs and chaises to our pool area. We do hope you give our hotel another chance to impress you the next time you are in Anaheim.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: I have stayed here more than a half dozen times each time was excellent good service good bar, good food. the staff is very nice very attentive plus you can see the backside of fireworks... from Disneyland!!!

Hotel was very clean and nice! Standard room was kind of small compared to other hotels I've stayed at, but room was clean and fresh. My daughter's, my husband and I loved the kids area, the pool and jacuzzi.  Friendly staff and place. The only downside, you have to pay $10 per day for parking and you have to pay for breakfast too. We did order a pizza and wings from there and it was delicious! Will stay again! :)

I wouldn't say this hotel is "1 Block" from Disneyland however our room did look out to the parking garage, so the 10 minute walk sure beat the $15 parking that was maybe 3 minutes closer. This hotel was great, we had no issues. Spent some time in the pool and our daughter loved it. The room was clean and in great shape. Front desk help was very friendly. We walked for a few minutes and was able to see the nightly fireworks.

This Hotel is old but it has been remodeled and kept very clean. We enjoyed our stay it worked out for the days we were at Disney Land. The pool and the water works is nice and my kids had a blast. One of days we went to the beach and came back tired so we ate at the restaurant and they have good pizza. I really enjoyed my pizza.

Summary Heading: Small but great hotel next to Disneyland!
Summary: I live near Disneyland, but needed a place to for a Disney race I was running.  SO glad I chose this hotel and hope to come back again!  Location:  Nice, safe 10 minute walk to Downtown Disney.  FYI:  The hotel is located at the back of the main Disneyland parking structure.  Rooms:  We got a standard room which was clean, nicely sized, comfortable, and modern. Staff: Very helpful and nice. Price:  Very reasonable price considering it's great location and accommodations!  (Parking fee: $10/night) Best feature:  The pool because it was warm and nicely heated....perfect for my tired legs after running 13 miles! :)

Summary Heading: Excellent place to stay with kids!!
Summary: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. Check in was easy and smooth. I got upgraded to character suite  which my kids just loved! Breakfast was free every morning and my kids got free breakfast and dinner every night. The breakfast was quite good. There was some remodeling being done on the stairs leading to our room but it wasn't a big deal. Every single staff member was helpful and friendly! I recommend getting a drink from the bar. The bar tender Jose was the best!! The bar doesn't open until 3:00 pm. Something got mixed up at the front desk with billing so for my inconvenience I got free parking for the day! My kids had a blast in the pool and hot tube with was good size. If you want to walk to Disneyland go to the front of the hotel and turn left and follow the

If this really family orientated hotel served real eggs for breakfast they would have received five stars. Despite some reviews indicating that it is too far from the Disneyland parks, it is an easy 15 -20 min walk or 10 mins to the tram stop. The walk is shaded and flat and very pleasant. there is a Shell service station 150 steps to the right of the hotel that has eveything (including some cheaper disney souvenirs) and a halal mexican restaurant with fabulous burritos.  We had a double room as we were travelling with our two children and this was an excellent size for us. Our bed's base was broken which made the mattress sag and was quite uncomfortable and there is no fridge which I believe is a mandatory appliance at this level of accommodation.we were able to do laundry at a
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your review of our Holiday Inn and Suites Anaheim. We are glad you enjoyed our location and our new Splash Zone. Also, I want to assure you we do not, and never will, serve powdered eggs. We use liquid eggs from Glenview Farms and shipped fresh to us from our food distributor.  If you can let me know what room number you were in I can make sure we fix the problem with the bed. Things break but we want to make sure we fix things quickly. My e-mail is tomv@hianaheim.com if you get a chance.  We do hope you will visit us again the next time you are in Anaheim!  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Me and my family absolutely love this hotel!!  We have been staying here on our trips to Anaheim for a few years now.  All of the staff in the hotel are always friendly and helpful.  Some actually remember us each time we stay which is always nice.  The pool is always clean and now they have a splash park which looks awesome and I am sure my nieces will love.  The rooms are always clean and quiet which is quite nice for me.  I will be staying at this hotel again in October for my Fall trip to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind comments! We at the Holiday Inn and Suites Anaheim look forward to being your host again in October!  Thank you!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Best location, great value for money
Summary: This hotel, in my opinion, is in a great location and is perfect for disneyland and trips into Los Angeles. We stayed here for 6 nights in 2 rooms. The rooms are large with 2 beds in them. We did 2 days at disneyland, universal studios, dodgers game and Santa Monica/Venice beach. We had a hire car and the location for us was perfect. It is a 10 minute walk to downtown Disney and about 15 minutes to both parks. It is not located near to the main restaurant/hotel area so you would have to have a hire car or catch a taxi to the restaurant area. We ate at the restaurant in the hotel, it is great for after a big day at the parks to be able to just walk down stairs and eat. Jose at the bar is great! The price is good value for money at this hotel. I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: We appreciate your nice words and I assure you I will share them with our staff--especially Jose. We hope you choose the Holiday Inn and Suites Anaheim with our new Splash Zone the next time you are in the area.   Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Stayed here for 6 nights on a family vacation to Disneyland. Front desk staff not that friendly.  Rooms, small and housekeeping did a horrible job of cleaning and replenishing what was needed. Had to call and ask for toilet paper and tissue twice. If you look underneath the beds had all kinds of rubbish left over from past guest. Coffee, tea, sugar, stir stick where never replenished . In fact, when we checked in the package of coffee and napkin package was already ripped and opened from the previous guest. We left it to see when it would be replenished. For our whole stay, almost one week it was never touched by housekeeping . We had 2 dbl beds. One beds was new and comfortable the other was old and had a super squeaky box spring. The bedside lamp was broken. The bathtub was
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about your recent stay with us. I assure you we have addressed the problems with our housekeeping staff. I sincerely apologize that we fell short in this area. If you get a chance please contact me directly so I can determine what room you stayed in so I can address the physical shortcomings you experienced. I would really appreciate that. We do hope you consider us again next time you are in the area. We try to improve every day and we hope you would give a chance to show you this.  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager 714-535-0300

Summary: We spent three Nights there. The room is not big, but very clean. Kind of strange is, that the sink is located in the bedroom. The bathroom has a tub and a toilet, but the room is very small.  But the Location is great. It is only a five to Ten minutes walk to Disney Land. They have a Shuttle but you have to Pay approx. $10 per direction.  Staff was very friendly and helpful. FYI you can also buy Disney Land Tickets at the hotel.

Our family of five stayed here eight nights and rented two rooms. We enjoyed our stay tremendously. We have stayed in many hotels and condos. These rooms are tidy neat and is a fairly new property.   The rooms are on the smaller size but just right for a good nights rest with firm comfortable beds. We visited Disney parks. It is a good 15 minute hike but fairly easy as we did not have any small children.   It was close to Downtown Disney and you can enter the gates to both California and DS Resort from there. We had a rent a car so it was easy to go inside the Downtown Disney parking lot as it was free for the first several hours. So I dropped off the family, parked the car back at the hotel and enjoyed the peaceful stroll myself along with my son some good bonding time! What I

I stayed at holiday inn Anaheim during our summer vacations. Best part of this hotel is the location which makes it an ideal place for planning disney park visits with the flexibility of walking back post lunch for a quick nap and then get back in park in evening. Negatives : breakfast spread is limited, small swimming pool with no bath area. Positive : friendly front desk, location,spacious rooms n the pizzas which are best to have when you are dead tired after disney park visit.

The hotel gets the job done. It wasn't unreasonably priced either, considering the location. The pool is pretty nice too. Standard room, plenty of parking. Staff was helpful and friendly. We weren't able to check in until almost 4pm on the dot, but thats the way it is a lot of places nowadays. I'd stay here again if you're doing Disney.

Nice hotel for the price. Disneyland and downtown Disney within walking distance. Nice pool area and in restraint. Very nice staff. Location is great although there is not any other restraints really close but there are a ton of places that deliver for free.

Summary Heading: Overnight stay in Holiday Inn Anaheim
Summary: After a long day in Disneyland this hotel is very good to stay in. Its very near Disneyland and the service is efficient. The room is just the right size for 4  persons. The room and linens are very clean and the big window makes the room very bright. The internet is very fast and reliable. The rapid check out is very convenient

Perfect place to stay at if you are looking to save some money on a hotel. It's walking distance to Downtown Disney and the parks. The area seems safe. We walked back from Disney at midnight. The street is well lit. The restaurant in the hotel offers free kid's breakfast. That was a plus! The rooms are clean. I would stay here again if visiting the Disneyland area.

This place is a great location. It's literally on the other side of the disneyland parking garage. You can walk to downtown disney in 10 minutes, or take the shuttle for $5 per day and it's unlimited trips back and forth. The rooms are big, clean, and very well maintained. Housekeeping is great and the front desk staff is very pleasant. The only frustration I had thus time I stayed here was I bought $20 in shuttle passes and the shuttle was supposed to come every 20 minutes. Well at one point we waited 45 mins and finally walked and decided not to wait .....and the hotel said sorry no refunds, however their schedule was way off. The restaurant has fantastic food...pizza is great!!

This is a great hotel for families.  The place is clean and nicely maintained.  The rooms are a good size.  We were in tower 4 on the 2nd floor and the room had 2 beds and a nice sized desk.  It was great for me and my husband and our 2 kids.  The one complaint I have is the washroom area was a tad small the had the toilet and bathtub shower combo in a small room with a door so it was a bit tight with the kids in the tub and a pain if anyone needs to use the toilet while someone is in the shower but it's not that bad.  Also the air conditioning unit was loud so it gets annoying if your trying to sleep.  The outside had a nice pool and hot tub also the have this super cute splash park for the little kids! The food is average but was great for some quick breakfast especially since

Summary Heading: Not what a holiday inn should be!!!!!!
Summary: The hotel is old and outdated. It is not 1 hotel, it has building around one property. We came during a heat wave and arrived to a super hot old room in a building with the security lock broken. After a long hot day in the parks we came back to the room and the cleaning service turned off the air so the room was super hot again!!! I would expect that from a 1star motel not a 3 star holiday inn.   This holiday inn is on walnut and shows north Disney area if booking by 3rd party. The holiday inn on Manchester is fabulous.
Manager Response: Thank you taking the time to let us know about your recent stay with us. We apologize that the housekeeper turned off your A/C while you were out. We've instructed our staff about this and this won't happen again. Our hotel is fairly large with 255 rooms but all buildings are close to each other and the Holiday Inn and Suites Anaheim is in one of the best locations in the area. We are a short walk to Downtown Disney and the park entrance at the monorail stop there. Our new Splash Zone is very popular with our guests and we truly believe we are the best choice for travelers heading to Disneyland. We do hope you would give us another try the next time you are in the area.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Very hard to match the location of this hotel. Just around the corner from Disneyland. Hotel itself does have some issue related to its age. Eg whilst we were there we had a broken lift , ice machine broken, handle fell off our door and the room itself did have quite a musty smell. The heated pool and the splash park for the kids are a big plus when travelling with a younger family.  Whilst there was some downsides the price and location is hard to beat for a quick few days at Disneyland. If they upgraded their rooms it would turn this hotel into something very hard to beat in the Anaheim area for families.
Manager Response: Dear thecraw,  Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback on your stay.  It is unfortunate the room conditions prevented you from fully enjoying your time at the hotel.  We are confident the necessary adjustments will be made, in order to achieve complete guest satisfaction.   Thank you again for your comments, we look forward to serving you in the future.   Sincerely,  Ben J Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: This was perfect for a couple of days of hitting Disneyland from opening to close. A couple of friends and spent 2 days at Disney and this made a fantastic home base. It was a quick 10 minute walk to Downtown Disney, 15/20 to the park entrance, and not on Katella with all of the other hotels which is busy and loud. Although there may be slightly closer hotels, I preferred the walk to be away from the crowds after fighting the crowds in the park all day.   The shower and toilet are in the bathroom, and the mirror and sinks are in the main part of the room. At first we thought that was odd, but it turned out to be incredibly useful and allowed us to get ready much more quickly.  The breakfast was passable and the staff was fine, this hotel really served its purpose for us. There

We chose this hotel for its location/proximity to Disneyland.  We were not disappointed, it was about a ten minute walk from Downtown Disneyland, just short enough to accomplish at the end of a long day in the park.    Situated in a residential neighborhood, the hotel is also next to a gas station and the local post office, so everything you need is truly within a very short walking distance.    The rooms were clean and spacious.  More than enough elbow room for a family of four.  The pool area is a bit small, but wasn't busy at all during our stay so we didn't find it to be a problem and typically had the pool to ourselves.    Service was pleasant.  Restaurant on site had a good breakfast buffet.  Ask at the front desk for a discount coupon for breakfast if you did not purchase
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your recent stay with us. We appreciate your comments about our location and cleanliness here at the Holiday Inn and Suites Anaheim. With our Splash Zone now open and our great location we look forward to hosting you again the next time you visit the Magic Kingdom.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Great place to stay, good value
Summary: Brought my three kids, 17, 15 &  12 for 5 nights and had a great stay. We were in a room with two double beds which was big enough for our length of stay. Asked about moving up to a suite which another review recommended but it would have been an extra $200/night which seemed too high.  Our room was clean, beds were comfortable. Bathroom was tiny and the light was pretty dim for some reason, but the double sinks outside the bathroom was a nice feature.   Pool was nice, restaurant was decent and affordable. Service was great.   Downtown Disney was a brisk 10 minute walk away, so no big deal.  My only complaint would be that I had to call and request that our beds be made or it wasn't done.

Recent stay here was good, arrived early, but where able to accommodate which was good. Front desk staff great and friendly, welcoming you back from your day at the park.  Room was good and clean, we had a suite with two queen beds and was huge. Was surprised though how small the bathroom was! Also was a little stuffy, wish you could open a window, to get fresh air in. We found the walk to park fine, was about 15 mins, the monorail is at the start of downtown Disney and avoids the walk through downtown, and the longer lines of main entrance to park.

Just gave another chance and spent a few nights with my family again. I must be honest, the experience was quite better than before. I do believe my very first impressions were due to the crowds and the inability to deal with them.

Summary Heading: Very close to the Disney Parks
Summary: We have stayed here twice now and we will go back on future Disney trips.  The hotel is clean and comfortable.  Both times I have found this hotel to be very good on the price considering what you are getting - which is being just a short walk from Disney.  The hotel is pretty much right next to the parking garage, so you can't get a much shorter walk.  Maybe 12-15 minutes from downtown Disney.  You walk right past the Disney parking garage, so you could probably just hop on a tram too halfway along your walk.  Plus there is a bus (I do not believe it is operated by Holiday Inn at all) that makes round trips to the park for a fee.   The bathroom is set up where the toilet and the shower are together and the sink is outside the door.  Good for families with children I suppose,

Summary Heading: Great location for the Disney parks!
Summary: We stayed here as part of a trip last September!   The hotel was nice and clean and the perfect location for the Disney parks and downtown disney!   We walked to downtown Disney to eat all 3 nights, usually took about 15 minutes and one night we got a taxi back which was about $8.  The parks are around a 20 minute walk, but a bus stops at the hotel to collect people. A return ticket was $5 when we were there.   The staff at the hotel are helpful, and the facilities are great!

Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim At check-in, my business covered all hotel charges. But, I was required give Holiday Inn my personal charge card.  I was told the charge was: "$50."   NOT!!!  My business dinner at the same Holiday Inn who was refused my card! Tracing back through my receipts, I found that the the Holiday Inn had over-charged my room to my personal card $289.00. The desk clerk offered me "Free Meals" or "Free Drinks", but these options were after my scheduled departure. In other words, that Holiday Inn's "give your card" is a solicitation for "Holiday Inn's" version identity thrift. My advice: Don't stay at "Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim," because they are dishonest.
Manager Response: Thank you for letting me know about your recent experience at the Holiday Inn and Suites in Anaheim. As with most hotels we will authorize $50 per stay top cover any incidental charges. However, if other mistakes were made, I would love the chance to fix them. Since reviews are anonymous, in order for me to help could you please contact me at the hotel. 714-535-0300.  Thank you,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: This hotel was very close to Disney, and Downtown Disney.  The rooms are nice and clean, and the breakfast prices aren't too bad at all, compared to the surrounding areas.  They had kids eat free, and a nice pool, with a little splash park for younger kids.  We ordered the in-room pizza, and that was really good also.  We also upgraded to the family suite, and it was so worth it, I would do that everytime.  It had a 2 double beds in one room, with a living room, and a pullout sofa in the other room, and a really nice bar/kitchen area with a fridge.  WE had plenty of space, and the room was set up really well.  They of course charge for parking here, but there was lots of it, with no issues getting close to our room and finding a spot.

Summary Heading: Convenient location and very helpful staff
Summary: The rooms were a bit dated but comfortable. The beds were very comfy.  The way the rooms are set up is odd, the carpet starts right at the bathroom entrance and because the bathroom is so small I assume people dry off outside the bathroom causing a damp carpet .They also use way much deodoriser covering up musky smells.The pool is great and the service in the hotel is awesome. This hotel is so convenient if you are going to Disneyland its only a few minutes away.  Restaurant was decent too
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know how your stay with us went recently. We are working on new solutions for air freshening and are excited about the potential increase in our guests' satisfaction. Thank you for the nice comments about the Holiday Inn and Suites in Anaheim. We now have a great Splash Zone for the kids to further enhance your experience the next time you are visiting Disneyland.  Best Regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: We loved this hotel and their staff.  Roy was absolutely amazing as was housekeeping and everyone else at the front desk.  It was quiet and a very pleasant walk to Disney.  Very close to the monorail which was great for getting in early and avoiding lines.  We were here with our children for vacation.  Hotel was clean and safe.  The pricing was very good-this was an excellent value. We've been To Disneyland before and stayed at Super 8 and the Fairfield and this was by far our favorite. The channel selection for the cable TV was also very good.  Even though I'm on vacation, I still like watch my regular shows after a day at the park.

And adequate room but as others noted not very clean. Carpers really scummy behind bedside table and headboards. Front desk very professional and helpful. El burrito at the mini mart up the street was good. Transit picks you up right at the hotel. Pool was warm. Probably wouldn't stay here again. Too dirty for the price.
Manager Response: We appreciate your feedback from your recent stay with us. I apologize for the condition of the carpet and I assure you we are stepping up our efforts to maintain our rooms in the best condition possible. We'd love to have you back and please feel free to call me at the hotel if I can be of any help to you booking your reservations. We have new theme suites available now. Cars, Star Wars, Fairies are some of the themes and our Splash Zone will be open within the next couple of days!  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: This hotel was fine, not what we typically experienced with holiday Inn. The staff did nothing above and beyond to make our stay memorable, however there was not an incident that was negative either. The restaurant is so high priced we never ate there, and the shuttle that we were told about was just as expensive to park a car at Disneyland. Rooms were not cleaned until later in the day, which would imply maybe needing more staff. And not close to Disneyland
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your thoughts about your recent stay with us. We apologize that you found our food overpriced but I assure you we are a great value for families especially since kids under 12 eat free with adults at any meal time. We do hope you consider us again the next time you are in Anaheim. Our 12 to 15 minute walk to the monorail stop and park entrance at Downtown Disney is found to be a big plus to our guests. And our Splash Zone for the kids will be open any day now!  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Friendly staff, close to Disneyland... but dirty room.
Summary: I stayed here as a low budget option allowing me to join my family for their first trip to Disneyland.  They stayed elsewhere on a Disney property. [They regretted spending the $$$ there as they had so much to squeeze into 4 full days they never enjoyed the amenities... splurge for 5+ days, not 3-4.  Just saying.]  Check-in, check out, billing, advice and suggestions were all great and stress free.  Staff were friendly.  They have a deal with Karmel shuttle service.  I had NO issues with this service whatsoever.  Driver who picked me up was fun to chat with.  It was $26.00 each way, pre-booked, using the link through the hotel website.  Compared to $45.00-ish each way, pre-booked, with SuperShuttle.  A good deal from LAX, I assure you.  The location is very walkable, but I know
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your experiences here. I apologize for the housekeeping issues you encountered and I assure you we are striving to improve every day. We do hope you choose our hotel again the next time you are in the area.   Thank you!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Recently returned from our trip to USA and we decided on this hotel due to the reviews. The room was OK the bathroom was poor. Beds were comfy but most of all the staff were very helpful. They assisted us with tickets, shuttles, transfers etc. The food in the resturant was great, the best part is kids eat free for all meals! I would come back however would like the bathrooms to be nicer.... Great security at night at they hire a security guard to walk all of the floors each night!

Summary Heading: Nice hotel for a few days in Disneyland
Summary: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in May 2013 whilst visiting Disneyland Anaheim. It was a very enjoyable stay, and cheap considering the area, it was clean and simple but as we spent most of our days out in the Disney parks we didn't mind as it was just somewhere to put our heads down at night. We did eat in the restaurant on one night though and the food was one of the nicest i'd eaten on my trip to America, recommend this hotel.

Was in Anaheim for work from Sunday-Friday, March 1st week and the place we normally stay was booked and this was our second choice. It is very convenient if you are taking the family on a vacation to Disneyland, this place is located right  next to the resort. The morning breakfast buffet has  lots of choices and the staff was very friendly.  The pool has a nice terrace area an in the early morning it was nice to sip some coffee or juice and work or read a paper. The rooms are okay mine came with two queens and a work station which I used for work. The wifi  worked great and the TV was a newer model.  This is a great location from my work and for the budget minded vacation goer this is the spot!

Summary Heading: December Disneyland Vacation, Roberto B was awesome.
Summary: It's been five months since our trip to Disneyland, but I wanted to finally take the time to review this hotel.  My girlfriend and I stayed in the hotel December 9-11.  We arrived super early on Monday morning the 9th and Roberto got us into our room early since it was already available.  He helped us with every question/problem we had.  My money clip wallet erased our room keys a couple of times and he fixed it, no problem.  The food at the hotel restaurant was good, and convenient.  We are planning another trip as soon as we can and will definitely be staying at this hotel again.

We stayed four nights and the hotel was exactly as we expected from the reviews: it is a low cost alternative within a short walk to the parks.  The staff was very friendly, helping us get set up with DL tickets, booking shuttles, and giving directions. We booked early and took advantage of the pizza deal which we used instead as a $20 daily voucher for the restaurant, which took care of breakfasts each day. The restaurant was nice, with good service, and the food came out FAST each morning. Also, once you have finished the pot of coffee the servers bring you for refills, there are to go cups provided to take one for the walk to the parks.  I would definitely stay here again as long as the prices remain affordable.

Summary Heading: A little dissapointed with the HI brand
Summary: This hotel was close to Disney, amazing location and much quieter than the other side. It had been recommended by a colleague who visited over xmas. I agree with all the comments about the front desk staff, VERY courteous and polite.   The room: older and mold smell. Unfortunately the room had no opening windows, so no way to get fresh air unless you use the AC.  The kitchennette had no supplies, no dishes, just 4 sets of plastic forks and napkins and plastic cups. That was a little dissapointing but.. Ok. Note bring your own dishes (BYOD). The bathroom was in dire need of repairs, mold and ripped dry wall in the corners. The hotel needs a remodel.  Our suite was 3614.  What pissed us off was someone programmed the AC to go to 50 degrees at 6 am each day, so we would wake up
Manager Response: Dear been_hereYT,  Thank you for taking the time to post a review of our property.  It is really nice to know that you liked our location.  Please accept my sincerest apologies for the air conditioning issue you experienced.  I also apologize that you had some issues with the condition of the room.  I understand the discomfort this caused you.  Rest assured that this matter will be looked into.  Again, I do apologize and regret that this impacted your experience at our hotel.  To better assist you on your next stay, please do not hesitate to approach the manager on duty.  Sincerely,  Karen G. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: Excellent - love this place.  Easy walking to Disneyland.   Great Breakfast Buffet.  Excellent & friendly:)  helpful staff.  Will always stay here.  Just need a shortcut door:) into the Disneyland Parking Garage to shorten the walk just a wee bit.

Summary Heading: A block from Disneyland....well, sort of.
Summary: Our 7 night stay at this Holiday Inn was good overall.  Front counter staff are excellent and very helpful and friendly.  Top marks to all of them.  We stayed in building 3: room 3219.  The first number of your room denotes the building you are in.  So, our room was in building 3, 2nd floor.  We arrived late for check in and I was a little boggled by the numbering system, but that was because I was super tired from driving and exploring LA.    The gift shop in the lobby was well stocked with Disney souvenirs and other necessities.   We bought a yo yo and it was defective.  Returned and received a new one without issue.    Our 2nd floor room was very spacious with a view of the Mickey and Friends parking structure facing the south of the hotel.  One thing that I wish we had was a

This place was not at all what I expected. First let me start by saying they do have comfortable beds and it is close to Disneyland for driving purposes. They do have a nice giftshop with reasonable prices. Too bad it is seperate from the rooms. I thought because it was a Holiday Inn it would be nicer. Anyway, this building is very old. The elevator is tiny and I didnt know if it would hold 6 people and all our luggage (luckily it did) The room was small. The toilet, shower and light/fan was so loud you could hear in next door. Also when a bar of soap was dropped on the floor and  picked it up there was a long hair which did not belong to us. The restaurant had great ambiance with the princesses on the walls and stuffed animal Disney characters hanging from the ceiling. However
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay with us. We apologize for the issues you mentioned. I assure you I am addressing them with our housekeeping and restaurant staff. We do appreciate your business and do hope you would reconsider staying with us again.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Mamager

Summary: We primarily wanted a hotel close to Disneyland that was not too expensive and clean.  This hotel did fit that criteria. 15 minute walk to Disneyland and the restaurants etc.  Note there is literally nothing around this hotel except a gas station. So if you do need anything or want to eat outside the hotel you do have to walk.  We didn't mind this.  Weird fact - No fridge in room it costs extra if you ask they will pop one in the room for you. The room was clean, bed comfy but bathrooms are pretty bad - the shower was terrible, the whole bathroom needed replacing.  Also if you are flying into lax - take the Disneyland shuttle to Disneyland Resort and walk from there its super easy and its affordable.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing our hotel and we thank you for your feedback. We will be replacing all shower fixtures in the very near future. With our Splash Zone coming this spring we hope to see you again soon!  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Family, Kids, and Pets are truly welcome
Summary: My family's first trip to Disneyland, in Anaheim, California. For my grandaughter's 7th birthday. This hotel and their staff, we feel, went out of their way to make every aspect of our trip a pleasent and memorable one. From navigating the transportation to and from the hotel and Disneyland, to the comfort of the room, and service for our pets. Major Thanks especially to Veronica and Kevin. You guys are the best!!! Thank you again for the memories!

Our family has been coming here from Australia three times in four years, second time stayed for 3 weeks. We love it here. The two bedroom is fantastic and easily accommodates 6, this time we had the Pirate Room. The kids were so excited the first night they couldn't sleep. A couple of staff have still been there from the first time we stayed in 2010 and they still remembered us! Exactly a mile from Disney, very easy walk through Downtown. We felt very safe walking even at 11pm. Otherwise the ART is great, if your going to stay a while and planning on going to Disney every day, buy a 3 or 5 day pass much more cost effective. Oh and discounts tickets can only be bought at the self service machines at Disney stop, bit silly that the hotels don't stock them. Restaurant food was

Summary Heading: Stay away if you need a suite!!!!!
Summary: When we checked into this hotel after a long day of traveling we were informed by the desk clerk that our suite which we had prepaid for and booked months in advance was not available she offered us two separate rooms that were down the hall from each other this was a ridiculous solution as we were clearly traveling with two small children and a suite was essential for us due to their ages and the fact that they are extremely light sleepers. After more time spent at the desk the clerk informed us that the room had been smoked in, and this was why it was not available to us.we did eventually get the suite after much stress and messing around- not the way to start a holiday after being in airports all day :-( While in the lobby we heard two other families getting the same run
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We apologize for the issue with the room type at check in. If you would like to call me directly at the hotel to give me more information I can research what happened and discuss with you further. We don't intentionally overbook suites here and we are very sorry this happened.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: The only reason why 4 stars:  Location!
Summary: If you are a walker/in physical shape and don't mind walking another 30 minutes while walking the theme parks most of the day, then this place is for you!  For the price, this hotel is amazing and beautiful.  Cleanliness, modern establishments, comfortable beds, and great AC are the reasons to stay here.  This Holiday Inn is just like any other Holiday Inn.   It is true it is one block away from Disneyland.  What you don't know is you have to pass three parking lots to get to Downtown Disney, walk through Downtown Disney, and then you are at the parks.  It is about a 15 minute walk, so 30 minutes of walking round-trip.  You can opt to take the Holiday Inn shuttle for a fee, but we like to get the exercise.  I do have to say at the end of the day when you are done with Disney the

The Hotel Staff is courteous, The Location is VERY near to Disneyland just take a 2-3 Day Park Hopper and There could be no better option if you are travelling on a budget. The Lobby has the Disney feel to it. The Pool is pretty cool and you can see Disney's Firework Show from the poolside area as well.

Summary Heading: Exceptional Service for a 20th Anniversary Surprise
Summary: My wife and I desired a trip to celebrate our 20th anniversary and decided to take our kids to Disneyland. As others have shared, this hotel is within easy walking distance of Downtown Disney and the theme parks. The facility was extremely clean, and the breakfast buffet offered a wonderful assortment of food and beverages.  Yet, what impressed "me" the most was the assistance by the hotel staff for a romantic surprise. I contacted the hotel by email about three weeks before our departure date; I asked for ideas that were available at their site. Revenue Manager Craig replied very quickly and made some wonderful recommendations ... including Mickey Mouse-like cookies from their restaurant. He stated that the staff would be more than happy to place my gifts (such as flowers) in

My family and I have stayed here in the past twice in the past and finally decided to write a review, As far as location it is a block away and yes but a far block. The Staff was fine I will not say great. The Pros: You can look out of your Hotel room and see the Disneyland fireworks, the drinks and appetizers were priced well I have to admit, and next door there is a gas station to get snacks and drinks. Cons: No refrigerators which is very upsetting because when you travel from another state and have needs such as food and drinks it helps so much and I'm sure you know that. My biggest complaint was that they charged to put a refrigerator in the room and when I did make my complaint to the person at the front desk he said oh you got this hotel booking it from Priceline and why
Manager Response: Dear Sleepy505,  Thank you for your feedback about your stay. It is good to know that our location was convenient for your needs. However, please accept my apologies if the level of customer service received on this occasion was not up to par. I have taken note of your feedback and this shall be forwarded to the appropriate departments to consider for improvements needed in our efforts.  Regards,  Pam G Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: I had the best customer service ever, very professional and very kind, I will be going back with no hesitation. I experienced a rude customer and with your staff, I was amazed how they handled them.With a smile on their face, they still took care of business.

This is a way over the top of the line Holiday Inn.   The location is 5 minutes walk to the Disneyland Mickey and Friends Tram. The Staff SUPER HELPFUL and ULTRA FRIENDLY.  Rooms CLEAN,  Breakfast either off a Buffett or off the MEnu.  Parking on sight, WIFI works fine.  Price is well set for the value.  Would stay anytime again and again.

After a long day at Disney it was a treat to stay at this Holiday Inn.  Clean, fresh, pool, hot tub, friendly staff, and wonderful buffet breakfast included.  The beds were outstanding...soft but firm and very fresh.

My wife and I stayed here for a Disneyland vacation. The bed and location were fine, and the staff who greeted us on day one were very pleasant.   However, upon checkout they tried to charge us an additional $250 "smoking fee". My wife and I don't smoke, so I went down to the lobby to inquire what this was regarding. Then the front desk employee told me that on the previous day at 2pm, housekeeping walked into our room and caught my wife and I smoking marijuana. At first I thought this accusation was some kind of prank. My wife and I are deeply religious people, we don't smoke marijuana, AND we were at Disneyland the entire day that they claimed this incident occurred.  I tried to be reasonable and suggest this must be some kind of mistake (maybe housekeeping wrote the wrong
