Manager Response: Dear David S,  Thank you for taking the time to express your thoughts and concerns regarding your stay with us. We are disappointed and concerned to read your comments. We rely on you, our guest, to let us know how we are doing and how we can better meet your needs. We have taken note and wish to thank you for all your comments. We have sent you a private message in an effort to obtain additional information.  Sincerely,  Joel B Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: The location is excellent, walking distance to disneyland/downtown disney, allowed to leave car until midnight after checkout.  The staff at the front desk was very nice.  Cons:  pay for parking, rooms are redone yet show age and have a mildew smell, can't get a reserve a specific bed size, and hotel restaurant is MORE expensive then food at disney!  The price wasn't worth it to me.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for taking the time to let us know about your recent experience. I assure you we are addressing the issues you experienced with your sleeping room.  Most of our bookings do guarantee room types but there are some that do not and this is clearly stated at the time of booking. This is also true of many other booking sites. Also, our parking does have a fee but is practically the lowest of any full service hotel next to Disneyland at $10 per car per night plus tax. We do hope you would visit us again on your next trip to Anaheim. With our new Splash Zone opening soon we are certain you will enjoy your experience here.  Thank you,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Front dest guy Kevin will go out of the way to make your stay as great as possible. Some of the best customer service I have ever received from a hotel. Jose the bar tender is extremely friendly and one of the best and restaurant has a very good selection of food choices. This is one hotel that I will recommend this one to anyone that ask where to stay in the area. Beds are very comfortable and rooms are very spacious and very clean.

Summary Heading: Excellent location very close to Disneyland!!
Summary: Affordable accommodation close to Disneyland! Rooms were clean but basic and there were renovations occurring! Overall decent accommodation that would be affordable for a family! This hotel had the best apple cobbler for room service that I have ever eaten!!

Summary Heading: excellent staff, good food, clean rooms
Summary: Kevin and the rest of the front desk staff are extremely friendly and very helpful. This was our first trip to Anaheim and we never once left the lobby without smiles and laughter. They all put in a great effort to make getting around easy and stress free. Our daughter left  a stuffed toy on the bed while we were out and was overjoyed to return and find it tucked into bed by the cleaning staff. This extra mile attitude will have us here again the next time we travel here. It is an easy walk to Disneyland even with our youngest being 4 years old although she had to be carried back at the end of the day.

I would like to thank and congratulate the excelent attention of Kevin of the Holliday Inn Hotel in Anaheim. The hotel is in a great location and has very pleasant Rooms. I recommend and when you're there, look for Kevin Rodrigo Bustamante

We had booked two nights here but decided to stay on an extra night as we were very happy. When we checked in we didn't like the room as the air conditioning was a bit noisy but the hotel were very helpful and gave us another straight away. Staff couldn't have been more helpfu and went out of their way It's only a 10 to 15 minute walk to Disney so very convenient. The breakfast wasn't included but it was surmising ly good and good value. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: Good, close, but still a walk. Extra for Parking!
Summary: We took this hotel because of its cheap rates and being so close to Disney. The hotel did not dissapoint. Rooms were very nice, though the bathrooms could be updated. You can see the fireworks show from your room if you face towards disneyland. Have to pay extra for parking on arrival..per vehichle. It was like 24 dollars a day.

Summary Heading: Perfect Hotel for your Disney Vacation
Summary: If you are looking for a place to stay on your Disney vacation..you gotta consider this place. It is close to Disneyland parks, it is just behind the parking lot for Disneyland. It's 8-10 mins walk going to the tram ride or you can walk all the way to the gates for a good 15-18 mins cardio exercise. Aside from the location, the service is amazing, great staff and clean rooms. Free wifi, heated pool, nice & simple gym. if you book it early, you'll get a good price. My daughter loves going back to Disneyland and we will definitely book our stay here the next time we go...it's not a 5star hotel but everything here is awesome. Kudos to the staff and we will see you again on our next Disneyland vacation.

So I m going to get the con out of the way so you aren't waiting for the "but..." at the end.  THE WALK. It isn't quite a mile but close....it's long enough for Older people to pay for the ART bus pass. But for the avid disneyland goer you will be fine. Now that that's out, the service has been amazing and the newly renovated lobby is very welcoming and of 5 star caliber. KEVIN at the front desk greeted me with a smile and welcomed my family to the area with some great tips on eateries and walking paths. The Breakfast buffet isn't free but kids will eat free with paid adult and the food is excellent. Our room was clean and the towels smelled fresh; not like chlorine. I don't think we will have time to use the small water playground or gym but both look usable and are great

As IHG members, we try to stay at IHG hotels whenever we travel.  For Disneyland, we narrowed our search to two hotels - the Hotel Indigo and this hotel.  While we love the Hotel Indigo, we weren't happy with the location of the one in Anaheim, whereas this Holiday Inn was an easy and safe walk to Disneyland (no crazy main streets like Harbor Blvd.), and it had great reviews.  When we got here, we were upgraded to a suite for our entire stay which was a nice perk.  The front desk staff were excellent and very accommodating.  Our room was really nice and clean and the beds were ridiculously comfortable.  Parking is only $10 per night (cheap compared to other hotels in the area) and there is a shuttle available for taking you to Disneyland, although we chose to walk each time.

Summary Heading: 15 minutes from the gates of Disney
Summary: If you are looking for a place to crash after a long day in the magic kingdom this is the place. Clean, comfortable and great staff. And almost half the price of the Disneyland hotel and well worth it. You can still have character dining in the Disneyland Hotel and The California grand without having to stay there and with all of your savings from staying at the holiday inn you can afford it!   If you are staying when the weather is warmer there is an impressive splash park and swimming pool to unwind in.   Kids eat free in their restaurant as well!

Went there in December 2012 for IEEE Globecom at Disneyland Hotel. This is a reasonable option due to budget but very handy location. ART buses are very convenient and you can purchase the tickets at the lobby shop. Or 10 minutes walk to Disneyland with nice walkway. The room is reasonable and comfortable.

My family of 7 stayed here for a week and found it to be just awesome. Kevin at the front desk went above and beyond to help us and make sure we were satisfied and got to where we wanted to be.  He was very genuine and took the time to stop and visit with us and ask about our day!  Very impressed and will recommend this hotel to others for sure!  Thank you Kevin and Staff!  Stephanie Bignell, Alberta, Canada

Summary Heading: 15 min brisk walk to Disneyland parks.
Summary: PROS:  ~Modern, clean, renovated hotel. ~Pleasant staff. ~15 min brisk walk to Disneyland. They gave us a map and showed us how to get there. ~In-room amenities like coffee maker, hair-dryer, flat screen, free WiFi, alarm clocks, A/C, basic toiletries. ~Spacious room with comfy pillows and nice linens. ~Quiet. ~Clean. ~Elevators. ~Spacious modern lobby.  ~Easy to find from freeway.  CONS: ~$10 outdoor parking, but cheaper than the Disneyland parks.  We booked this hotel for one night through an on-line bidding web site, so our rate didn't include breakfast. We were very pleased with the hotel and the fact we were able to leave our car there and walk to the parks. The hotel backs onto the perimeter of the park's parking structure.  I give this hotel 5 'green circles' in it's

Stayed for two nights while visiting Disneyland. Had an amazing stay. Jay(I believe was his name) at the front desk was really nice, very helpful with information, and gave us great rooms. Had a few drinks in the cute little bar there. Jose was our bartender and he gave us great food and drink recommendations and was super friendly! Breakfast was delicious. Our server was great and service was very fast. Wish I had a chance to use the heated pool. Definitely will return to this Holiday Inn next time I'm in the area!

Found this hotel by booking a "Top Secret Hotel" with Travelocity. We stayed here on our last night in Anaheim and regretted not staying here our entire trip. The rooms were very nice and spacious, and most importantly, clean! We stayed in a Motel 6 prior to staying here, and in comparison, this was a Luxury stay. The hotel is very close to Disneyland, within walking distance, also backs up to the massive Disney parking structure. The downside, you have to pay for parking, but that is the same with many hotels near Disneyland.   The front desk staff was "friendly" to a certain extent, but we did not feel welcome. To top it off, the front desk had difficulty seeing the transaction from Travelocity and insisted repeatedly that the room was not paid for, and I would be charged the

Summary Heading: Clean, convenient hotel with friendly staff.
Summary: Great hotel with some of the friendliest staff I've ever encountered.  We stayed for 4 days (Jan 31-Feb 4) without a vehicle and had no issue getting around.  Downtown Disney, Disneyland, and California Adventure are all within walking distance (about 15 min walk to Downtown Disney).  There is also a gas station next to the hotel which was great for picking up snacks/drinks.  Rooms are nice, clean, and modern.  Restaurant in the hotel also had great food for a reasonable price.

Summary Heading: Convenient, clean, and we enjoyed a wonderful meal in the restaurant by the pool.
Summary: If you are looking fir a place to stay near Disneyland, I recommend this Holiday Inn. We didn't get a suite room, but when we inquired about a refrigerator, they had one delivered to our room prior to our checking in. This hotel is family friendly, clean, the windows open, and walking distance to Disneyland. We walked to Downtown Disney, had dinner at the House of Blues, and then saw a movie at the Disney theater. The next night we enjoyed a wonderful meal at the restaurant in the hotel. The chicken flautus, nachos  supreme, and chowder was an awesome meal! Everything very tasty and fresh. The staff here are friendly, and parking is close to the rear entrance. Recommend this hotel, and I would return to dine at this restaurant even if we weren't staying here.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your kind words!! We do appreciate your business and would love to host you again on your next visit.. BTW-- I've shared your comments with our Chef and it made his day.  Thanks much!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Convenient, Close to Disneyland, Excellent Customer Service
Summary: I stayed at the holiday inn for one night for the Disney Half-Marathon in Sept 2013 as well as in Jan 2014. Staff was excellent especially Kevin. Good location for Disney races since it is less than 5 minutes away (walking distance).

My family just returned from a week there. The property is an older one but What hospitality we enjoyed, even tho we checked in 2 days late due to an airline issues in Bellingham WA.We were warmly welcomed upon arrival and given great attentive service particularly by Kevin at the front desk and Girsel in the dining room. Many favors were extended to us, kids dined free, .Would return in a heartbeat, and give it top rating.Shuttles to and from Disney and airports are easy and reasonable
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know how your trip went! Your shout out to Kevin and Girsel made their day and mine too! We do hope to see you again next time you come to visit the Happiest Place on Earth!  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: We stayed at the holiday inn for 5 nights in the princess suite with 2 adults and 2 kids (a 3 year old and 3 month old) We had lots of space and the refridgerator was a nice bonus. Staff was friendly and helpful.  We ate a few meals in the restaurant that were all pretty good. The pool area is nice although we didn't spend much time there. We walked to and from disney land - it took us 15-20 minutes with 2 strollers through downtown disney. Seems like a long walk but we did it for 4 days in a row and didn't mind at all. We would definitely stay again.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing our hotel for your time at the Magic Kingdom. We are please you had a good time and we do hope to be your host the next time you visit Anaheim.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: We recently stayed here for 3 nights while enjoying Disneyland.  We have been staying here for a number of years and through their remodeling and updating.  The hotel has a small bar and restaurant.  The Hotel is clean and the staff is very helpful, accommodating, and professional.  The Hotel has a Anaheim Rapid Transit stop on a regular schedule to take guests to and from the Disneyland Park for a very reasonable fee.  It is also extremely close to the Disney parking area and within easy walking distance to downtown Disney and Disneyland/California Adventure.  I would suggest a flashlight if returning by foot at night.  The street is lighted but a flashlight would be helpful.  Watch for packages for this Hotel as you can find some great deals at times.  And BTW, if you are

We stayed here for 3 nights and I have zero complaints! I think some of the reviewers on here look for complaints and if I wanted to be picky, I could say it's an older building, but is has obviously undergone major updating and for the price and location, you can't beat it. Jennifer R and the front desk team were the best I've dealt with at any hotel. Always available, helpful and super friendly. People have complained about the location, and we timed it, a 7 minute (slowish) walk to the Disneyland parkade with the free trams. So very doable with strollers or children over 5. I used the fitness centre all 3 nights and it was in good condition wi a tv and water cooler. I would suggest expanding on free weight selection and maybe a bosh or stability ball. Rooms are clean and beds

As a IHG platinum member I am constantly staying in hotels throughout the year for business. A good majority of the time the HI and Crowne Plaza are stingy with upgrades and perks. This hotel was not! They sought to upgrade my family (traveling with me) and I voluntarily, offered us bottled water, and made us feel welcome. The pick a perk package is a fabulous deal- $25 food credit at the restaurant. The restaurant was very reasonable for high quality food and the service was exceptional. The servers/hosts were extremely friendly. The room was modern and equipped. Many times it's the little things-like plenty of outlets for ironing and charging phones-that make the difference. This hotel had it. The kids splash area, coming soon, looks to be another attraction. Walk to Disney

Close to Disnleyland, and a decent base for us to explore LA too. The reception always seemed understaffed and after waiting in queue to get their attention, they weren't ever very keen to help. Parking required an extra fee, yet it was in short supply so you had to do rounds of the lot to find a spot every time. Rooms were ok, housekeeping staff was very nice. We stayed in a bunch of Holiday Inns throughout that trip and this one was the least good.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your feedback. I sincerely apologize for the service deficiencies at our front desk. Our Guest Service Agents take great pride in their service and they are committed to not letting this happen again. Thank you for your kind comments about our housekeeping staff. They work very hard and will be thrilled they were able to please you.  We do hope to see you again in the future. Please feel free to contact me at the hotel anytime if I can be of assistance.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: We had a wonderful stay at Holiday Inn and suites! We were worried that our walk would be long to Disneyland but it wasn't bad at all! The location was convenient! The rooms were nice and clean. I really appreciate the hotels manager Kevin for helping us with our room! Thank you for a safe and wonderful stay!

We stayed here only for the last night of our trip to SoCal, but I wish we had more time at this hotel. The service was excellent and the room was great - we were upgraded to a suite. I would have loved to stay here longer. It is a short walk to Downtown Disney.

Servers were friendly and gave us excellent service; manger Gisel (?spelling) was friendly and efficient and Veronica was so helpful at the front desk.  Would certainly stay again.  We were a short walk to Disneyland but our room was quiet.

I typically don't give reviews and when I do including employee reviews I don't give 5 stars across the board. However based on my many years of traveling around the world I felt my stay at The Holiday Inn Anaheim was exactly the experience I expect particularly when I'm vacationing at Disneyland. I felt the friendliness of the staff from the onset was conducive with the happy experience of being at Disneyland. I felt the staff was happy and enjoyed their job, their hospitality is exceptional. The room was very clean and comfortable. If I could recommend a change it would be that the rooms have refrigerators and microwave. Especially when centrally located near Disneyland. I ended up having to bring a ice chest which is inconvenient. I really enjoyed the chicken piccata. I would

I want to thank Tom Van Winkle for being so very nice and kind he made my grand daughter feel so welcome it was her first surprise trip to Disneyland . The staff was so friendly and helpful I told them  I was surprising my grand daughter and they where great.  Also Angela came out and welcomed us and answered all the questions we had, thank you Angela for being so sweet to my grand daughter. Our room was fantastic and room service was really good  Mr van winkle I would really like to complement you on a great staff, they really know how to make you feel welcome, so I'm sure it comes from great leader ship. Once again thank you all for the hospitality.

Summary Heading: Old building and staff are not welcome
Summary: Dec 15 I was stay for 3 night at Anaheim Holiday Inn. My point of view is this hotel close to my business trip location near Disneyland Resort as i am a member of IHG club. I have been stay at Holiday Inn such as Beijing, Guangzou, HK, Thailand, Indonesia. Express or not, but never have experience like i had at Holiday Inn Anaheim. Staff are not welcome, breakfast menu is standard compare to the price i have to pay. Lift is so old and terrible. I am not recommended this hotel to other IHG member.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your experience here. We do apologize that we fell short of your expectations and I assure you I have addressed the issues with my front desk and restaurant staff. We do hope you would reconsider us again the next time your are in the Anaheim area.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: The Holiday Inn and Suites is pretty standard Holiday Inn accommodation worldwide - comfortable and clean but not exceptional rooms at a reasonable price.  Check in is a bit later than standard (4pm).  It's located a reasonable distance from the theme parks and other amenities (restaurants, supermarkets etc.) and you'll certainly want to use the regular bus service that links the hotels in the area with Disneyland, Knotts Berry Farm, Supermarkets and the Outlets at Orange Mall.  A $5 ticket gets you a full day of bus travel - you will do enough walking in the theme parks!  What made the difference for our stay was the friendly personalised service we received from the  concierge Robert who went out of his way to assist us.  This is a hotel that has a great friendly vibe to it -

Room was old and dated. Grout was dirty and broken tile in bath. Parking lot had shipping containers and dump trucks clogging it from construction next door. They made it tight. Staff was friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. Our location close to Downtown Disney and the monorail park entrance there is very popular with our valued guests. We do have easy access from Ball Rd. to Interstate 5 only 5 minutes from our hotel. We would love to show everyone how easily our hotel can used as a base for exploring not only the Disneyland resort but all of Southern California's great attractions.  We do hope you will come back and see us soon!  Best Regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Although there is nothing wrong with this hotel, it is not one I would wish to revisit. The locaton leaves much to be desired- it is on the Disneyland 'campus', but about as far away as you can get from the Park while remaining 'on site'- but Anaheim and LA are not readily accessable from it. So unless Disneyland is your thing, this is not for you- and unless you are a reasonable walker, you'll need to take a shuttle bus to the Park and/or village. Best description of the hotel is probably 'tired'- nothing to take exception to, but nothing memorable either. Be sure to read the breakfast options- the buffet may not be best value on offer. Coffee is good, and I can recommend the pancakes (one stack for two people will probably suffice). Overall, the food is good (and watch out for
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and letting us know about your recent stay with us. We do offer a great location and for those not wishing to stroll the 15 minutes to the park entrance at the Monorail stop, the Anaheim Resort Transportation coaches stop at our front door about every 20 minutes. For $5 for adults and $2 for children 3-9 it is a great alternative to walking.  Glad you liked the pancakes! Taco Tuesday is also a favorite!  We do hope you come visit us again soon!  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: I really enjoyed this location.  The facility is nice. There is some construction going on.  But the service was great.  There is security on the grounds. They also accept pets.  Good  for family trip. Hotel seems up to date as far as accommodations.

Good for the price. Enjoyed our stay. Good breakfast. Fernando was extremely helpful. It was very handy to be able to purchase our Disneyland tickets at the front desk.  We were also able to get passes for the shuttle to Disneyland.

We used Priceline name your price and got this hotel. We did not know that at the time we were going they were going to be renovating. The front desk was in a portable trailer. The continental breakfast was in a tent in the parking lot. Despite the renovations our stay was very good.

We go to Disneyland once a year, so I have been to several hotels in the area and this was my least favorite. The location is nearby (not walkable in my opinion - but I have a little one), and the lobby and restaurant are very nice. The room was what I was not impressed with. Luckily, when we go to Disneyland we aren't there to stay in the room - we are out and about the whole time. The room was just kind of grimy and very cramped once the stroller and crib were in the room. The price was right though! So all in all - not a bad place to stay for the price - but definitely not my top pick in the area.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments. I have informed our housekeeping staff about your room condition and they are working diligently to ensure all of rooms look great for our guests. While our rooms are larger than many hotels in the area I should point out we have very large suites available for families traveling that need room to stretch out and enjoy their time in Anaheim! Our two bedroom suites have themed d√©cor including Disney inspired movies, a pirate themed suite and a princess and classical Disney movie themed suite.  Thank you,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: We were so pleased with the Holiday Inn on our most recent visit.  Our daughter and son-in-law have stayed with you many times but this was our first trip.  The hotel staff (and I'm embarrassed because I should have kept their names) were nothing but pleasant from our first call to ask questions and get a reservation (I called the local hotel, not the 800 Number) to our calling to confirm our reservation, to call and ask questions, directions, etc. to even making sure that if we got in early, they could hold our luggage in order for us to go and do what we wanted to do prior to check-in. Every employee greeting us with a smile and the same question . . . what can we do for you!  They had a restaurant which also fulfilled our needs, the wait staff was excellent, the food was

Summary Heading: Great place to stay and visit Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here in June 2013 for four nights.  Hotel was clean, parking was free with Priority club membership, and it was only a 5 min walk to the parking lot at Disneyland where we boarded the tram with transportation to the main gate.

Miguel was our server this morning in the restaurant. He was very friendly attentive and the food was great. I work at a holiday inn full service hotel and he is definitely an asset to your team! He deserves employee of the month!!!

The price was fairly good, the staff were able help us with most of our questions and let us check in an hour early. The rooms were clean and warm. The location is good, about a ten minute walk to the disneyland entrance. I was pretty happy with our stay and the cleaners were amazing!!

Summary Heading: Wonderful hotel great alternative to Disneyland resorts
Summary: This hotel is fantastic! Free wifi to keep in contact with family. Free parking (we had an offer) and the beds very comfortable. Big enough bathroom and great location. 10 minute drive down the road from Anaheim Plaza (Walmart superstore, forever21), 15 minutes from Knotts Berry Farm and a 5 minute shuttle ride (which a very frequent and only $5 for an all day pass) straight outside the doors of Disneyland. The restaurant downstairs has great staff and great priced food that is delicious. The only negatives are that the lifts are a little slow & you can hear the next door neighbours shower going. Good little gym too. All in all fantastic hotel for a couple or family to stay whilst visiting Anaheim. Kevin at the front desk was fantastic.

Fantastic hotel - all staff very friendly and helpful.  The rooms were very spacious and comfortable with a choice of pillows which was a nice touch.  Great location for Disneyland and the shuttles were very frequent.  Would recommend for anyone visiting Anaheim.  Breakfast was good and very varied.

Summary Heading: Great value! Easy shuttle to Disneyland, clean and spacious rooms
Summary: Our family of 5 stayed here for 3 nights. Although we didn't spend a lot of time at the hotel, it was a great hotel for Disneyland. The shuttle came frequently and was quick and easy! I wouldn't recommend walking-especially with young children. The rooms were spacious and beds comfortable. The bathrooms are a bit worn and dated but clean. The front desk and restaurant was sometimes a little slow but always polite. This hotel is wonderful value for money! Will be back.

Summary Heading: I was given awesome service by staff members Jennifer (manager) and Kevin ( front desk).
Summary: Awesome hotel to stay in when visiting the Magic Kingdom; Disneyland.  Magical service with a smile!  Kevin was awesome, and so wad Jennifer!!  Thank you Holiday Inn Staff members, will definately visit/ stay with your hotel again.   Tammy Gonis Customer
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind comments. We appreciate you choosing our hotel and hope to see you again!  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: very clean, very friendly, great distance from the park.  staff was very very friendly.  i plan on returning to this hotel.  its not really a block away from the disneyland its a block from the disneyland parking garage.  Its about 3 blocks or half a mile from the park.  Takes about 20-30 minutes.
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us. We are glad you liked the pizza and our great location!  Come see us again soon!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Flying out of John Wayne the next day and shouldn't have stayed north of CA-55, but once I fought through traffic the hotel was a welcome sight.  Unfortunately the room I was assigned was either not yet checked out or not yet cleaned.  Fortunately after I made my way back to the front desk, he gave me a suite for my inconvenience.  Appreciated it.  Just remember that you are close to Disney so the sounds of the shoot-out are really just fireworks.

Summary Heading: Not as close as advertised unless you're a bird.
Summary: This hotel claims to be a block from the Disneyland resort, and that's true, so far as it goes. However, that's only as the bird flies. As the pedestrian walks, it's a good mile. The hotel's parking lot is backed up against Disney's Mickey and Friends parking garage...but you can't cut through there to use the shuttle. No, you have to walk all the way around a very large city block to get to it, nearly 3/4 of a mile, to use the shuttle for the last half mile. So, while it isn't false advertising, it is certainly misleading. The room was clean and quiet. There is no microwave or fridge which is a convenience I've come to depend on as I have food allergies. Otherwise the property is average. The bed was far too firm for my taste, but my husband thought it was fine.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your comments. While most of our guests love our location and the 15 minute walk to the Downtown Disney park entrance at the Monorail stop, I do apologize if this walk distance seemed misleading.   We do hope you will consider us again the next time you are in the area. With our Splash Zone for the kids coming soon, free internet access, kids under 12 eating free and much more, we know all of our new and returning guests will have a great time here.  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: I visited Disneyland for the first time about a month ago and chose this hotel simply for location and name recognition.  It was a short, tree lined walk to the parks and DTD and that was my #1 priority.  The rooms are typical hotel rooms, nothing fancy but in good condition, clean, and exactly what I expected from a Holiday Inn.  The beds and bedding were comfortable but I wasn't a fan of the pillows and will bring my own next time.  I spent most of my time in DTD and the parks but the first night I had a couple of hours and took advantage of the free wifi and watched TV, no problems with either.  Basically this is a clean and comfortable hotel, nothing special, but no negatives either and it took care of all my needs at a decent price.  I was in the last building (6?) and the

We stayed here from the 1 - 15 November and really couldn't have asked for more.   We had a family suite and the only thing that was a downside was although we had a fridge and microwave there was no cutlery or plates in the room so it meant it was difficult to have breakfasts or takeaway meals in the room.   The upside was we had to to the restaurant for breakfasts.   The staff were awesome a huge thank you to Jose and Maria for looking after us so well.   Really good food and very reasonably priced.   Cheaper than most of the others around Disney and much better value. The front desk staff couldn't have been more helpful and we were always treated to a "welcome back' or cheery "hello" as we entered the hotel. Easy walking distance from Downtown Disney and well serviced by the

Despite renovation efforts there is a musty old smell in the hallways and lifts. Lifts are very old. We had a kitchenette but there was absolutely no equipment to use this eg no utensils, plates etc. the room service was ok. Don't expect quality but its ok for a short stay and not too far to disneyland
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay with us. I do apologize for the shortcomings you experienced. We have put utensils for our guests in all of our suites with the kitchenettes and are making sure we freshen our hallway carpets more often and thoroughly.  We do hope you give us another look next time you are in the area. We would love the chance to host you again.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Needed a reasonably priced hotel near Disneyland, and chose this Holiday Inn due to location (an easy 3 block walk), and price (including breakfast each day). Quiet. Clean, comfortable beds, large rooms, housekeeping staff friendly and efficient.  A well lit area for returning at night in the dark, felt safe. Tickets available for purchase to Disneyland and California Adventure on premises.  I would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disney
Summary: The hotel has nicely renovated, clean, and quiet rooms.  Ample sundries store (no liquor like other hotels' stores and limited foodstuffs - a lot of merch).  Really nice restaurant.  We were thinking standard hotel/motel food.  But it was a very nice menu (with breakfast buffet if you wanted) and very acceptable, if not downright good,  food.  Like a Denny's/Shari's/Elmer's type.    Prices were VERY legit.  No gouging because you are vacation.  Kids eat free, so that was a bonus.  Really nice pool area, with the warmest pool water I've ever been in.  Almost not a relief from the afternoon heat.  But fun and clean.  Staff was friendly and attentive.  We'd give this a 5, except the restaurant/bar was closed from 2-4pm - so no afternoon snacks before heading back to the parks.  And

I like this hotel , because it is always clean . It is on the backside of disneyland , but I take the ART bus or walk to the backside of downtown disney from here. It is a quiet hotel and clean. I never had a problem here. Have stayed 7 or more times here.The last time was in October for 2 nights . the gift store in the hotel has lots of souvenirs , and nicely priced.

Summary Heading: Friendly staff, good beds, nearby disneyland.
Summary: Stayed at the hotel from 4 - 10 november and were really satisfied. Staff was nice and really helpful. We had free wi-fi in the room and pc/printing also free. Rooms were nice and clean and housekeeping did a good job keeping it that way! Hotel is on walking distance of downtown disney and shuttle service to disneyland was nice and easy too. Overall had a good stay and would defenitely come back again!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us! We are very happy you had a good time here. Our entire staff is looking forward to seeing you again!  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Horrible Customer Service on Management's Part
Summary: I guess I should have read some of the other reviews before booking here. I am extremely disappointed by the lack of customer service. I booked way in advance, only to find a cheaper rate (a savings of almost $30/per night) a couple of weeks later. Even though my rate is non-refundable, my confirmation email did say that if I found a lower advertised rate that the first night is free. Unfortunately, getting a hold of someone who is helpful and the power to credit our first night is a completely different story.     Over the course of a week and a half, I talked to a series of people. Only one of the people that I spoke to seemed like he cared, although he stated that he was unable to help me. Over that same time period, I left three messages, two of which were for the Sales
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about your recent experience with booking our hotel. I do apologize for the confusion regarding our best price internet guarantee. I know you have spoken to our Reservations Manager and he explained the policy but should you have any other questions please contact me at 714-535-0300.  We do hope you enjoy and the rest of your party enjoy your future stay with us.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: This hotel was quite nice. Rooms were updated. It is quite close to Disneyland. If you are walking to Disneyland it is about a block and a half to the parking lot for Downtown Disney. The restaurant was good not great. It was also updated. The staff were all nice except for 1 male manager that helped my husband check in first. Very rude! Overall good experience.

We stayed at the Holiday inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim from November 2-9, 2013.  We had a 1 bedroom suite for ourselves and our two children, aged 5 and 3.  Checkin was painless and soon we were into our room.  The 1 bedroom suite was spacious and included a small kitchenette with a larger bar fridge, sink, microwave, and pod-type coffeemaker.  Although no cutlery or dishware is provided, they do give you coffee and tea.  Lovely toiletries are in the bathroom.  Great flat screen TV's with lots of channels.  Comfy beds with clean white linen.  This hotel, as is the case in nearly all hotels in the Disneyland area, is older, however they have done renovations to try to bring the hotel up to snuff.  The hallways are bright and clean, nice new-looking carpets (not a huge thing, but
Manager Response: Hello and thank you for your kind comments. We are thrilled you had a good time here. I very much appreciate your suggestion regarding the seating outside by the pool. I'm working on a solution and hope to put your suggestion in place within 2 weeks.   We hope to see you again soon!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: We had a fantastic time. Kevin at the desk was the Best! Great sense of humor and always ready to please. Miguel in the restaurant for breakfast started our days on a happy jovial foot - great food too! The jacuzzi was clean and perfect temperature. Beds were clean and very comfortable, and we all LOVED the pillows! Four to each double bed, two soft and two hard, and pillow cases marked. Also loved the lemon and orange waters dispensers in lobby. :)

Summary Heading: Satisfactory hotel, but wait until construction is done
Summary: We stayed for two nights in Bldg 3.  Unfortunately they are constructing a water play area right below our window.  They started construction at 8 am each morning.  Not bad on the morning we did Disney, but we were tired the next day and the sound prevented sleeping in.  Call and make sure you are not near this construction.  Someone else commented on the pillows, and oddly enough, our pillows were strangely small and thin too.  Made sleeping difficult.    This hotel is on the ART route and for $5 one way, you can shuttle easily to the park and return within 30 minutes of the park closing.  That was very convenient.    Would I stay again?  Yes, but I would check on construction plans and bring my own pillow!

The hotel is okay....badly in need of reno's in many areas. Breakfast in the morning is very good. We switched rooms as we were originally placed at the very rear of the building.......very dark and away from everything. Pillows are very small. The walk to Disneyland is misleading as it is not a block to the entrance. It is a good 20 minute brisk walk just to get to the ESPN building. In the daytime the neighborhood is fine, at night it's not bad but you should keep an eye out.
Manager Response: Dear BigT1234,  Thank you so much for the feedback provided after your recent stay. It is good to know that you found breakfast commendable. We appreciate you taking the time to help us improve our services by providing crucial feedback. I am sorry you had to experience the issues you did particularly with the pillows and condition of the property. Please be assured that your comments have been noted and will be used to reconsider improvements.   We appreciate your review and we hope to serve you soon.  Sincerely,  Zelyn N Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: Needed a moderately priced hotel in the Anaheim area, that wasn't too far from Disney but not in the "thick of things". The neighborhood was quiet and you wouldn't think that two blocks away you'd have crowds of people walking around. Food took forever though in the restaurant. But the server was quite nice.

Had some business to do in LA and a business dinner close by.  I figured I was asking for it when I booked this room so close to Disneyland.  I was wrong.  A QUIET hotel with a great staff.  Freindly and hepful.  The room was a standard room for a Holiday Inn, but it was cleaner than anticipated.  The noise level was non existant.  I was expecting screaming and yelling with kids being kids around Disneyland.   Didnt hear a peep.  Internet ( as I use it now) was faster than expected.    Parking, a tad cramped, but get over it, find a spot and ignore the overweight complaining guests because they have to walk 200 ft.    Overall, I enjoyed the stay, 3 nights.  Good food available, pretty inexpensive and fast.  I'll be back

This hotel was comfortable, clean, and close to everything. The staff was extremely helpful, and the bed was very comfortable. I have no idea why anyone would think it wasn't a good place to stay. I'd go again in a heartbeat.

The two-bedroom suite that we booked came with some surprises.  We were not aware that there was only one bathroom, and that it was in one of the bedrooms.  That meant that if you wanted to use the bathroom, you had to go through the other bedroom. Not a good option.  A central location would have been better if there was only one bathroom.  I checked the website and this certainly was not made clear in the booking process.  Most two bedroom suites come with a bathroom in each room or a central location in the suite.  The room also had a musty smell so anyone that has a mold allergy might want to be aware of that could be an issue.  After the front desk was made aware of the fact that we were unhappy with the situation, they did make the offer to change us the NEXT day.  The
Manager Response: Dear margaretbb,   Thank you for the candid review of our property as this will guide us in making the right decisions. Please accept my sincerest apologies and for any inconvenience the cleanliness of the room may have caused you. Rest assured that the issues you have raised has been documented and will be forwarded to the appropriate departments for necessary actions.   Once again, thank you for staying with us and we all hope to have an opportunity to serve you again on your next future visit.  Sincerely,   Janice A Case Manager  IHGCare

Summary: Stayed here October 2013.  Hotel is close to Disney, within walking distance, but highly recommend taking the ART bus to Disney. Tix are something like $5 adult, $1 kid, buy them in the gift shop. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean, newly redecorated with a more modern feel.  Pool was warm in October which was nice (and I'm from Arizona, so that's saying something)!  There is a splash park under construction which should be done in a few months (?). Note, there is currently a new hotel under construction next door, but there was ZERO noise in the hotel from this, note however parking spaces were limited, but did not have a problem in this regard.  Restaurant service was friendly, but a little slow.  However, they have a kids eat free menu, so that makes

Summary Heading: Not within walking distance of Disneyland
Summary: Nice hotel. Clean, comfy and quiet. However, it is not as close to Disneyland and they would have you believe. It is right next to the Mickey and Friends parking structure and in theory would be close enough to take the parking tram, but there is a very high brick wall surrounding the parking structure and you must walk a fair distance to get around it and back track to the tram, or continue on to Downtown Disney and still have quite a walk before you reach the parks. If you are looking for a hotel "within walking distance to the parks" chose one of the Hotels on Harbor Blvd between Manchester Ave and Disney Way.

Summary Heading: This will be our Disneyland Hotel Forevermore!
Summary: We visit Disneyland every year, and have been bouncing from hotel to hotel because nothing seems 'just right' but now we found our fit!  Check in was quick, courteous and informative.  The room was clean and comfortable.  We used the pool and hot tub in the evenings--nice temperature and well maintained.  The walk to Disneyland was pleasant.  Be sure to purchase tickets ahead of time, or through the hotel.  Then, it's a 12 minute (I timed it!) walk from the hotel to the monorail at Downtown Disney.  and here's the super part:  the monorail takes you directly to Tomorrow Land where you can get on Space Mountain about 4 times before the Main Gate stragglers get there!  The walk to Disney and back is quiet--no huge crowds.  It gave us some time to decompress from the energy of the

Summary Heading: Walkable to Disneyland.  Otherwise very average hotel.
Summary: First off we arrived early but the hotel front desk did give us a pass so we can park here and go to Disneyland right away instead of having us park over in Disney's parking lot.  That's a plus.  It's more like a 15 to 20 minutes walk to Disney entrance.  The room we're in was a little disappointing. It's not awful but there isn't even a frig.  And high speed internet?  ~0.5 Mbps down via wifi from my room is not high speed...  But yes, it does work and it's free.  Bathroom is meh and wish they would give you a little more toiletries to begin with.  Bring your own soap and shampoo/conditioner, the ones they provide are barely enough for one person, and it's not that good.  The location is good and staff has been courteous so that's what it's got going for it.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your feedback regarding your recent stay with us. We apologize for the slow speed of your computer on our free internet. We have recently upgraded our WiFi and have gotten good feedback from our frequent guests. Our location is a 15 minute walk to the monorail stop at Downtown Disney. You can enter the park there if you already have a ticket or annual pass. It's another 5 minutes to the main gate security tents and the ticket booths. We also provide Bath and Body works amenities in all of our room and will gladly deliver extra supplies to a guest room any time.  With our Splash Park opening soon and our great location we do hope you would consider staying here again the next time you are in the area.  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Not in a ghetto area, 5-10 minute walk
Summary: I felt the need to write a review for this hotel because someone mentioned that this hotel was in a "ghetto area", it was far from that.  I took that to heart and I was nervous to make my family scared.  We walked back between 10pm - 11pm without a problem.    The check in process was prompt, courteous, and helpful.  The person that checked me in gave me a couple of free vouchers for breakfast, a map, and a rundown of how to get to Disney.  We were upgraded to the suite because of my membership and the room was to my expectations for a Holiday Inn.  I had a two queen bed suite with a pull out couch, the kitchen was more of a kitchenette because it came with a sink, microwave, and a fridge.  People are correct, the pillows are weirdly shaped and affected how I slept in the

Stayed here for a few days after spending 2 weeks travelling around California on a coach trip. Rooms very nice comfortable beds.  Handy to have wash hand vanity units outside bathroom enabling 2 to get ready at one time.  No safe but free use of safes at reception so no problem.  Reception staff extra helpful with information especially on bus routes and times.  Only draw back is only 1 restaurant which could not cope with amount of people staying at hotel.  Really needs a little coffee shop.  Nice pool and heated spa.  Would recommend  and stay again if in Anaheim.

We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights while visiting Disneyland and other venues in the LAX area. The first night; the a/c made a horrible noise, so I spoke to the front desk. By the time returned that evening the noise was gone, much better sleep. The restaurant we ate there for breakfast and all but one, the eggs where done perfectly. Friendly staff. The water available at the front with lime/lemmons was great. The to go cup for coffee from the restaurant was perfect for early mornings. Walking to Disney downtown wasn't that far, it is only long when you have had a full day of walking. I didn't mind it. Parking is 10.00/night +taxes which is fine. Close to other stores if you needed medicine or booze. I would stay again as we collect Rewards points for HI and it makes the hotel

This is a standard Holiday Inn and the rooms are exactly what you would expect of this chain.  This was our final stopover on our 16 day journey through California, Nevada and Arizona and we stayed three nights. There is no safe in the room (important to visitors from abroad who need to carry their passports with them if they cant lock them up), but apparently there are safes in reception. There was a separate bath and sink area and the vanity unit was nice.  The shower was powerful but over the bath.  The beds were comfortable.  The coffee machine was good.  The swimming pool and terrace area were really nice.  As you can see from the photos, we didnt have a very nice view. The bar had a "Happy Hour" from 4 pm - 7pm with drinks two for one and a Bud lite worked out at $3 each.

We stayed here 4 years ago for 14 days and was very pleased so returned 3 weeks ago. Not dissappointed again---staff very friendly----hotel very clean and the walk to Disneyland is not that far especially if you go down the road and through the Disney Resort Hotel which brings you right into Down Town Disney.. There were 10 of us so the 2 families had the 1 bedroom suites but beware says cooking facilities but NO plates or cutlery. Fridge Microwave and floor area expansive.I had a room next door that had 2x Queen sized beds and one of the granddaughters stayed with me. Missed having a fridge in the rooms though.Hotel well served by the ART shuttle bus service.If we were to go back would stay here again as so quiet an area.Onyx Restuarant on site was very good also if

We just checked out and our headed home after 5 nights.  This is our second stay here and it was not as enjoyable as the first round.  First off if you have a double stroller be prepared to unload sleeping kids and bags and keep the stroller in your car. That's fun at 11pm! The doors aren't big enough to go through.  There was no luggage rollers near our building and after hunting for a while my husband finally found one 2 buildings over. Ugh!  The room was clean, bathroom small but that's ok. The AC was barley capable. The pillows are half size for some reason?!?! But you do get 4 of them.  Walking to Disneyland is bearable in the morning and unbearable returning. We prefer to walk so we don't have to unload and fold the stroller for a shuttle.  We probably won't return here
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your experience here at our hotel. We do apologize for the problems you encountered. I assure you our doorways are are the same width as nearly all hotels. You are correct about the pillows and those are all being replaced this week with nice big comfortable pillows. There will still be 4 for every bed. We do charge $10 per night for parking as do most Disneyland area hotels. As a matter of fact we are less expensive than most.  We do hope you will give us another try the next time you are in the area. Our Splash Zone will be completed soon and the kids will love it!  Best regards  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: I needed to write this review because we were treated very well by this hotel staff.  We booked our reservations through Hotwire and the dates were wrong. Fortunately Hotwire refunded us, however we had no hotel room. The staff let us use their phone to call hotwire, and made sure we had a room for the night. Thank You Jay, Ray and Veronica.  Nice room also!

Close walk to the park. Our room literally faced the downtown disney parking garage. The hotel also did not charge us to park and let us check in early. Very clean, clearly recently rennovated. Also was very quite being so close to the hotel. A+

Hotel is in walking distance to Disney. It's about an hour car drive to 45 mins from the airport. The rooms are big but slightly dated, the restaurant food is good but service leaves alot to be desired and help-desk staff are very accommodating. Very convenient if you are heading to Disney as its only a 10 minute walk away.

Rooms were clean , pool was great. Not a fan of no microwave or fridges in the room. Restaurant was so so. We ate breakfast off site the second day, and didn't like the TV at each table. Might stay here again , it was a good rate but didn't car for the location, the walk seemed closer to a couple blocks

My stay this past Tuesday, 24 September. As an IHG Platinum member I've had the pleasure of visiting numerous hotels, but my recent stay at this one of my most enjoyable stays that I can remember .  From the super fast check-in with such a happy agent whose name I don't remember, which included a very nice upgrade to a suite that overlooked the pool to the attentive service that our waiter Jose gave us during breakfast (and this was with his knowing that it was a comp breakfast).  Surprisingly the only things that were even slightly amiss was our wake up call was 5 min late (not a biggie), and that there were no plates or silverware in the suites' kitchenette.  The hotel has it's own restaurant and a small bar.  We enjoyed breakfast there, they offered a full menu as well as an

Summary Heading: OK hotel, but in a Ghetto Neighborhood
Summary: We wanted a hotel within half mile to Disneyland so I booked this hotel seeing that it was a block away from Downtown Disney.  So it IS one block and it is within walking distance (it is literally right behind the Disneyland parking garage), but be warned:  this is the only hotel on this part of the street and is located in a "ghetto" neighborhood.  We definitely didn't feel very safe walking back to our hotel at night after our day in Disneyland.  Since it's the only hotel in this particular area, you're walking back to the hotel by yourself with not a lot of people/toursists around.  And no point in driving since the Disneyland parking lot is next door to the hotel. Also, the hotel charges $5 per adult to ride the shuttle to Disneyland.   But other than hotel location, we
Manager Response: Dear Michelle L,  Thank you for your review.  We are pleased you liked the hotel suite you received.  However, we are sorry to read that you did not find our hotel in a convenient location for your needs and regret you felt unsafe in the area. We appreciate your feedback as this is our best resource for improving guest services. If there is anything you need next time you stay with us, please do not hesitate to let us know.  Sincerely,  Zelyn N Case Manager IHGCare

Summary Heading: You cannot get better than this Hotel for the price!
Summary: Fellow Disney travellers...We have been staying at the Holiday Inn and Suties in Anaheim for years....even before their renovation...We have always found the staff to be on the helpful and friendly side...The reno's just make this hotel a must stay when in Disney...The restaurant staff are also very kind and helpful and they get the job done in a quick orderly manner...In fact our waitress gave us a hug when we told her it was our last day at the hotel and told us that she would miss us...Our original stay was for 7 nights and then we were moving to another property in Newport...The hotel Manager asked us if we would consider staying if they were to match the price of the other property and of course we said YES!!! Taking a chance on another property when we already know that

Summary Heading: The old Conestoga now Holiday Inn a nice place to stay
Summary: I've been staying at this hotel on a number of occasions over the years, from back when it was the Conestoga. Holiday Inn have freshened up the place nicely however being a sentimentalist I miss the old western theme of the Conestoga. However the atmosphere now is very family oriented which makes sense given its close proximity to Disneyland. I would not hesitate to stay here again and will definitely bring the kids. You do have to pay for parking which in my opinion seems unreasonable.

I had a good stay at this hotel.  Viviane at the checkin desk was terrific.   I had a special request and she went out of her way to get it for me.  Then she called my room multiple times to ensure it went well.  Thank you, Viviane.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind comments. We do have a wonderful staff and I'll make sure your comments are shared with them.   We hope to see you again the next time you visit the Anaheim area.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Construction going on!!! Will not go back ever!!!
Summary: When I booked for a room there was no description saying that there is a on going CONSTRUCTION right IN FRONT of our room! We had to wake up hearing VERY LOUD hammering and grinding sounds of construction. What was supposed to be a relaxing getaway really turned out to be worst place to visit. DEFINITELY NOT worth the money you pay for the room plus $10 parking fee. When I notified the front desk about the matter they didn't do anything about it. AVOID if you don't want to get morning calls by the loud construction sounds!!!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay with us. I do apologize for the construction going on next to us. This project is normally not very loud and is coming to a close very soon. We are also putting in a Splash Park here at our hotel but that project never starts before 9am and noise from that was limited to 2-3 days earlier in the month due to some digging. We do hope you will consider giving us another try as the Splash Park is going to be a wonderful addition to our great property and it's proximity(15 minute walk) to Downtown Disney and the park entrance at the monorail stop there.  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, a tad long to walk to Disneyland.
Summary: The hotel was a decent, safe, clean, comfortable choice. I'd say that although it's technically close enough to walk to Disneyland, since you are on your feet all day, it isn't practical to walk...we chose to drive and pay for parking which is definitely an added expense.

I stayed here for 2 nights during a conference trip. It is within walking distance to the Disneyland Hotel and downtown Disneyland. The dinning area is pretty nice with welcoming services. I reserved a single-bed room and it was pretty clean and neat. From the backyard I actually saw part of the firework show at night, which is like an expected bonus. Overall I don't really have anything to complain for the price of just USD 90 per night.

Stayed at the hotel recently with my wife. Room that we stayed in was average, but was clean and had everything we needed. Beds were comfortable, however I agreed with other comments about the weird square pillows. On the positive side I found the staff extremely helpful going above and beyond to help my wife and I during our stay and even after we had checked out of the hotel. Would definitely stay here again, as so close to Disneyland at a reasonable price.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your stay with us. Holiday Inn has a new pillow package that is wonderful and this has been ordered by our hotel. We should have them in place in a week or two. We look forward to you and all of our wonderful guests experiencing them soon! And our Splash Park for the kids coming in a few weeks will make a great enhancement for our families staying here!  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: The size of the room was nice, we had a suite, but there were gaps around the tub, and gaps in the molding around the floor.  The hairdryer started smoking when we went to use it.  For a suite, not enough towels were left.  Pillows are wrapped as squares and you have to unwrap them, weird.  We asked for a second floor room, but were given a 1st floor room facing a dirt lot that was supposed to be a kids type-water park with fountains, etc. For 2 women with small children, I would have felt safer.  It was supposed to be finished in Spring 2013--by July, not done.  Our entire family has stayed here many times before (at least 20+ room nights over 10 years) and have always enjoyed our stay--I am wondering if there has been a change in management because the employees are downright
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know how things went while you were here. I assure you I have addressed the training issues at our front desk and we have ordered all new pillows for every room and hope to have them in place within two weeks. Our Splash Park should be finished in about 3-4 weeks and we apologize for the delays. We do hope you try us again and see the improvements for yourself. We'd love to have you back here with us the next time you visit the area.  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, did the job for our trip
Summary: We stayed here because we are Platinum Elite members with IHG and we were upgraded to a 2Q suite for our stay.  The hotel room was clean and tended to every day.  The pillows were an odd square shape.  The rooms could use updating.  There was construction going on so hopefully there will be improvements.  Rooms looked dated, and could use a fresh coat of paint. But, rooms were spacious, and clean, and was perfect for a place to sleep after long days in the parks.  Not 'lush' in any way, despite being in a suite. It had a fridge and a microwave which was nice.   Breakfast was good, kids eat free, but we also had two vouchers for breakfast for being Priority Club members.  It's one LONG block to Disneyland.  It's right next to the Mickey & Friends parking structure.

Summary Heading: Good hotel let down by the little things that count
Summary: This was a 3 night stop over during a California tour. Hotel and room are good and our Gold Elite was recognised. We are not going to Disneyland but can see that this hotel is nicely placed for that with buses that stop outside the hotel so everything good. Now the minor issues; nice coffee making peculator in room but I only drink tea not much use to me. So I asked if I could have a couple of tea bags but the hotel do not have any. Tried the restaurant and they kindly provided a couple for a cost of $4.80!! I also purchased a bottle of water from the hotel shop $5. Whilst I expect to pay higher prices this is totally a rip off. The restaurant is American brasserie and speaking to others at the hotel it is a place to avoid. We attended 'happy hour' only to later find out that it
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay with us. I've instructed my staff to have tea bags available if requested by our guests and these will be complimentary. Our gift shop offers many competitively priced items including $.99 23 oz bottles of water. We are happy you had an overall good stay with us and we do hope to see you again in the future.  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Confusing check in-but overall good stay
Summary: We booked 2 rooms at this hotel for 3 nights.  When booking, I specifically asked for connecting rooms, 1 room with a king bed, and 1 room with 2 queen beds.  The person on the phone said that was not a problem.  Upon check in, we were informed the king rooms were in a separate building from the queen rooms, and no rooms connected.  We needed 1 of each room, as we had 3 adults and 2 small children traveling together.  The person at check in was helpful, we ended up getting 2 queen rooms to be next door from each other.  This would have normally been a more expensive option, but he did not charge us different because of the mix up.   The breakfast was nice, there are tv's in the booths in the restaurant which is great with small kids.  Kids ate free, which was great because the

Our hard-earned trip to Disneyland placed us here for a few days.  Check -in was fast and professional.  I didn't eat at the restaurant but got coffee to-go each day and found the service friendly and accommodating.  Staff was attentive everywhere encountered.  The pool was great for my little one- he had a nice time.   I would (and likely will) choose this hotel again for the next Disney trip!   We walked to the Disney tram the first day but found it much, much, better to pony up for the ART bus/shuttle the following day.

I had a difficult time finding a reasonably priced hotel in Irvine, so I expanded my search and found this great Holiday Inn a block from Disneyland.   I was concerned that it would be too kid-friendly for a business traveler and would be noisy, but no, it was great!   The front desk staff acted very professionally and were attentive to my needs.  The room service menu was good and served quickly. Did I mention that the room was quiet? No noise from the rooms next door or above or below, no noise from kids running in the halls  (and yes I did see many) . I got a good night's sleep in a very comfortable room. It can't get much better than that.   Well, the only thing better would have been if I looked out the window when I heard the Disneyland fireworks go off at 9:30 and

There were some good things about this hotel - the rooms were pleasant and clean, though I found the cushion sized pillows rather inconvenient. The lay-out of the bathroom area was strange - very cramped and inconvenient. The domestic staff were very friendly (I even tried out my limited Spanish with them and they didn't laugh at me!) However, there were things about the hotel that were very disappointing and even annoying at times. The reception was always busy and always, so it seemed to me, understaffed. Every time I went there, I had to wait to be attended to, on one occasion for more than 20 minutes. The reception staff - well, it is hard to describe their attitude. I couldn't say they were impolite, but they certainly were not friendly like most of the places we stayed in.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent experience at our hotel. I do apologize for our staff not being up to par with their friendliness level. I assure you this is not the norm and it will be addressed through more training and a revision of our staffing levels both at the Front Desk and the restaurant. We do hope you would give us another try and see the improvements we are making.  Again, thank you very much for letting me know what happened and for giving me the opportunity to improve our service.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: The parking fee is less than the hilton and hampton inn. This big name brand is closer than the others. No fridge for the regular rooms which is a draw back. Pool could have been cleaned better and more regularly as this seems to be used. A couple pool chairs where broken and should be replaced. Hotel does need an update, elevator is slow so taking the stairs will be quicker. Staff was  friendly. Their computer system is slow, printing a receipt took 10 min which is just sad. Not a good location to walk to restaurants to get something to eat, if you have a vehicle then makes no difference. Pillows are like couch square ones which is not really comfortable. Room was clean with a flat screen tv. Bathroom is small with narrow walkway where the outside sink is located. Great view in
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your experience here. We are in the process of getting new pillows and we promise to do a better job in our pool area. We are also installing a Splash Park for the kids and we do hope you will take another look at us next time you are in the area.  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: We booked this hotel based on reading many other reviews and felt we were making a great choice for the money. Well, I can't say the hotel was horrible but we don't feel it lived up to its overall rating. The positives were that the pool was quite nice and the kids loved it. The breakfast that was included was also good value as there were many choices and the staff at the restaurant were great. Now for the not so good; while the lobby was inviting and clean, the rest of the hotel was not. Our room was small and outdated: old carpets, lamps and chair., and a desk that was way too big for the room. The room was not very clean and you could tell the carpets were not clean. The bathroom was so tiny and the tub and sink did not drain well. We also booked for two adults and three
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about your visit here. We do apologize for the issues you encountered. We do have everyone working on correcting any cleanliness issues. You correct it is a 15 minute walk to the Disneyland monorail stop where you can enter the park. This stop will only let visitors in if they have passes or tickets already in hand. Our desk does sell discounted Disneyland multi-day Park Hopper passes that will allow you in at this special place.  We do hope you give us another try as our coll Splash Zone will be ready for the kids in about a month.  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Fine For A Place To Sleep
Summary: Friends and I stayed here after a long day at the Disney parks.  It's conveniently located to the parks (though not as close as the hotels on Harbor Blvd).  It fit the bill for what we needed - a place to sleep after 16 hours in the parks (plus a 4.5 hour drive to get to Anaheim....looong day!).  The beds were comfortable enough, but the pillows were unusually small (more square in shape than rectangular).  While it was nice to have the bathroom sink outside of the toilet/shower room, the configuration was a little odd.  But in the grand scheme of things, it was no big deal.  What mattered was that the room was clean, the room was comfortable, and it provided us with an opportunity to catch some much needed zzz's before the drive back home.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing our hotel for your trip to the Disneyland Resort. We are happy you found our hotel a good place to catch up on your sleep. While our pillows are comfortable, we will be replacing our pillows soon with a new Holiday Inn brand standard pillow offering that will be incredible for everybody's comfort level. I will keep all Tripadvisor posters updated as to the progress.  Thank you,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Fantastic Value for this Hidden Hotel
Summary: We have stayed at this property for 3-4 Disneyland trips, and it is a simple yet nice hotel within quiet walking distance from Downtown Disney. WARNING: take a cab back at night...it is Anaheim you know. The rooms are a bit standard but you only see them at night. The beds are comfortable and the WiFi is free. The bathroom shower is excellent. The upkeep and housekeeping are great.  The restaurant is not the best. The bar is great and serves generous pours. But the food and the staff at the restaurant are a bit subpar. As with many hotels that are close and offer a nice location, they skimp on the food as they have a kept audience. However, we didn't expect for it to offer anything but out of the box food. Why would you venture to Disneyland to eat hotel food? I'm not sure. But,

Summary Heading: Not At All What I Excepted
Summary: Visited Disneyland early July and decided to stay here with my family. Bad decision! For the price I would think this place would look up to date, Not at all. Pool water looks cloudy, walls are marked and scratched, elevators are slow, the list goes on and on.  Would I stay here again? As a last resort yes.
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about your recent stay with us. We will definitely do our best to continue our property improvements as we have already added new furniture to the rooms and completely remodeled the exterior of the buildings. We are adding a Kids Splash Zone and have new lamps coming for every guest room. We do hope you would give us another look the next time you visit the area.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: This Holiday Inn is fabulous!  Our vacation destination changed from Myrtle Beach to California very quickly.  Of course I was on TripAdvisor researching hotels right away!  This hotel seemed good enough, but when we arrived we found it to be even better than we had hoped!  Our flight was delayed, and although we had our room tagged as a late arrival, I was afraid that it would be sold before we arrived.  We made a call to let them know we would be late, and when I walked up to the registration desk, sure enough, our room was all set.  Awesome!      This Holiday Inn was our home base for our entire southern California vacation.  The location is wonderful.  We drove all but one day (the day we visited Disneyland/California Adventure) and when we returned late each evening we had

Holiday Inn people were very nice to work with.  Veronica and Jennifer were there to answer my questions and even had our anniversary and my husband's birthday celebrated with a free appetizer on one night and a dessert on another (with candle included!).  The van "ART" that took our family to Disneyland was the first to pick us up and the first to drop off.  The hotel room was clean when we arrived, and clean every day when we came back from Disneyland.  One of the staff members even took time to listen to my 6 year old try and talk in Spanish.  It was a great family environment and the staff was courteous and friendly.  We plan on coming back, thank you Holiday Inn!

Summary Heading: Fantastic Friendly Service, Why Go Anywhere Else.....
Summary: Our family arrived at this hotel around 2:30p.m. on Tuesday July 22, 2013 after a long 7 hour day of driving.  We were tired and asked if we could check in our reserved room a little early, but were told that no rooms were available, so we waited in the nice and inviting lobby with complementary ice cold water dispensers filled with either slices of lemons or oranges.  That was refreshing and made us feel welcomed as we waited about an hour until we were kindly notified by a warm and pleasant staff member by the name of Roberto that a room was ready for our family.  We were so surprised when we opened the door to our room and noticed we were upgraded to a Suite!!! Such a nice way to start out our once a year family vacation.......... When we did a walk around our room, I noticed

When I first arrived at this hotel, and waiting to check in; I was in line for about 10 minutes. There was another man that walked up, and he was asked right away if he could be helped.  I was with my family of 5. I was a little annoyed when this man just walked up, and I was waiting for 10 minutes ( I was tired from my long flight and with 3 screaming children). To make a long story short; we finally got checked in.  Then things went down hill from there. The onyx restaurant there overcharged us 3 times (kids eat free), they kept charging me for the kids. I had to go to the manager 3 times to get things straighten out.  After 2 days of this overcharging; I finally met the nicest manager (Jennifer) and another coworker (Veronica).  They were able to straighten everything out,

Summary Heading: Very friendly and always going above and beyond...
Summary: There was an initial mix-up with our rooms but Roberto was very understanding and comped us breakfast meals for our entire stay. The next day we were given our desired room and Veronica made sure we were taken care of. Our stay was outstanding from the cleaniness of the rooms, very comfortable and the amazing staff. It was great to have an in-house restaurant for our late night meals and room service.. but it was also great to have such caring, helpful and upbeat and postive attitudes from each staff member.. especially from Miguel in the restaurant who greeted us each morning! Thanks Holiday Inn.. you were very much a part of our Magical Disneyland Getaway! :-)
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your review. Our staff is very pleased you enjoyed your time here and we hope to see you again in the future.  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: I stayed here just for one night this past week and I must say that I was pleasantly surprised at the cleaniness of our room and the hotel. It was 4 adults and one child. We booked a Suite and it was the perfect size and had plenty of space for the 5 of us. We had the suite with two queen sized beds and also had a sofa bed in the living room. Beds were very comfortable. Both the living room and bedroom had flat screen tv's. The bar area had a microwave, coffee maker, refrigerator and sink which was very nice. This hotel is right next to the Disneyland parking structure so it's not too far from the tram. Another nice touch is that they had Bath and Body Works shampoo, conditioner, and body lotion. Overall it was a nice experience. We all had a very good rest and didn't feel like

We had two rooms for three nights at this hotel.  I was hesitant to visit Disneyland in mid-July, but I am very glad we went.  Normally I like to stay away from the "resort district", and drive to Disneyland from Garden Grove, Santa Ana or Irvine.  But since we were bringing family this time around, we decided to pick a hotel that people could return to for an afternoon break.    The Holiday Inn & Suites is located on the other side of Disneyland, and a world away from the traffic, crowds and the hustle & bustle of the strip of eateries and outdated motels found on Harbor Blvd and Katella. That being said, it's only about a fifteen minute, very peaceful walk from the hotel to the Downtown Disney Monorail station, where you can board a train which will take you directly into

The Hotel is ok if you just comt to sleep and stay in the parks all day if you buy the kids eat free promotion be aware they can eat only what they have in the kids menu for 3.95 and the adults have free buffet so its not exactly free.  We stayed in building 4 and the noise from the construction start at 7:00am we didn't know the hotel is next to construction site and we didn't see it when we arrived at night
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing our hotel to be your home away from home at the Magic Kingdom.
