We do have some very attractive breakfast inclusive rates but we also are proud of our Kids Eat Free program when dining with adults. This is regardless of what type of rate package is purchased or what website you purchase your room. If you have any questions regarding our hotel please feel free to call the hotel directly at 714-535-0300. We appreciate your business!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: This is my 4th or 5th trip to Disneyland and first time staying at this Holiday Inn. Have stayed in several other hotels in the area, but this one was disappointing! The good... We got there a little earlier than check in time, but were able to get an available room right away. Front desk staff was courteous. The room looked clean and it was kept clean, furniture was nice, and beds were comfy. Restaurant food was good and well priced, especially with kids eat free. The male server at the restaurant was very nice and attentive. Pool was clean. Walk to Disney wasn't too bad, we took 15 min (timed it) of relax walking with kids to the Mickey & Friends parking lot where we took the Disney parking tram to the park entrance. Add about 5 minutes if you rather walk to the entrance. The
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your time with us. I do apologize for the inconveniences you described. I assure you I have addressed the in room issues and the construction project next door has nearly completed their exterior work.   We are glad you enjoyed our location and with our Splash Park opening towards the end of August we hope you will give us another shot at hosting your next trip to the Magic Kingdom!  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Great for Disneyland Fly N Taxi Vacation
Summary: Okay, yes after walking 6 miles in the park the 4 block walk back to the hotel appears to be deadly! I took my 5 & 8 y.o. Boys by myself for a 7 day Disneyland Vacation. We walked to the Disney tram and then hit the parks. The hotel is right beside the Disney parking lot, unfortunately the walk around is long after a day in the park. We decided against the shuttle, nice walk, and safe. The hotel has a perfect view of the fireworks each night. Yes kids eat free, or 8 bucks if you are sick of food. To feed a kid at the parks is well over 8 bucks. Dinner, kids eat free! Yes the dinner is grim but the poolside pizza was fine. The hotel ride from LAX is $130 one-way....yes you have to pay to park at the hotel, otherwise SoCal will fill the parking lot in a second with cars. The
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing our hotel for your Disneyland trip. We are glad you had a good time and we hope to see you again soon! Our Splash Park for the kids should be open late August and is going to be a great addition to our hotel.   Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Sleek and modern, but still a great place to stay for DL resort
Summary: We've been coming to this hotel since back when it was the Conestoga. This is the first time coming since the most recent renovation. The hotel has a sleek, modern interior, now. Call me weird, but I miss the kitschy western decor and theming from the older days.  We showed up way too early for check in, so we weren't surprised that our room wasn't ready, but when asked about it, they were able to check our luggage so that we could hit the parks until check in time. We booked a suite, and found it roomy, clean and full of amenities like a microwave, refrigerator and wet bar sink. The beds were comfy, the pillows a strange, small size, but comfortable and plentiful, with a variety of firmnesses. Our view was of our vehicles in the parking lot and of the massive parking garage for

My family and mom stayed here for a quick trip to Disneyland.  The suite was a great size and the proximity to Disneyland was fantastic.  What made the location even better is that it is far enough away to be quiet, yet close enough to walk.  The grounds were well kept and the restaurant was a great way to start (and end) the day.  The housekeepers were thorough and the beds were comfortable.  No free shuttle, but the walk is not too bad.

Summary Heading: Clean and Comfortable - Convenient Location to Disneyland
Summary: We found this Holiday Inn to be very convenient for visiting Disneyland.  Although the description for this hotel (1-BLK/Disneyland) seems to indicate a short walking distance, it is not.  It will take about 10 to 15 minutes walk to the Disneyland monorail station at the Disneyland hotel, or 20 to 30 minutes to walk directly to the main entrance to Disneyland.  The best choice from this hotel to Disneyland is the very convenient ART (Anaheim Resort Transportation) shuttle bus system that is provided by the city of Anaheim.  The ART shuttle (Route #11) picks-up at the front lobby of this Holiday Inn every 20-minutes starting at 6:20AM and returns from Disneyland back to the hotel every 20-minutes with the last shuttle leaving at 12:30AM - which is well past closing time for

Erica and Veronica's friendly customer service made our trip a 5 star experience.  Upon checking into the hotel, They personally responded to our simple requests leading to exceedingly comfort and satisfaction.  Thank you sooooo much Erica and Veronica.

Second time staying here for Disneyland.  Rooms are clean, fresh and modern. Wi-fi was fast.  Pool was super clean and warm.  Restaurant is open until 1 am so after you return from park.  Food service in morning is quick, prices reasonable and kids eat free.  Bar was welcome. No free shuttle to park but only .6 mile walk to Disney tram.

Summary Heading: Great Stay at Holiday Inn & Suites So. Walnut in Anaheim
Summary: We had an excellent stay at the Holiday Inn & Suites at 1240 So. Walnut in Anaheim when we visited Disneyland from June 23 - 25, 2013.  Rooms were clean, food was good and service was excellent except for one point.  The waitresses Taylor in the afternoon and evening; and Jen in the morning were exceptionally professional, personable and with a "can-do" attitude.  The front desk clerk named Roy was exceptionally professional, polite and helpful to those who approached him.  The only exception was when we checked in, unfortunately we got a front desk clerk named Jennifer who was marginal at best.  We arrived at 10:00 a.m. and of course there were no rooms available.  That wasn't a problem, but Jennifer's attitude was cold, her responses were curt and like she was doing us some

The ladies at the front desk are so helpful! Veronica helped was waiting for us in the lobby when we arrived, felt very welcome here! The Inn is located very close to Dysneyland and is SOOO easy to travel back and forth as much as you want. We were very tired from walking around and had to come back to the hotel a few times a day! it's great, Miara and Roberto are so friendly! how do I know all these peoples names??? they are like friends when you arrive.

Summary Heading: Absolutely the place to go for dysneyland!
Summary: We were here for a week and the hotel is located in the perfect location! There is a store around the corner open 24 hrs! Veronica who works at the front desk took care of me and I feel like she's my friend! Anyways, there are many choices and last time I chose a different hotel and it wasn't that great. Oh kids eat free at the restaurant!

Great service from veronica, javier and Erika. We came in early with kids and luggage. The hotel was fully booked and rooms were not available for early check in. The team made us comfortable by offering breakfast coupons and storage place for the luggage. This went a long way to make out life easy. Great service from veronica, javier and Erika. We came in early with kids and luggage. The hotel was fully booked and rooms were not available for early check in. The team made us comfortable by offering breakfast coupons and storage place for the luggage. This went a long way to make out life easy.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind comments. We really appreciate your business and I am extremely happy my staff made you feel at home.   We hope to see you again!!  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: This hotel was mostly a positive experience. Close to Disneyland and shuttles every 15-20 mins going to the parks. The rooms were neat, clean and roomy and tidied everyday. My kids loved the pool area. We had a great view from our room of the pool and restaurant lights. The food was tasty but needed more variety especially if you are staying there for a longer period. The staff were friendly and there to help however not as friendly as what I'm used to in Australia or the south pacific. The gift shop was great and the pricing good. I would recommend this hotel if you're going to Disneyland however if you want to explore other parts of California stay closer to LA as it's very expensive to get transport to LA, Hollywood etc. I would stay here again for sure.

Summary Heading: At least it was close to Disney
Summary: This hotel wasn't the worst I had ever stayed in, but it was far from the best.  It was remarkably close to Disneyland, so the location was great, but everything else to me just seemed sub-par.  I stayed here with the fam while on summer vaca.  The beds were whatevs, as a whole I just wasn't impressed.  Pretty run of the mill.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our hotel. Since you stayed here back in July of 2012, I'd like to point out that we have completely re-done our exterior appearance and put new furniture in our rooms. We have begun construction of a very cool Splash Park and have added one more two bedroom two bath suites to themed decor. This is a pirate themed room along with our two Disney Pixar/Cars themed rooms.  We do hope you come again and see our improvements. And we are still the perfect location for the Disneyland Resort.  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: We stayed at this hotel specifically because we had 5 people and needed a larger room with more bedding and close to Disney.  It was PERFECT.  We stayed in a 2 bed suite with a pull out and it also included mini fridge microwave and sink with a bar area.  we had plenty of room.   It was clean quiet and comfortable.   After reading some reviews about the longer than expected walk to Disney, I expected much worse......we were totally fine with it, and even though the evening time walk was not as fun......we were happy to have a nice rom to crash in!  Breakfast was great and with the kids eating free, for our family of 5......was a big savings for us.  All of the Staff was very nice.  One other thing that was great.   we were able to buy our Disney hopper passes with the hotel.  We
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments. We are thrilled you enjoyed our hotel and we do hope to see you again on your next visit to the Magic Kingdom!!  Best Regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Stayed here after visiting Vegas and Catalina Island. Fairly typical three star Holiday Inn. Reasonable size room with small bathroom and inadequate storage space. Not a great problem as we were only here for two nights. It's a short one long block walk to Disney. Took us just over ten minutes and is the nearest you can get without staying at an overpriced Disney Hotel. Good meals in the Restaurant and the buffet breakfast was good value. Staff very friendly and helpful, service in the Restaurant was excellent. Hotel could do with a bit of a makeover but all in all a good value enjoyable stay.

Summary Heading: House keeping dropped the ball, keeping it a 3 star hotel.
Summary: First off I am a priority club member, if you are not... sign up. It's a good program and you can get good deals and get points to use on free nights or even merchandise not affiliated with the hotel.  This was not our first choice, but couldn't pass up the price. I took advantage of the family pizza deal, which is a large 2 topping pizza and sodas each night free or if pizza isn't your thing it is also a $20 credit towards anything at the restaurant or bar. We also received kids eat free vouchers for each day. We had the pizza dinner 2 nights and used the vouchers towards breakfast on days we had dinner elsewhere. This was a nice added bonus.   When we arrived the lobby was nice and clean. As a club member I was taken care of promptly and was given complementary cold waters and
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. I do apologize about our housekeeping issues. We take our cleanliness very seriously here and I assure you our Housekeeping Manager is aggressively addressing the issues you mentioned. I am glad you enjoyed our location and we do hope to see you and your family again.  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: We stayed here for 5 ngihts and absolutely loved it.  The front desk staff was very friendly and very helpful ( especially Javier)  The restaurant was reasonably priced and the food was good.  Bonus that kids eat free.  The pool was a great way to end the day.  The rooms were very clean and comfortable.  the only thing we missed was a fridge.  OVerall, its a very clean and friendly hotel.  Would diffenatly recommend it and stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are very happy you had a good time here. We do hope to see you again soon.   Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Clean, Fresh, Near, Convenient and Enjoyable.  An easy walk to the tram which transports visitors to the Main Gate.  Friendly and efficient staff.  Breakfast Buffet was OK.  The price was reasonable, no hassle online booking.  Stayed here before and would definitely stay at this hotel again!

The hotel is very clean and the staff were very friendly. It's advertised as being a block from Disneyland, but we didn't try to walk. They sell shuttle passes for $5.00 a day, which is better than paying the $15.00 for Disneyland parking because you can come and go all day. Tthe hotel's restaurant, Onyx, has good food, and generous portions for a reasonable price. The only thing I can complain about is the fact that they charge $10.00 a day for parking. I must have missed that when I read the hotel's description.

While advertised as a "block from Disneyland" is a bit of a stretch it is certainly walkable.  We met up with our young family staying at the Disneyland Hotel which is a 10Minute walk.  We altered between walking and taking the Monorail just outside the Disneyland Hotel.  The Holiday sells park admittance at a discount which you must have before boarding the Monorail.  Now for the Pros,  The Hotel itself is clean.  We had a renovated room on the main floor.  The furnishings were not that far off Hilton or Starwood standard.  The beds are comfortable with a choice of pillow softness is provided.  The toilet is separate from the sink area which is a generous size providing ample room for toiletry kits, etc. The shampoo etc is from Bed and Bath.  The TV is a flat screen LG.  Ample

had a three night stay at this hotel, we found it to clean and airy, the rooms were kept clean, the toilet and bathroom were tiny and showed a lot of wear and tear, the bottom of the toilet door was broken, and this stood out as you sat on the toilet, because the door was nearly touching your nose.Our room had a wonderful ground floor view of the car park. Sorry to say, but the food was only fair, and service was poor, they kept running out of basics such as vanilla ice cream various puddings etc etc But being so close to Disney, and down town Disney it excusable
Manager Response: Thank you very much for taking the time to let us know about your time with us. I apologize for the condition of your bathroom door and we have our engineering department taking care of that. As with most hotels the ground floor rooms don't offer much in the way of scenery but we do hope you visit us again and let us do our best to put you on a higher floor. We are happy you enjoyed our location as it is one of the best in town for access to Downtown Disney and the "secret" park entrance at the monorail stop there.  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Perfect accommodations for Disney parks visit
Summary: We stayed here May 12-15, 2013 for a family vacation to Disneyland and California Adventure.  The room was spacious enough for the 4 of us, with updated furniture, carpet and paint and was very clean and comfortable.  Although the bathroom area which contains the toilet and shower was small, it was clean and manageable. The hotel is within walking distance to the Disney tram station (1 block down and 1 over).  Although this HH doesn't offer free continental breakfast, the hotel restaurant, with a Disney theme, was nice with great service and we received coupons for a free kid's meal for each day of our visit.  In fact, we received excellent service from all of the hotel staff who were very friendly and customer service oriented.  There's even a little gift shop in the lobby. The

Staying in this hotel greatly enhanced the enjoyment of our recent trip to Disneyland. Our family of seven, including two infants, arrived late at night and we were warmly greeted by Roy, who consistently gave us great customer service throught our stay!  Lucy from the restaurant was very kind and she made sure we were all looked after. The food is very good and one afternoon the kitchen staff stayed longer so we could eat and that was certainly appreciated! All the servers were friendly and nice too! Our rooms were really clean and Maria D and all the other staff from housekeepimg for the third floor of the main building were friendly and very helpful. Three of our family members stayed on the fourth floor of another building and they were very happy with the housekeeping staff
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing our hotel. We are glad you enjoyed yourself and hope to see you again soon!!  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Everything you need for a stay at Disneyland
Summary: The hotel itself is located about 15 minutes walk to Disneyland. The room we had was clean, had a comfy bed, wifi and the basic necessities. We requested a bar fridge on arrival for our a room which was delivered promptly. We ate in the diner for breakfast most mornings and had dinner there most nights. The service was great and the food was well priced and tasty.

the site says it's near Disneyland, but it is actually near ONLY for those Marathoners, Triathletes or the like, and especially not for those with little children who cannot walk the 15-20 walk...During the night, after having a long day at Disneyland, it is really very tiring to take that walk to the hotel and scary too coz of the dark, hardly-illuminated streets.,,,I suggest you either stay farther where you can take a taxi (as the taxi won't take us as passengers to somewhere "that" near) or stay at one of the more expensive hotels within the Territory of Disneyland...and there is no Free Parking for hotel guests who brought their own vehicle from out of state....they charged $10 per day!  And there is no free hotel shuttle to transport guests from hotel to the theme
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay at our hotel. We are sorry that you didn't find our location suitable for your needs. The majority of our reviewers like our proximity to Downtown Disney and the park entrance there at the Monorail stop. Being away from the crowds and traffic on the east side of the resort area also is a big plus.  As with most full service hotels next to Disneyland, we do charge for parking. However, our $10 charge is at the lower end of the scale for hotels that do charge.  Thank you again for your review and for choosing our hotel.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Reasonably priced, close enough to walk, but 1 block??
Summary: alright, so it's a holiday, you pretty much know what to expect, normal US looking hotel room, a couple beds, a flat screen TV with cable and WiFi, standard amenities.  The place wasn't dirty, but it also isn't clean, I guess it's safe to say it's starting to show some age, and they appear to be doing some modernization here and there, but not in the area of the hotel I was in anyway.  Still for the price (around $120 with parking), and within walking distance to the Disney park area, it's a fair deal. Here's some of the interesting things that happened to us, both good and bad, while at this property: The first day, both elevators worked, and they dinged at each floor, the second day, only 1 elevator worked and the dinging had stopped (we found the ding, ding at each floor kind
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your experience at our hotel. We are a 15 minute walk to the park entrance at the Monorail stop at the entrance to Downtown Disney. This entrance is for ticket holders and pass holders only so please check with our front desk as we sell 2 and 3 day park hopper passes at a discount from maingate prices. We have completely re-done our exterior and are nearly finished replacing the furniture in the rooms. In addition we are adding a Splash Zone that will be great for kids. We do hope you will come and see us again to check out our improvements.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Ten minutes walk to the Disney carpark where you can catch the tram to the parks. Restaurant at hotel was surprisingly good and great value and we ate here nearly everyday. Pool and spa were heated which was welcome relief after long long days at the parks! Only disappointing thing was that I booked a room on the website and entered 2 adults and 3 kids. It accepted the booking but when we arrived we were told that the room only slept 4 and we could not get a foldout in the room. Luckily we were travelling with friends and were able to sleep one of our children with them.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback! We apologize for any confusion about the number of people the room you reserved could accomodate. We do have 2 adults and 3  small children stay in the two bedded rooms often. However, if anyone needs more beds we have several one and two bedroom suites available. We hope your time in Anaheim was magical and we do hope to see you again in the future.  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: My husband, 2 kids ( 5 & 8 ) and I  stayed at this hotel  April 17-22 to experience Disneyland. Overall, this is a clean and family friendly hotel about a 15 min walk to Downtown Disney. There is a Shell gas station as well as a Mexican restaurant just 2 mins down the block. Convenient for picking up some last minute goodies! Like some cheap beer ;) This hotel is located in a residential area.  The front desk staff were very welcoming and friendly. My husband had upgraded us to a Double Suite. It consists of a separate living room (with a tv, sofa bed and wet bar with microwave and fridge) and a bedroom with either 2 queen beds or 1 king ( with tv and bathroom). Don't worry about the small square pillows, we are slpet fine using them. There are not many of these rooms, as they
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing our hotel. We are thrilled you had a good time. We do hope to see you again. BTW-our exterior facelift is complete and the hotel looks beautiful!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: We stayed 2 nights while visiting the Disneyland Resort.  The rooms are clean, modern and comfy.  We did have a noise issue due to a very load compressor in the soft drink machine near our room, and since the hotel was completely booked we couldn't move to another room.  Thankfully I had my iPad sleep machines app, which I cranked up loud enough to mask the offending noise.  Great restaurant and bar made our mornings and evenings pleasant, and the staff were friendly and competent.  The park is close enough for a longish walk, about .3 miles to the main gate, plus the ART shuttle makes frequent stops.  I will stay there any time we visit Disney.

Before our stay here, I had read a mixture of reviews.. I must say, I was pleasantly surprised. We stayed here for 3 nights in a suite with 2 Queen beds. The rooms were a good size and clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We ate breakfast in the restaurant each morning(very nice), and a great price. The hotel is close to Disneyland, about 10 minute walk or there is a fantastic car service Performance Travel & Tours phone: 714-745-8935 that will pick you up and take  and collect you from where-ever you want to go. We used this service the whole time we stayed in Anaheim, as it was cheaper than a shuttle or taxi. If I had to complain about anything, it would be - our flight arrived at 7.00 am, and we arrived at the hotel around 10.00 am, check - in isn't until 4.00

We planned our Disney trip 15 months in advance planning for my daughters 5th birthday.  We booked three rooms with Holiday Inn customer service.  When we booked we needed one room with a king bed connecting to another room with two queen beds for my kids 4 and 3 and another room for the grandparents.  48 hours to our arrival I called the hotel to make sure we could get two rooms connecting.  I was told that they don't have connecting rooms at this location. Going into panic mode thinking great our FAMILY vacation will be ruined my husband and I will have to split up and each take a child to sleep in different rooms every ought of our week long stay. I was near tears. But Gary at the front desk said let me work on this and ill call you back. Within an hour he had called me back

Summary Heading: The Good. The Bad. And the Meh.
Summary: As there were 7 of us needing 3 rooms over the busy President's Day holiday weekend, we made reservations +6 months in advance and then called the hotel directly shortly before our arrival to try to book rooms together. We were told that we had 3 rooms side by side, (we were even given the room numbers), were told one room was a suite for the family of 4, and that all rooms had a view of the Disneyland Resort fireworks.  Upon arrival, not only were the three rooms we were told we had booked NOT booked, none were suites, and the staff member actually laughed saying that because of the orientation of the hotel buildings, NONE of them had a view of the fireworks. He had no idea why we had been told any of the above and had no record of the previous conversation where we thought
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your stay with us. We are glad you had an overall good time while you were here but it is obvious we have some work to do in training our staff to consistntly communicate our amenities and location to our guests. I assure you we are busy improving in this area. I've let the restaurant know they did a good job.  Please feel free to call and ask for me if you should have any questions or if I can help you plan your next trip. Our exterior facelift is complete, we are nearly finished installing new furniture in all guest rooms and we are putting in a cool Splash Zone for the kids that will be complete by mid-summer.  Thanks again for helping us become better!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: I spent two days in this hotel because I was attending a conference in the near-by Disneyland hotel. It was only a 10 minute walk to the Disneyland hotel and Holiday Inn was one third the price of the former hotel, which was great for my budget. I shared the room with another friend which cut the price down by another half. There was plenty of room for two people with two queen size beds and wash basin was separate from the toilet & shower allowing us to be very efficient when rushing to get to the conference in the morning. The beds were great, and lighting was good. The view from the window was not the greatest because I saw a parking lot, but I was not there for the scenery. There was a coffee machine, ironing supplies and enough closet room. The front desk staff was very

We booked a 2 bedroom suite in this hotel about six months before our intended arrival.  When we arrived there seemed to be a problem as the front desk staff kept madly typing on the computer so we could tell something was up.  After quite sometime they informed us we would have to move rooms half way through our stay.  Obviously we were quite upset at this as we had 3 kids with us and packing up when we were at the parks all day was going to be pain.  I asked to speak to the manager.  The manager was very young and didn't seem very confident he did not handle the situation very well.  To their credit they did offer us a reduction in room rate and free parking which was appreciated.  The 2 bedroom suites are in the only building that had not been renovated (from what I could
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your review of our hotel. We are very sorry for the problems you encountered with your keys and the music by the pool. I assure you we are taking the proper steps to correct these issues. While nearly all full service hotels in the US do not include breakfast, we do offer some great breakfast inclusive rates on our website.  The suite you stayed in is pictures on the Tripadvisor website and we have been getting great reviews. I apologize that it wasn't what you expected.  Thank you again.  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Holiday Inn (Address: 1240 S Walnut St, Anaheim, CA 92802; Phone:(714) 535-0300)  Thank you for having outstanding employees like Alberto on your site to help with guest needs and emergencies.    On Friday (3/29/13) morning prior to leaving for Disneyland for the day (approximately 8:30 a.m.), the clip/clasp that holds our two seat jogging stroller together broke due to our repeated use, but we needed it badly to transport our five and two-year-old daughters around the park.  I brought it downstairs looking for twine or duct tape to just ‚Äúmake it work‚Äù for the day and that‚Äôs where I met Alberto.  He was able to get a hot glue gun that fixed the cracked and broken clasp/clip and it held through the entire day, making our experience at Disneyland and our family vacation a great

Unless you have a serious health issue, it realy only takes 15 min to walk to Disneyland. We (with 2 kids, 11 and 16) found this a very good hotel for a day of fun in Disneyland. We used the pool, it's not the largest and the most fancy, but that is not what you expect in HIE hotel. The breakfast was very good although we believe the $3 uplft for using the buffet should be dropped. That is no longer common practice these days. Food quality was fine. The staff is friendly and the rooms were clean and silent. So we would recommend this hotel to friends.

Summary Heading: Very nice, but DEFINITELY not a block from Disneyland
Summary: This was a really decent hotel, but I feel that I need to set the record straight about how far this is from the front gates (read: the ONLY WAY IN) of Disneyland and California Adventure.  My husband and I and our two sons, ages 8 and 10 have been to the Disneyland Resort 7 times in the past 5 years. I have even gone three times without them while attending conferences in the area. We definitely know how to "do Disney". We are all in very good shape. The boys play hockey. My husband and I run regularly. I only tell you this so that you don't think that my review is coming from somebody who is out of shape and not used to physical activity. That said, here is the real deal about this place:  It took me, without the kids or my husband or any bags whatsoever, 20 minutes to walk
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write about your recent stay with us. We are a short 12 to 15 minute walk to the park entrance at Downtown Disney and the majority of our guests find this to be a great location. The Monorail stop is a great way to enter the park and provides fantastic views of your upcoming experience. You must have your tickets in advance or be a passholder to enter there. Discounted 2 and 3 day parkhopper passes can be purchased at our front desk or through the Disney Resort website.  Thanks again for staying with us!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Restful time was had by all.
Summary: We recently stayed at this hotel for two nights on a whirlwind tour of California and Arizona, it was a fantastic place to stay, staff were more than friendly, especially in the restaurant area, room very clean and comfortable, not far to walk down to Disney area, the only downside was that the bar and restaurant werent open during the early afternoon, such a shame that Titan Tours wont be calling there in the future, we would definitely go back independantly and would recommend it for adults and children alike!! thanks again.

Summary Heading: Overpriced, confusing, and not that close to Disney
Summary: Just stayed here while at Disneyland.  They claim to be close to the entrance, but it is pretty far to walk, and there is no free shuttle.  It would be fair enough to pay for a shuttle, but you also have to pay for parking, and I just feel that this is a bit much.  We also had made a reservation for 3 adults, for which we were charged an extra $10 when making the reservation.  Then, at the front desk, they claimed that we had to pay an additional $10.  We just needed to move on, so we agreed, but this was a shady way to begin the stay.  Now, onto the room.  We had a suite.  It was very spacious and the bedroom had doors, which was great for us with our almost-2-year-old.  HOWEVER, we had to wait for them to deliver a crib (even though we requested in advance).  Argh.  The beds
Manager Response: Dear AmyMCLA,  Thank you for your review of your stay at Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim (1 BLK/Disneyland). I am sorry you did not find our hotel to your liking.  All of our reviews are evaluated by management, and your review is no exception. Your feedback is very important to us as this assists us in continually improving the services and facilities we have to offer to our guests. Thank you again for your comments.  Your business is valued and we hope your future travel plans will continue to include IHG properties.  Regards,  Brenda J. eMedia Coordinator IHGCare

Summary Heading: Clean, Friendly Hotel - Location Not Ideal
Summary: Hotel stay was wonderful! Clean rooms that are upgraded and large, felt comfortable with family of three older siblings and myself.  The restaurant food was great and priced well.  Helpful staff, never ran into any issues.  My only complaint about the hotel (which is not something they can control) is the location. While the location is *technically* a block away, it is actually situated in an odd location to the theme parks where the main entrance is not close at all. if you are traveling with small kids, I can see the walk back to the hotel at night being not enjoyable.

This being our 3rd trip to Disneyland in the last 4 years, we were looking forward to staying at the Holiday Inn Hotel as it billed itself as very close to the theme park...it's not!  With 3 kids in tow it is a long 20 minute walk to the Disneyland entrance.  There is apparently a shuttle, however they actually charge guests to use it.  The hotel is located next to a postal depot center and across from a residential neighborhood, in other words in the middle of no-where.  There are no restaurants (other than the one in the hotel), and no services.  The hotel itself was OK, however with only 1 small elevator (we stayed on the 4th floor) the wait was ridiculous, especially with luggage when we tried to check out at 8:00am.  The pool was small and did not allow a lot of sunshine,
Manager Response: Dear James O,  Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback on your stay.  It is unfortunate the proximity of the hotel to the park was not as expected.  We are confident the necessary adjustments will be made, in order to achieve complete guest satisfaction.   Thank you again for your comments, we look forward to serving you in the future.  Sincerely,  Ben J Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: Our mistake for booking here as we had no intention of visiting Disneyland. So location is not convenient for much else. The hotel is good. Our room was very comfortable and clean. The pool area is quite relaxing. Restaurant is average and adequate for this style of hotel. If you are a Disney fan, this hotel is family friendly and the location is ideal.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We do agree that being the closest non-Disney hotel to the only park entrance outside of the main gate is perfect for visiting Disneyland. Many of our guests that don't go to Disneyland also like the fact we are on the quiet side of the park rather than the congested area of Harbor and Katella streets. So we hope you choose us again next time you are in the area. We'd love to see you again!  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Not close and no mini fridge
Summary: I requested the crib for my little one like a  month ago but when I arrived they said I didn't requested.OMG! Not close to the park and yes, no mini fridge! My kids need to take medicine and need a fridge to keep the medicine! As the other people said, the pillow is terrible!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your stay with us. We are embarrassed about not having your crib ready for you when you got here and we have put better procedures in place to make sure this doesn't happen again. We do have a limited number of fridges and microwaves available and I am sorry we didn't have one for you and your family.   Thank you again for letting us know what happened.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: The hotel was very reasonably priced (even a little cheap), so my expectations were low.  I have to say that I was impressed.  The room was clean and comfortable, plenty of space for my family of four.  The onsite restaurant was clean and well priced too.  I would not hesitate to stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are glad you stayed with us and hope to see you again soon!  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: We checked into the hotel and were very impressed with the welcome we received from the front desk staff. When we went to the room, however we had to dodge construction that is currently underway at the hotel. Once in the room my daughter sat down on the floor to take offs her shoes and found herself sitting in a large puddle of what smelled suspiciously like urine. We were offered another room but that left us even further away from the front door. On the morning we decided to sleep in we were woken by construction noise.  On the issue if sleep the beds were quite comfortable but the pillows were weird squares, stuffed with hard squares of foam-nasty.   The location is not exactly close to the gates of the park. We have no problem walking but found the walk longer than the
Manager Response: Thank you for telling us about how your stay went. We do apologize for the leak in your room and I assure you it was fixed. Our walk time time to the park entrance is averaging 12 to 15 minutes and that is the most convenient way to enter the park at the Monorail stop there if you already have tickets or passes. With our exterior painting nearly complete, we do hope you would reconsider trying us again. Please feel free to call me directly at the hotel if I can be of any further assistance.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: I took cash w/out thinking to pay for my room. Yes, dumb I know better than that and of course it caused a problem at check-in. Instead of giving me a minute to figure things out, the man at the front desk asked me if I wanted him to call another hotel. If it weren't for other people in our group being checked in I definitely would've have gone to another hotel! After figuring things out, I went back to the hotel expecting to have to deal w the same man and was not too happy but thank goodness I was greeted with a smile by another staff member. What an awesome, awesome person he is! His name was Victor. He was so respectful, he helped me get all checked in and treated my family and I like royalty. Every hotel needs staff members like him! Thanks to Victor, he made our stay a
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay with us. We are glad everyone had a good time and we hope to see you again soon! I've also given Victor kudos for a job well done and I appreciate you letting me know how he performed.  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: If you enjoy sleeping in a can a Lysol, this is the place for you
Summary: My family checked in on a trip to Disneyland (January 2013).  Upon walking in the front door, the first thing I see is people consuming alcohol at an open bar which doubles as their breakfast area.  They offer no free breakfasts. The hotel lobby, hallways, and room were outdated and run down.  I saw wall paper peeling off the walls in the hallways and their elevators were terribly slow.  Everything in the room felt like it was coated with something - most likely some cleaning spray as the smell of Lysol or something like it permeated the entire room.  Instead of a normal pillow, they provide these square shaped pillows on the beds that aren't comfortable in the least.  My wife and I found another hotel online and checked out the very next day staying less than 24 hours.  For the
Manager Response: Dear J G,   Thank you very much for taking the time to share your comments online. I am sorry we were not able to exceed or at least be at par with your expectation. Your comments about the room conditions have been documented and will certainly be looked into. We take the confidence our guests place in us very seriously and work diligently to rectify any unsatisfactory experiences. We hope that you will give us another opportunity to pamper you and provide you with exceptional service.  Sincerely,   Janice A Case Manager  IHGCare

Summary: I was pleasantly surprised at every turn! The service at this hotel was outstanding....the staff, in particular, Joshua at the front desk, made every effort to accommodate us and were super friendly and efficient.  The restaurant food was always very good and reasonably priced.  On a few occasions we actually made the trip back from Disney just for a meal. The  hotel was a very easy walk to downtown Disney.  My 3 kids never complained about it being too far. Great value for the $.
Manager Response: We thank you for taking the time to let us know about your stay with us. We are thrilled you and your family had a good time. We do hope to see you again the next time you come to the area!  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Just got back, and well, I really liked this property the last two times I stayed there (gave it 4 stars over a year ago), but this time wasn't as good. At check in I tried to get a refrigerator for my son's medications. They told me they'd call my room within 30 minutes after locating one... well, I waited for an hour and never got a call, when I called back they basically said they didn't have any, and there was nothing they could do. I made a trip to the store and picked up a foam ice chest to get us through the night. Next Morning I ask the desk again, and they now have a ton of them, for a $10/night fee. I've been staying at the Hilton a few times in the past year, while they also don't have them in rooms, they bring them to your room without any issues (usually before you
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent experience with us. We do apologize for the service issues you had and I assure you we are taking every step to make sure they do not happen again. Also, the City of Anaheim requires that hotels that charge for parking must also charge the city's accomodation taxes associated with that charge. As we finished our work on the exterior of the building we hope you will decide to visit us again and see our improvements.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Location has to be a must as well as the size of the family suite.  We are a family of 5 and fitted more than comfortably into the suite, along with 5 large suitcases.  The ART stopping at the door was also a bonus for us.  The breakfast was good and reasonably priced.  Couldn't fault the hotel and hopefully will be back in 2014!
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments! We too look forward to seeing you next year!!  Thank you!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Great stay at the Holiday Inn!
Summary: We decided to treat our boys to their first Disneyland trip last October. We chose this hotel based on the reviews from Trip Advisor as well as the great package deal offered by Westjet Vacations. We had a wonderful stay at the hotel, the boys (6 and 3) LOVED the pool and hot tub, both of which were open till late evening. Even in October, we closed down that pool every night. The walk to downtown Disney was lovely. We did bring our stroller in case the little one's legs got tired and in case we got tired of carrying all of our necessary things for the day - water, food, towels, etc. The hotel itself was clean and quiet in the rooms despite the number of young families staying there. We requested a fridge and microwave for our room for a $5 per day charge - well worth it so that
Manager Response: Our staff is very happy you enjoyed your time here. We love our Westjet travelers!!  We hope to see you again on your next trip to the Magic Kingdom!  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: This was the first time we've stayed off property to go to Disneyland.   We are used to the Grand Californian, and the D-land Hotel.  The experience began when I called the hotel to request a refrigerator in the room.  Javier could not have been kinder, or more accommodating.  He set our vacation off to the right start! we checked in, and found our room to be spacious, clean, and comfortable.  The staff made all of the difference.  They were all so courteous, kind, and made sure our vacation was perfect.  the 10 dollar parking fee...I cant believe people are upset about this...They tell you verbally, There are 2 signs in the lobby, and you sign a parking agreement upon check in! 10 dollars a day for parking is SOOOOOO CHEAP! embrace it.  the construction...Even the construction
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments. We are thrilled you enjoyed your time with us and we hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely,   Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Selected the Holiday in on Walnut St for this vacation. The hotel was your average Holiday Inn. Nothing fancy, but fit our needs. The onsite dining was affordable and good but the service was a little slow at times. Pool was sufficient but lacked a shallow place for our toddler to splash around Short walk to Disney trams (15min) or about 25min to walk right to the front gates. Seemed a little further at the end of the day with a 5 year sleeping on my shoulders :)  Only thing I wish is the room had a fridge as that is a huge help in keeping trip costs down.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing our hotel and letting us know about your experience. Our location close to Downtown Disney is great and we are glad you enjoyed that. We also have have discounted 2 and 3 day passes available at our front desk that enable our guests to use the Monorail entrance at Downtown Disney and save some walk time to the Magic Kingdom.  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: The hotel was clean and well maintained. The staff was very thoughtful annd helpfull throughout my stay.  I would like to point out Jennifer in particular for going the extra mile, helping this tired traveler to make last minute connections to LAX, and home.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing our hotel during your recent trip to Anaheim. We are thrilled we were able to provide you with an enjoyable experience and we hope to see you soon!  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: So disappointed in our stay --- from the rude checkin person -- to the $25 charged for parking fees --- sent to the WRONG BUILDING and ROOM --- No breakfast like our reservation stated !  Will NEVER stay here again !
Manager Response: My sincere apologies for the poor performance of my self and my staff. We are deeply dissappointed we did not provide our normal good service to you. There is no excuse for rudeness and bad directions to hotels rooms and I assure you we are taking all the steps necessary to correct this. I want to make sure there was not a billing problem as we only charge $10 to park. If you were overcharged please contact me directly at the hotel and I'll personally fix it.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: My family stayed the last week of february and we were very impressed. We would like to thank the friendly and helpful staff especially Tom. Thank you so much Tom for your amazing attitude and service. Its so nice to know there are people out there still with high standards of customer service. I pride myself with the same dedication to my clients and after staying at your hotel I got to see the flip side . We are a new family and plan on visiting Disneyland several times a year and will always stay at holiday inn. We have stayed at several other places in the past in anaheim and after staying at holiday inn theres no comparison.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind comments. We were thrilled you chose our hotel and we look forward to seeing you on your visit to the Magic Kingdom!  Best regards!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Family of 5 stayed 4 nights the week of feb.25 during our disneyland vacation .Booked thru hotels.com, got a good rate 590 which includes free breakfast for all of us, parking, and wi-fi. Did allot of research and I am glad we picked this hotel. It met all our needs, and although it isn't the most modern or new- the service was great, it was close to Disney (at least I think it is, other reviews disagree). Took us 15 min. to walk from hotel to adventureland or disney gates. 10min to downtown disney. Shuttle option for hotel, although we only used it 1 night we stayed late for a show. Call them to confirm price & shuttle details. It was 12.00 for our family for a return pass. The first nite our room was way  too small, for a small fee they upgraded us to a suite where it was way
Manager Response: Thank you fer letting us know about your recent stay with us. We are glad you liked our hotel. My apologies for the pillow size and we are working on a solution for that soon. We hope to see you again next time you come to the Disneyland Resprt area!  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Great hotel for families away from the normal hustle bustle you get on the disneyland block.
Summary: We stayed for 4 nights at the en if February. We come to disneyland about once a year for the past 8 years and we have always stayed at a different hotel because we have not found the hotel we would stay twice at...yet...I think we found it! Too far from disneyland to walk but we had season passes so we had free parking so it was not a downside for us but could be if you had to pay for parking. Loved the Mickey pool and hot tub! Breakfast was great each morning at the restaurant attach√©d to hotel. Very clean but dated. Will definitely stay again!
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing us as your home away from home. We are very happy you enjoyed your time here. We do hope we will see you every time you come to the area. As an FYI we are getting all new furniture in the rooms soon and we are installing a cool Splash Park for the kids before summer.  Thanks again for your comments!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: We stayed at this hotel because it seemed very convient and we would earn points for Holiday Inn. I would strongly recommend staying at one of the Disneyland Hotels if at all possible, the staff we talked to on the phone was very friendly and willing to help, but once we got to the hotel did not even care that we were staying with them. We booked out room online and then a few weeks later decided that we needed to stay an extra night so we called the hotel directly to add a night to our stay. The receptionist on the phone was great, said that he would change it right away and he told us everything had been changed. He failed to give me a confirmation number which was my fault in part, but I didn't think it was necessary as the changes were applied to our current reservation.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments. We apologize that we fell short in providing you with great service. I've discussed the proper procedures with our staff regarding adding an extra day to a reservation and I assure you will do a better job in the future. We do hope you will give us another chance to shine the next time you are in the area.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: I stayed here during the Disneyland Tinkerbell Half Marathon weekend, and it was the best decision, as I didn't have to pay Disney fees to stay at the park.  It was an easy walk to to the park, and also for the run on Sunday morning.  The beds were comfy, great breakfast as well, very quiet.  Great value, will stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing our hotel. We are very happy you had a good time. We look forward to hosting you again during the next Tinkerbell run!  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: We stayed in the hotel for 10 days from Feb 17-27. The front desk staff were awesome!!  They were very helpful with all our questions and requests. Our kids loved the pool and it has a very good hot tub. The maid service was exceptional and our rooms were cleaned every day!  We didn't eat at the restaurant that much but the few times we did for breakfast the buffet was okay.   My overall recommendation is it was a very good stay and we would definitely stay there again!!  Scott
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are thrilled you enjoyed yourself here. We look forward to seeing you again!  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: We obtained our room from skyauction.com and paid less than $100  a night- a very good value.  The room we received was in an excellent location - very close proximity to the business center, laundry, entrance to our room, lobby.  Room was spacious, very, very clean; beds were very comfortable.   We really enjoyed our stay.  The only disappointing aspect was having to pay to use the business center and $10 a day for parking - however, this may be because this hotel is close to Disneyland and there is a shuttle (so I guess one would save money by leaving car at hotel).  Check-in was quick; receptionist was courteous.   We enjoyed our 2 night stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know how your recent stay with us went. We are very glad you had a good time. Come see us again soon!  Thank you!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: The worse of all Holiday Inn‚Äôs that we have ever stayed in.  Hotel is old and shows it.  There‚Äôs no refrigerator or Microwave.  Small puffy pillows and really soft beds.  The room was really stuffy and the air conditioner barely worked.  Hotel was under renovation so you couldn‚Äôt‚Äô see out any windows.  There‚Äôs no complimentary breakfast.  The restaurant was good but pricy.  And the most upsetting was having to pay $23.00 for two nights for parking in an open lot... seriously?   Ridiculous!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your stay with us. I apologize your experience was a dissappointment. While nearly all full service hotels next to Disneyland charge for parking, we are priced towards the lower end of the scale. We are beautifying our hotel with a new stucco exterior we are only doing 1/3 of the hotel at a time so I do apologize for your window being blocked. Should you have any questions or further comments please feel free to contact me at the hotel.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager 714-535-0300

Summary: This hotel was great. We stayed in a suite which was surprisingly large, around double the size of a regular room. The decor was a little dated/worn and in the kitchen there was no cutlery which made it difficult when it came to eating so we had to nip out to Walmart for some flatwear and cutlery. Despite this the location made up completely for this. The hotel is situated on the edge of Disneyland California and it backs onto the rear carpark of Disneyland. The pool is nice and is a great little sun trap. There are plenty of sun loungers and canopies so there is no fighting. In the hotel there is a lovely restaurant and the food was amazing although a little expensive. The staff were all friendly and check in was a breeze. Within the room the are two televisions and two rooms,
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments. We are very happy you had a good time while you were here. We hope to see you again soon!  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Like Melissa my travel agent booked this hotel on behalf for my son and I to stay for ten days in september. I never asked about a refrigerator or microwave as it usually is in every hotel room amd I am quite disappointed its not in ours! Staying for ten days I dont particularly want to have to eat out all the time. I am also now concerned about all the bad reviews! Thin wall, dirty, bad food, no pillows and worst of all the advertisement of this hotel (and number one reason I chose it) claimed to be only a minutes walk....turns out its a ten to fifteen! Very unsure if I should take a chance and stay risking my trip of a lifetime, or changing hotel? My question then would be, can I after ive booked and paid for it???
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. I'm very sorry but I am not sure how I can help you. I do want to assure you we have some microwaves and fridges here for rent at very reasonable rates. Just let us know in advance. We are also 1 block or 10-15 minutes walk from the park entrance in Downtown Disney. You can buy discounted tickets at our front desk for two or three day passes and you can enter the park with them (or other Disney passes) at the Monorail stop in Downtown Disney. Please feel free to call me at the hotel so I can help you further.  Thank you!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager 714-535-0300

Summary: I just booked this hotel today to take my grandson to Disnryland. I booked through a travel agent. I initially asked for.a suite so I could have some time to myself after he went to sleep. But she told me there were no suites available. I was very excited about staying at this hotel until I read the reviews. My travel agent neglected to tell me there were no refrigerators in the rooms. This is a major unconvinced for me travelling with a 7 year old who has health issues and I won't be able to have any refrigerator snacks or healthy foods on hand.  I wonder if it's too late for me to change hotels. To read the closest place to eat is in the hotel and it is pricey scares me.   If I am not able to change hotels hopefully the positive I read makes up for the shortcomings. I will
Manager Response: HI there. We do have a limited amount fridges and microwaves available. I've reserved them for you and we look forward to seeing you in March! Please call me if you have any questions.  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager 714-535-0300

Summary Heading: ants, over charging and bad service
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for four nights in a standard 2 queen bedroom over a holiday weekend and the first 3 nights were fine. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful at this point. On our 3rd day at Disneyland we checked our bank account to find out that the hotel charged us over $200 extra by mistake. I called the hotel and was placed on hold for 10 minutes!! I ended up hanging up and calling back and the front desk put me on hold again to look into for 8 minutes.. When they came back on the line they told me that the guy who had checked us in made a mistake and charged our full amount rather than just the partial for the deposit and that they would refund the money within 5 days.. No big deal right? He also agreed to give me a receipt for records as they made a mistake.
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about your experience. We are very sorry we did not provide you with our normal excellent service. I assure you my staff and myself are doing everything in our power to make sure this does not happen again.  We would love to have you stay with us again and allow us to show you our improvements. Please call me at the hotel if you have any questions or comments.  Thank you  Tom Van Winkle General Manager 714-678-0301

Summary: We took a trip to Southern California with our 2 year old grand daughter and had a great stay at this hotel. The front desk staff, the restaurant employees, and housekeeping staff were very helpful and professional. We have stayed here before and will again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind comments. I will definitely share them with our team. We hope to see you again soon!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: 1. After checking in I went up to my assigned room only to my horror to find out I was given a room already occupied by a couple that obvious didn't want to be interrupted.  I had to lug all my luggage back to the front and wait another 10 minutes to have my room reassigned.  The next morning someone from the outside neighborhood had managed to get into the hotel and the gym where I was working out. Apparently the door between the pool and the entrance was not locking. I was scared because of the things he was asking, saying and suggesting to me.   I was not able to complete my workout and was frazzled for quite some time. After calling my husband, I went to the front dest to express my concerns. Upon checking out the front desk clerk indicated that for my trouble they were
Manager Response: I'm very sorry for what happened. Please contact me at the hotel so I can fix this. 714-535-3000.  Thank you  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: We stayed here for 7 nights at the end of January 2013. The 2 queen bed suite with a private bed room is the way to go for a family of 4. Lots of room, two flat screen hd tv's, breakfast bar, sink, microwave, fridge, living area and a desk. All the facilities were clean and staff were very friendly and helpful.They even let you print off airport boarding passes and restaraunt coupons at the front desk. The restaraunt food is ok (breakfast buffet was a little cold) and kids eat for free off the menu.  It takes about 10 minutes to walk to the Disney parking lot tram and about 15 minutes to walk to the Monorail in Downtown Disney. The Monorail is a great way to get into Disneyland Park and avoid the lineups at the main gate.
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know how your stay with us went. We are glad you had a good time and took advantage of our great location.   We are also committed to do better with the quality of our breakfast buffet.  Thank you!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Not a 3 star like Priceline said
Summary: Hotel had no view only view of parking lots and our room was right over the laundry room so we has a view of dirty Landry and pipes . The rooms were clean but beds hard a a rock and the smallest pillows I ever saw thought they were for decor. Walls seem thin we heard everyone in the halls and surounding rooms toilets flush Are floor had no ice so we had to go up one floor or down one. I was also surprised they charged $10 a night for parking I have paid it at other hotels but just didn't think this one was worth it
Manager Response: Dear gina k,   Thank you for staying with us and providing us with your valuable feedback. We are hospitality professionals who  work diligently to ensure our facilities are well maintained and we strive to provide service rates that are competitive in the area. It is certainly not our intent to inconvenience our valued customers, but to instead provide good value, comfortable, clean and friendly accommodations. Your feedback is of great importance to us and allows us to monitor and improve our service continually.  Once again many thanks for your feedback.   Sincerely,   Janice A Case Manager  IHGCare

Summary: I would stay here again, that is the easiest way to sum up the Holiday inn and suites.  The top feature is that it is close to the Disneyland parking structure, in fact it is probably the easiest 3 star hotel to get to the parking garage.  The rooms were clean, the staff was great and room had a flat screen.  Here are the not so great things about this hotel: 1. It says one block from Disneyland, but walking one block gets you to the edge of the Disneyland hotel parking lot.  To get  to the parks, i would say the the walk is 1 1/2 to 2 miles.    2. The hotel has a funky set up.  Building 2 and 3 are connected to each other, and building 2 is connected to the main lobby.  But the other two buildings are not connected.   3. There is really no view from any of the rooms.  You have
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments. As an FYI there is a Disneyland entrance in Downtown Disney that is a 12 minute walk from our front door. They don't sell tickets there but if you have a pass or already have tickets or buy discounted two or 3 day passes from our front desk you can use that entrance. Otherwise, the main entrance to the park is another 5 minutes through Downtown Disney. The ART shuttle also stops at our front door and that goes to the main entrance. All day tickets are $5 or $2 for children under 9.  We do hope you come visit us the next time you are here!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: We recently stayed here the other night. Got good deal with Hotwire. Located behind Downtown Disney. It's a good long walk. However, the ART shuttle also makes a stop here so decided to take that. Seemed to come by pretty often going to Disneyland.   We got a room in construction area. Didn't hear anything, but that's probably because we were at Disneyland during the day. Room was nice and front desk folks were all very friendly and helpful. Room was very clean and will definetely stay here again!
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know how things went on your trip here to Anaheim. Since the work we are doing on the building is just a stucco project to enhance our appearance there there is little or no problems to our guests. All facilities are open and ready for our valued guests when they need us!  We hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely,  Tom  Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: This budget hotel thinks it's a resort
Summary: PRO: 1. Close enough to Disneyland to walk to, although is it a long walk. 2. All of the personnel that we dealt with were very friendly and helpful. 3. WiFi is free  CON: 1. The room had 2 double beds, not queens. 2. The room itself was so small that the double beds barely fit, there was about 6 inches between the side of the beds and the walls. 3. $10 dollars a night for parking 4. No lounge area for guests to sit, read the paper, and have coffee in the morning.  There is a sofa and 2 chairs outside the restuarant, but it is very loud and crowded. 5. Regular room rates are very expensive.  We got a deal on our room though one of the discount travel sites, but they slipped someone else's bill under our door one night and the standard rate was twice what I paid.
Manager Response: Dear tjdmlhw,  Thank you for taking the time to express your thoughts and concerns. I am more than happy that you liked our location and found our staff to be very friendly. Please allow me to apologize for the inconvenience and negative impression you may have had on some aspect during your stay. I assure you that every comment, no matter how small, is taken very seriously. We hope to get a chance of hosting you again and show you how great our hotel is. We appreciate your feedback as this is our best resource for improving guest services.  Sincerely,  Karen G.  Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: Check in was excellent and quick.  Roy was awesome.  The manager that we talked to (did not get his name) was super. This place far exceeded our expectations. We walked to Downtown Disney and Disneyland about (7) times without problems.   It was about 20 min.  Parking was fine.  The room was great.  Maintenence help us fix a stroller.  Food was OK....Kids at Free!  The pool was nice....kids had fun....it was nice a warm.    Our whole family of (5) would recommend this property to anyone and would stay here again in a heartbeat.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments and we are glad you had a good time. We hope to see you again soon!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: My bf and I are locals and wanted a night out at Disney with a show at House of Blues to finish the night.  We booked Holiday Inn & Suites through Priceline and it was great.  The room was updated, the beds were comfortable (amazingly soft sheets) and the convenience of the $5/pp shuttle to and from Disney was awesome.  Would definitely recommend a stay at this hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us. If you have an annual pass we have a great package deal for you so next time call the hotel directly when you need a room!  Thank you!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: We stayed here in the fall for a week long Disneyland trip.  It was our fourth time to Disney and first time to this hotel.  I don't know why people complain about the distance to the park.  We walked it in the morning and again around 11pm everyday with three kids easily (no strollers either).  In the long scheme of things when you are walking around the park all day what's a 10 minute walk back to your hotel!  We got the large top floor suite.  It had living area, bar with sink, fridge and stools to sit at and then another large room with two queens. The only complaint would be the uncomfortable hide a bed mattress.  It was pretty bad.  We tried laying blankets on the mattress for our son but it didn't help with the springs and we were pretty close to buying a novaform

This hotel is pretty good overall. The room itself is nice, but the bathroom is very cramped (toilet paper hidden behind the bathroom door, etc) and the shower was very difficult to turn on. The in house restaurant was nice, we ate there twice and were happy with prices/service. The free wifi was "busy" on our first night, and Reception didn't care when we complained. There is a $10 per day parking fee, which we weren't aware of before arrival. A bit rich when it's just an outside car park - no security or under cover area, and it is purely a 'first come first served' basis. We were on the ground floor, which was great for ease of access to our room from the carpark, but annoying when the car park could see directly into our room. Every day the maid opened the curtains up! On
Manager Response: Dear Mandy-S-Oz,  Thank you for your feedback. We take our guest comments very seriously and always strive to provide comfortable and friendly accommodations. We appreciate that you find our location to be convenient and for your nice comment regarding our restaurant.  However, We‚Äôre sorry we fell below your expectation regarding customer service and the bathroom experience.  We will look into this point. I assure you the feedback of our hotel will be reviewed and most certainly forwarded to the appropriate departments. We take  the confidence our guests place in us very seriously and work diligently to rectify any unsatisfactory experiences. We hope you give us a chance in the future to show you how great our hotel is.  Sincerely,  Orlando A. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary Heading: Average hotel, staff to be more helpful
Summary: Right after booking, I've written a letter to the address at hotel's web site to clarify my needs. No feedback at all.  Upon arrival, the staff at the reception seemed to be too tired. They just wanted to check you in and not willing to help for further questions.  Holding a Gold Ambassador card and knewing what are the benefits of it, all my attempts were rejected politely. The attitude was "so what you have that card"  Room was comfortable for us. Bathroom was excellent, having everything we needed and expected. The air conditioning was trouble. It worked so strong that, we could not turn it on continuously. In five minutes the room was hot, but after two hours it is cold again. Therefore, night was quite uncomfortable.  Hotel is 15-20 minutes walk from Disneyland downtown. A
Manager Response: Dear Eyrice,  Thank you so much for taking the time to leave us your feedback. Your comments are highly valuable to us and will assist us in our continuous efforts to maintain and improve the service level we aim for. I am pleased to know that you had a satisfactory stay at our hotel and apologize for the shortfalls you have encountered. I appreciate feedback that we receive, whether positive and negative to ensure we provide the best level of service and facilities that we can give to our guests. Thank you again for your review and I hope to have an opportunity of welcoming you back again soon.  Sincerely,  Krysllin G. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: Did not seem suited to families going to Disneyland. No free Disneyland shuttle. No breakfast buffet.  Daily parking charge which was not disclosed on the online booking. Room was a bit cramped. Commode and shower very cramped.   Next time staying elsewhere.
Manager Response: Dear Steve S,  Thank you for taking the time to relay your comments regarding our property during your recent stay. I apologize you were not fully satisfied with your accommodations and the service you received during your stay. We just want to assure you that our hotel is very proud of its level of service, cleanliness and quality of its product. We are sorry we fell below your expectations this particular day. I have taken note of your valuable comments and will use these to monitor and improve the quality of breakfast and services we offer to our guests.  If there is anything we can do to make your next stay more comfortable, please do not hesitate to ask the Manager on Duty.  Sincerely,   Connie D Case Manager IHGCare

Summary Heading: good value hotel but a little away from the action
Summary: Our family stayed here during the Christmas week of 2012. We got a great rate of $77 USD a night. The hotel is in a residential area and about a 10 minute walk to the Disneyland hotel. There is the ART bus will drop you off at Disneyland but we walked everytime. The lobby was nice but I found the rooms a little tired but for what we paid I'm not complaining especially during the busy Christmas week.  There is a petrol station next door that you can buy drinks at non Disney prices and pick up stuff for breakfast. Our family tended to eat at downtown Disney most nights as it was on our walk home. I liked the hotel but I wouldn't recommend it as I think the hotels directly opposite Disneyland are more convenient even if you pay a little extra.

Fiance and i stayed saturday night (1/6/13) got in around 7pm. front desk manager check us in right away and gave us a water bottle and a bag of goodies for being priority club members a nice little unexpected treat. Also when I made the reservations I forgot I have AAA so i didnt make the reservation using the discount but when we got in the front desk manager was able to apply the discount. took off $9 which was nice, we only ended up paying $1 for the parking. Room was clean, bed was comfy, I like that you feel safe enough to leave your car in the parking, even go downstairs in the middle of the night when you realize you forgot your phone in the car (LOL). As always we can't wait to go back for another random disneyland trip and stay at the holiday inn :)

Summary Heading: Long one block to the park
Summary: agree with the rest of the reviews that its a long one block to the park.  We have now stayed at both holiday inns in Anaheim and this one is cleaner but it lacks the free breakfast, free parking, microwave, and frig in the room.  Pro: Clean, price, friendly staff, walking distance but still a far walk. Cons: No microwave, no frig, $10 per night for parking, no breakfast, elevators are super slow.  For an off property Disneyland hotel I would say its about average.  If the price point were the same I would book the other Holiday Inn for the free breakfast and free parking.  Also, the gift shop was extremely expensive so if you need anything you are better off driving to a nearby store.
Manager Response: Dear Rani C,  Thank you so much for taking the time to leave us your feedback. Your comments are highly valuable to us and will assist us in our continuous efforts to maintain and improve the service level we aim for. I am pleased to know that you had a satisfactory stay at our hotel. I appreciate feedback that we receive, whether positive and negative to ensure we provide the best level of service and facilities that we can give to our guests. Thank you again for your review and I hope to have an opportunity of welcoming you back again soon.  Sincerely,  Krysllin G. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: Stayed here for a week, booked through one of those 'blind' booking sites to save some money during the busy holiday season. The room was comfortable, and we ended up with a 2 Queen bed room, which was perfect for us. The room was right near the elevator, which I was initially concerned about, but the elevator was surprisingly quiet, so it wasn't an issue. The front desk staff were very courteous and helpful as well.  There is not much around the hotel, just a convencience store at the gas station around the corner, so dining options are limited to the hotel restaurant unless you want to walk to Downtown Disney.  We ended up eating 3 times at the restaurant, due to timing and circumstance. The first time was bad, I ordered the T-bone steak and when it came, the server asked if I
Manager Response: Thank you very much for letting us know about your experience at our hotel. I do apologize for the inconsistencies in our food and I assure you I have addressed these with our kitchen staff. We will do everything we can to ensure this is fixed and we deliver quality food every time.  Thank you for staying with us and we do hope to see you again.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Location is OK, close enough to Disney within 15 minutes walk so will save you parking at Disney (which is btw located right next to the hotel).  It's also close to I-5 and to many resaurants and businesses (car rentals etc.) on Katela and Harbor.  The staff was friendly and helpful but I didn't like a few things: * the rooms are way too small * there's a coffee machine in the room, but no fridge or microwave. You can order them (based on availability) and pay and extra $10 per appliance per night (way overpriced!) * the building looks old. Elevators are slow and old. * breakfast is not included (as in many HI hotels) * wifi signal in my room was very weak  * parking is not included in the room rate. It was $10 a night for me. In my opinion, you do need a car even if you just
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay with us. I do want to let you know we will be improving our hotel very soon.
