New furniture and fixtures in the guest rooms and a complete remodeling of our exterior should be completed in the next 2 months. We will also be adding a great splash park for the kids this spring. We do hope to see you again soon and have you experience our new and improved look!  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: I stayed here for a total of 8 nights and I totally loved it. This hotel has everything you would need. The parking got quite busy on an evening when everybody was back from the theme parks but I was always able to find a space. We had a larger family room as I was travelling in a  group of three adults. We had a queen sized bed each and I sleeper sofa which was great with some extra blankets underneath for padding. The room was huge with a small kitchen which came in useful. Bathroom was large with a powerful shower which didn't steam up. Our view wasnt the greatest but this hotel is in a residential area so its what I expected. The view was of the Disneyland carpark which you actaully have to drive too as the etrance is so far and its a busy road so its safer to drive. We used

Summary Heading: That's a LONG one block to Disneyland!
Summary: This hotel was a big disappointment. We booked it because of the price and it's claim to be one block (walking distance) from Disneyland. If that was one block, it was the longest block I have ever walked in my life. We were a group of 4 adults- no kids and no health restrictions that would make the walk difficult. We did the walk one day only and then ended up paying for the shuttle bus the rest of the days. I have stayed at the hotels across from the "main gate" before and, to me, that is one block. This walk back to the hotel was not something we ended up wanting to do after a long day of walking around the parks. Also, the street you have to walk down seemed a bit unsafe at night. There were not a lot of people walking in that area and the lighting was dim. As for the room
Manager Response: Dear Kelly J,  Thank you for taking the time to express your thoughts and concerns. I am so glad you liked our on-site hotel restaurant. I would like to apologize the location of our hotel did not live up to your expectations. I am also sorry for the issues you had with the noise and your room accommodations. I understand the discomfort this has caused you. The feedback we receive from our valued guests, like you, enables us to target problem areas and take the necessary actions to ensure similar situations can be avoided in the future. Thank you for staying with us and we hope you give us another chance in the future to make your stay as best as it can be.  Sincerely,  Anthony M Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: Stayed 2 nights with grand daughters at Christmas.   Pros: fair value for the area.   20 minute walk to Disneyland restaurant on site. breakfast buffet was very good.and fairly priced Kids eat free with adults Cons: rooms are small bathroom/shower is tiny older hotel in need of a makeover, some lifting of wall paper, dirty seams around tub, etc. some park noise late at night $10/day parking fee  all in all this is a really fair deal if you're going to disneyland.  Clean, reliable, and the staff is helpful.  Reccommended

We took our 3 kids for New Years at Disneyland.  My husband found this hotel and its amazing deal.  We walked to Disney every day and enjoyed the clean, quite and wonderful staff!  We will be come back again!

This was our first stop in the USA & what a lovely group of people who work at this hotel. "All" of the staff - front desk, restaurant etc were so accommodating, lovely & friendly. The food was great & very reasonably priced! The hotel itself was a bit aged but very clean & had all amenities we needed for a great stay in Disneyland. This hotel staff set a very high bench mark for the rest of our stay in the USA. We would definitely recommend for any family to stay here.

The best thing about this hotel is that it's walking distance to Downtown Disney and the monorail entrance. The room was reasonable, but nothing special. The hotel is pretty big with several buildings, and there is ample parking. The fitness room was a little lacking, although they did have a pool (which I didn't have time to use).  Nothing here stood out, although that isn't necessarily a bad thing, since nothing negative stood out either. It was pretty much what you expect from a Holiday Inn. They were nice about letting me park there in the morning on the day of check-in so that we wouldn't have to park at Disneyland. Thumbs up for that.

We visited this Holiday Inn hotel on Dec 9011 - Jan 2012. The staff were friendly and always there to help. Nothing too much of a bother and they basically became family over those 2 weeks. Thank you Roxanne, Roberto, Miguel & Princess.  We were given all the great places to shop, the best times to go to Disneyland vs shopping, when to go to the Citadel due to traffic. this was a dream come true for me and to also have my husband and 2 children was just great. it was a definite once in a lifetime holiday. The rooms were clean, the toilet/shower was a bit small as having to share with 2 boys. Only problem we had was if you wanted a coffee you had trouble getting water for the jug.

We stayed recently at the end of November/beginning of December.  The rooms were clean and staff was friendly.  It's no longer than a 10min walk to downtown Disney and another 5/10min to the main gate dependent on how busy it is.  The restaurant food was decent and staff was very accommodating. Many afternoons we just ordered the family pizza deal to our room. $20 gets u a large pizza, pitcher of drinks, garlic bread and salad. We spent less doing that then actually dinning in the restaurant where the kids eat free! My only complaint is the in room coffee. It tasted HORRIBLE! I would stay here again.

We (Dad, mom, 8 yr old and 5 yr old) stayed here for 8 nights in Dec 2012. When we reserved we asked for an upper floor room and got a main floor room. We also asked for a fridge rental ($10 daily) and upon getting into our room there was none, so we had to call and ask again. On their website it says "self-parking" but they don't mention the $10 daily fee unlike the airport shuttle service "Airport Shuttle Transportation (Fee)". But the biggest complaint was the major building construction going on 40 feet from our window that woke us up at 6:30am everyday. (which is no fault of the Holiday Inn)  Sure it is within walking distance to Disneyland, but definitely not after a day of walking around the parks. Make use of the Anaheim Resort Transit system for $3 an adult and $1 per

The location was perfect for our Disneyland trip and it was convenient that it has a restaurant and bar on-site. Staff was friendly and fast, lobby and common areas clean. The rooms are in need of an upgrade however.

Although this hotel was farther to Disneyland than could comfortably be walked, the city bus shuttle made frequent stops there. The staff are all very nice and attentive, rooms are clean and comfortable.  A couple of drawbacks to this hotel is they have no free breakfast (and the buffet was expensive for the quality of the food offered) and no microwaves or refrigerators in the rooms.AND of course coffee offered by this chain is the worst.

I stayed here when I went to Disneyland. location was excellent. I walked to Disneyland in about 20 minutes. You can Take the ART shuttle from the hotel to Disneyland if you want. If you are a senior pay when you ride instead of buying a $5 pass as it only costs $1 one way and you save a lot of money. The hotel staff was great and very helpful and courteous. Rooms were great and I paid a lot less than one of the other hotels in the area. I do not generally stay at Holiday Inns but this was nice and I would consider it again. Parking is $10 per day at the hotel. Rooms were nice and service was everyday. Great place to sleep and refresh after a day at Disneyland. Hotel restaurant was a little expensive however.

We rented two rooms here for under $100 each per night.  parking is $10 per car, and wifi is free. Overall the property was clean, staff were friendly, and there was a pool and hot tub. If you are looking for a family friendly place to stay, get out early to the parks, and have a place to let the kids splash in the pool before bed, it's hard to go wrong with this place.

This is an excellent hotel It is within walking distance of Disney. There is a convenience store and a Mexican Restaurant at the nearby service station. Other than these, you need a car. We were on a bus tour and felt remote. You can get a pick up bus to three beaches whicfjh weerre interesting.

Huge suite with kitchenette that had coffee machine, fridge & microwave. Both rooms had large flat screen televisions so kids didn't have to watch CNN and we didn't have to watch Cartoon Connection.  Staff were friendly and helpful. Quiet, peaceful place to rest after a big day at Disneyland.  Would definitely book again.

This is only geared toward Disneyland guests.  This is the 3rd Anaheim property we have stayed at in 5 weeks, and this is easily the best choice by far...as long as you don't pay too much.  The price for us was great (Hotwire) and the $10 parking is okay.  We stayed in a 2 queen room.  Everything was clean, quiet, and comfortable.  The staff was excellent.  We arrived at 8am to 'pre-check-in' (just to secure a specific room, get a parking pass and leave for the day).  They upgraded our room and checked us in early.  I didn't expect that and it was a great surprise.  This property is geared toward families, and the staff knows why they would want to stay here.  They meet the expectations perfectly.  The pool was super warm and nice.  Everything was just perfect for us.  The

Our family of 4 stayed here for 5 nights in October.  We found the hotel room was very clean and a decent size for our family (kids were able to play mini-stick hockey in the room).  We routinely walked from here to Disneyland with both kids (3 year old in a stroller).  It was an easy walk for us and we enjoyed the quietness compared walking down Harbour Blvd.  A few days we did ride the monorail in to Disneyland which was great, we saved waiting in the line-up at the entrance and we didn't have to walk through downtown disney.  One day we rode the ART to disneyland and on to the Outlets at Orange.  The front desk staff were awesome and giving us schedules and information and we were able to purchase tickets through them as well.  The service at this hotel is amazing!  They were

we booked and confirmed a king bed room - upon check in after our group of friends we discovered it was a twin share room with double beds (they say queen but they're hardly queen size).  advised them of this and they said they moved us to be closer to our other friends upon check in and in the meantime (2 hours) the other king room had gone to someone else.  Not being happy with this we then wanted an upgrade to anything else available and were told nothing in hotel is available but the twin rooms - then spoke to another person at the property and i was told sorry but the King room isn't available due to a maintenance issue and the engineers won't allow it to be let out to guests - however we have a queen suite available (thought there were none available) - anyways a long

We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of our holiday, it was very handy for Disneyland and Downtown Disney.  The room was clean and the bed comfortable with the choice of soft or firmer pillows but the bathroom arrangement with the wash basin vanity unit just within the room by the door that opened into the hotel corridor and away from the shower/bath toilet was very strange. For hygiene reasons we would have preferred a hand basin next to the toilet.  The first night we ate in the restaurant and the food was good but the service was slow as was the breakfast service.  The last night we ordered a take out meal from the restaurant to eat in our room while packing and it was inedible. The bar service was good and the prices were reasonable

Good experience. Hotel was older but clean and service was acceptible. The hotel resturant was decent for breakfast and location on the Anaheim Rapid Transit couldn't be beat. Would definately stay again the next time we visit Disneyland.

This was our second trip to Disney and our first time at this Holiday Inn and I will definitely stay here again.  The rooms were clean and fairly updated.  The pool was great! The folks that work at the hotel are super friendly and very accomodating.  The restaurant has a kids eat free offer and a hot buffet breakfast if you are in a hurry along with a full menu.  Great service by some seriously friendly staff! WiFi worked perfectly (yes.....this is not the case at all hotels that say they offer "free wireless internet").  We didn't walk to Disney but the shuttle was perfect as it takes you right to the main gates. Lets be clear, after walking for 8-12 hours.....who wants to walk back to the hotel anyway!!! :)  Fireworks can be viewed beautifully from the parking lot as well!

We stayed here one night before a Disneyland vacation.  The location is nice - it was a moderate walk to/from Disneyland; I felt safe walking at night.  The room was adequate but needs updating (the bathroom especially).  I found the lobby to be very nice (as with most Holiday Inn properties) and the staff friendly.  My biggest complaint about the hotel is the layout - winding your way through hallways and narrow doorways with luggage was difficult.    I'd consider staying here again if the price was right, but would look at other options first.

If you've chosen to stay here, it's pretty much because you want to be within easy access to Disneyland theme park. You won't make a wrong decision given that the location was great. Staff were really helpful and informative which definitely scored with us. We managed to catch the fireworks from the hotel as well. If you're intending to have food in the hotel, they are reasonably priced.

Summary Heading: Good hotel close to the parks
Summary: We were not expecting much from our stay here as the rooms were so cheap. However we managed to check in at 7.30am in the morning! - which meant that all of our luggage was out of the car and safe whilst we enjoyed the parks. The receptionist was extremely helpful. It was the quickest check in we have ever had which was just what we wanted as we were desperate to get into the parks. Our room was clean and serviced both days. Good location and excellent value for money.

We stayed here for one night during our Disneyland vacation.  I can't really think of anything nice to say about this place other than that it is close to Disneyland and nothing terrible happened to us here.   The rooms was small.  The bathroom was tiny. The room just didn't feel clean and there were cigarette burns on the bathroom counter. Our room looked out at the Mickey and Friends parking garage so we got to listen to all the garage noise.    We stayed here in a pinch and payed more for for a night's stay than any of the other nicer hotels we stayed at during our visit.  I would only stay here again if I had no other options.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your stay with us. We do hope you would reconsider staying here as our rooms are will be improving with new furniture soon to go along with our great service and staff. Our Kids Eat Free deal is another great feature our guests love and to be a 12 minute walk to Downtown Disney and the park entrance there at the Monorail stop makes our location ideal. We also have roomy suites reasonable priced that work great for larger families.  Thanks again for your feedback.  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Stayed here for one night to visit Disneyland.  Great location for the park.  It's possible to walk to the monorail in Downtown Disney (drops you off in Tomorrowland) or to walk to the shuttle stop for the Mickey and Friends parking structure.  I would recommend the parking lot shuttle as it's slightly closer.  Walk south Walnut, turn left on Magic Way, there will be an opening in the fence so that you can get to the parking lot shuttle to the main gate.  Pros:  - Received a goodie bag and dessert in the room (Priority Club gold)  - Standard room - exactly as expected  - Breakfast buffet was excellent and well-stocked  - Despite being a family-friendly hotel, very quiet  Cons:  - Breakfast service (drinks) was a little slow  - Bathrooms slightly small  - $10 charge for parking,

My husband and I stayed here for a week in August 2012.  Not a fancy hotel, but comfortable and very clean and nice.  Exercise room is quite adequate and the pool area is fantastic.  Every evening in August during our stay, there was popcorn and a movie around the pool, and the fireworks from Disney were great at 9:45 p.m. (every evening except for one - I think it was too windy).  We would definitely return to this spot as it is close to great amenities.

The hotel "suites" are very small.  Not the best if you are going to stay for an extended period of time.  We only stayed one night so it wasn't a big deal.  Hotel smells a big mouldy.  The bathroom was noisy.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing our hotel during  your last visit to the area. I assure you we have taken care of the noisy fan in the room you stayed in for our future guests. Our standard rooms are about 325 sq. ft. but we also offer  more than 20 one and two bedroom suites that are quite large and comfortable for big families. We do hope you would choose us again next time you are in the area and take advantage of our many room type options.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights in October mainly to go to Disney. It is in a great location, it took us about 10-15 minutes to get all the way to Disney through Downtown Disney. About 5 minutes to get to Downtown Disney. It has everything you would expect from an Amercian hotel, big comfy beds, and nice size bathroom. Can't go wrong with this hotel, we had no complaints.

The holiday inn hotel is in a good position for disneyland, which is easy to get to. it has a small swimming pool and the rooms are clean and comfortable. The resteraunt serves a reasonable choice of meals. however the service can be quite slow. This hotel is not startling but serves the purpose for a short stay
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your feedback regarding your recent stay. We hope you choose us again the next time you are in the area.   Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: We are Disneyland regulars visiting 1-2 times per year.  We usually stay at the HoJo on Harbor which we love but their rates were extremely high during our stay so we decided to give the Holiday Inn a shot.  We were able to get a standard room at the Holiday Inn for around $110 per night and with my corporate rate breakfast for two was included.   Parking is an additional $10 per night The hotel is about a 15 minute walk to the beginning of Downtown Disney (near the Disneyland Hotel side).  My recommendation is you take the monorail in and out of the park to save some walking time.  The hotel also recommends using the tram from the Disneyland parking garage (next door) but I‚Äôm not sure this really saves you any time.  The ART shuttle runs every twenty minutes and only has two
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your review of our hotel. I assure you I am addressing the issues you found in the hopes of improving our service in the future. I do hope you would give us another try the next time you are in the area.  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Good view of the nightly fireworks show from the parking lot so bring out the lawn chairs.  Not one room in the entire hotel has a good view of the fireworks show.  The hotel is a pleasant walk to Downtown Disney and than again to the Disneyland and Grand California.  The walk or the shuttle are ideal to avoid the madness associated with the drive.  The extra few minutes walk involves a walk through the Disneyland Hotel but the extra few minutes walk is 1/4 the price of the Disneyland Hotel; and so book accordingly.  The hotel is a standard Holiday Inn with a bit of character.  Party of three traveling for a weekend in Anaheim / LAX so booked the "two bedroom suite".  The two bedroom suite is designed for families and sleeps 8 easily given the two queens beds, one king bed and

We have just returned from a 2 week trip to the USA. We stayed here for 4 nights & can't say enough about this hotel. It is very clean, the Restaurant is fantastic, very affordable & very large tasty meals & all the staff so friendly & helpful.We are a family of 6 (4 teenagers), so were very surprised about how much food we could get for our money.The location is great, nice & quiet,about a 10 minute safe & easy walk to Downtown Disney then probably another 5 minutes to the main park gates.Rooms were comfortable & very clean.All our other hotels were 4 & 5 star,but Holiday Inn Staff & restuarant beat them all.Would definately stay here again. A special thankyou to Haviere at the front desk & Princess & Miguel in the restuarant for your wonderful service.We had a great stay.

We stayed at this hotel during our 16 day tour. Usual style hotel, nice large reception area. Restaurant had a good dinner menu with a nice choice and quality; however the breakfast buffet was just adequate with limited choice. The waitress service was slow in the mornings, so allow time. The bedroom was the normal 2 x double bed, with tea making facilities. No safe provided. Free wi-fi. Clean and well decorated.The bath plug did not work, so only could shower. Outside swimming pool. Nicely located giving easy access to Disney via a 10 minute shuttle service. Not many other eating choices nearby. Hotel ok for a short stopover.

Summary Heading: Excellent Place for the Whole Family!
Summary: We had a great expierence here!  The rooms were clean and well-serviced, the staff was very friendly and helpful, and the location was great.  Close to Disney, but far enough away to not be noisy or busy. Yes, we had to rent a fridge (hence the 4/5 score) but that's really the only negative I can mention.  We had 7 stay in 2 rooms (3-generation trip to Disney) and we were all happy. The restaurant was suprisingly good for being a standard hotel eatery and the pool space was just right in size and location (ie: the hot sun was out when you wanted it, and hidden behind the building when you didn't.) As for the trip to Disney, door-to-gate was a 20 minute walk with plenty to see once you reached Downtown Disney.  A shade over 10 minutes for door-to-monorail.  Considering the amount

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay for Disney, but a bit of a walk
Summary: Positives: --Very clean room, in good condition, plenty of space, had no problem with keeping the room dark with the drapes (as another reviewer mentioned). --Comfy beds and pillows --Friendly staff --Fairly close to the park, but be aware that it's not across the street.  If you plan to walk, the hotel is located 1 blk from the Disneyland parking lot exit.  Take the monorail to Downtown Disney and catch a tram to the parking lot area to save yourself a bit of walking. --Small but serviceable fitness center with cardio equipment --If you book through certain sites, the parking/resort fee is waived Negatives: --No in-room fridge or microwave in the standard rooms.  They are available for a daily fee, and best to reserve ahead of time. --No free breakfast, and the restaurant

I CHOSE THIS HOTEL FOR PROXIMITY TO Disneyland.  It was very affordable & clean & our stay came with a full buffet breakfast > "average food" but when ur hungry, ur hungry right!  Definitly would stay here again.

There were 15 of us in total visiting Disneyland from New Zealand, we had 2 family suites and 1 standard room.  The family suites were awesome!  Very roomey!  One of our suites was a disney decorated suite so very exciting.  Service upon arrival and throughout was great.  Restaurant was fantastic!  Kids eat free so why wouldn't you eat here!  We did for all of our breakfasts's and one dinner.  Dinner was delicious!  Nothing was too much trouble for the staff.  Pool was awesome and much needed during our break to Disney.  Would stay again!  The walk to Disney didn't bother us too much.

This is my third visit to Anaheim in the past year, and the other two times, I stayed at two other Holiday Inn properties, both of which were "Express" which is their supposed budget properties. So when I came to this property, I would expect something better, considering the price and the fact that it wasn't "Express." Boy, was I wrong.  Yes, the hotel is very pretty, but our room is significantly smaller than at the last two Holiday Inn Express properties and the amenities were scarce. There is no mini fridge in the room and no seating area except for one chair. The heavy drapes are also just made to be decorations on the side of the window, so you can't close them all the way to keep the room dark.  While I know these are petty, again, I would expect something more if I pay a

My 7 year old daughter and I recently stayed here for 6 days in August and we had a pleasant experience. The front desk was very friendly, and helpful with providing options for all our travel needs.  The room was comfortable and clean. It was your ordinary hotel room with 2 beds. My daughter enjoyed the movie and popcorn poolside. The hotel has a restaurant which was ok we enjoyed their dinner choices better than their breakfast selection. We don't eat pork and they didnt offer any other type of breakfast meat besides pork. The dinner portion was fairly large my daughter and I was able to share a meal and both be full. Children eat free if you eat in the restaurant for breakfast and dinner. The proximity to the Disney Parks is a rather long block and then you have to walk

The hotel is clean and friendly, but the location is odd. From the website it seems closer.  We took the shuttle to Disney our 1st day, which was convenient, but the cost of a family is about the same as driving.  The 2nd day we drove and discovered that the parking garage right next to the hotel is where you park for the parks and take a tram to the enterance.

Summary Heading: Beyond friendly, Good value, and Plenty close!
Summary: Start by thanking my wife who went on Tripadvisor when I said I was looking at staying at 1 of 3 places for my Disneyland trip! After reading the review she said your staying there! Wow was I happy she did!  1st-Got there very early and was greeted with a smile and eager "lets see what we can put you in" so was great to get in my room early. 2nd-Room was clean and a good size, loved the choice of pillows, and the bed was super comfy my back sure loved that. 3rd-SERVICE WAS SO GOOD! Every person I dealt with there was nicer than the next! All three time I went to the desk nothing but friendly and helpful, all the house keepers was pleasant and said good morning. Even the person who works the little store. The stand out among all this good service was Kelli who was my server there

My other half and I stayed here for two nights as part of a greater California trip. We wanted to spend some time in Disneyland and wanted to stay close. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and I would stay here again if in the area. It is located only a five minute walk to the Disneyland car park where you can jump on a shuttle to the park entrance.  Our room was modern and spacious with free wifi. There is a charge for parking (we made our booking through an agency and parking was included).  The only fault I found was that in-room safes were not available, but there are safety deposit boxes available at reception.  We ate breakfast in the hotel one morning and there was good variety of food options.  The hotel also has a handy shop selling a range of items from souvenirs, snacks,

Summary Heading: Great hotel with an awesome pool
Summary: We stayed in this property on our road trip of the west coast and were very tired by the time we reached the hotel late in the evening. Their heated pool like so much fun that we just dumped our luggage and jumped right in.  Good, clean rooms and a very relaxing environment. Just the perfect place to rest and recharge before catching the action at Disney!  We got a good deal too!

Summary Heading: Comfortable and very friendly hotel, close by to Disney and beaches
Summary: On arrival at the hotel the front desk staff were very helpful and quickly had us checked into our rooms.  The room we had was spacious, clean with good facilities including free internet.  The restaurant offers a fixed price buffet with plenty of choice.  If you choose you can have a booth with your own TV to watch.  We had a couple of nice evening meals and one okay meal in the restaurant.  The staff in the restaurant were very friendly and service was good.  The swimming pool is a good size such that you can actually swim.  Amazingly I had the pool all to myself for two mornings.  Probably due to everyone being in Disney.  The location of the hotel is good for trips to the beach.  Huntington Beach is a great place to visit.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We are glad you had a good time while you were here. Our location is great and it's good to hear it fit your needs. Come back and see us again real soon!!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: This is my second time staying at this location. I stayed for three nights and enjoyed my stay. My room was very clean. The bathroom was spotless. My bed was very comfortable. There is an ART bus service that picks you up from the hotel and drops you off at disneyland for $4 a day. We ate at the onyx bar restaurant and the pizza tasted delicious. The staff at the front desk was very friendly and quick to accommodate us.   This place has excellent customer service. I realized that I left my Armani sunglasses inside our room after we already checked out. I notified the front desk and they sent in housekeeping to our old room to retrieve my sunglasses. She found my sunglasses within 5 minutes and I was ecstatic. You can't get better service than that. I only chose to stay at this
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind comments. Our staff is thrilled you were happy and we look forward to being at your service on your next visit!  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Never having stayed in the area before and just wanting a reasonable rate on a place just to sleep at, I felt overwhelmed reading all the tripadvisor reviews for all the hotels near Disney. I ended up randoming choosing this one based on the price and the above average ratings. I am very very glad I did!  I saw no evidence of the negative elements present in prior reviews. Good value, clean rooms, nice pool, comfortable beds, the air conditioner worked perfectly, good variety of pillows. We arrived early on the day of check in and the hotel staff was extremely accommodating and let us park in the lot and leave our car to head to the Disney parks. We bought our tickets at a reasonable rate for the shuttle which stopped right in front of the hotel multiple times day and night and
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about your stay with us. We are very glad you enjoyed your time here. We hope to see you again and again on each trip you make to the Magic Kingdom!  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: When it is 100 degrees outside the air conditioning is a real advantage. It is about a twenty five minute walk from the entrance of Disneyland, to far to walk in hot weather, especially with children. A much better option is to use the shuttle bus at a cost of $4 a day for adults and $2.50 for children. Tickets can be bought in the hotel shop (run by a very helpful lady).  The room is acceptable. It is a big hotel so it can be quite a walk to get to reception or the breakfast area. An all you can eat breakfast is $13 for adults but much cheaper for children, I think it is $2.  A good way to see Disneyland is to arrive early, leave during the hottest part of the day, have a swim in the hotel pool and return to Disneyland at around 4.00.
Manager Response: We are pleased you enjoyed your stay with us. We do appreciate you taking the time to let us know about it. We hope to be your host again the next time you are in the area.  Sincererly,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Location - The hotel is located on Walnut St & Ball Rd, close to the Disney property. Although the hotel is advertised as being 1 block from Disneyland, it is not. It would take 25-30 minutes to walk to the Disneyland & Disney California Adventure entrance. To clarify, the hotel is 1 block from the Mickey & Friends Parking Structure/Lot, where you can catch the Disney trams to Downtown Disney. The walk (along Walnut St) from the hotel to the tram waiting area was about 8-10 minutes.The Disney tram is free to ride, and it takes less than 5 minutes to Downtown Disney.   Hotel - The hotel's 3 star rating met my expectations. I have stayed at Inns near Disney, and this hotel is definitely of better quality. The hotel property and rooms are well kept and clean, with nice decor, and
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent experiences at our hotel. I assure you we are busy correcting the deficiencies you noted. I should point out that we are only a 12 minute walk to the park entrance located in downtown Disney at the monorail stop there. This is the only monorail stop outside of the parks and we are the closest non-Disney hotel to it. It's a great way to enter the park for the first time! We do hope you choose our hotel again the next time you visit the Magic Kingdom!  Thank you,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Who in the world thought of this brilliant idea?  I have never in my life seen decorator pillows used as hotel pillows ever!  This has got to be the stupidest idea ever in the hotel industry.  Pack your own pillows if you want a decent night sleep.  We have stayed at this hotel in the past and stopped going several years ago after we had the "luck" of being placed on the same floor as a high school field trip.  The hotel couldn't move us because they were "booked solid".  Every night we complained and got no where.  We stupidly, decided to give them another shot, but now with pillow-gate...you can forget it.  We will go back to the Holiday Inn Express around the corner from Disneyland.  Check in was also horrible.  It took 45 minutes waiting in line to check in and they only had
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about your experience at our hotel. We are very sorry that you found our pillows to be inadequate. All of our beds have 4 pillows and we do have extra available should our valued guests require them. We do hope you would consider visiting us again on your next trip to the area.  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle GeneraL Manager

Summary: We got a great rate for a Sunday night.  Staff was friendly and courteous, rooms were nice with a hdtv.  The bed was rather comfortable as well.  The best part is the location.  The hotel is located in the northwest corner of the disneyland block, adjacent to the parking structure.  Easy to get into the mickey and friends parking structure as well because you will be going opposite of the the main traffic on ball rd.  Its only a bout a 20 minute walk or so from downtown disney. Only downfall is there are not a lot of restaurant choices super close.  Owever there is a restaurant on site.  one other bummer is there is a $10 charge to park. I expected parking to be free.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing our hotel during your recent visit to Anaheim. We are glad you enjoyed your stay and hope to see you again!  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Resort Charge referred to as Parking Charge.  Other than that, avg Holiday Inn w/ good location
Summary: I stay in the area quite often.  I've stayed here more than once and was a bit irritated by paying a resort charge at a basic hotel.  I was excited when checking in to hear that they'd done away w/ the resort fee; however, they've replaced it with a parking charge.  Paying to park at this facility is beyond silly, but the front desk response was "the good news is that this prevents locals from parking here".  In other words, it's good for the hotel, still meaningless for travelers forced to pay the same fee.  Why not include the parking rate in the hotel rate to avoid forcing your guests to feel the nickle/diming negativity?  I don't buy the "all other hotels in the area do it", because I'm typing this from the Best Western Courtesy (which is fine btw): it's right up the street
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about your stay with us. While we do charge for parking, a few limited service hotels do not. Our parking charge enables us to maintain a security patrolled lot and allows us to offer other amenities limited service hotels can not. These include kids eating free with their parents during all meal periods, a great fitness room and free high speed internet access. We do hope you would give us another visit as we are sure the value of our hotel along with it's location is the best in Anaheim.  Sincerely,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: When i first walked in the lobby was very nice so i assumed the rooms would be nice too. but as soon as i went to the room i was disappointed. the room was tiny & HOT. The bed didnt even have real pillows , more like couch pillows w. pillow cases on them. When i was just about to pick up the room phone i saw the most horrible thing. a pubic hair ! EW!! Then the next morning i find these bugs all over the desk & even in the food & gifts from disneyland! (i can understand if the food was left in the open but it was still in the un-opened package) How do bugs get on the 4th floor anyway? Never staying there again
Manager Response: I would like personally apologize for your experience here at our hotel. We strive to give the best possible service and product to all of our guests and we obviously did not make this happen during your stay with us. I assure you that I am taking the necessary steps to ensure this experience does not occur again. Thank you for taking the time to let me know about what happened.   Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: We had a great few days here after a gruelling drive through Route 66. The room was very good and clean. We had a great time due to assistance from the staff. I recommend Roxanne behind the front desk for all tour information-she is a real whiz. The guys all except one whose sense of direction was a little out of sync leading to much mirth were all very helpful too. We had a great time with other guests at the bar manned by the incomparable Kelli. A star!Recommend a bit of time spent there. A short walk to Downtown Disney if you have no kids and a nice stroll back after a really satisfying dinner. The buffet breakfast was a real delight.
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about your recent stay with us. Our staff is very happy they made you happy while you were here. We hope to see you again soon!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Very clean and comfortable location. Staff was great.  Resturant on site served very nice meals.  Close to Disney but we did not walk there.  There is a bus available.  Pool area family friendly.  Families ate brought in food at out door tables in courtyard. Rooms are airconditioned.  Would stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know you had a good time during your stay with us. We hope to see you again very soon!!  Best regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Wonderful experience! ¬†Were are a family of four, two adults and two children. ¬†Arrived at the hotel was in a great location, nice and green all around. ¬†Roberto the front desk clerk was very polite, courteous made check in easy and welcoming. ¬†The front lobby looked just like their website spacious and clean. ¬†Stayed seven days and the room was very clean, quite and comfortable. Had breakfast at the hotel restaurant every morning the food was excellent and the morning staff Maria, Jen, Alfonso and their front cashier manager truly exceeded the overall customer service. The overall experience at the hotel including pricing was a five star rating. ¬†For once the service exceeded the image of a good hotel. ¬†  PS. ¬†Our Disneyland vacation was awesome within walking distance. ¬†Thank
Manager Response: We are thrilled you had a great time and enjoyed our staff and hotel. We very much appreciate your comments and I will definitely share them with our team.  Thank you!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Stayed in a family suite . It was a little smaller than the one I was shown so that was a little disappointing .  The  bathrooms were set up weird but other than that it was nice. The girls  enjoyed it. If you plan on walking to Downtown Disney you're in for a long walk. Especially for little children .
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay with us. We hope to see you again soon!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for two days and it was a relief after some bad nights in other cheap hotels. Nice place if you want to go to Disneyland or even Downtown Disney by walk. Don't forget to ask for your free breakfasts if you booked with Booking.com. Also children under the age of 12 eat free with a coupon that you get at the front desk when registering. There a pool and spa and those are very clean.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your comments regarding your recent stay with us. We are very happy you had a great time. While not all of our rate packages include breakfast it is a great value when you choose a rate that starts your day off with a great meal. We hope to see you soon!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Grandma, daughter and two children were pleasantly pleased staying at this hotel. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. Shuttle toDisney is on time and quik.
Manager Response: We are glad to hear you had a great time visiting Disneyland and staying at our hotel. We hope to see the whole family again the next time you visit the area!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights.  We had 2 rooms for 6 people (2 children).  It's about a 10-15 minute walk to downtown Disney and to the Disney carpark where you can catch the tram to the main entrance gates of the theme parks. The staff were very friendly.  The restaurant was clean and reasonably priced.  The rooms were big enough to move around in. They were clean and the beds were very comfortable.  I would recommend this hotel as its a quieter location that the hotels situated on S Harbor Blv.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing our hotel and for letting us know about your experience. We are thrilled you had a great time and we hope to see you again on your next visit to the Magic Kingdom!  Tom vn Wnkle General Manager

Summary: We could here everything from every room around us. The air conditioners are so loud. The hotel was ok. The staff wasn't rude but cold. The shuttle to Disneyland is super fast. We were always the first pickup. You are out in a neighborhood which detracts a little from a family exciting vacation. We didn't get to use the pool because we chose being at Disneyland instead. But it looked beautiful.
Manager Response: Thank you for the feedback given to us regarding your recent stay with us. I do apologize for our staff not putting their best foot forward during their interactions with you. I assure you your comments have been shared with them and we are doing our very best to make sure we strive toward service excellence evry day. We do hope you come visit us again and experince our hotel again.  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Our room was very clean and it is an easy walk to disney, however,if your room is on the first floor it is very noisy, we had to change rooms and, it costs 4.49 per 15 minutes to use the buisness center where as at any other holiday inn it is free.
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about your experiences while you visited our hotel recently. I do apologize for any noise issues you encountered and we working diligently as a team to quiet down any noisemakers as much as we can. I do want to make sure everyone is aware that the first 15 minutes of use in our business center is complimentary and the charge will only happen if a guest stays online longer than 15 minutes. We sorry for any problems this may have caused you. We do hope to have you visit us at our wonderful location again soon as we do our best to improve our service by using the feedback from reviews to make necessary improvements.  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Perfect Place for family and Disney Visit
Summary: We recently stayed for three nights shortly before Independence Day. Extremely friendly and helpful staff at check-in and check-out. We booked two rooms and they were able to put our rooms across from each other as we requested. Rooms were clean and comfortable. With the exception of the loud Disney Fireworks, it was very soundproof as well. Property was a bit dated, but it didn't hinder our stay. Breakfast was expensive, but they did give us a buy one adult meal, get a kid meal free coupon for each day.Super easy to access by car. Had to pay for parking, but plenty of parking available! Internet worked great as well. There was a shuttle that took you to Disney and CA Adventure that ran every 20 minutes from right outside the lobby. Loved that! Easily allowed us to come and go

One of my pet peaves is staying in a dirty room. Let's face it, sometimes in and around big cities, this can be a problem. it wasn't at this hotel. I actually stayed here on a business trip and was pleased with my experience. It is an obvious choice for anyone visiting Disney. The price was actually pretty reasonable. The staff was pleasant. The rooms and grounds were clean and well lit at night. I am planning a return trip to the area on business and have already booked my room.

Summary Heading: Good Hotel for Disney LA visit...
Summary: We stayed in Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim from 1st to 3rd July 2012. The hotel was very nice and the hospitality and assistance of the staff were quite warm and friendly. Though Disney is not really an easy walk from the hotel, frequent shuttle service is available. We used ART service, which reaches this hotel as the last stop for pick up and the first stop for drop, which made our shuttling quite convenient. With 2 hyper charged boys (5 & 8), we thoroughly enjoyed our stay in this hotel and recommend the same to anyone who is planning to visit Disney LA.   The negative points I felt was; 1. The elevator is very very slow. If you are depending on elevators, you will have to wait a while. I used the staircase instead which was more convenient.  2. The rooms are spread out
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to let us know how things went during your stay with us earlier this month. It sounds like you and your family had a great time while visiting the Magic Kingdom and we appreciate you choosing us to be your host. We hope to see you all again on your next visit.  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Good service, well maintained, great value and convenient location
Summary: I booked this hotel for a 4 night stay near the Disneyland Resort.  My husband and two year old son joined me on this trip.  The hotel was great for this particular stay.  For a 3-star property, the room was very clean and well maintained.  The hallways smelled funny, similar to smoke, but the rooms were fine.  The only complaints I have regarding the room (king bed, 5th floor) is that it was small and space was tight, and the pillows were smaller than standard size.  But yes, the room was clean when we checked in and housekeeping did a great job every day we were there.  Pool and Spa were perfect for us.  It never got too crowded.  Each visit to the pool, we had to request more towels be provided.  They had these great cabana units, similar to those shells you could rent on the
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay with us. We are glad you found our location and amenity offerings to your liking. We would love to see you here again on your next visit. There is an entrance to the park at the Monorail stop at Downtown Disney that is only a 12 minute walk from our front door!  Best Regards,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Stayed here for a week. It is only practical if you want to do Disneyland or other Anaheim attractions. Getting into LA is a hour in th car or near impossible by the rubbish public transport in LA and Orange County. But for Disney, well placed and very good place to stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying at our hotel. Since we are the closest non-Disney hotel to Downtown Disney and the park entrance there at the Monorail Station, we are glad we met your needs for your visit to the Magic Kingdom. We do hope to see you again!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: I loved this hotel, it was great for our disneyland trip, from the really clean, big, nice room, to the (free) complete breakfast buffet  in the hotel restaurant. With 3 small children we couldn't ask for more, even tv with cartoons in every booth at the restaurant, wow.  Really close to disneyland but we bought the ART tickets for $4 dlls a day for adults and $1 for each child 3 and older, it really saves you the walking. The hotel staff was great, always smiling and asking if we needed anything, the people in the front desk wonderful also, thank you guys,  keep up the good work !!! I would recommend this hotel and stay again for sure.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback and we hope to see you and your family the next time you visit the Disney parks.  Tom Van Winkle General Maager

Summary: The area was a very safe place for kids , food and store close around .holiday inn express staff was wonderful rooms were always clean breakfast was outstanding we had about 30 kids and the staff didn't seem to mine . If I ever go back I would stay with u guys again thanks for all u did to make our stay outstanding
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing our hotel. We hope to see you and your group again next time you visit the area!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Great Price and Close to Disneyland
Summary: We were able to get a great deal on Expedia for the room for a family trip to Disneyland.  The hotel is actually right next to the Disney Mickey garage and offers tram service (ART) or it's a short walk to the parks.  The hotel staff was very helpful and the room was clean and comfortable.
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know how things went when you were here recently. We hope to be your home away from home on your next visit to the Magic Kingdom!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: This hotel was very good quality it had plenty of things for us to do, like the games room, the pool and the shuttle bus service that took us to disneyland. The service was very very good and the quality of the room was also very good. The restaurant was alright but it could do with a little improvement. overall it was pretty impressive and close walking distance from all the shops.
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about your experience here. Our staff is thrilled you had a good experience. We've also extended our hours at the restaurant until 1am now that the park is open until midnight this summer.  Come stay with us again soon!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Hotel is quite close to Disneyland Park: about 12 -15 minutes easy walk. Room was very clean, and maintenance was excellent: every evening when we got back to the room all the bed linens were changed, cleaned, impecable service. We would stay there again on our next Disneyland trip.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know how things went when you stayed here. We are very happy you enjoyed your time here. We hope to see you soon! As an FYI we are putting in a water park this fall that will be a lot of fun for everyone!  Tom Van Winkle General

Summary: We stayed here four 4 days, hotel was about 15 mins walk to Disneyland. Hotel clean and service was great. We had a 2 Bedroom suite for 5 of us which was a bit tight but we ended up getting a roll out bed which was ok.  Good hotel would stay again.
Manager Response: Great to hear you had a good time here! Enjoy the rest of your summer and thank you!!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: My daughter and I stayed here for a short getaway to Disneyland.   Our family goes to Disneyland frequently and have stayed at the Disney Resort Hotels... Have to say, the staff here was much friendlier and responsive.  They treated us like they wanted us there and that they weren't "just doing us a favor."  The room was clean and bright.  We also stayed on the ground floor.  I agree with another review, that the ceiling in low, but a complaint? How are they going to change what has already been built (and not by mamagement)?  What I liked is that I felt safe on the ground floor, which is saying a lot since we were mother and daughter alone.  The air conditioner was very quiet, which you don't find too often in hotels. We took the shuttle to and from the park, which was also
Manager Response: Hi there. We are very happy you and your daughter had a good time here. Come see us again soon! Thank you for taking the time to write a review of us.  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: We stayed here for two days while visiting Disneyland.  The hotel was clean and simple with ample parking.  The bed was comfortable and a choice of pillows was nice.  Overall location was good, but we did opt to drive to Disneyland anyway.  The staff was nice.  If I had one minor complaint, it was that we had to wait in a pretty long line when we checked in.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We are glad you had a good time here in Anaheim. We hope to see you again soon!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Great hotel and staff. A little longer than 1 blk more like 2 because you have to walk through downtown Disney as well. Remember to save the walking for Disneyland or CA Adventure and purchase (great buy) ART bus transfer from front desk.  This Hotel is the 1st stop on your return from park to hotel!  Would definitely stay here again :)

I booked this room using some airline miles so that is the only reason I picked this place. It's okay but I don't think I would stay here again.   Pros: - the room was pretty spacious - easy to find off the freeway  - Free parking - The staff was nice - NIce selection of Bath & Body works soaps.  Cons: -  The hotel is suppose to be within "walking distance" from Disneyland. It's 2/10th a mile from the entrance of Downtown Disney then you walk through that onto Disneyland.  More like a 20 minute walk. Just seemed like a long walk and there was NO shuttle service.   - We stayed on the bottom level and the ceilings seemed pretty low and dark. -  The walls needed to be wiped down - Carpet needs to be cleaned - Bathroom was really small and the fan was probably on it's last leg.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for taking the time to let us know about your experience with us. I have shared your comments with my staff and we are working diligently to improve everything we can in our rooms. I also want everyone to know that there is a somewhat "secret" entrance to Disneyland in Downtown Disney. There is a Monorail stop just past the entrance to Downtown Disney and it's a great way to enter the park. Many of our guests tell us they love disembarking in the middle of Disney right next to the Matterhorn and Nemo's Submarine Ride!  Thanks again for your comments and we hope to see you again soon!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for a Disneyland visit
Summary: I agree with other reviewers. It is more than 1 block to Disneyland but if you walk around to the parking lot for the Mickey and Friends parking structure you can catch the free Disney shuttle the rest of the way to the park. Our room was clean and comfortable and quiet. Check-in was quick and the staff were friendly and helpful. Our room included a breakfast voucher and all I can say is when the guy brings you a carafe of orange juice make sure he is clear what that is going to cost you. He poured our glasses full and left the carafe on the table. When the bill came the price for a carafe of orange juice was very pricey. I pointed out to the cashier that we hadn't ordered a whole carafe and they adjusted the bill with no problems.  We will be staying here again.

We found this Holiday Inn to be convenient, reasonable walk to Downtown Disney about 10 minutes. The first day we took the shuttle but for the other three days we walked to and from Disneyland. The neighborhood felt safe walking at night with the family.  The staff at the hotel were very helpful and willing to assist always. The rooms were reasonable and had everything that we needed. Overall I would recommend to others, as a family of five we felt this hotel was great for us.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind comments. I always make a point to share all comments with my valued staff and they will be pleased they made your stay enjoyable. We hope to be your Magic Kingdom home away from home for years to come!!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: Everyone at this Holiday Inn was very friendly.  What impressed me most was that we were greeted by every staff member we encountered- from the front desk each time we walked through the lobby to the housekeepers and engineers we passed in the hallway.   The furniture was a bit worn, but the room was clean.  The blackout curtains were great for our toddler's afternoon nap!  We were a bit concerned by the previous reviews about the walk  to Disneyland.  On the first day, it took about 25 minutes to walk from the hotel to the Disneyland gates, since we had to walk through "Downtown Disney".  But we found that if you stop at the "Mickey and Friends" parking structure, you can pick up the tram there and cut about 15 minutes off the walk.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for letting us know about your time with us. I'll be sure to share your comments with all of our staff. As an FYI for the next time you stay with us, there is a park entrance just steps after the Downtown Disney entrance. It's a Monorail stop and is a great way to enter the park in style! We are also getting new furniture in our rooms in the next 30-60 days.  We hope to see you and your family again soon!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Ok for a day trip to Disney
Summary: Other hotels exist with closer proximity. This is a long "1 block" from the park entrance. If your kids are 10+, it may work. Or if they are in strollers, it may work for you. Otherwise, plan on using the shuttle that isn't free. The hotel is older and in need of some updating. I may use this hotel again, depending on what else is available at the time.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback regarding your stay with us. I hope you used the park entrance in Downtown Disney that is about 10-12 minutes away when walking. I will definitely make sure our staff communicates this better to our valued guests. We do hope to see you here again as we are in the process up upgrading our rooms, restaurant and lobby. We are exicited about the changes coming and will be very excited if you choose our hotel again on your next visit to the Magic Kingdom!  Thank you,  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: OK hotel but not a convenient location for Disneyland
Summary: We are adults that do not mind walking, but at a brisk pace it was an 11 minute walk to the start of Downtown Disney and then another 10 minutes walk through Downtown Disney before reaching the Disney entrance gates.  So, ... a 21 minutes long brisk walk just to get to the Disneyland / California Adventure entrance gates.  The hotels on the other side of Disneyland are way more convenient for Disneyland access and also for dining options!   i.e. the hotels on South Harbor Boulevard  The hotel had a nice restaurant for breakfast or lunch.  But the breakfast ends at 11 a.m., then lunch is from 11:30 a.m. to 1 p.m.   Dinner does not start until 5 p.m.  There are no other dining options in the area other than a Mexican fast-food restaurant that is attached to the gas station next
Manager Response: Thank you very much for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay with us. I do apologize for the restaurant and noise inconveniences. We just completed replacing our single-paned windows with dual paned and that will significantly reduce any unwanted noises. Our restaurant just started making boxed lunches available for advance purchase and pick up any time you want at very reasonable prices. I have also made sure our staff lets our guests know that there is a park entrance at the beginning of Downtown Disney at the Monorail stop (look up and you'll see the tracks!!) We have great discounted park ticket packages available  that enable our guests to pick up their park tickets when they check-in. The walk to the park entrance at Downtown Disney is 10-12 minutes and you get to ride the Monorail from there to any of the several stops in the park. It's a great 1st view of the Magic Kingdom!!  Thank you!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: My friends alongs with her children and i took a spring break to Anaheim for fun filled week.    Once arrived from John Wayne Airport via shuttle bus , the check in was easy .  The Hotel had done renovation.  I wish i had the picture to show.  There is a restaurant just opposite of the check in area. Little store which consist of gifts which just off the check in.  Entering the room is very nice but dark.  No problem with the bed and pillow.  Did sleep very well.  Each morning there is breakfast on first floor.  not expensive.    Getting to Disneyland is easy.  Just board Anaheim Resort Transit, otherwise know at ART,  ART cost about $2  and is good for a day.  The store do offer more than one day farecard.  ART stop right in front of the hotel and take you to disneyland.  Don't
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your comments. We are thrilled that you all had a great time! Come see us again soon!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Perfect for a group of high school students
Summary: I recently took a group of high school musicians for a weekend music festival at Disneyland.  We checked in earlier than the posted check in time and only 2 of our 19 rooms were not ready.  The front desk staff was able to book me into another room, so in reality, only 1 of our 19 rooms was not ready.  The remaining room was ready within an hour of our arrival.  The rooms were spacious enough for 3 high school students to be in for the weekend.  The rooms were clean and well appointed.  Every room had a flat panel TV, and wireless internet access was available free of charge.  Since this was a group of students, the hotel turned off all optional services (pay-per-view, room service, etc.) without question.  Everything from our initial inquiry to our reservations and
Manager Response: Our staff is very happy they were able to meet all of your needs while you were our guests. We pride ourselves in taking the worry out of group travel. We sincerely hope to see you and another group of musicians here again!!  Thank you, Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: They charged our credit card 3 times for the visit!!!
Summary: when we arrived the hotel seemed very nice...clean...right near Disney...nice restaurant...gift shop...bus to take you to Disney a few blocks away...but what happened next was UNBELIEVABLE!!!...as soon as we got there we went to the front desk...it wa about 11:30pm at night...we gave the front desk guy our receipt showing we paid for all 4 days in advance a month ago...he looked it up and said ok...but said all guests have to pay a $50.00 fee for the room and it would be returned at the end of the stay as long as the room was in good condition...so my 21 yr old daughter said ok and handed him $50.00 cash...he said Oh No...if its cash then it has to be 150.00...if using a card then its $50.00...so she gave him her debit card....well as we are standing there all 4 of us
Manager Response: I would like to offer you another apology for your experience. We strive to provide superior service in all facets of a guest's experience with us and we obviousy failed. While I can't change what happened, I would like the chance to make up for this in some way. Please feel free to contact me directly at the hotel so we can discuss.  Thank you for taking the time to let me know about what happened so I can be sure it does not happen again.  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: First off, we stayed here just overnight on a quick trip to Disneyland (from north of LA), and were just looking for a suite within walking distance to the park. The hotel IS one block from Disneyland, technically, but it is a LONG block to walk with little ones, and that isn't to the gate, but rather to the park itself. In reality, it is 4-5 blocks to the gate of the park. The easiest way we found to go, was out the front of the hotel, turn left on Walnut, walk down to the Disneyland Hotel and cut through Downtown Disney. As for the hotel, everything was VERY nice. We had a suite and there was a bar area with a fridge and microwave, a living area with seating and a pullout sofa then french doors to the bedroom with 2 queen beds and the bathroom. Rooms were both clean and
Manager Response: Thank you very much for taking the time to let us know about your stay with us. I do apologize for your long walk. Many folks do not realize that there is a park entrance gate at the MOnorail stop in the first part of Downtown Disney which makes the walk  one block from the park AND by riding the Monorail you can start you Disney adventure at one of the several stops in the park including the Submarine ride! We do hope you come and visit with us again. We'd love a chance to be your host again!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Very nice, clean hotel - super sweet bartender!
Summary: Great hotel - very accomodating front desk and wonderful bartender.  First room we were put in was right next to the pool - I kindly asked the front desk if they could find us a different room - far from the pool.  They were great - found us a new room immediately that was awesome!  Very clean and quiet hotel.  Don't be fooled by the 1 block from Disneyland though.  It is close - 20 minute walk, but definitely not 1 block!  We took the shuttle in the morning, shuttle back to our room in the afternoon - then walked back to downtown Disney at night.  I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your kind comments. I will ensure my staff is aware they did a great job! We hope we can be your Disneyland home from now on!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Great hotel, 10 minute walk to Disneyland, Awesome water park!
Summary: Clean hotel. Very close to Disneyland. The water park at the hotel is great! The pool is shallow, but nice to sit and relax at. I would recommend this resort, specially to families.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for choosing our hotel! My staff and I are very happy that you enjoyed yourselves. We hope to see you again very soon!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: We had a great stay here at this hotel, except for the restaurant experience.  Once we learned that and avoided it, all was fabulous!  The hotel was clean and the staff was very friendly.  We immediately felt comfortable there.  We were there for five days, four of them to be spent at Disney/DCA.  The first day we really didn't know where we were in proximity to the part.  They say one block from Disneyland, but that's not to the entrance!  We took the shuttle/transit bus ($4.00 a day pass) that picks up every half hour.  It is a transit after all, so we stopped at a few different stops along the way.  All in all probably 20 minutes to a half hour ride.  It drops you right by the entrance to the parks, so it was all good.  The next day we thought we'd take our chances and walk
Manager Response: Thank you very much for taking the time to let us know about your experience. We are glad you enjoyed most of it but we are dissappointed in our performance in the restaurant. I assure you we have taken the steps to make sure our restaurant is consistently of the same calibur as the rest of our hotel. We do hope you will come and see us again and give our eating establishment one more try.  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary: this hotel is the prefect location when traveling to Disneyland only 20 mins walk.  Great service and great staff.  I would defiantly go back again.
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about your experience here. We are thrilled you had a great time and hope to see you here again soon!  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: GREAT PLACE TO STAY - WILL STAY AGAIN!
Summary: My husband and myself stayed at the Holiday Inn for one week in march, from the time we checked in to the time we checked out we had nothing but great service. The hotel was beautiful and we were upgraded to a suite at no additional charge, it was a 5 min walk to the disneyland shuttle service, and the hotel was at an overall great location. We are already planning our next trip to Anaheim and will be staying at the Hoilday Inn and Suites again!
Manager Response: We are very happy you enjoyed your week with us. We hope you will be regular visitors and that we see you again soon!. Thank you very much for taking the time to write your review.  Tom Van Winkle General Manager

Summary Heading: Older Hotel with a Nice Facade...
Summary: Stayed for 3 nights with two adults, one child (4 years old). Got the room on Hotwire. Asked at check-in about possibility of a King room and was told they didn't have any available and after all they are family hotel.  Older hotel unfortunately shows through the nice overlay. The elevators are tiny, slow, and there is only one per building. Parking was okay, but if you get back too late you're parking far away from your room. Only one ice machine WAY at the other end of the last building so it was also a bit of a walk to get to. Fan in the bathroom made a terrible noise as did the ancient through-the-wall A/C, but it worked and kept the room cool/warm as needed. Sink is outside the bathroom and kind of in an awkward location. The sink drained very slowly so we had to watch
Manager Response: Dear Crystal C,  Thank you for your review. I am sorry that we fell below your expectaions. We are hospitality proffesionals and strive to be the best. I hope you have a chance to stay with us again.  Katie J Case Manager IHGCare

Summary Heading: Not bad, but noisy and crowded
Summary: This hotel was ok considering the price for four persons (two adults and two kids under 12).  As others have already mentioned, it's actually about 15 to 20 minutes walk to Disneyland. This was not a problem for us, but some people might not consider this a "short walking distance."  Just before Christmas, the hotel seemed to be fully booked and at most times there was a long line at the front desk. There is only one elevator, so if the hotel is even nearly full the stairs are really your only option.  When we arrived, we still had some problems with jet lag/time difference. The fact that there were no black out curtains in the room did not help, nor did the noise coming from guest talking (yelling) and laughing loudly very late at night in the hotel corridors, parking lot etc.

This hotel was clean and comfortable.  I saved several hundreds of dollars when I compared it to the other hotels.  What I enjoyed most was the restaurant.  I traveled as a single parent with two children.  I had to purchase and entree and both my children were free.  This was a nice savings as I ate here for two meals a day.  The service was terrific at the restaurant as well.  Food tasted great. They left you with a pot of coffee and a too go cup which is greatly appreciated. The rooms are your average Holiday Inn style rooms.  The beds were comfortable.  All the lights and taps/tv/phones worked.  The pool had good operational times 9A-10P.  It was heated...which we needed.  The Jacuzzi was great to have as well after many hours of walking. Maid service was daily and was good.

This is a nice property that is close but "off the strip" so to speak and this property flies under the radar compared to other Hotels in the area. This hotel has been updated and seems relatively new with modern decor and flat screen 32" TVs in the rooms. Staff was friendly and accommodating and manager on duty, Roberto even comp'd me an in room mini-fridge as I had requested this amenity prior to my check in but it was not immediately available (it only took them 10 min to get me one so this was more than I expected). The room was average size maybe a bit smallish but was clean and noise was not an issue. Housekeeping was good and I had no issues there.  A couple of things to note is there is a resort fee of about $10 a night but there is no charge for parking or internet so

Myself, husband and two young children flew in on Presidents day caught a yellow cab which was about the same price to our hotel as the super shuttle would have been, so cab it was.  The hotel check in was seamless and the room was clean, and all staff was nice!  We ate 3 times at the hotel restaurant where the food was good and service the same.  We bought daily ART passes to come and go from hotel to disneyland and visa versa, which worked well, do to the amount of walking you have already done while at the park (Buy passes ahead of time and save money).  At first I was confused regarding how to use the "Fast Pass"  option that is available on rides, but it is quite user friendly, simply go to the ride you wish to ride "later" and insert your disney ticket and the machine will

Feb 15th to the 22nd  my wife and I decided on a tour of Southern California. We decided on this hotel quite by chance but what a little nugget it turned out to be. It was very inexpensive clean and the staff were very hospitable. It was full of little kids on their way to see Mickey Mouse etc. All these kids made me  a little apprehensive at first being an old codger and done with all the kid stuff but I found it  great fun to watch all the little 5 and 6 year olds dressed up in their "tinker belle" costumes going  to off to Fantasy land. The location is perfect for Disney land or just to go in the other direction to all the California beaches, fashion mall in Newport or north to Hollywood.. The restaurant was small but  had good food at very reasonable prices. The staff were

I've been in different hotels during the years i've visited Disneyland, and i was so pleased to visit this one. I really enjoyed my time there. I'm from mexico and each time that i go to Anaheim i plan my entire vacation, but this time i really met people who helped me to make it better. Those guys are people that i really want to see again. My wife was also very pleased. I really recommend the frontdesk people, especially for Roxanne. She was really a great support for planning my vacation, and she is also a nice person to talk with. When i return i hope to see her again, She was so kind with us!!! Thanx Roxanne!!! I would also want to thank Xavier from the frontdesk and Jos√©, Miguel and a red haired girl (i don't remember her name) from restaurant, they were also great! The

Summary Heading: Dated and not a good choice for the business traveler.
Summary: In attempting to find a good place in the area for frequent business travel, I tried this hotel.  It's easy to find and parking is free.  The front desk staff were neither friendly nor welcoming upon check in, simply perfunctory.  Despite my high level with priority club, nothing extra was offered.  The room was small and dated and just a little depressing to occupy..  The sink is actually in the room kind of like a '60's era Travelodge and the bath area was tiny.  The beds were somewhat comfortable.  The HVAC is the old school push-button wall mounted variety under the window.  On my first night I attempted to get on line.  I got a message that said "There are too many people online, please try back later"  I called the front desk for help.  They suggested that I contact their

We booked this hotel online though the Holiday Inn website and were happy with our rate using the Entertainment card discount.  We stayed for 3 nights and the rates were $65-$75, there is a $10 resort fee on top of the room rate, there is no parking fee.  Parking fees and resort fees in addition to the room rates are typical in this area.  We were visiting Disneyland on this trip and it was in close proximity if using your vehicle or the shuttle that picks up at the hotel every 20 min.  This hotel is located at the back of the Disneyland Park so it is too far to walk to the front gates to enter the park.  The shuttles are sufficient and cost $4 for adults and $1 for kids for the day, so your pass would get you to and from Disney.  You can buy the passes at the gift shop in the
Manager Response: ABCanadaFamily, Thank you for your great review!  Seems like you were able to take in almost everything we had to offer! To touch on a few of your concerns that you had pointed out, we have gone through and fixed the problem with our WiFi. We had to purchase some new hardware which dropped our limitation on how many users can be logged in, and we are currently installing a new connection which will triple our speeds.  We have gotten a few complaints about the fans in the bathroom, and about all I can say for now is that we are looking into renovating our bathrooms completely. Ever since our new ownership took over, we have been looking at renovating and touching up a lot of our property. You will have to come back again next year so you can see what we have done! Thanks, See you again soon! Craig Carlson, Reservations Manager

Summary Heading: Okay for the price, but nothing special
Summary: It just was not all that enjoyable.  Very spread out, average cleanliness and helpfulness, but the WiFi was AWFUL.  Part of the time the WiFi didn't work at all.  Definately not a place to go if you need to work while the family plays at the parks.  While it may technically only be a block from Disney, it's really a lot further than that to get to Downtown Disney or Disneyland.  The 'shuttle' to the parks is public transit.  It is nice transit, but there was lots of waiting.  If there was a 2.5 star rating, I'd have given it that...it's just a bit old.  I spent three nights there, two nights too long.
Manager Response: GreenBiners, On behalf of our Hotel Staff, I apologize that your stay didn't meet your expectations. In regards to our WiFi, we have just recently upgraded the hardware that was holding us back, and we are in the process of installing more bandwidth which will triple our hotels total speed.
