What bothers me most is that you felt that your received average service. I am going to forward your review over to our Housekeeping and Front Office managers. To have our rooms have average cleanliness and our staff provide average service is unacceptable.  In regards to the ART shuttle, we have gotten a few complaints due to the time table that they run, but unfortunately there isn't really much we can do about it. The best part about the shuttle is that it is a $4 all day pass that can take you to most of the attractions in the area, whether it be some of the bigger malls, Disneyland, and soon to be Knott's Berry Farm.  We hope that you do come back and give us another try! Thanks, Craig Carlson, Reservations Manager

Summary Heading: Nice enough but nothing over special.
Summary: We stayed here for 2 nights in Feb, 3 of us sharing a room (me, husband & niece).  We wanted somewhere close to Disney as this was a quick visit on our way to San Diago.  We hired a car and had no trouble getting a car parking space, which was free.  They have plenty of spaces.  The hotel does have an outdoor swimming pool, for hotel guests only with a hot tub.  We didn't use this though as the 1st night we were tired from travelling and the 2nd we were in the parks.  It also had a gym with windows overlooking the pool, again we didn't use this though.  The room was big enough for us all and was very clean.  Our room was in a block away from the main hotel, but that wasn't an issue, the blocks are close together with doors that only open with your room key card.  We had a twin
Manager Response: Christinejames7, Thank you for your thorough review! Seems like you were able to take in everything, whether or not you were able to take advantage of it!  I am glad that you were able to enjoy your stay here, I hope that you do come back and visit us again so you can take advantage of all of our amenities! Our new Food and Beverage manager has been taking leaps and bounds in changing our restaurant. We have been revamping the overall appearance, along with new menu items to choose from, and just the overall experience given to our guests.  We hope to see you again in the future! Thanks, Craig Carlson, Reservations Mananger

Summary: We decided to try this Holiday Inn after being loyal to one hotel for many years.  Why?  Because we wanted better television channels, especially ESPN, which we love and our favorite place refuses to carry.  We did get the televsion channels, as promised.       It was pleasant enough, but there was no wow factor to this hotel.  The room was just, well, a room.  It was of adequate size, clean, but with a terrible view of a parking lot and I presume post office (a lot of mail-trucks). Very noisy with the guests parking, talking, laughing, children screaming as they got in and out of their vehicles.  However, the noise did stop.         Mattress was a little too firm for us, but the covers were warm.  Temperature controls worked very well.  Bathroom on the small size, but clean.
Manager Response: FuntimesX2, First off, Thank You for coming to our hotel and giving us a try! I know when you have a favorite place that you prefer to visit, it is pretty hard to switch things around and try something new, but thank you for keeping open minded and giving us a try! Our location is a special one to say the least. The positives with the location is it is away from all the congestion of the Disneyland foot and vehicle traffic off of Harbor, making it a bit quieter in the day and night, but being in the Disneyland area does tend to get noisy, especially with all the families that come around. We do try to keep a strict rule of no noise after 10PM, so if our guests ever have a problem with noise after 10PM, the front desk will help out when notified.  I would suggest the next time you visit us to give one of our suites a try. I am sure that our Family Suite (2 bedroom and living room) or the 1 bedroom suite will definitely give you the experience you were looking for. Both of these rooms do come with a fridge and a microwave, and our Family Suite has 2 bathrooms (1 for each bedroom). We have had a lot of comments regarding our standard rooms not having a fridge and microwave, and we are addressing that. We hope to get at least mini-fridges for all of the rooms some time in the future.  With the ART shuttle, it is a great tool for our guests to use. Although we do get some complaints about their time schedule, the one thing that guests don't know about it is that you can use it like any other public bus transportation. The $4.25 ticket that you purchase can be used to go to a couple of malls, Disneyland, and soon to be added Knott's Berry Farm (much cheaper than any taxi fare). The times are for the most part based off of Disneyland occupancy, but they usually take no longer than 40 minutes.  We hope that you will give us a try again in the future! Thanks, Craig Carlson, Reservations Manager

Summary: Pretty old interior and poor Internet wifi. They said is free but never able To get online. Housekeeping standard is not consistant. Never has one day got all amenities refilled with no error. Location is good, you can walk to Disneyland. Ask 2 times at front desk if they have any envelop and answer is NO and need to buy it From gift shop  So surprise that the whole hotel won't have any envelop available for guest.
Manager Response: sasa99, On behalf of the hotel staff, I do apologize that your experience here wasn't up to your expectations. I have forwarded your comment to our Housekeeping Manager and our Front Office Manager. In regards to the WiFi problem that you had incurred, I can assure you that we are aware of this problem and are working towards getting it fixed. We have currently upgraded our hardware to allow more users to be logged in, and we are currently on track to triple our speed in the next few weeks.  We hope that you will give us another try at accommodating you in the future! Craig Carlson, Reservations Manager

Summary: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel.  It was clean, the beds were really comfortable and the restaurant was pleasant and served a generous portion of nice food.  The parking situation was also very good, and there was good availability of parking spaces near the entrances to the rooms.  The staff were very pleasant and helpful as well.  I was traveling alone and the hotel seems much more family-oriented, so I would more strongly recommend it for family travel.
Manager Response: LisaD47, Thank you for your review! On behalf of the hotel, we are glad that we were able to make you stay here in Anaheim enjoyable!  Due to Disneyland being around the corner, we do try to be a little more family oriented, but we do treat all of our guests the same! Thanks! Craig Carlson, Reservations Manager

Summary: While the proximity to downtown Disney is pretty decent (a 10 min walk), there are plenty of closer hotels. There was only one working elevator that was also used by the service staff, so there was a wait, or it was always crowded.  The rooms aren't anything to write home about, but were okay for what we paid.  The hotel restaurant had a terrible and expensive breakfast, be careful of them pouring a $4 glass of OJ without you noticing.  The hotel had great prices on 2-day park hopper tickets (about 7$ less than online or at the park), and they were fast pass ready, so keep that in mind.  The shower had no pressure, nor could you change the nozzle to anything other than drizzle.  It's a good budget hotel, but the fancy photos on the website are a bit misleading.
Manager Response: SuperDeanio, Thank you for your review of the hotel! On behalf of our staff here at the hotel, we are sorry that we were not able to meet up to your expectations.  We have had a few complaints with the elevators, but unfortunately due to the way the building was constructed, there isn't much we can do. The worst part is when we do our routine maintenance on the elevators causing one to go down only leaving one in the main building. In regards to your experience in the restaurant, I apologize for the miscommunication during your breakfast. Our new Food and Beverage manager is and has been working revamping the menu at the restaurant and as of now we have added new items to our lunch and dinner menu's.  We hope that you can give us another try and stay here again! Thanks, Craig Carlson

Summary: Stayed for 2 nights to see the mouse and this hotel is almost next door!! Previous reviews give the impression of a dreadful walk but it's really 10 mins at most from downtown disney - saves you money on parking for sure. Check in was efficient and friendly, we got a room upgrade and 10% discount card for restaurant (which we didn't use ) by being in their loyalty scheme so that is worth considering. Room had 2 queen beds and they were comfortable and clean. Flat screen tv. Usual bits and pieces and nothing out of the ordinary but all very clean - carpets for once that aren't dirty and make your feet yukky ! We didn't use any hotel facilities as we had little time so can't comment on pool etc. Also hubby delighted with free internet. Overall a decent hotel, great value for
Manager Response: AndyJ37_11, Thank you for your great and thorough review of the hotel and our rooms! Since our new ownership took over back in August, we have really been trying to push the bar in our service and overall cleanliness of the hotel! I am glad you were able to take notice of this!  We hope to see you again soon! Thanks, Craig Carlson, Reservations Manager

Summary: We stayed there during our recent trip to Universal Studios & Disneyland.   Pros: Meets all basic necessities  1. Comfortable beds 2. Clean and decent room (just your average hotel room but most importantly it's clean) 3. Free wifi/internet 4. Within walking distance to Disneyland, and if you're lazy, it's along the route of the Anaheim Transit shuttle. You can get the ticket from the front desk. 5. has a guest laundry room.   Cons:  1. Friendly staff but bad service. Our aircond was leaking and I called the front desk but they never turned up. Also, I asked for a hairdryer as the one in our room wasn't working but again, it never turned up. On both occasions, they promised to send someone over. But they were friendly.
Manager Response: Emmelina C., Thank you for your great review of the hotel! On behalf of our hotel I sincerely apologize for the inconveniences that you had in your room! I have already forwarded your message to our Front Office Manager and he will be looking into the situation and consulting the staff involved. Besides those 2 mishaps, looks like you were able to get the most out of our other amenities! We hope you come back so we can make up for the short comings of this stay! Thanks, Craig Carlson, Reservations Manager

Summary: I booked this hotel because it is close to Disneyland, and I was running the Tinkerbell half marathon. Check-in was a breeze; and employee was very friendly and gave me pamphlets on the complimentary bus for the race weekend. I booked a 2 double-bed room, which was a little small, but clean and quiet.  The hotel is directly next to the parking structure for Disneyland, but I didn't hear much noise. The hotel is walking distance to Downtown Disney, which worked out very well for going to the Expo the day before the race, then just walking to the start line for the marathon the next morning. I didn't have to worry about catching the shuttle.  I have already booked my room for the next Disneyland marathon in September, but have booked a 2 Queen-bed room; hopefully that will be a
Manager Response: ladywofld, Thank you for your great review! I would just like to warn you for your next visit to the hotel, the standard rooms are for the most part all the same size. The only difference would be the size of the beds. If you had booked in a room with 2 double beds for this stay, the next room may feel a little smaller due to the queen beds being bigger.  To respond to your complaint, I know I am a little late in writing this response, but I know that the building on the same lot as us is going to be going through some major construction so that may have played a roll in it, but I will definitely bring that up with our Engineering department so he will be able to look into it.  Thanks, Craig Carlson, Reservations Manager

Summary: Purpose of stay was in town for the Tinker Bell Half-Marathon, hotel was on the course, a Big Plus for booking this hotel. This was our 2nd stay at this Hotel, last stay was for Disneyland Half-Marathon during Labor Day weekend. They did an upgrade with the TV's, we had a nice large LG HDTV with 3-HBO's, and 3-ESPN, so there are plenty of channels to watch.  Major disappointment was the Outage of the WiFi Internet, I brought my laptop and my wife's tablet, Useless without Internet. I called front Desk, Jose, said he fielded 2-3 other complaints about WiFi Outage, but could not give me an ETA when it would be up again.  Con's - the $10.00 Resort Fee, No Refrigerators or Micowaves in the room.
Manager Response: KWongR1430, Thank you for your great reviews! I envy all of the marathon runners that come to our hotel! I wake up at 6:00AM to go to work and by that time you guys are already half way done with your marathon! I think there is going to be a couple more marathons coming up before the end of the year! Hope we get the pleasure of having you come back again! Craig Carlson, Reservations Manager

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for a Disneyland trip!!
Summary: We really enjoyed our stay last week.  The hotel is located in a very unique spot near the park which provides a very pleasant walk to the park.  We stayed in the themed room and it was absolutely worth it!!  Staff was very nice and the kids eat free breakfast was great.  Will stay there again for sure.
Manager Response: Rich, Thank you for your review! Our themed rooms are really going off to a good start! I am glad you were able to take notice to our  rather unique location. We are away from all the traffic on the main major streets and in front of Disneyland, yet we are close enough for a comfortable walk to the park gates. Thanks again for the review! See you again soon! Craig Carlson, Reservations Manager

Summary: The Disney themed spacious Family Suite here was one of the real highlights, for kids and adults alike, on our recent trip to Anaheim. The kids Bedroom had a Toy Story theme, while the Adults Bedroom was adorned with images from Cars. The Living Area was all about Monsters Inc. The vibrant and colourful decorations meant our Disney experience started as soon as we entered our room and long before we even made it to the Parks.   But enough about the frills the basics were great here too - super comfortable beds, smiley and fun Restaurant staff and delicious and inexpensive breakfasts made our stay a real winner. Finally, other members of our Group were equally impressed by the non-themed Double Suites and we all agreed that at Holiday Inn Hotel and Suites we had found a real gem.
Manager Response: Ann and Pat, Thank you for your great review! I am glad that you enjoyed our newly renovated Family Suite! We are currently in the process of renovating the rest of our suites right now for the summer. Craig Carlson, Reservations Manager

Summary: Great Location, Good service Rooms were quite large we had two queen size beds in our room,not far to disneyland and cheap breakfast for the kids in the hotel restaraunt would stay there again
Manager Response: shoppinggirls, Thank you for your review! Short and sweet! Glad you enjoyed your room, restaurant, and our hotel!  We hope to see you again soon! Thanks, Craig Carlson, Reservations Manager

Summary: We booked this hotel because it was close to Disneyland, although it is a 20 minutes walk to main gate, it is nice walk, you can cut that time in half if you use the free tram service from the Mickey and Friends parking structure.  The staffs were friendly and accommodating.  There is a $11/day resort fee, but this included the parking and WiFi internet.  Although the WiFi internet was very slow, The rooms were on the small size, but they were clean.  There is a large flat screen tv in the room and to my surprise, the TV signals was all high definition. We've stayed at other 4 and 5 stars hotels recently and they were all still disappointingly on standard def TV. There is a heated pool, but we did not use it.  I would recommend this hotels for families wanting to be close to
Manager Response: Luckster777, Thank you for your review! With most of our guests, they tend to note that the walk seems long, but I would have to agree with you when you say it is a nice walk. With our guests that have never seen Downtown Disneyland, it really gets you into the "Disneyland Spirit" before you reach the gate!  We have notice the problems that the guests have been having with our WiFi and we are fixing them! We have already increased the number of users and are currently working on increasing bandwidth!  The HDTV's that are in the room are quite new, about 1-2 months old new, and one of our major goals was we did not want to be like the "other hotels" who have their HDTV's without any HD signal. Thank you for noticing! We hope to see you again soon! Thanks, Craig Carlson, Reservations Mananger

Summary: Stayed here on business.  The staff is excellent, friendly and helpful on a 10 out of 10, up there with the best I've experienced, and I have traveled the world.  First time here for me, room was clean, nice flat screen hi def tv.  Beds are comfortable and fresh.  The only downside is the slow internet speed, and in the morning I wasn't able to get online due to bandwidth traffic congestion.  Good thing I had a Verizon MiFi.  Later in the day and evenings, internet was available, but slow.  This is the one upgrade I think they need.  Besides that, big thumbs up for a well-run hotel.
Manager Response: Rick S, Thank you for your review! I am happy to hear that you would rank our staff as one of the best you have experienced! With all the hotels in the Anaheim area, we try our best to stand out with our customer service! Our IT department is going through our WIFI and has made adjustments to allow more users on (this is why you were not able to get on in the morning) and we are working out a contract to boost our bandwidth! Hopefully this will be done by your next visit so you will have no downside during your stay! Thanks, Craig Carlson, Reservations Mananger

Summary Heading: It's Ok, But Not as Good a Location as It Might Appear
Summary: My daughter and I stayed here on a visit to Disneyland.  I run at least one 10K per week.  My daughter is eleven with boundless energy.  When it comes to walking, need I say more?  This property is not within easy walking distance to Disneyland, especially if you have smaller kids.  There is a shuttle service although we found that it didn't run very frequently.  Check with the hotel for specifics on that.  It is the best way to go to the resort.  There are no restaurants near this property.  The onsite restaurant was mediocre and not a good value.  Note:  the first room we were sent to was occupied by someone else.  They were pretty surprised when my daughter and I entered their room.  We had to walk all the way back to the front desk to get another room.  The front desk
Manager Response: Global_Coug, Thank you for your review! The walk for smaller kids can be a little far, but I would still urge our guests to do it at least once so you can get the joy of going through Downtown Disneyland if they have never gone. In Downtown Disneyland, there are many restaurants and stores to enjoy. The Anaheim Resort Transit is controlled by the City of Anaheim so unfortunately the hours of operation and pick up/drop off times are out of our hands, but I can tell you that they do schedule it more often during busier days. Usually when Disneyland expects a low occupancy, they will combine routes making the wait a little longer. ART has developed an online tool that we use at our front desk now that uses a GPS on the shuttle to let you know where the shuttle is and we will be able to approximate the exact time of its arrival within a minute or two! In regards to the restaurant, we have acquired new management who is working with our kitchen staff to revamp our whole menu.  As a hotel employee and guest at times, I know how frustrating it can be switching rooms, especially with the circumstances that you had to encounter. With our hotel changing ownership and management, we are also putting our staff through intensive training with the goal to ensure the best customer satisfaction possible. Since your stay in June, I am confident in saying that we have made major leaps towards this goal from where the hotel was at when you were here.  We would love to have you come back to the hotel, given the date of your last visit, so you could let us know first hand how far we have come! Thanks again, Craig Carlson, Reservations Manager

Summary Heading: Amazing, and within WALKING distance to Disneyland!
Summary: I got a great deal on this hotel using Priceline, and what a great stay we had! It was my friend's first time to LA and our main purpose for going was a visit to Disneyland, with shopping and eating as kind of a secondary reason. What a pleasant surprise to find that downtown Disney was literally a 10-15 minute walk from the hotel, and another 10-15 minute walk to the Disneyland maingate--beyond convenient! Rooms were clean, although a bit on the small side and our room only had a view of another building's wall.  Also, we were next door to a gas station, which may not seem all that great, but hidden inside the gas station is hands down my favourite Mexican hole-in-the-wall: Alberto's. Cheap, and delicious, Mexican eats (if you don't mind eating them inside a gas station). Only
Manager Response: audilim, Thank you for your enthusiastic review!  I am glad to hear that you got a great deal and we were able to make your stay enjoyable!  We hope to see you again soon! Craig Carlson, Reservations Manager

Summary: We just returned from a week in Disneyland and a great stay at the Holiday Inn and Suites.  This was a last minute trip and while we normally stay at private villas and apartments when we travel, we booked this hotel as part of a package.  It is a more basic hotel but the staff were all very friendly and definitely ready to help with anything we needed.    We upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite which was so worth it!  It had several things that I really appreciated.  I really liked the floor to ceiling windows.  They brought in a lot of natural light and we could always see palm trees (which is something people from Canada, where there is snow this time of year, really appreciate!).  There was a large bar area with a small fridge and microwave.  This was really helpful to be able to
Manager Response: Lisa015, Thank you for your great and thorough review of our property! You seem to have touched every aspect of your visit and were able to take advantage of most of what our property had to offer! From taking a lunch break from the park to our front row seat to the firework display at Disneyland! To respond to your complaint about our wifi, our IT department is working with our internet company in upgrading us and allowing for more users at fast speeds.  We hope to see you again on your next family vacation! Thanks, Craig Carlson, Reservations Manager

Summary Heading: Not as close to Disneyland entrance as expected
Summary: Stay was comfortable enough, however there were limited dining options close by except for the in-house facility which lacked variety especially for breakfast.  On the map it appears the hotel is very close to Disneyland, but to get to the entrance it is ~ a 25 minute walk, or a 10 minute walk and then catch the free tram from the entrance to the multistorey carpark.  Restaurants, cafes and fast food outlets are another 10 minute walk the other side of the park entrance.  Service from front desk staff was satisfactory but nothing exceptional.  Our rooms were ground floor, suffered from noise intrusion from rooms above and adjacent, and both just had views of the car park or maintenance building - lucky we spent so much time in Disneyland and not in our rooms.  Except from the
Manager Response: Sue65H, Thank you for your review! Due to our location, we are further away from Harbor Blvd. making dining options as you say "limited." The best part about our location would be that we are a much quieter location in comparison to all the hotels off of Harbor, where congestion and foot traffic is at a maximum. As far as the restaurant menu selection, we have new management working with our kitchen staff in getting the menu a makeover. For the walk to the park, did you happen to try the Anaheim Resort Transit (ART)? Anaheim does provide a shuttle to and from the park for $4/Adult and $1/Child for an all day pass. They also sell multi-day passes on their website at a discount.  We hope you come back and give us another try!  Craig Carlson, Reservations Manager

Summary: Booked this hotel as part of a Costco travel package. The hotel was nice and the staff was friendly. Check in was a little rushed. You could tell that the front deck person had given the check in speach so many times that it became rushed and hard to follow.  The room was clean and well maintained, but it was really small. Not much room for four people to move around in. If you are looking for a clean bed after spending the day at Disneyland this is a great hotel, The location of the hotel is perfect for walking or driving to the park.
Manager Response: Brian C, Thank you for your review! I am glad you enjoyed our hotel! In regards to your check-in, let me assure you that we have undergone new ownership/management and are constantly training and evaluating our employees to give the best customer service to all of our guests. As for your room, next time you come in you should try out one of our suites! We have 2 room suites (living room and bedroom with 1 king or 2 queen beds) or our Family Suites with 3 rooms (living room and 2 bedrooms, 1 with a king and the other with 2 queens).  We hope to see you again soon! Thanks, Craig Carlson, Reservations Mananger

Summary Heading: Nothing to say but a poor place to stay.
Summary: I should have gone to a Disney Hotel! If you wish to visit Disneyland resort, this hotel isn‚Äôt that close to the parks be careful and aware that you are likely to use the ART (Anaheim Resort Transport) The staff definitely isn‚Äôt friendly  (they simply don‚Äôt care about your satisfaction and are full of excuses), the cleanliness is poor and the restaurant is awful. I know what to expect when booking a Holiday Inn, but this one was the worst hotel during my last visit to California.
Manager Response: Waehneldt, On behalf of the hotel, I would like to apologize for your stay at our hotel. If you don't mind, I would like to know more about your stay so we may know what exactly you didn't like so we can make your next stay more enjoyable. Our number one goal is to satisfy our customers and if that didn't happen with you, I would like to work with you in finding where we may have dropped the ball and fix it. Thank you for your review, Craig Carlson, Reservations Manager

Summary Heading: Great Value for a Disneyland Area Hotel
Summary: I brought my two girls, ages 12 and 9, for a quick trip to Disneyland while visiting relatives over the holidays; got this hotel via Priceline at a very reasonable rate, even with the $10/day resort fee added to the bill. The hotel is literally behind the Mickey & Friends parking structure, though I would not consider it "walking distance" to the theme parks. $15/day parking fee at Disneyland was well worth the money, especially after spending a whole day beating the crowds at the parks! Parking is complimentary at the hotel, which is a rare find for hotels/motels in the area.  The lobby was very nicely updated and the front desk staff was super friendly, just like other reviewers had indicated. There was even a small gift shop in the lobby area. We did not get to use the pool,
Manager Response: ashleykaitlynsmom, Thanks for your excellent and thorough review! I am glad to hear that we were able to make your quick Disneyland trip fun! With all the hotels in the Anaheim/Disney area, our goal is to stand out with our customer service! In regards with the walk to Disneyland, were you informed about the Anaheim Resort Transit (ART)? Anaheim provides a shuttle that picks you up right in front of our hotel and drops you off right next to the main gate of Disneyland. There is a charge of $4/adult and $1/child, and these passes can be bought at the gift shop or the front desk. Saves you a little money compared to the parking at Disney, and best of all, you don't have to worry about driving!  We hope to see you again! Thanks, Craig Carlson Reservations Manager

Summary: My hubby and I are from Singapore and we went there for a short stay during our honeymoon in 2011 Nov. Rates are reasonable, rooms are clean and well equipped except without refrigerator, free internet access and staff are quite friendly and helpful. Location is however not very ideal as it requires a 15 minutes walk or a 25 minute slow walk to the Disneyland.
Manager Response: Diazt, Thank you for your review! We have heard concerns about our rooms not coming with refrigerators and we are working fixing that! As far as the walk to Disneyland, where you able to use the Anaheim Resort Transit (ART)? Anaheim provides a shuttle to and from Disneyland for $4/adult and $1/child for an all day pass. We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: My night started out great at the bar. The bartender provided wonderful service and I would come back to the bar only. This is where me and my group decided to have our new years eve dinner that we never recieved. A little while after our order was put in we were told the kitchen lost our ticket and never informed our server,but they were now making it, we waited over an hour all together and our food was never made. We left the onyx without ever getting our food and I blame the kitchen, our server was very attentive and busy but it is no excuse for the kitchens actions, it is unacceptable and unprofessional we will never come back to eat here. I hope the hotel manager realizes the kitchen is responsible for the loss of business and put a damper in our holiday night.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! I apologize on behalf of the hotel for having such bad service in our restaurant. I can say that there was some staffing issues that day which caused the restaurant to back up, but as you noted, that is no excuse for having your order take that long. Your issue has been brought up with our management.  I hope you give us another chance and come to visit us again. Craig Carlson, Reservations Manager

Summary: Stayed here from 12-25 to 12-31-2011..It is a great place to stay, quiet and very clean.  Everyone from the housekeeping staff to the front desk was so helpful with whatever you needed.  I had trouble with my keys not working and they were very understanding (don't put your keys by your cell phone-did it once but we don't know what happened the other 4 times) and they comp'd me 2 days for the refer we had in the room.  Kids eat free with a paying adult, the pool is heated and the hot tub is great!!  It was nice to have the shuttle to Disneyland every 20/30 minutes. Definately would stay here again..
Manager Response: Thank you for your great review!  Looks like you booked your stay through one of the travel companies that we work with. We do put out specials giving 3rd, 4th, or 5th night free promotions often. Our staff is trained to be as helpful and friendly as possible no matter what the question or concern is.  Hotel keys can be kind of tricky. The keys are magnetically charged to open doors so when you put them next to anything magnetic, such as credit cards, phones, etc, it can erase the key.   Thanks again for the review! We hope to see you again! Craig Carlson, Reservations Manager

Summary Heading: Easy walk to Disneyland and has a great restaurant
Summary: We have stayed at this hotel twice now and just booked again for January.  The location is in a quiet area and it takes only about 15 minutes to walk to downtown Disney.  They have a fantastic restaurant in the hotel in which kids eat free with a paying adult.  Staff are very friendly, the prices are very reasonable, and we have yet to be disappointed with the food.  You never have to wait long to get a table.  The rooms are clean and staff are friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: Thank you for your excellent review! See you again soon! Craig Carlson, Reservations Manager

Summary: Hotel and rooms were very clean.  We stayed for 2 nights and as a priority platinum member I was given a coupon which covered 1 free breakfast for my son and I.  We used the bus service to Disneyland and that was perfect.  Many restaurant choices were wihin a 10 - 15 minute drive.  We were very happy with our choice and found the front desk staff to be very helpful and friendly.
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review! We LOVE to give back to our Priority Club Members who give Our Brand so Much! Your review proved to be quite helpful to many other potential guests and we thank you for that! We hope to see you again soon! Craig Carlson, Reservations Manager

Summary Heading: Great priced hotel, convenient to Disney
Summary: We just got back from a fast trip to Disneyland and got a great deal on this hotel through Priceline.  Yes, there was a $10 resort fee and this hotel is not really a 'resort'; however, even with $10 added to the price I thought it was a great deal.  It has free parking, modern lobby, clean rooms, VERY hot showers, and relatively quiet rooms.  The hotel is far enough from the freeway that there isn't road noise; however, you may hear your neighbors.  Its not walking distance to Disney (or that wouldn't be my choice with my 3 and 5 year old), but the ART shuttle picks you up right in front of the hotel and is a great price.  And when I say right in front of the hotel, I mean in the driveway.  You can wait for the shuttle from the warmth of the hotel lobby.  Overall, I was
Manager Response: Thank you for your great review!!  Looks like you were able to utilize most of the property! By the looks of your comment, you have stayed in the area before. With our hotel being away from the freeways and Harbor Blvd. congestion isn't bad, and the freeway noise is irrelevant. You were able to use the ART shuttle rather than walk to the park. You also got the benefits of Holiday Inn's Kids Eat Free promotion.   Thanks again! We hope to see you again soon! Craig Carlson, Reservations Manager

Summary Heading: Great hotel, all the amenties, and excellent staff in the restaurant
Summary: We were especially impressed with the restaurant service. We were very fortunate to have Miguel Sitventez as our server for the 3 days of our stay. He was very accomadating, thoughtful and cheerful . Even the people who were seated next to us commented on his service. I spoke to his manager ( Sal ) and he was very grateful for the compliment  regarding Miguel. He made sure that Miguel was aware about my comment. He was overlooking all the restaurant staff and they all seemed to enjoy working under his supervision. I hope we get Miguel to serve when we come back again. I would recommend this hotel without a doubt. It had all the ameneties and it was in close proximity to Disney Land
Manager Response: Thank you for you great review!  We love when guests put the names of our employees who gave great service! I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay here at the hotel! I would also have to agree with your tip! Always book in advance to receive the best discounts!  Thanks again! Craig Carlson, Reservations Manager

Summary Heading: Good value for a place close to Disneyland
Summary: It is a little weird having the sink right besides your bed, otherwise, it is clean and the staff is very helpful.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review!  Craig Carlson, Reservations Manager

Summary: Really no issues, it's an older property, but clean, and up-to-date. Quiet (except for when Disneyland Fireworks are going off). And a Quick Drive or 15 min walk to Disneyland (walk to the tram area at mickey and friends). Only issue was with smokers hanging outside the rooms and the A/C picking it up as it's a Non-Smoking Hotel. Also would love to see a Fridge in the rooms, we ended picking up a foam cooler at the Shell Station at the corner to store milk for our twins.  Overall really like this place, and it's available at some really good rates, will return!
Manager Response: Thank you for your great review!  I am sorry to hear that you had other guests smoking outside your room! I know that would have definitely ruined my day! We will go around and make sure our smoking areas a plainly marked and also look into putting "No Smoking" signs to make sure things like this don't happen!  We are also looking into getting refrigerators and microwaves put into all of our rooms!  Your issues have been noted and we are glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay here!  We hope to see you again!  Craig Carlson, Reservations Manager

Summary: My stay at THE AMAZING Holiday Inn Hotel and Suites Anaheim was one of my most exciting times in my life. The queen suite made it that little bit more special with the added spaciousness when you came back home from the parks. Not too mention the cleanliness, lovely surrounds and the staff,they were all so welcoming, helpful and friendly including the restaurant staff. The attention to service was the making of the stay. thank you Holiday Inn.
Manager Response: Thank you for your AMAZING review! With the queen suites you can never go wrong! Looks like you were able to soak in everything we had to offer. As you noted in your comment we strive to do our best in helping out all of our guests. Service is our top priority! Thanks again for the great review! We hope to see you again soon! Craig Carlson, Reservations Manager

Summary: Liked the hotel. Like the front desk staff who was helpful. Lots of parking. The only downside: does not have a shuttle to Disneyland. Would love the hotel if they start one.  Overall: good deal.
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review! I am glad to hear that you were able to enjoy your stay here! With the Anaheim Resort Transit system in place, it makes it a little difficult to have a hotel ran shuttle service, but it is definitely something that we are looking into.  We hope to see you again soon! Craig Carlson, Reservations Manager

Summary: We stayed overnight here on our visit to Disneyland. Roxanne at the from desk was amazing! She went above and beyond to accomodate our needs. She really made us feel welcome at this hotel! We have never received such great customer service! The rooms were clean, comfortable and updated nicely. My three kids ate for free in the restaurant which was nice after spending so much money at Disneyland. :-) The staff was very welcoming as well. I would definately stay here again!
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful review! I have notified Roxanne of your great review of her! We love it when our guests write comments about specific employees! Our hotels Kids Eat free is on of the best deals around! Thanks again and see you soon! Craig Carlson, Reservations Manager

Summary: Because we're Disneyland annual passholders, we often stay in the area hotels. This is the first time we stayed at a Holiday Inn ever.   We're a family of 5 and we stayed in a queen suite for 2 days. Roomy enough for us. It consists of 2 queen beds in a separate bedroom, sofa bed and kitchenette(micro, fridge, sink). Very convenient. We took advantage of the kids eat free in the restaurant. There's also a nice gift shop.  We used the ART shuttle. Pickup is every about every 20 minutes. For some reason, we didn't wait long (less than 5 minutes) for pickup in front of the hotel. But our wait for the shuttle at Disneyland was 20-25 minutes. That's long a wait when you want to return to your room to relax or when you've been playing at the parks for the entire day.  Though the rooms
Manager Response: Thank you for your great review! Although you won't change us to your primary hotel, I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay here with us! As you have noticed, we strive to give our guests the best possible experience when coming to Anaheim. There are many hotels to choose from in the area, and with hotel rooms being roughly the same no matter where you go, we have realized the real catch is to give our guests the best possible customer service.  I hope next time your in town those other hotels are full so we will be able to enjoy your company again! =] Thanks, Craig Carlson, Reservations Manager

Summary: This was a great place to stay for our trip to Disneyland. The room was clean, the staff was friendly, rates are reasonable and parking was free. It is located in a residential area so dining options are limited. We had a car so this was not a problem for us. There is a restaurant on site and kids eat free. There are also a number of restaurants close enough that they would deliver to the hotel. We saw a few families do this and the hotel provides a list of restaurants around the area. Overall, I was pleased with this hotel and would stay here again if in the area.
Manager Response: Thank you for your excellent review! We are glad that you were able to enjoy your stay! We strive to give our guests the best experience possible and I am glad to hear that you received it! Thank you again and we hope to see you again soon! Craig Carlson, Reservations Manager

Summary Heading: Looking forward to staying here again :)
Summary: The staff at this hotel are amazing.  Each and every one of them.  From the start of our vacation, we found the front desk staff very kind, friendly and willing to go out of their way to help you (especially Anil, Ed and Roxanne).  Whether you need directions, or a taxi, or suggestions on things to do, they will help you (even opening a bottle of wine for us - yup, forgot to bring a corkscrew).  Yes, it's 'their job' to help, but some hotels do it MUCH better than others, and this one definitely did.  We reserved a queen bedroom suite that had the fridge and microwave.  This came in so handy and saved us a lot of money on eating out (as we stayed for 7 nights).  The housekeeping did a fantastic job, our room was always cleaned and beds made by the time we returned to our room
Manager Response: Thank you for your excellent review! As always, we love when our guests point out our employees's! Thank you very much! To comment on your only complaint of your stay, we have recognized the problem with our bathrooms, and as the front desk has told you, we are in the process of renovating. We are glad that you were able to enjoy your stay here and were able to take advantage of our hotels amenities!  We hope to see you again soon!  Thanks, Craig Carlson, Reservations Manager

Summary Heading: A Fantastic Find Close to Disneyland!
Summary: Great hotel near Disney, on the quiet side of the area. Nice lobby, tasty restaurant.  Customer service is friendly and first rate!  Comfortable,causal lobby. Rooms are very clean and more than adequate.  Expected much less for such a good price on priceline.  ART bus stops right in front of the door and drops you off right at Disney if you don't want to take the 15-20 minute walk.  We would certainly come back to this hotel for its comfort and service and conveninet location!  They went out of their way to give great customer service.  Thanks to all!!
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review!  We can't wait to accommodate you and your family the next time you are in town!  Thanks! Craig Carlson, Reservations Mananger

Summary: we stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in october, the staff was very friendly, and helpful,staff member hooked us up with some tours that worked great for us,went to the beach and hollywood tour the day we left then took us to airport. The hotel is small enough our kids could go from pool to room and feel comfortable. The pool was sufficent for us but there is no shallow end for non swimming children.The hot tub was indeed hot that doesnt always happen. The kids eat free if adult orders a entre does not count if you have appitizer do not know why cause they are the same price.The rooms where clean and comfortable. if you can get in building 3 you can see fireworks from window at end of hall.
Manager Response: Thank you for your excellent review!  We are glad to hear that you and your family enjoyed your stay here at our hotel! It is good to hear that you were able to catch the fireworks also! One of our hotels best kept secrets is how we are away from all the congestion on Harbor Blvd, but we are close enough to have a good front row seat for the fireworks. We hope to see you and your family again in the future!   Thanks! Craig Carlson, Reservations Manager

Summary: This was an incredible value for the location. Very clean and pleasant, beautiful rooms and comfortable beds.  Would not really use this for a 'walking disfance' hotel, there is a $4 shuttle that is well worth the price. Staff was wonderful and accomodates an early checkin as the rooms were ready. Can't say enough good things. Great job!
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful review!  We are a little further from the main gate of Disneyland than other hotels, but we are the closest hotel to Downtown Disney. One good tip for a future stay with us, if you don't mind the walk to Downtown Disney, there is a Monorail entrance towards the front entrance of Downtown Disney. As long as you have your Disneyland Ticket, you are able to use the Monorail to get dropped off in Tomorrowland inside the park! This saves you some time, especially if you want to jump straight to the Finding Nemo Submarine ride or Space Mountain (one of my favorites). Otherwise, like you said, with the Anaheim Resort Transit's all day pass, you can get to the park with ease.  Thanks again and see you next time you come to town!  Craig Carlson, Reservations Manager

Summary Heading: Very friendly staff and comfortable rooms:)
Summary: We stayed two nights on our way back to Australia we were staying in NYC and decided we wanted to visit Disneyland for a day just for something different. So we did and last minute we booked this hotel and we were not disappointed. Pretty large rooms comfy beds and friendly staff checking us in and out. Free wifi was good reception with my iPhone wasn't great but still managed. I didn't really get the whole resort fee thing but was happy enough to pay it as I seems pretty standard amd I had read about it so jst expected it.  It's a short bus ride to Disneyland but it's quick and easy. I'd stay again if I came back.
Manager Response: Thank you for your great review!  To respond to your concern with our wifi, we were actually in the process of switching our providers. We had just switched ownership back in August and there were a couple of small things, like the wifi, that we had to get sorted out.  Thank you for choosing us to book your last minute add-on to your vacation!  We really hope to see you again soon!  Thanks, Craig Carlson, Reservations Manager

Summary: We had a great stay at this hotel. The location was excellent for our days spent at Disneyland- about a 10-15 minute walk- pleasant, even with our 3 young children. The view of the evining fireworks was as good in our parkinglot as it was in the resort. Kids eating free at the restaurant made it worth our time to be back in time for supper, and the food was excellent - restaurant could use a little upkeep though. Staff was excellent, especially when we arrived very early for check-in on our first day - they made sure we were comfortable and our family could enjoy the pool area until our room was ready. We also appreciated the laundry facilities onsite. We would definately return to this resort!
Manager Response: Thank you for you excellent review!  I am glad to hear that you were able to catch the fireworks here at our property! One of the secrets behind this property that people don't know about is how close we are to the park. Being on the back side of Disneyland, we are much quieter than all of the usual congestion off of Harbor Blvd, yet we are still close enough to walk to the park and have a good front row seat to the amazing fireworks display! To address your concern with our restaurant, we are currently in the works of renovating it completely. Thanks again for the wonderful review! We hope to see you again! Craig Carlson, Reservations Manager

Summary: The night shift concierge, Roxanne, she is so excellent on customer service of Q&As about map, road direction, shopping information, tour information,...etc. Make us feel like we are family & at home. Very good!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful review! We really appreciate when guests have comments about specific employees! Whenever guests stay with us, we try our best to give you the best experience possible! We are glad to hear you enjoyed your stay!  Thanks, Craig Carlson, Reservations Manager

Summary: our family loved this hotel. Its close to the  Angels baseball stadium , shuttle buses run ever 20 minutes to Disneyland, door to door drop off/ pick up, amenities for washing and drying clothes, and very helpful friendly staff. not aimed at supplying entertainment for the kids, I guess its due to Disneyland being up the road. we were able to get picked up from the hotel  to travel to San Diego. :)
Manager Response: Thank you for your great review! We are glad that you were able to enjoy our hotel and our amenities available to our guests!  Currently we are tossing around the idea of putting a small arcade somewhere to help with entertaining the kids!   We hope to see you again! Craig Carlson, Reservations Manager

Summary Heading: Location Location with the Personal Touch
Summary: My Family stayed here for 12 nights and had an awesome stay.  Whilst the close proximity to Disneyland (10-20 minute walk) was a major plus, this was certainly enhanced by the shining example of exemplary customer service and care shown to us by the reception staff (Gary & Roxanne outstanding !) and all the housekeeping and catering staff.  We very much felt part of the family and enjoyed the friendly welcomes by everyone we met.  Our room was kept spotless and well stocked with towels (though we did miss the minifridge to be able to store drinks in) and the reception staff were responsive and professional in all our dealings. Guest laundry facilities are adequate, but given the amount of guests travelling, two areas per building would be a great improvement.  The restaurant
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful and thorough review!  First off, Thank You for the specific employee comments! We love it when our guests mention employees by name! For the concern with our laundry facilities, we do recognize this issue and are looking at ways to better suit our guests. We would be glad to hear from you as to which dishes at the restaurant you had this concern with. If you are able to pull up our email on our homepage, I would be glad to forward your message over to the restaurant. Lastly, it is awesome that you were able to take advantage of this properties best kept secret! We are extremely close to Disneyland but on the opposite side of Harbor Blvd's congestion. Our quiet location on the back of Disneyland gives families a nice place to rest during the day/night and also gives a great front row seat to Disneyland's AMAZING firework display.   Thank you again for your excellent review! We hope to see you again!  Craig Carlson, Reservations Mananger

Summary: I worked with this hotel for a family gathering October 2011.  All of our rooms were on the same floor, They were ready when we all arrived at different hours as we were coming from various places within the state and outside the state.    The breakfast was okay, but the wait staff amazing, as breakfast started with two and 9 more members joined, we outgrew the booth they put two tables together and allowed for folks to come and join in.  I like to stay at this hotel as it is close and reasonably priced.   My one complaint would be around the bathroom, I'm not sure it could get any smaller.  The toilet paper is hidden behind the door, the door had to be shoved shut or it would swing back open hitting you in the head.  The Shower was good, did not run out of hot water, shower

Summary Heading: Decent enough I guess for what it is..Not Bad..Not Great
Summary: I booked this on Hot Wire and of course when you do that you don't know which hotel you are getting until you book it..only the general area. I was a little let down because in past trips to Disneyland I had used Hot Wire and for the same price we stayed at a Marriott, Hyatt or Sheraton. This Holiday Inn was not on the same level and for the first time It seemed like the price we paid (about $60.00 a night) was not the greatest deal on a room as we had gotten in the past.In fact it seemed like that was what the normal rate should be. I was surprised because I did review it on this site before leaving and it had a bunch of 5 star rating so I kind of got my hopes up...that was probably a mistake.This is a 3 star property at best and I'm just giving fair warning to all the other

This hotel was exactly what we paid for.Great friendly service,clean tidy room and worth what we paid.We called the Anaheim Market who provide a shuttle bus to take you to the market so you can shop.We waited over an hour in the lobby for the shuttle which says pick up n 10 minutes.The hotel front desk rang them twice for us and still no shuttle.I think it was the hotel manager rang a taxi for us and they paid for the taxi to take us to the market.That is first class service.[There are 3 holiday Inns in Anaheim and the shuttle bus went to the wrong one]. Sit in the rear car park around 9pm for an excellent veiw of the Disney fireworks. Buy a shuttle bus ticket it is a good walk to Disneyland especially if the weather is hot. We would recommend this hotel to friends and stay here

We made a trip to disneyland and had planned to stay at a days inn and when we got back to our room we found multiple bugs crawling around so we checked out and found the holiday inn. We were more than pleased with our stay at the holiday inn. They were very helpful at getting us a room even though it was very late at night. The rooms were very clean and best of all there was not a bug in sight. I would definitely stay at the holiday inn again and would definitely recommend it to everyone. Overall it was a great hotel with great service.
It was relatively inexpensive and the service was great. Wouldn't mind going again if I'm in the area!

My fiance and I decided on a late tuesday afternoon to go to  Disneyland and get a hotel room because we have season passes & wanted to get use of them. Called to make reservations (super fast and easy) got there had late check in and they gave us a priority club card and also gave us late check out for free! The hotel is nice, super close to disneyland and beds were comfy. We're planning another trip and plan on staying here again :)
Manager Response: Thank you so much for you excellent review!  We hope to see you again next time you decide another vacation!

Summary: I recently called ahead to have fruit, cookies and wine placed in a friend's room before they checked in with their kids.  Sal, the F&B manager was exceptional.  He confirmed the check-in, booked my order and then e-mailed me a receipt - all within minutes!  A refreshing change from past experiences with other hotel chains.  Our friends were pleasantly surprised with the awesome fruit platter (sliced and arranged) as well as the wine! Well done and thanks.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for this fantastic review! I am glad to hear you enjoyed your stay! We hope to see you again soon!  Craig Reservations Manager

Summary: I work as a travel agent. So, I see hotel rooms all the time as a frequent traveler. I got a great discount here because of my line of work. I had looked online too see what I should expect. Upon arrival, the front desk looked very well put together! The staff was super friendly and helpful! I did notice with the heat that there was a big need a better air ventilation. It was a little bit of a walk to our building/elevator. Our room was much darker than expected due to facing the parking structure in front of us. I could care less about the view. This is Disneyland, not Hawaii. I didn't pay to have a fantastic view. The furnishings looked a little tired and could stand to be replaced. However, I do realize I am not at the Four Seasons. This is a moderate! I loved the location

Our family of four stayed at the Holiday Inn & Suites Anaheim Sept 9-13th and were very happy with our choice.  We wanted a hotel with a pool, restaurant, walking distance to Disneyland and a room with a separate bedroom.This hotel met all those needs and was a great place to stay.  Pros: - The room was very large with a separate bedroom - Restaurant with "kids eat free" program for guests - Outdoor pool - Clean rooms - Fridge and microwave - Well stocked giftshop - Staff at check-in and the restaurant were friendly and helpful - Free parking Cons: - No other restaurants walking distance (which was fine because we had a car) - 15-20 minute walk to Disneyland which was a bit long after a day walking at the park, until will learned to catch the Disney Tram. - Only 15 channels

We were in town for the Disneyland 5K/Half-Marathon, this Holiday Inn was right next door to the Mickey and Friends Parking Structure, we were within walking distance to the start to both races, only a 7-minute walk and avoided the hassle of using the Parking structure and the $15 to park. It is also close to the Esplanade(entrance to both Cal Adventure and Disneyland), Downtown Disney too. We even took in an Angels game on Sat, just a 10-min drive to Angels Stadium.  Back to the hotel, we had the double Queen room, the room was very large, clean with plenty of nice(thick) terry towels, a big 27" TV with cable, HBO, ESPN, ESPN2, USA, TNT, etc.  Free WiFi in the room the log-in name and password was in the little key jacket you get at Check-In.  The only thing lacking was No

Summary Heading: its ok but watch out for taxi scam
Summary: We spent 5 nights here and overall it was ok. we booked a suite but was told it was not avalible when we got there. so we were in a 2 queen room it was ok . air conditiong was good cleaned everyday lots of  towels. The bad part is i asked the front desk to call me a TAXI to go to best buy so he calls me one. it was his friend that owns a transportation van. he took me the 2 miles there and back less than 20min and charged me 40.00 "he said to me "didnt the front desk person tell me how much ?" i said no he didnt and your not the TAXI i asked for and was told taxis wont come there the hotel is to far away from things. i ended up paying but not happy.its not right that there employess are lining the pockets of there pals and not giving the hotel guest with what they asked for. So

I ended up having to book this hotel at the very last minute for two days.  Most of the hotels in the area were already booked, so I was hesitant about this hotel, but ended up being happy with the choice to stay here.    The front desk was amazing!  By accident, I booked the wrong room, when we asked to be moved they were more than willing to do so without any problems.  The rooms were clean, the bed was comfortable, the only thing I didn't like was the rooms seemed really dark.  Hotel was SO quiet, I didn't hear any of the people around us which was so nice after a night at Disneyland.    A lot of people complaining about the fees, that didn't bother me as we were told about it up front and they don't charge for parking as most of the hotels in the area do.

Summary Heading: Holiday Inn & Suites, Anaheim Super Clean, Comfortable and Friendly
Summary: My wife and I made a trip last weekend to Anaheim, Ca. and Disneyland. As a travel agent one purpose of the trip was to check out a different hotel in the area that I could (hopefully) recommend to clients. We have stayed at many motels and hotels there. While most were adequate only a few really stood out as commendable but one has a more rustic theme that might not appeal to everyone and the others are generally more expensive.   This time we stayed at the Holiday Inn & Suites, one of Disney‚Äôs Good Neighbor hotels. This hotel is adjacent to Disney‚Äôs Mickey and Friends Parking Structure and just down the street from Downtown Disney. For the big city it was a reasonably quiet well manicured location away from freeway noise yet only a couple of blocks from the entrance to I-5.

We stayed here for four nights on our trip to disneyland. The location is excellent, its about at 10-15 minute walk to disneyland which some people may not like to do however there is also a ART stop at this hotel which is basically a shuttle that stops at certain hotels and then disneyland is the final stop. Passes for the art are a couple of dollars and can be bought from the hotel at the little shop in there. The staff at this hotel were wonderful, incredibly helpful and they put on a wonderful breakfast. I will be staying here again on my next trip to disneyland for sure!

Summary Heading: Suites that dont have a fridge or microwave???
Summary: Place was clean, but how can you be a suite if you have no fridge, no microwave and small rooms. If your for business, ok but families for Disney, charges add up. 10 dollar resort charge per day added. They never could tell me what this is for as there is nothing they offer that makes it a resort style.

My sister and I stayed 3 nights at the Holiday Inn.  I was surprised at how nice the bed was, bedding and how clean the hotel was.  There were people cleaning everywhere we went. I even saw a man spraying bug spray on the grounds. I never saw one bug.  Everyone was so nice. I used the free Wi-Fi. We watched the fireworks from Disneyland right outside our room. The food in the restaruant was good. Downtown Disney was just around the corner. I would definitely stay here again.

We booked this hotel through Hotwire and got a good rate. But upon checking in the clerk talked my husband into upgrading to a suite- that tacked on an extra $50. So much for the savings but I'm not going to complain much. The room was immaculate. Thank goodness because that has not been our experience lately...  The master bedroom had a queen bed, a large tv, side tables and lamps and the bathroom. It was very spacious and the bedding was lovely. The bathroom was very clean. The cable channels were adequate and there's free WiFi. There are french doors to separate the master room from the living room which has a sofa sleeper, two chairs, a desk, some lamps and another large tv. There is a nice sized kitchen with a bar counter with stools- very nice. There's also a small

Although not a luxury hotel it offered great stuff. Room's were small and the bathroom was. Need to revamp the rooms, looking really dated. Enjoyed the hotel pool and breaky. Waffles and Pancakes are beautiful. The staff were very nice and helpful from the first minute we got their to the last. All in all really enjoyed it and also enjoyed the firework show we got every night from Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Good option to stay close to the park, outstanding breakfast!!!
Summary: The service at this hotel was very good, and the rooms were comfortable.  There is a shuttle available at an extra fee for like a 10 minutes ride and they drop you at the maingate.  The best surpirse at this hotel was the restaurant.... what a great breakfast we had!!!! Everything was fresh and tasty, price is very reasonable and they give a discount if you are Priority Club Member.
Manager Response: Thank you! We are happy to hear that you loved your stay, and I couldn't agree more, the breakfast options are fantastic! Kids love our Mickey Mouse-shaped pancakes, be sure to order some of them if you're staying here with children.  Thank you again for the recommendation, and we hope to welcome you back again soon!  Sincerely, your team from the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim

Summary: I booked this hotel through Priceline and instantly regretted not staying at the Holiday Inn Express in Anaheim.  This hotel is very disorganized.  We arrived two hours after check in and were directed to our room.  To our surprise, our room was still occupied!  I saw a pair of feet peeking out from the edge of a mattresss.  I quickly shut the door and marched back to reception and told them about this.  The receptionist scrambled to find an explanation and then found us another room.  We were late for our concert because of this move and did not have time to inspect the room.  When we arrived from our concert, we could not sleep as this room faced the Disneyland parking lot for employees and we were kept up for several hours with the distinct sound of "Bump, bump" as cars went

I stayed there with my son In Mid June. Roxanne worked at Reception. I would like Management to recognise my apprecitation of her services provided to my son and I. In short, I found Roxanne professional, friendly and accommodating to all my questions and requests.  Not only does she have a lovely nature, nothing seemed to be a problem for her. You never felt from the 1st time of meeting her that anything was a problem for her in relation to customer service. Roxanne is definitely a real assest to your Hotel. She has people skills that a lot of people in her profession lack. To me she also appears to have natural management skills as well. She was a joy to deal with. Let her be aware of this review of her from me. William Renouf
Manager Response: Hi William,  Thank you for this wonderful review!  We have just forwarded your comments to Roxanne, I am sure she will love to read them.  I am more than happy to hear about yet another example of our friendly staff going above and beyond to make sure our guests have everything they could ask for during their stay.  We thank you again for the recommendation, and hope to be able to welcome you again soon.  Greetings,  Your team from the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim

Summary Heading: KEEP looking for another place to stay...this was the worst HI experience I have ever encountered!
Summary: Where to start? I could say ditto to a lot of what others are saying: the "resort fee" which was never explained and when I asked I only got a silly answer "you are staying on Disney property"  to the extremely slow HSI speed (I understand I wasn't paying for it but really? if it's going to be sub-par either tell me that up front "hey, it's free but!..." or don't offer it at all) to needing to call the front desk each time we needed addittional towels (which was always because we only got ONE bath towel each cleaning AND we were in a room with 2 queen beds with three people) and out of 7 nights we called each day and only once did someone bring us up towels. We learned really quickly to "steal" them from the housecleaning carts each morning! The ultimate insult was when I was

This was our first stay in the Holiday Inn and Suites on Walnut -- the property itself was nice, everything you expect in a Holiday Inn.  The rooms were typical, comfortable size and the beds were great after long days at Disneyland.  The front desk people were great -- always very helpful and friendly.  The pool was nice, jacuzzi was PACKED and the towels ran out twice, but they were always quick to refill them with a smile. . .  Our only complaint was the shuttle service to and from the Park . . . the waits were REALLY long at the end of the day, back to the Hotel.  On our second evening (a Sunday night), we waited 45 minutes at 8 PM.  I realize its probably the busiest then, but I would still say 45 minutes is a LONG wait for something that should be picking up every 15-20
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience at our hotel! We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your stay, and were happy with the hotel and friendly service. I apologize for the long wait for the shuttle that one evening, that is definitely not the service our guests have come to expect. We appreciate you bringing this to our attention.  Again, thank you for the recommendation, and we hope to be able to welcome you and your family back again soon.  Greetings,   Your team from the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim

Summary Heading: We loved it we will definitely be back!
Summary: We stayed here during our stay in Anahiem whilst visiting Disneyland.  Lovely clean room with pool view and flat screen TV.  Reception staff helpful and informative aswell as friendly.  Shuttle bus runs every 5 mins to Disneyland just 1 Block away.  Nice restaurant with all you can eat buffet breakfast.  Good choive of food and kids eat free!  Hotel was very quiet during our stay.  We loved it and would definitely stay here againfor our next trip to Disneyland!
Manager Response: Thank you for this wonderful review, and for taking the time to share your experience at our hotel!  We are more than happy to hear that you had a great time, and are looking forward to welcoming you again soon!  All the best,  Your team from the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim

Summary: We stayed for almost a week doing the Disney rounds and heading into LA for a tour and could not complain about one thing that the hotel provided. Room was immaculate, staff always super friendly and very helpful in providing information or tips. Alicia on the front desk was especially helpful in the evenings. We went to the restaurant for breakfast twice and service was great both times.
Manager Response: Thank you for this wonderful review! We are glad to hear that you enjoyed everything about your stay.  Your recommendation is greatly appreciated, and we are looking forward to welcoming you again soon.  Greetings,  Your team from the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim

Summary: For the price the hotel was not too bad. The hotel does charge a 11.00 resort fee so be prepared for that. The rooms were ok. It would be a looooong walk to Disney. The hotel states a block which technically is correct but they are only certain ways to get into Disney which would make the walk about a mile or so.

Summary Heading: Golf Event // we loved the stay at Holiday Inn, we'll be back
Summary: I wanted to take a minute to express my gratitude and thanks to Beckie Bruffey for a job well done. In booking our hotel we were looking for something that would accommodate our entire party and just as Beckie had stated your Holiday Inn in Anaheim was a great place to stay. Your guest services, the entire staff was all about customer service and Crystal from the bar/restaurant was fabulous. We cannot express how thankful we are to Beckie. Her understanding of our requests and the thoroughness are what stands her apart from other hotel Sales Mgmt. Our guest and I are appreciative of Beckie, for her hard work and all she provided to us. Thank you again for a great stay...
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this wonderful review! We were all very happy to read that you enjoyed your stay and had a good time. Beckie remembered you very well and asked me to post the following:  ‚ÄúThanks, Nellie! It was fun working with you. I‚Äôm glad that you‚Äôve decided to make this an annual trip and look forward to working with you again next year.‚Äù - Beckie B.  We are all looking forward to your next stay, and wish you all the best.  Sincerely, Your team from the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim

Summary: Hotel was nice and clean, staff was friendly, but watch out for the $10 extra charge per night. This fee is not on the website and we had no clue about it.  The excuse is that the fee is because the hotel is on Disney property, SO WHAT. Luckily, we only stayed one night, but a week stay could set you back a lot of money. (This fee is on top of the 17% surcharge fee).

Summary Heading: Close to the Park for us, might be a bit far if you don't want a walk
Summary: We stayed here for my Birthday, which I wanted to spend in Disneyland.  Hotel was very nice for the price, and def close enough for us to walk to the park.  On day 2 the walk felt a bit long, but we were tired.   The restaurant downstairs had very friendly waitstaff however if you are allergic to somthing make sure you are SUPER clear.  My boyfriend is allergic to mushrooms so we asked if there was any mushrooms in his meal, the waitress said No and when the food arrived and he was part way through he noticed the gravy had mushrooms in it.  Thankfully he noticed before putting any in his mouth, but still!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this review! We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay in general, but I also have to apologize for the incident at the restaurant. There is certainly no excuse for this lapse in service, and I'll make sure that the issue of food allergies is addressed again with the restaurant staff, so we can learn from our mistake.  Thank you again for sharing your experience, and we hope to be able to welcome you back again soon!  Sincerely,  Sandra Gilliom Marketing Manager Holiday Inn & Suites Anaheim

Summary Heading: Not Impressed, Will Not Go Back
Summary: So my girlfriend and I were going to Disneyland and we booked at this hotel because it had good reviews and we've had good experience with Holiday Inns in the past.  We actually booked our May vacation back in January because we wanted everything sorted out ahead of time.  When we arrived, they told us that they did not have a room for us.  I presented the reservation confirmation ticket that our AAA agent printed for us.  They told us that they did not have a room for us, even though we had a reservation and transferred us to another hotel without giving us a better explanation why they didn't have a room.  They told us that they would pay for our first night, but one month later, I still have not received any refund.  The next day, we went back to the Holiday Inn and attempted

Summary Heading: Affordable, easy and close to Disneyland!
Summary: We booked our 2 night stay last minute and got a great deal. The hotel was on the Disney shuttle route which was so useful and totally saved us money and hassle of parking at Disneyland. The room service was fast, hot, and a lot of food for the money. Our room was small but worked for us. It didn't have a mini fridge which would have been useful... couldn't find a place nearby that sold a cooler so we had to use the sink filled with ice. The TV was old and didn't have many channels. We were close enough to the park to stand in the parking lot and watch the fireworks which was nice. The pillows however were the absolute worst I have ever slept on... bring your own!!! I would stay here again, I would just make sure to bring a cooler and a pillow next time. The location and price
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this review, we always love to hear back from our guests. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay in general, but I am also sorry to hear that the pillow wasn't up to the comfort standards that our guests have come to expect, I have definitely made a note of that.  Thank you again for your comments and we hope to see you back at the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim, sometime soon.

Summary: This is a tough one, I'll be honest.  Here's what I loved:  LOCATION: The location for this hotel is great for walking to the park (15-20 minutes).  It's as close to being on property as you can get without paying the Disneyland Resort prices.  You can even slip over to the Mickey and Friends tram to save some time.  CLEANING STAFF: I do not know who cleaned our room, but the maid went a little extra mile to arrange our 2-year-old's stuffed toys in fun ways for our return each night.  It's not much, but our son loved it, and we appreciated the effort.  (To the hotel management: we were in room #3114 from May 31-June 3, so if you can find and reward our maid for this effort, we would appreciate it)  Here's what was just so-so:  DOUBLE BEDS: The main reason I think they have

My wife & I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights at the end of May this year, we only have praise for everything about it, great room great shower super bed & pillows,nice & quiet,nice breakfast &dinner , excellent servce from all staff , thanks to Robert and a very big thanks to Ed, he made our stay most enjoyable. we had absolutely nothing to complain about. Margaret & Tony Miller, Queensland Australia.
Manager Response: Hi Margaret and Tony! Thank you for taking the time to write this great review, we are very happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay at our hotel.  Again, thank you for the recommendation and greetings to beautiful Australia,  your team from the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim

Summary: This is a very nice and roomy hotel.  We are not here for disneyland, but it is within walking distance.  Staff seem very friendly and helpful.  We are only here for one night, but will stay here if in the area again. We did have to go back to the front desk for a parking pass and the internet code, but it is summer and right by Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you! We appreciate your recommendation and hope to be able to welcome you again the next time you are visiting Anaheim.  Greetings, your team from the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim

Summary: My daughter and I recently spent four nights at this hotel.  The rooms were a bit dated but clean.  The beds were comfortable.  As others have mentioned, there are no black out curtains, just shears that allow in lots of sunlight in the morning.  While my daughter and I were there they also had a large group of high school students staying there (probably about 100 or so).  On our second night these kids were noisy until about 1:00 a.m.  in the hallways and outside in the parking lot.  I complained to management and they did talk to the kids in the parking lot but the kids continued to talk loudly in the halls and continually open and close their heavy metal room doors until 1:00 a.m.  We had planned an early wake up (5:00 a.m.) so that we could arrive extra early for our magic

Summary Heading: Mostly good with just a couple of hiccups
Summary: I had just stayed here in the last six months - so I knew what to expect.   I like that it is walking distance to downtown disney and the other resort hotels.   The room was fine, the parking is FREE, there is a daily resort fee of $10 - just an annoyance - it is req because you are on Disney resort property - oh well.   I got a king bed room - okay size.  Still old school TVs - I asked for a quiet room and I have to say it was pretty quiet.  Stayed way from the pool - to keep it quiet.     The free parking is great - and usually you can find a space fairly close to your room - so that is good.  Now the hiccups - elevator is tortourusly slow, the front desk screwed up and I did not give me my wake up call on the last day (when you are staying for a conference - being on time is
