Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this review. We are glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay at our hotel in general. As for the hiccups - there is certainly no excuse for the lapses in service that you received and we apologize. This is certainly not an example of the fantastic service our hotel is known for, and I will forward your review to our staff members and make sure that we learn from our mistakes and not repeat them.   Thank you again for your recommendation, and we hope to be able to welcome you back again soon.  Greetings, your team from the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim.

Summary: My new Wife and I drove from salem oregon at 10 in the morning on sunday and i called at 1:30 early monday morning to see if we could add a night on since our checkin wasn't until monday night, and we were only an hour away. Andrew answered the phone and was unbelievably helpful. I didn't expect for him to be able to get us the same room, but he did. I didn't expect him to match the rate for the rest of the stay, but he did. we got in and he set us up, gave us all the information we needed, and was funny while he did. Thanks to Andrew and the Holiday Inn and Suites, My Wife and I are experiencing the best honeymoon we could have wished for.
Manager Response: Thank you for this wonderful review, and congratulations on the wedding! We'll be sure to recognize Andrew for a job well done - just another example of the fantastic service our hotel is known for.  Again, we are happy to hear that you had a wonderful time on your honeymoon, and hope to be able to welcome you back again soon.  Greetings, your team from the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Clean rooms, great service, out-of-the way location
Summary: We had a one bedroom suite on the top floor of building 4.  Very spacious with a small wet bar and counter seating.  The room was very clean and well appointed.  The front desk staff were very helpful responding to questions, calling cabs, and checking us in and out.    The pool is on the north side of the main building, so it is mainly in the shade, which would be great if the weather is hot, but if it's in the 60s or low 70s, you'll be chilly there.  We spend almost all of our three whole days in Disney, though, so the public amenities of the hotel weren't of much use to us.    Location:  This is not a block from Disneyland.  Technically, it might be a long block from Critter Country, but you can't get into the park there.  It's a 15 minute walk to the security checkstands at
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this review, we very much appreciate your comments. We are happy to hear that you had a great time staying at our hotel, and hope to be able to welcome you back again soon.  Greetings, your team from the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Great Value. Loved the stay- Perfect for a short trip only for DIsney
Summary: Disney Land was our second stop after Vegas and we were very happy with the location of this hotel. It was right behind the main entrance to the park. Upon checking in, the front desk was friendly and was very accommodating. They provided us with whatever we asked and also increased our room limit for breakfast. We got upgraded to a suite and we loved it. It had a kitchenette and nintendo video games (pay per use/game). The whole concept of having $20 per room for breakfast is something that is totally beyond me. Each entree in the menu starts at 7.99 and goes up to 15.99. $20 is too little for 3 people and they increased it for us to $40. But, here is the catch, no matter how much ever or how little you spend from the allowed amount, YOU PAY THE TAX!!. It was a little tedious
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this review. We always love to hear from our guests and appreciate the comments. We're glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay, and hope to be able to welcome you back again soon.  Greetings, your team from the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Nice staff, Average quality hotel, but small rooms
Summary: You can't get closer to disneyland than this without staying at the disney hotels. so the location was great. arrived late and there was only 1 person checking people in. Had to wait a while with two people in front of me and only 1 clerk.   Room was right next to elevator/laundry room so it was super noisy ALL NIGHT LONG. the room was small too compared to other places we've stayed in Anaheim.  Overall, staff was friendly. There is a $10/night resort/parking fee though... which i don't get because by the looks of it.. it is definitely not a resort. Wifi is not free.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this review, we very much appreciate your comments. I apologize for your wait at check-in, and we hope you will consider returning again for an experience that reflects the great service our hotel is known for.  Greetings, your team from the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim.

Summary: The staff here is great! I visited this property and was greeted by friendly and courteous staff, one in particular was Javier. We dined for breakfast in their wonderful restaurant and was serviced by Chef Arturo and Jose who ensured that we enjoyed every moment of our time in the restaurant. The food was great and served in a timely manner. My family and I utilized the very convenient shuttle service to and from Disneyland Parks and it was also very affordable and cheaper than parking at the park; and it was only a 10 minute ride. My family and I would definitely be visiting again and we hope to see Javier, Arturo and Jose to say thank you for last time and look forward to another Excellent Experience! Thank you, thank you, thank you!!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this wonderful review! We are glad to hear that you enjoyed a fantastic vacation at our hotel, and we'll be sure to recognize Javier, Arturo and Jose for a job well done!  Thank you again for the recommendation, and we hope to be able to welcome you back again soon!  Greetings, your team from the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim

Summary: The staff at this hotel are wam, friendly,extremely polite and very caring. Maria G kept our room beautifully clean and well stocked.My daughter left a treasured item in  the room as we left for the airport.  Maria found the parcel and handed it in and after contacting the General Manager this item is now on its way to us in England. I am so grateful. The hotel is clean,friendly and very well located, Our tour was greeted with cheese and wine on our arrival. Would definately recommend this place to anyone.It is within walking distance of Downtown Disney. There is a shuttle bus to the mall and to Disneyland. Excellent place,fantastic people and Maria G you are wonderful
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this wonderful review! I am so glad to hear that your daughter's treasured item was found, and that it is now on its way back to her. We'll be sure to recognize Maria for a job well done.  Again, thank you for the recommendation, and we hope to be able to welcome you and your family back again soon.  Greetings, your team from the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim

Summary Heading: Great location, easy access to Disneyland & great staff!
Summary: We just returned from 3 nights at this resort & we loved it.  We traveled with me, my brother, my 6 year old, his 5 year old & our Mom.  We used Holiday Inn points to book the rooms & were given one suite with 2 queen beds & a pull out sofa with a kitchenette & a regular room with 2 queen beds.  It was the perfect set-up for the 5 of us because no one had to share beds & we had a kitchen & family room to hang out together.  The pool area is great for the kids & the bar is fun for the adults.  The restaurant was fine & it was a great place to relax after a long day at Disneyland.  You can also view the fireworks from the parking lot but they're much more impressive inside the park.  It is an older property that is showing some wear but I would absolutely stay here again & can't
Manager Response: Thank you for this great review! We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay, and yes, the suites are really the way to go if you're traveling with family!  Again, thank you for the recommendation, and we hope to welcome you and your family again soon! Greetings, your team from the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim.

Summary Heading: The staff is genuinely pleasant which is rare to see now a days in any hotel.
Summary: Stayed on 04.20 for 3 nights with my kids and we had a great time in the pool and restaurant. The staff always made us feel welcomed and they were very pleased to see that everyone was taken care of. The rooms were very well maintained and clean. Always fresh sheets and towels were waiting for us when we got back to our rooms. The fitness room, business center and wireless was a huge plus! There's a shuttle that conveniently picks you up infront of the hotel that takes you to the Disney Parks.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this wonderful review! We are always enjoy hearing from guests that truly enjoyed their stay at our hotel - it's the best motivation to keep providing the superb service we're known for!  We appreciate the recommendation, and hope to welcome you and your family again soon. Greetings, your team from the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim.

Summary: My partner and I stayed in this hotel for two nights. We had tickets to see Prince( at the LA forum) and wanted to take advantage of our annual passports for Disneyland. The hotel was very nice. Check-in was simple. The front lobby was nice and the bar/restaurant looked great. Sadly we didn't get to partake in the bar/restaurant. I did take a quick look at the pool area it was very nice. If we had more time we totally would have taken a dip.  The rooms were nice, comfy and clean. The beds were comfortable and so were the pillows.  The shower was AWESOME..nice hot water and great water pressure, it helped after late nights in Disneyland.  We kept the privacy key in during our stay and we didn't have anyone bother us.  Parking was ample and the hotel was close to the freeway and
Manager Response: First of all, I am a tad jealous that you got to see Prince at the LA Forum, I heard the concert was fantastic!  But more than that, I am happy that you chose our hotel, and we all love hearing that you genuinely enjoyed your stay.  Thank you for taking the time to write this review, and we hope to welcome you back again soon. We wish you all the best, your team from the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim.

Summary: I pricelined this hotel and got a great rate for the Easter weekend.  My self and 2 kids (12 and 10) stayed 2 nights.  We found the location easily and there were 2 people in front of me when I checked in.  The wait was very short, only about 10 minutes and I was taken care of by Jackie who did a great job welcoming me.  Our room was in the middle of the building very close to the elevator so it was easy to get in and out of.  The only thing was on Sunday morning, the elevators were very slow with lots of people leaving.  Our room had 2 queen beds and it was very clean.  We got to see the fireworks on Friday night from Disneyland in the parking lot and I can see why people would complain as it was very loud and kept setting off car alarms but we found it rather amusing and
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this great review, and thank you for taking the fireworks/ car alarm situation with a sense of humor... it is kind of funny, actually.  We always love to hear back from our guests, and are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay. We hope to welcome you again soon, and appreciate your recommendation.  Greetings, your team from the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim.

Summary: Stayed in this hotel because most of the hotels around Anaheim were booked for the convention. If you just want a place to sleep in that is relatively comfortable, this hotel will be good enough for you. The good: free shuttle to Anaheim Convention Center, courteous staff, clean rooms. The bad: nothing really but it wouldn't really be a good idea to book this if you are going to Disneyland because it's going to be a long walk or you have to pay extra for the shuttle and one more thing, their internet does not allow Skype (this was a let-down) because of bandwidth restrictions.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this review, and for making us aware of the Skype/ bandwidth situation. We always appreciate feedback and are grateful for ideas on how to improve the guest experience.  We're happy to hear that you were generally pleased with your stay, and hope to be able to welcome you back again soon.  Greetings, your team from the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim.

Summary: We stayed here on a b-day trip to Disneyland for my 6 yr old.  We had a suite and it was great; clean & updated.  The size of the room and the kitchenette were perfect.  The minibar sink needed repairs; leaked and faucet was loose.  But the convenience of it was great.  Our family of 6 was very comfortable.  The staff was great and mailed postcards to the kids' grandma for us.  Having a restaurant onsite was nice as well.  Only problem was it didn't open on time for dinner.  We waited around and the staff just kept telling us the cook was "getting ready".  After an hour it still wasn't open so we had to eat elsewhere.  That was disappointing because it was a big factor in our decision to book there.  The room & price made up for it.  Heads up on the extra charges though like
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this review! I am sorry to hear about the minibar sink and restaurant issue, that is certainly not in line with the service and room quality we are known for, and that our guests have come to expect. Were you able to notify staff about the faucet and sink during your stay? Feel free to email me your room number at SandraG [at] DKNHotels [.] com, so I can make sure that the problem has been fixed by now.  We are happy to hear that you had a great stay nonetheless, and hope to welcome you again soon!  Greetings, your team from the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim.

Summary: Like many, I stayed at this hotel whilst visiting Disneyland. The location is close to the park. Just be careful when ordering taxis or when booking your return travel to the airport. I told them it's the Holiday Inn on Walnut, but on numerous occasions they went to the Holiday Inn on Manchester. When we first checked in we were super excited to start our trip, but the front desk staff were very pushy. They wanted to sell anything they could to you. It's always cheaper to buy Disney Park tickets, SeaWorld tickets online. I wouldn't recommend the hotel restaurant to anyone - it's not good. I found a hair in my food and the server was hardly there, plus he didn't take anything off the bill for that until I mentioned it to him. Overall, the hotel was what you'd expect for the
Manager Response: Dear recent guest,  I am very sorry your stay was less than expected. Your concerns have been discussed during our most recent departmental meeting and we are working as a team to ensure they get rectified. Please contact me directly on your next visit to Anaheim and I would personally ensure your stay is pleasant one.  Sincerely,  Esequiel Munoz General Manager esequielm@dknhotels.com

Summary Heading: What a fantastic Front Office staff
Summary: It was wonderful staying here and the Front Office Staff is fantastic!!! Mr. Robert, Mr. Javier, Ms. Roxanne do everything possible to insure your   stay with them is stress free...  Housekeeping staff keep the rooms tidy...
Manager Response: Thank you for the lovely comments! We have forwarded your review to our front office staff, they loved reading it!  We hope to welcome you again in the future, and wish you all the best. Greetings, your team from the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Great location, great beds, friendly and helpful staff.
Summary: My sister and I spent 3 nights for my birthday. Older hotel but mostly refurbished with modern colors and designs. Beds were very cozy. Rooms a bit on the smaller side but worked for us just fine. The staff was always pleasant and helpful and greeted you with a smile, which I loved. There's a nice gift shop to grab those last minute items and tickets for the Anaheim shuttle for $4 that picked you up in front of the hotel about every 15 minutes or less . We used the shuttle just to go to Disneyland which worked out well.   It was only a 10-15 minute walk to Downtown Disney through a well maintained and quite residential area-felt safe. We ate several times in the restaurant and also ordered room service ,which was pricey but food  and service was very good. Front desk recommended
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this great review! We're glad to hear that you had a wonderful stay, and I am happy to see that our staff once again lived up to their excellent service reputation, no matter if it is by calming down overly noisy teenagers in the night, or through a simple heartfelt smile.  We hope to welcome you again soon!   Greetings, your team from the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel and good customer service , this hotel is the best !
Summary: I stayed 2 nights at this hotel from 04-01-11 thru 04-03-11..i checked in so late, i stayed in room # 3611 i was so happy because their service is excellent ,the night agent , security , housekeepers, and waiters are very welcome...,my room was very clean, the sheets and towels smells so fresh! The food in the restaurant are delicious ! My kids love them so much ! I feel home during my stay ... and i will choose this Holiday Inn and Suites and stay again for my next visit. I would like to thank you for serving us during our stay ! and of course i will tell my friends and relative to stay with you when they go to orange county, because of your good service, good hotel and good people !
Manager Response: Wow, thank you for this wonderful review! It is always our goal to make every guest feel at home, and I am so happy to hear that our excellent staff has made you feel just that. We are so proud of our genuinely friendly and attentive staff, and we appreciate you helping us spread the word!  Kind regards, and thanks again,  your team from the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim

Summary: I have seen many mixed reviews on Trip Advisor but this hotel takes the prize! We have been here for four nights and just about to take a late check out that was happily agreed to with no extra charge. Service is very prompt and accommodating. The suite is huge and so quiet. A little kitchen was very helpful although a few real plates would be good to have for heating up food etc. The restaurant is excellent and the prices very reasonable. I have no idea how the views can be so polarized as I just can't fault it. Proximity to theme parks is super. if you don't want to catch the shuttle the free tram ride from the adjacent car park is very handy. Oh and it's spotless.
Manager Response: Thank you for writing this wonderful review, your comments are much appreciated! We're happy to hear you enjoyed your stay at our hotel, and hope to welcome you again soon! Greetings, your team from the Holiday Inn Anaheim.

Summary: Poor lighting inside or outside, drape/black-out missing, tv remote not working, coffee maker missing peices which doesn't work, take at least over 20 mintues to deliver a bottle of lotion. The only thing that were nice is the bed.

I recently stayed at the Holiday Inn as a last minute trip and was extremely pleased with the friendliness of the staff. When I arrived in the room it was immaculate. This was due completely to the great service I recieved from Roya. She is amazing. I was tired from a long trip and had wanted to to take an immediate shower and couldn't figure out how to turn the water on....like I said, long trip. I went out to the hallway and asked if she could help me and I explained the situation and we got quite a giggle. She also noticed that the bathtub was missing a part and immediately had it replaced. She kept checking on me throughout my stay to make sure everything was perfect and it was. I even called down later to the front desk wondering if they might have a bowl and some plastic
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review, and thanks for sharing the story about your shower trouble after the long trip, it got a little giggle out of me as well (I've so been there before, but that's another story...). Anyway, we'll make sure to recognize Roya for a job well done. Thanks again for recommending the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim, we hope to welcome you again soon!

Summary Heading: My favorite place to stay while visiting DisneyLand and parks
Summary: when I stay in a hotel I expect the best. Rooms:clean and modern Pool: Clean and well cared for. Cleaning staff work hard to keep it this way Restaurant: Food is super, all 7 days of our stay our food was excellent, not one thing to complain about.  Menu prices are very good and kids eat free with a 10% discount for supper. The service was also something to write home about. Front desk staff is very informative, they helped us plan our day trips, very experienced and friendly.  Very nice when you know your business is appreciated.  THank you for a wonderful stay.  Thank you to Roxanne(front desk staff for helping us with our planning our day trips to the other parks)
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful review, and yay for being your favorite hotel in the Disneyland area! We're happy to hear that you had a great vacation, and we'll be sure to recognize Roxanne for a job well done. We hope to welcome you again soon! Greetings, your team from the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel...Very Close to Disneyland without paying Disney Resort prices!
Summary: I recently traveled to Disneyland with my stepson (age 11) and nephew (age 9). The room was plenty big enough for us and they both enjoyed the pool and hot tub. The restaurant has great food and the package I received gave me a $20 voucher each day for food. Plus - they had a promotion where kids eat free with an adult entree. I spent literally no money on eating breakfast each morning for all 3 of us (excluding tip). The check in and out process was very fast. The hotel is also less than a mile from the Mickey Mouse parking garage. This makes it an easy drive or an easy walk as well to garage, where you can then take the tram to Disneyland. Overall, I really enjoyed this hotel and would stay again!
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind review, we really appreciate your comments! It's great to hear that you and your stepson and nephew enjoyed your stay, and we hope to welcome you again soon. Greetings, your team from the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim.

Summary Heading: One of the best hotels you will find near Disneyland - exceptional service!
Summary: We stayed here with a group of 25 and found the hotel and staff to be exceptional.  The staff were great in answering our many questions, booking taxis and advising us of things to do in the area. The hotel has everything you would need on site - restaurant, pool, bar and convenience store. The rooms are clean, comfortable and spacious.  The hotel is just a few blocks from Disneyland (easily accessed by the ART bus or 20min walk through downtown Disney).  This hotel has a very friendly and family oriented feel and I'd recommend it to guests of any age!
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful review! Nothing makes us happier than reading that you enjoyed your vacation, and that the service provided by our staff exceeded your expectations - we'll be sure to recognize them for a job well done!   We hope to welcome you again soon. Greetings, your team from the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim!

Summary Heading: Great Service, Lovely Staff, Comfy Rooms, Great location
Summary: Stayed at this hotel whilst visiting Disney Land, Hotel was in a great spot with regular shuttles to and from the parks, the staff at check in were really friendly and helpful and the hotel had ideal inclusions for us mid trip including a laundry. The rooms were great sizes and the beds really comfy, the service and the food from the restaurant were great too. having stayed in the supposedly superior sister hotels - Intercontinental on parts of the rest of our trip, I found this hotel to be superior to them in all ways and much better value, Highly recommended, for couples, family's and single travellers alike.
Manager Response: Wow, thank you for this great review! We're glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay at our hotel, and thank you for the recommendation.  We hope to welcome you again soon. Greetings, your team from the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim.

Summary: Very economical, no frills, but very decent. There were free shuttle-buses about every 20 minutes to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: They will Nickel and Dime you if given the chance"
Summary: Upon arriving, we were notified that they have a, "Resort Fee" of $10.00 per night.  Going into the room, my boy turned on the TV and was imediately presented with the option of playing video games.  He ordered a video game from the TV and found that they charge $7.99 for each game and movie ordered.  After calling the front desk, they took off the charge but told us that there is no way to block it.  I had to explain to the kids which buttons NOT to press on the remote.  I needed to use a computer, so I went to the front desk and asked about it.  They told me where their business room was located.  When I went in there, I found that they wanted to charge $5.99 to use the computer for 15 minutes.  After that, the charge jumped to $15.00.  I have never been to a hotel who charged

We stayed here for 4 nights with my extended family for a visit to Disneyland.  My parents, my grandmother, my 6 year old daughter and a friend and his 6 year old daughter.  We were all given ground floor rooms close to each other and close to the parking lot which was very convenient.    The rooms are large and very clean.  They are refurbished and comfortable.  Bathrooms were also extremely clean.  The room we had was very quiet, we heard nothing during the nigth and were able to sleep well.  The front desk personnel were always availalbe, friendly and efficient.  Also, the restaurant stafff was equally professional and friendly.  Restaurant prices were reasonable, portiions good and quality acceptable.  The facility has ample parking and regular shuttles to Disneyland.  The

Room was priced very competitively. We were down from Bay area for spring break. The from desk staff, Basel, Javi, and Gracie were exceptional. Basel took care of our needs at check in and took the time out of his way to ensure oure trips expectations were being met during our stay. He referred to me as Mr. Connor each time I approached the front desk or when I called the front desk from our room. We loved it so much, we stayed an extra day...I must admit I had preconceived notions about Holiday Inn from the past, but this experience simply blew us away. Whatever they are doing, or whatever hotel group they belong to now, it's working. The servers in the restaurant, Freddie, Jose and Salvador were also extremely kind and attentive and great with the kids. I have to say, the

I wanted to send you an email letting you know how HAPPY we were staying at the Holiday Inn On Walnut St. Everything about the hotel was AMAZING. Great price for a EXTRA clean room, even the sheets smelled sparkly clean. Loved the single coffee maker, pool, restaurant, clean modern Lobby and amazing staff. Basil was the best help we have ever had. I will highly recommend your hotel to everyone!!! Thanks again!

Summary Heading: Not all Holiday Inns are alike
Summary: We've stayed at Holiday Inns across California and always enjoyed our stay, until staying at the Holiday Inn in Anaheim.  The front desk was rude.  One clerk rolled his eyes when we asked about the last minute addition of a mandatory $10 a night "resort fee" (trust me, this was NO resort), while the other chatted on her cellphone. Not only were the beds miserable, but the wall paper was peeling in the bathroom and unlike other Holiday Inns, this one offers no free breakfast, just a 20% discount in their own restaurant.  The only thing going for this hotel was it's location.

The hotel is okay for it's star rating but the best part is the excellent customer service and attitude we get from the people who works there especially the front desk staff. Special mention to Roxanne who greeted everyone with a smile and made sure that everything is in order and in place. Also, Basil and Ed were very kind and helpful and have cheerful attitude toward the guests. Most often, it's the people who works in the organization that matters and will make or break the company and these people need to be acknowledged. Again, the service I got from  Roxanne and to a lesser but equally improtant degree from Basil and Ed are highly commendable. The rooms are clean and comfortable, however, they should have more rooms with only one bed in it rather than have two beds in
In a great location! Especially if you have a car. Easy access to freeways and to Disney. Hotel was a very good value. Would stay here again.

Amazing stay!  Hotel was beautiful, and very welcoming.  The staff could not have gotten any better.  They truely knew the value of great service and as well made you feel welcomed!  They were eager to ensure our stay was as pleasant as possible .  The hotel manager was very friendly kind and literally bent over backwards to make our first trip to Disneyland and our first stay at Holiday Inn as memorable as possible. Rooms were beautiful and most importantly clean!  You are not allowed to smoke in any of the rooms and needless to say that was a big plus especially when you have children.  Thank you once again Esequiel Munoz and we shall return soon!

Summary Heading: Good Location. Helpful Staff. No Blinds.
Summary: My girlfriend and i stayed her for a mini vacation which was actually a ploy to surprise her. I e-mailed the hotel to have them help me decorate the room with petals in the shape of a heart on the bed, balloons, and a bouquet of flowers. I had trouble communicating with the staff member who was supposed to help but eventually another staff member stepped up. They were able to get everything done for a nice surprise after I proposed to my girlfriend at Disneyland.  As far as the room, everything was comfortable except the room had no blinds to block out the light. It did have shear curtains but the heavy curtains didn't even cover half the window. I'm not sure if it was just our room (building three on the fifth floor) but my fiancee had trouble sleeping. Overall it was a pretty
Manager Response: First of all: CONGRATULATIONS! Proposing at Disneyland is such a wonderful idea! We're glad you had a fun time, but we have also taken note of the curtain issue. We hope to welcome you and your soon-to-be wife back again soon. All the best, your team from the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim

Summary: First of all, I got this hotel for extremely price from a winning bid of PRICELINE...so, there's nothing to complain about the value.  PROs:  1. Great location(near Disney, and you can see the FREE fireworks show from it's parking lot),  2. Great service(excellent attitude at all time, willing to fulfill all the request), special thanks to the desk clerk Roxanne, who helped a lot on my wife's personal issue during our stay, BIG THANKS!! 3. Good enough facilities, with pool, wireless, and fitness room 4. Great price for sure...:)  CONs: 1. As all the other comments, the no reason "resort fee"(USD11.xx) could be an extra charge without advance notice, and the shuttle fee is not included inside the resort fee~~but I shouldn't complain about this, because I got unbeatable price from
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this review, we always appreciate our guests' comments. We are thrilled to hear that once again, our staff is being recognized for going the extra mile in order to make your stay a pleasant one. We're happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay, and we will also take the "Cons" you mentioned into account, as we are continually striving to improve the guest experience.   We hope to welcome you again soon.   Best wishes, your team from the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Convenience and comfort for a great price!
Summary: Check-in staff was friendly and very helpful.  Room was clean and comfortable.  Breakfast was quick and delicious.  Gift shop had what we needed.  This is a very Tourist Friendly Hotel!  Shuttle offered to and from Disneyland all day.  Restaurant/Bar inside hotel.  Every staff member we saw had a big smile on their face.  I will definitely be back! and bring friends!
Manager Response: What a wonderful review, thank you for taking the time to write it! We are thrilled to hear you enjoyed your stay, and are looking forward to welcome you (and your friends) again in the future! Greetings, your team from the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim.

Summary: We were allowed an early check in; friendly helpful front desk staff.  The room, a suite, came with two very comfortable queen size beds.  The living room almost as big as the bedroom, that was a pleasant surprise.  Also a pleasant surprise was the decent sized refrigerator, microwave.  It was an easy walk Disneyland, and the shuttle schedule is easy enough to navigate.  Restaurant staff was very friendly, and service was good.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this review, we very much appreciate your comments. We are glad to hear that you were happy with our rooms and amenities, and that you enjoyed your Disneyland trip in general. We hope to welcome you again in the future! Greetings, your team from the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Great Stay! Bargains, service, comfort and amenities - all excellent!
Summary: I love the Holiday Inn!  Take a moment to join the free "Priority Club" and get spoiled! We got to check in way early - 10:30am - for no charge, and check out as late as 2pm! Extra 10% off at the yummy restaurant where kids eat free (wow!), plus free daily USA Today paper. Got an Entertainment Book card? Use it! Keep checking back on HI website til the HI you want is offering an ET card deal, then book fast! I got a room worth around $130 a night for an average of $80 per night!!!!  The place was very modern, trendy, clean. The few, and minor, drawbacks: Daily $10 "resort fee" they don't mention til you check out. Also, "one block to Disneyland" is a crock b/c it's one block to the BACK of Disney, not the front gate where you enter! Be prepared to either walk over a mile, or use

Summary Heading: Okay Hotel but the restaurant is terrible
Summary: The hotel was what we expected for the price and location.   To get to Disneyland you simply turn left at the front entrance and then turn left into Magic Way to read Downtown Disney. It will take about 20 minutes plus to walk it.  The downside of this hotel is that if you ask for a taxi, in my case, they recommended one of these unmarked cars without a meter. It may look like a good deal but is not. I tried it once and found the best was the Yellow Cab.  The extractor fan in the bathroom was extremely noisy.  I tried the restaurant on the last day of our stay with my grandson and two daughters. The server was a complete waste of time with no idea about customer service. He had not set up the table with the adequate cutlery and had to ask him several times before it was done. My
Manager Response: Dear Canadafoodman,  Thank you very much for making the time to inform us of your recent stay. I truly apologize for the experience you had at the restaurant. It is honest feedback like yours that allows us to review the areas that require our attention to improve upon.  Sincerely,  Esequiel Munoz General Manager

Summary Heading: Feels just like staying with family!
Summary: I've visited Holiday Inn, Manchester now for about (7) years for business travel.  "Jennifer" in the Restaurant has always had a professional, friendly demeanor about her.  it's great coming back to after a long day at the local office we have here in Anaheim to have Jennifer pass me a much needed happy hour cocktail.  She also never seems to tire in saying Hi to the other customers and promptly attends to their requests.

While we didn't stay at the inn on this trip we would like to commend Ed Bellamy at the desk of the Holiday Inn who was extremely helpful in solving a problem we had with transportation to the airport on our way home. We had a family of 17 people visiting Disneyland and we stayed locally in some rental houses. When I approached Ed for advice re transporting 8 of our party, including 3 young children, to the airport to go home he helped us find 'John' and a hire car (actually a stretch Hummer!) who was able to provide the car seats required and provide us with a really exciting end to our holiday. The service we received was exceptional and we would like to highly recommend Ed as a great person to help when on holiday in Annaheim. The hotel is very conveniently located to
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post this review! We recognized Ed for a job well done, and for living up to our high standards of customer service. We hope to be able to welcome you at a future trip to Anaheim. Best wishes, your team from the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim.

Summary: I wanted to thank the staff at Holiday Inn and Suites Anaheim. My 8 year old son and I drove for over an hour to have a fun weekend at Disneyland. When we arrived I found out that I had some how booked a different Holiday Inn and since there was a convention in town rooms were hard to come by. Of course I was bit distraught as we had been planning this trip for some time. The manager Rob Roxas was kind enough to get my reservation cancelled at the other location with no penalty then proceeded to call around to find me a room. He was able to find something less expensive however I choose to pay the addition cost and stay at this facility because of how I was treated. We frequent this location often and it is because of the excellent service we receive consistently by their staff.
Manager Response: Thank YOU for staying with us, and for taking the time to write this review! I have forwarded it to Robert and the General Manager of the property, to make sure our rockstar staff gets the recognition they deserve. We hope to welcome you and your family again soon, and wish you all the best. Greetings, your team from the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Great staff and very nice accomodations
Summary: We entered the lobby and asked if an early check in was available.  The supervisor running the desk, Ed replied "its never too early to check in," with a huge smile.  Sure enough he checked us right in a couple of hours early and gave us a room with bigger beds than we had ordered.  The room was great, and had very nice beds and pillows, all brand new looking.  Only downside was no refrigerator and the blinds don't close completely leaving the room very bright and not private.  Ed was the most helpful hotel concierge I've ever encountered. Thanks Ed
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this review, we'll be sure to recognize Ed for a job well done! We're glad you enjoyed your stay, and will make a note of your comment regarding the blinds. We hope to welcome you again soon, and wish you all the best. Greetings, your team from the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim.

Summary: I stayed here during a conference and I have nothing but great things to say about the bar staff.  Kelli and Kristen were excellent and treated me very well.  So much so that I stayed in the hotel for dinner that night instead of going out.  The rooms were good, but I have one small complaint about the doors.  Anytime someone shut the door, my door vibrated.  This is why I gave the hotel 4 stars, because I think there should have been better doors.  It made it hard to sleep when there was a lot of activity in the hotel.  If you are going to Disneyland and have a family, the location is hard to beat.  Overall, my experience at the hotel was good and I would recommend it for anyone going to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this review, and of making us aware of the vibrating door. Feel free to email me your room number (sandrag at dknhotels dot com), so I can have someone look at it. We're happy to hear that you enjoyed your Disneyland trip, and will definitely recognize Kelli and Kristen for a job well done. We hope to welcome you again soon, and wish you all the best. Your team from the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim.

Summary Heading: One of the best experiences EVER!!!
Summary: I went to Disneyland with some friends that stayed at the Grand Californian Resort.  I chose to stay for a fraction of the cost at the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim.  One of the best decisions I made ever in my travelling experience.  I was there a full week over the Thanksgiving holidays.  In the morning I would go to the Grand Californian to pick up my friends.  Their room was NOT that much nicer than mine.  Sure, they had fancier hand lotion w/mouse ears but....  My room was wonderful.  The bed super comfy.  The service at this hotel is incredible.  The front desk staff, especially Javier, were always so helpful and thoughtful.  When I was disturbed in the shower by a phone call from the front desk by accident, they made sure I ate complimentary at the great restaurant
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this review. We're very happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay, and we'll gladly recognize Javier and the team for a job well done. Thanks for posting the tip on hopping on the Disney parking lot tram, it really makes for a quick trip from the hotel to the Disneyland entrance. We hope to welcome you again in the future, and wish you all the best. Your team from the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites, Anaheim.

Summary Heading: A Blot on the Holiday Inn Landscape
Summary: I have stayed in a few Holiday Inns in my time - mostly they are functional,often modern and usually reasonable value for money. Best of all they are predictable - you know what you are getting. Meet the exception to that rule that is the Holiday Inn Anaheim, the problem child. From the front nothing to worry about, but enter through the front door and travel back in time to somewhere in the 1970s, for that is likely when this hotel had any money spent on it. Public spaces are small, and very down market. Bedrooms are just a mess.Old fashioned in the extreme. Bathrooms that are too small, showers with those awful cling-to-me-shower curtains, light switches that belong in a museum and curtains that are really curtains - far too much that needs attention. The positives - the staff

I felt compelled to write this review as I have just checked out today and was extremely satisfied with the service I received at the Hotel.  The food and rooms were very nice and we were made extremely welcome.  If your thinking of going to Disneyland you will love it, a bus picks you up out the front and takes a 5 min ride to the door of the theme park.  Staff were very friendly and the price was very reasonable, would definately stay there again, thankyou very much o the staff and especially the resteraunt staff, yes kids eat free,
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this positive review! We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay, and we will recognize our staff for a job well done. We hope to welcome you and your family again in the future. Greetings, your team from the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim.

Summary: We have stayed at this hotel multiple times and I have always been extremely happy. This time was no exception. The rooms are always clean and well maintained. The Suites have lots of room along with and a small Refrigerator, Microwave and a second TV. They are perfect for a family. The pool area has nice covers over some of the lounge chairs that create a mini cabana. You can walk to Disneyland if you want its about a 10 min walk. However, it is just as easy to use the Anaheim City shuttle that picks up in front of the hotel. The hotel has a Shell station next door which makes it nice to gass up  before you leave. We will definitely stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this review, your comments are greatly appreciated! We are glad to hear that you and your family enjoyed your stay, and are happy to have such wonderful, loyal guests like you. We hope to welcome you again soon, and wish you all the best. Greetings, your team from the Holiday Inn & Suites Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay while at Disneyland
Summary: Front staff were very friendly and helpful. Beds were very comfortable, room was spacious and has been renovated recently. Washroom was small and I have to say that it looked like a handyman did the plumbing renovation. Otherwise it is a very nice Hotel. Hotel does not provide a free continental breakfast. ART (Anaheim Resort Transit) daily passes sold in the gift shop.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, we greatly appreciate your comments! We're happy you enjoyed your stay at our hotel, and we'll be sure to recognize the front desk staff for a job well done! Greetings, your team from the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim

Summary Heading: Good price but rooms need work
Summary: Stayed here during a quick trip to Disneyland. The price was much cheaper than what the rest of the hotels in the area were charging since it was Rosebowl/New Year's week, and the location was good, closer to Medeival Times and with the ART transit getting to Disneyland was a breeze. Didn't try the food in the restaurant but saw plenty of people that were taking advantage of the free breakfast. Hotel isn't very close to restaurants so having one on site helps. Pool area was pretty basic.  The one complaint I have is that the beds are way too small (even a so-called queen looked more like a double) and quite uncomfortable, and the rooms weren't well insulated. We always thought our window was open because it was freezing (even with the heat on), and we could here EVERYTHING

Summary Heading: Average for a Holiday Inn, but close to Disney.
Summary: We stayed here for three nights and I have to say that I will walk away from this experience with a bad taste in my mouth.  First of all, you have to pay mandatory resort fees yet this isn't a resort, and they do not provide you complimentary shuttle service to Disneyland.  We walked with our 2 young children and it wasn't that huge of a deal but you would think that a resort fee is going to include some stuff that a normal resort would have.  The room service was quick, and we called for some towels several times and they brought them up right away. I would have given this 4 stars but the fact that they charge a resort fee makes me feel this is dishonest in the pricing.

Our stay at the Holiday Inn was one of the best choices we made for our Disneyland Trip.  Basil took care of everything from start to finish.  The reservation and check-out was very seamless and we appreciate the outstanding customer service.  Disneyland was just a block away and shuttle service runs frequently so you can park the car at the hotel parking lot.  Hotel staff around the vicinity was very helpful, and the kids slept soundly right after a fun day at Disney.  Would definitely come back and recommend this hotel to friends.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We appreciate your comments, and are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay at the Holiday Inn. We will recognize Basil and the rest of the staff for a job well done! We hope to welcome you and your family back soon. Have a wonderful New Year, your team from the Holiday Inn Hotels & Suites Anaheim!

Summary: This was a hotwire find. It was a good deal in general and close to disney, if you know the shortcut.  If you head directly to disney via downtown disney's back entrance, the monorail is very close.  I can't imagine trying to access disneyland through the main entrance.  That must have been a trek around all of the parking/hotels/etc.  Good and clean place to stay.  We were there two nights.
Manager Response: Thank you for the review! We're glad to hear you enjoyed your stay at the Holiday Inn & Suites Anaheim, and your trip to Disneyland. We hope to welcome you again in the future, and wish you a wonderful Holiday season!   Your team from the Holiday Inn & Suites Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Reviews posted on Trip advisor does not match experience
Summary: Resort fees & Resort taxes are charged ( $11.00) daily,  although you are not advised when booking on line, this is not a RESORT! I am a faithful Holiday Inn Guest and experienced business/leisure traveler. Check in was a clerk running through typical lines, but did not ask or seek to see if there was one thing I might want to know or need assistance with.. that was just the beginning. Rooms are small in relation to other Hotels in area and certainly within the Holiday Inn Chain. TV sorely outdated, who chooses darkest brown for a wall and expects a cheerful guest? The bathroom was so tiny the door was chipped from hitting the toilet when you closed the door. This is the most mediocre Holiday Inn I have ever stay in and we are Platinum Holiday Priority Club Members for years.The

This hotel was great. We had a car, so free parking was a bonus. We had free wifi also in our room. The beds were very comfortable, as were the pillows. In your room, the pillows are labelled soft, medium or firm, so you are bound to get a pillow you like.   Underneath the sink was carpet, and for some reason I don't like this, but this is not really a negative, and would definately not hinder me to stay there.   We got breakfast one morning, and it was beautiful. They seem to have a lot of choices.   The one positive that I really liked, was there was a coin operated washing machine and dryer on the site, and I think this is always a bonus when staying at a hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay, and hope to welcome you back soon! Have a wonderful Holiday season, your team from the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Anaheim!

Summary: We just came back from staying there 2 nights on our recent vist to SoCal.  PROs 1.  Excellent Value for Money 2.  Clean Room & Bathroom 3. Spacious rooms 4.  Free Internet (that works!) 5. Ample FREE parking -- make sure you put the tag up though on the mirror or else they will tow your car  CONs 1.  No free breakfast, but their breakfast is not too expensive and pretty good quality 2.  No Fridge/Microwave in the room

Summary Heading: water in the entire hotel was turned off for half a day without advice
Summary: some maintenance work was being done, i found out, but i did not get any advice that this was happening. also, our room felt dark and heavy because of the design of the headboard (solid wood carving) and the lighting. some interior design changes in the future can make the room a little more light, cheery, and young.  ok, on to the nice part, which is more than the down part! the Onyx restaurant was great -- a bit of fine dining but amazingly kid-friendly (kids eat free!). Front Desk people were very cheery and their service had a personal touch, as in they made you feel they are really looking after YOU, not just at a client standing in line for check in or check out.  no bellboys in the hotel but Maintenance helped push my luggage to my room. The Housekeeping senoras were warm

Robert Roxas at the front desk was outstanding in meeting our accomodations. Hotel is very nice, quiet, and within walking distance to Disneyland. They made our anniversary celebration great! Would definately stay here again! Debbie and Colin

Summary Heading: Not happy with policies, NOT a resort... otherwise content
Summary: Check-in is at 4pm. or something like that. I arrived around 10am, and was required to pay an additional $30 for early check-in -- even though, they had rooms ready. Not very customer-friendly.  I had to sign a no smoking agreement. The sign at the front desk says 100% smoke-free. However, smoking was not only allowed, but basically encouraged on the outdoor patio -- which is the only way to get to the pool. The signs say no smoking, but there were ashtrays on every table.  Also, the pool is small with limited seating. They charge a resort fee -- this is NOT a resort.  It's a clean, well-kept hotel, but its policies are not very customer-friendly, in my opinion.  Most of the staff was friendly and helpful, with the exception of one guy who inaccurately explained the payment

Summary Heading: Excellent customer care, comfortable rooms, decent price.
Summary: I stayed here with my 7 year-old on a Disney Trip.  The front desk staff was excellent.  Check-in and check-out was smooth.  They offered lots of help and information about transportation and the theme parks.  There was a brief time when I though I'd lost my Visa and Passport and the manager and front desk staff helped me by making calls to all the places I'd been when I last had the items, looking up and printing out information for me on how to cancel or block my credit card and how to get a temporary passport so I could get back to Canada.  I was stressing (big time!) but they went out of their way to assure me that we would figure it out and it would be ok. I ended up finding the documents bewtween the blankets of one of the beds (I know - I've just lost all credibility!),

Summary Heading: Assume hotel with great managers and staff!
Summary: The managers and staff have created a wonderful atmosphere at the Holiday Inn (Anaheim).  The managers and staff are friendly from the time you check-in to the time you check-out.  The hotel has recently been renovated with a brand new up to date look and free Wi-Fi.  The housekeeping staff does a wonderful job with cleaning the rooms while you are at Disneyland.  Speaking of Disneyland; it is within walking distance from the hotel (about 1 mile) or there is shuttle service you can use at a small price.  We chose to walk; which allowed us to walk through Downtown Disney prior to the park.

Summary Heading: The best value and excellent customer care
Summary: We booked a seriously cheap travelocity deal with a hotel and rental car for around $200 for 2 nights and 3 days car rental.  We were expecting not to be able to check in til 3pm (which seems very late, especially after a transpacific flight from Australia, arriving the same day with young children).  The front desk were amazing, they found a room we could check into early, albeit with a very modest extra charge (totally fair $30), we were checked in with free parking and awesome customer service at the front desk.  The hotel itself is great, family friendly and well resourced.  I believe you get more than you paid for, since they cater for just about everything.    Roberto at the front desk is a legend, well done Holiday Inn.

Summary Heading: Great value and walking distance to Disneyland
Summary: Stayed here twice now for our Disneyland trip. Room is spacious and clean. Free wireless access and $10 per day resort fee for parking. Approximately 15 minutes walking distance away from Disneyland (Downtown Disneyland).  Walking is much faster compare to $4 per day shuttle bus.  Last time I waited for 45 minutes for the shuttle bus.   Improvements needed: -Hotel elevator usually is quite slow and needs improvement. -Shower head and bathtub needs to be upgraded or fix.  Overall: Nice budget hotel within the walking distance to Disneyland and will stay again in the future.

It takes about 15 minutes to walk to Disneyland.  We once took a shuttle but to the park, but we had to wait for a long time and the bus was going around other hotels,  took us longer time to get to the park.  We decided to walk to the park during the 3 days stay, which was faster than waiting for a bus. You can take the monorail from Downtown Disney to the park.  Room is newly remodeled,  nice and clean, and has a free wireless. There is $10 resort fee per day.   Overall, it's a good hotel to stay when visiting Disneyland Resort, and we'll stay here again.

The hotel was clean and comfortable.  We booked a King Suite which had a sofa bed for the kids in a separate living room.  It has many conveniences such as a nice pool, gym, restaurant, bar, little gift store and also has vending machines for those late night snacks.  There are also ice machines available on each floor as well as a laundry which is handy when traveling with kids.  There is a shuttle bus that operates to/from Disneyland which we found convenient and efficient.  We did stay during the week so we didnt have to wait to long for rides at Disneyland. The staff were friendly and helpful with all our questions.  There is a safety deposit box which could fit my laptop.  The restaurant was efficient, though the food was a little basic.  Overall we enjoyed our stay here.

Summary Heading: The PERFECT room to return to after a hard day at Disneyland
Summary: Stayed here for three nights booked on Priceline.com for $35/night.  This hotel was recently completed renovated to reflect the new theming for Holiday Inn Hotels.  The only way to really describe it is that it was like staying at a W Hotel without the fake hipness of the W chain.  Entering the lobby, the place looks clean, modern, and inviting.  Check-in was simple and the staff was very friendly.  They take the time to provide maps to/of Disneyland Resort and surrounding area and clearly mark the best route to the Resort based on your mode of transportation.  While I am a local and did not really need the extra information, the personal attention was much appreciated.  I received a room in Building 3 right next to the rear elevator.  I was able to park my car right in front of

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel, more than I expected. Resort feel.
Summary: I stayed in the 2 bedroom suite with my husband, mother, mother-in-law, sister-in-law and 10 yr. old nephew for 3 nights/4 days (nephews 10th bday). There were six of us in this VERY spacious room and never once did I feel over crowded. The suites have their own building next to the pool, bar, restaurant, main lobby, etc. We had a fantastic view of the fireworks from Disneyland every night. The hotel offered movie nights in the pool area with popcorn. The lounge area around the pool/bar area was nice and was an excellent place to chill out with a drink. When we went to get the shuttle to go to Disneyland, we did not wait more than 10 mins. and the shuttle got us there quickly. The room we were in was very nice, spacious and clean. It had two bedrooms, one room had two queens and

We booked this hotel through Hotwire and ended up being extremely disappointed in our accommodations. I know that is one of the risks with Hotwire... but we have had good luck in the past. The staff member who checked us in was rude and quite frankly did not care if we were there or not.  We reserved two rooms and they charged  us a $10 per day (plus tax) per room resort fee. Trust me when I say this is NOT a resort. They also charged an additional $50 per room deposit ....which they refunded upon checkout. On a positive note, the hotel has had some recent renovations and is fairly clean. Our rooms were very small and they did not have refrigerators. They also do not have adjoining rooms which is important information if you are traveling with small children and want two rooms

I have stayed at this hotel twice now.  Both times thru Priceline.  In Jan '10 I paid $35 a night.  GREAT DEAL.  In Oct, I paid $51 a night.  Ok deal.  The part that bugs me is the "resort fee" of $10 a night.  At $35 a night I did not complain.  But when I "won" this hotel again at $51, the $10 made the hotel $61 a night.  I could have stayed at others just as nice for the same price.  Also, I've been to resorts.  Having a pool and a hot tub does not make it a resort.  Parking and internet, still not a resort.  Out of all of these, all I used was the parking.  On the plus, the hotel is nice and clean and newly updated.  When we entered the room, the beds were not made, so they moved us to another room.  Not a big deal.  But, 2 full beds is not really what I wanted.  When i

Overall, we were very pleased. The first woman we spoke to when we came to check in early (just to let them know we were in the area because we'd not be returning until after 10pm), was quite rude and said that she couldn't do any paperwork because we were too early. So we left.  But, when we returned at night, the man at the desk was super friendly. The rest of the staff was friendly.   The hotel was clean and ran nicely. Our room was just like most hotel rooms in the area. The beds were comfortable and sheets were soft. There were plenty of pillows (more than one type too). When we entered the room the clock was unplugged so we plugged it in. We found out through the night that the reason it was unplugged was because it made a random annoying noise off and on. (informed the

Stayed for 3 nights in a suite.  Great hotel, friendly staff.  Nice rooms with comfy beds, clean bedding etc.  Nice bathroom.    Good clean pool area.  Was quiet - we expected quite a bit of noise at the hotel due to the location etc, but none !!  So would recommend to everyone, with or without children (we had no children other than ourselves J)  Ate here quite a bit, food was good.  If pressed, the only bad thing I can mention is one morning during breakfast we were asked by the waiter to pay the bill there and then ‚Äì mid breakfast.  So we had to leave our cooked breakfast to sort out the bill as the waiter was finishing his shift.  We thought this was a little rude and should really have passed it to another waiter to take payment once we had finished / or even when ordering.

I stayed at this hotel Aug. 26-31st. I have not written any hotel reviews before, but after my stay here I felt compelled to warn  others about this place. Cons:  Upon check-in, my little girl started crying because the room smelled terrible. It literally smelled like sewage. I called the front desk and asked to be moved. We were moved to the room next door that the housekeeper had just finished.This room did not have the nasty smell, but the dressers and counters in the room had a layer of dust on them about an inch thick....ewwww!!! So,we called the front desk about this as well. They sent the housekeeping supervisor to take care of it and she was apologetic,explaining that the woman who cleaned  our room was still in training. So,went  on about our vacation assuming it was

we stayed here as part of disney land resort pakage, we chosed thishotel based on distance from disney land and being a Holiday inn hotel the room have no refirigerator,no Safe, no Kettle, we ca live with this but the main annoying thing is waiting for the bus to disney land, which suppose to be every 20 min, but we aere waitning for more than 40 min everey time we goor come from disney land, the trip each time lasted 1 hour and 20 min.. great waste of time if you are visiting disney book a hotel where you can walk to the resort

Summary Heading: Convenient and comfortable but housekeeping issues
Summary: We travel to Disneyland 4-5 times a year and use Priceline or Hotwire to reserve hotels. This was a Priceline special so the cost was okay. They did charge a  10.00 resort fee per night, so it added onto our cost.   The hotel is located kind of behind the parking garage of Disney. You could walk up the street and across through downtown Disney but would take about 30 minutes. The ART bus stops right at the hotel and is the first of 3 stops so it was convenient and fast.   There is a gift shop on premises but we walked a half block to the Shell station and stocked up on drinks and snacks (cheaper). There is a restaurant inside but we did not use it. No other restaurants nearby unless you walk a 4 or 5 blocks or go to downtown disney.   The pool was large and had plenty of
I liked my stay there, you have free wi-fi, Disneyland is nearby and the hotel is pretty nice. The only catch is the resort fee, the only negative aspect...other than that, I enjoyed my stay there.

Summary Heading: Sometimes You Get Exactly What you Pay For
Summary: After I had already selected another hotel I decided to take a chance with picking my own price at Priceline.  Based on my bid, Priceline selected this hotel for me.  I did save a lot of money in two respects.  First, with Priceline I saved significantly on the room price; secondly we saved the price of parking at Disneyland.   While the "1 block to Disneyland" is closer to 1 mile, we did not mind the 20-minute walk to the Disneyland parking structure shuttle.  For those who don't wish to walk the mile, the hotel offers a shuttle to the entrance for $4/day per person.  The room itself was small (though not the smallest I have ever seen), with two double beds.  It was clean, and the beds were comfortable.  The shower/bath and toilet were in a separate room while the vanity was in

Summary Heading: Hotel OK, check specifics of room location though
Summary: Front desk staff was very courteous; however, was VERY disappointed that early check-in (@30 minutes) was not available for 2-bedroom/2-bath suite upon arrival.  Had called two days previous and was assured that it wouldn't be a problem, and that was when I estimated an hour early arrival.  We planned on going directly to the resort, and were forced to change clothes, etc. in the lobby bathroom.  Did not like that at all.  Luggage storage was available in the lobby at least.  That night hotel guests (parents there with screaming children as well) were in the pool far past 10pm and that was of major concern.  Not sure how many 2-bedroom suites are available, but the one we had was in a separate building from the main hotel, facing the pool/jacuzzi area.  The hotel staff was very
Manager Response: Dear Rocksoldierette,  I apologize for not having your room available upon your arrival and for the noise disruption caused by the pool activity. It is honest feedback such as yours that allows us to identify the areas that we need to improve on. Your issues have been addressed with members of our team and we will work hard to prevent them from re-occurring on your next visit. We thank you for your recent visit and we look forward to welcoming you back to Anaheim.  Yours truly,  Niral Munshaw, General Manager

Summary Heading: Great Hotel - Beware of Hidden Fees!
Summary: Booked this hotel on Priceline and got a decent rate for the area.  Unfortunately, this is one of those hotels that charges you a "resort fee" for being down the street from Disneyland.  We had no choice but to pay it with our Priceline booking.  As long as you don't care about these fees added in addition to the room rate, it's a great place to stay.  We were able to walk to Disneyland (took about 20 minutes, but a nice walk).  Would recommend it, but still unhappy about the "hidden" fees...

We booked this Holiday Inn on priceline.com for $45 for 2 nights and ended up with a 2 Queen Bed room (Room 3413). We were driving in from Dana Point needed a place to stay near Disneyland. The location is literally RIGHT NEXT to the Mickey and Friends Parking Structure (the big one). Although I would not consider this "walking distance", a car drive to the entrance is right down the road. Unfortunetly, the 1-Block Disneyland is misleading. Yes it is one block, but 1-block to the Main Entrance to Disneyland at Ball Rd. and Disneyland Dr. Our room was clean and confortable and nice. I liked how Holiday Inn gave you a choice Firm or Soft pillows on its already very comfy bed. The bathroom was small but clean and had good water pressure and a powerful toilet. We used the iron on

Summary Heading: We were very pleased with our travel agent's selection of this hotel
Summary: We have just returned home after staying for 8 nights at this hotel.  We had a great time and enjoyed the fact that we were slightly removed from the madness of a very busy Disneyland and yet still able to walk to the gates (once we figured out where they were!).  It did take us a while to get our bearings and some places are much further away than they look on  map - don't assume (as we did) that you can cut through areas showing as carparks either!  It was nice and quiet in our 2 queen suite, the room was large and well appointed - my only gripe was that there was enough lighting for night vision (no ceiling lighting, just table lamps).  Made looking for stuff in your suitcase difficult after dark!  Great view of the nightly fireworks at 9.30pm though.  The service here was

Summary Heading: Great for families! This hotel is a great...
Summary: Great for families! This hotel is a great location for Disney guests. You can walk to all of the attractions while having good alternatives for suite living with a toddler!

We stayed at the Holiday Inn while on a quick trip to Disneyland and had a great time.  The front desk staff was VERY friendly in trying to accomodate us for an early check-in (and also late check out).  There is a very convienient shuttle to the Disneyland front gate that comes every 20 min.  It was nice to head back to the hotel for lunch (and happy hour starts at noon!) and a swim in the pool (my daughter LOVED the pool) before heading back to the park.  I paid under $100/night for our double queen room on a weekend and feel like I more than got my monies worth.

Summary Heading: not too bad, but not that great
Summary: Overall this hotel was "ok" but I would not stay here again with all of the competition in the area. I have definately stayed at better hotels near Disneyland for about the same price. This hotel was located away from the main drag which is good for some people but we had preferred to walk to Disneyland so the "1 block from Disneyland" description was a little misleading and disappointing. It was 1 block from Disneyland Dr. but a good 2 miles from the park entrance. This hotel was very clean, probably one of the cleanest rooms in which I have ever stayed in Anaheim. The room we had booked was to have 2 queen beds but actually had 2 double beds. They were very comfortable beds so I decided not to make an issue of it. The rooms were tiny, but I did like how the vanities were
Great Hotel, near Disneyland Resort couple blocks away, good service

Booked with a 3.5 star choice on Priceline...got the room for 47 dollars a night, to stay Saturday check out on Wednesday night.  The hotel charges a 10 dollar a day "resort fee"....this is NOT a resort, so basically it is a parking fee.....understand that all the hotels in this area are now charging a parking fee.  What happend to staying at a hotel, and driving there...you were already paying for a room?  Oh well, when one gets away with it...then suddenly they all do it. And with the 10 dollar fee....you get chaged 1.50 per day "tax" on the "resort fee"....so 11.50 a day extra.  The location. We use hotels in the Anaheim area for Disneyland.....we have stayed at many places in the area, so I will try not to compare...Ill just be factual.  Please note that if you have never

Summary Heading: Great value, great staff, did not want for anything
Summary: We went to Disneyland for one week. There was 4 adults and  one 4 year old. We had booked early and got one of the four 2 bedroom and livingroom suites. The master suite had walk in closet,SPA tub and double sinks. There were three TV's though we did not have time to watch much. It was our son-in-laws birthday and I had passed that on to the staff and on the day of his birthday they came in and decorated the suite and left presents at no charge. The desk staff were helpful and the maid serverice was beyond anything we could ask for. There were lots of towels, face clothes and toiletries. They supplied towels in the pool area which was a bonus. The woman who worked as the bartender in the lounge was a great source of information, meet her ASAP for all the local info. The rooms

Summary Heading: Loved my 1st Disneyland Experience(Me and my Children!)
Summary: The night I get in, the power was out!We were so tired that we agreed to check in- in the dark :o) We ordered pizza n went to bed!The lights came on in the morning and we were loving how our rooms looked!Just like the pictures!And Hotwire compensated me on the inconvenience on the lights, with 75hot dollars!Sweet!Pool was wonderful, they surprised me with their towel service and ice cold water with lemon in the pool area.Very professional on the cleaning however we lost our camera in the room! Anyways, the staff was pleasant however I AM customer service and I know how to treat my customers within 10feet, and I didn't get that from them? I would definately recommend this hotel because of their cleanliness!The housekeeper did a wonderdul job in cleaning n placing things in

I did a name your own price and felt very disrespected and deceived when I arrived at the hotel and was told there was and additional $11.50 in mandatory resort fees.  It was not the amount that bothered me but the deception on the part of both Priceline and Holiday Inn.  If my price was not high enough as is it should not have been accepted.  I did not agree to these charges and was not allowed to cancel my pre-paid reservation either.  I will not be doing business with Priceline or Holiday Inn again, and will encourage everyone else to do likewise.  I will pay full price at a place that respects me and my business rather than get a discount with those who choose to gain business through deception.

Summary Heading: Good hotel but make sure of what you have booked
Summary: Stayed at the HI suites in October 2009 with family group that totalled 11 in all. We chose the hotel as it advertised 2 bedroom family suites which suited our two families perfectly....Unfortunately upon arrival we were advised that our booking was for the two room suite not the two bedroom suite....there is a big difference.....the problem was that they only have 2 or 3 of these bigger rooms and guess what .....none available. We had planned to self cater in these rooms as well as they had kitchen facilites and so had to rethink our plans here as well....so our stay was a little less private than we had hoped with all of us bunked in together and the kids drawing straws as to who had to sleep on the roll out everynight... So tip No 1 .......triple check your booking....  Pros

Summary Heading: Great suite for 5 boys! Convenient to Disneyland, great room!
Summary: Chose this property because of pricing and available of a 2 bedroom suite that slept up to nine. A girlfriend and I took 5 12-year old boys to Disneyland and California Adventure. We we re not expecting much but were very pleasantly surprised. The room was brand new and incredible. Very comfortable, great beds, master suite had a jacuzzi tub. 3 TVs kept the boys entertained while I used the internet. Free breakfasts for the kids - great pancakes. My only caution would be that you have to get to breakfast early or be prepared to wait. The shuttle to the parks is expensive but well worth it as it saves tons of time in the hassle of parking at Disney properties. I highly recommend this jewel of a property - a great place at a bargain price.

Summary Heading: This Holiday Inn is at a good location for Disneyland but lacking a bit in customer service
Summary: Holiday Inn is at a very good location for Disneyland  It was a very easy walk.  The actual hotel room was clean and comfortable and alot quieter than other Hotels I have been.  However maid did some really strange things like one day she left no shampoo and as a result I was late and missed a meeting at Disney because of it. (It takes about 20 min to get shampoo from front desk).  On the last day the maid didn't put paper coffee cups in room.  I dont know if it was the maids oversight or if Holiday Inn is trying to save money by not providing shampoo and coffee cups.  But room was very clean and other than that She did a good job. The pool was good a little cool but acceptable.   I asked 3 times for towels to be put by the pool as they do not want you to bring room towels to

My family is staying there the last week of April. I have a special needs son and when i read some of the reviews I was pretty nervous. I called and talked to Ed in the front desk and expressed my concerns. He was so helpful and kind. He understood that my son needs to be able to have some quiet time and moved our room to one that was a on a  higher floor in hopes that there would be less foot traffic.   With a special needs kid it can be really difficult to travel but Ed was a great help and I look am actually looking forward to our trip.

it's next to parking lot of Disneyland. However, it takes some time to walk from the hotel to Disneyland. I thought that it's not good way to do with my last son, a 4 years old boy. Firstly, I took my other family into disney drop off area. And then return the hotel and park my car into the parking lot at hotel. I walk down to disney tram. not far without little boy. the tram take me into the front door of the park.   after my sons enjoying Disneyland, they had some time to enjoy swimming at hotel. they had  fun times. it would be a good place if u take a trip with ur family. that's because it's not crowded, and it has no problems for safety and convenience location to enjoy Disneyland.

We booked this hotel for one night. This hotel is clean and functional, but lacks any sort of pride or customer service. I felt like the hotel didn't care about anything else besides getting my money and charging me more.  To start things off we arrived fairly late having traveled all day. I admit I booked this hotel on Priceline, so I did not know for sure what I was in for... I was greeted by a snooty, wise guy, desk receptionist. The first thing he let me know was that I was a Priceline customer and owed the hotel $11 for parking and resort fee. I did not get a greeting, a smile, or anything in that nature... He checked me in as quick as he could, but I managed to get in the dreaded question; "do you have a king bed available?"... He quickly responded that they did not and we

I am a travel agent and switched to this hotel at the last minute. This hotel has been recently updated and is extremely clean. The staff here are excellent and go above and beyond to accomodate you. The rooms are spacious and very nice.   The Anaheim Transit pulls right up in front of the lobby and picks you up and drops you off in front of the parks for a very nominal fee and returns you so you don't have to drive.  The restaurant here serves great food and serve kids for free with a paying adult. If you are on a budget, this is the place to stay. I sent some clients here who brought their family of 8 and they stayed in a 2 bedroom suite and raved about their stay as well.   I will continue to refer clients to this hotel. Keep up the great work.
