Summary Heading: Poor to average. The only good thing was the price for a Sat. night!
Summary: This was a last minute, spur of the moment trip booked  the night. Hotel was booked through hot wire.com for $49 plus tax totaling $63 for a Sat night in Feb. 2010. The goal was to be in Anaheim the night before and wake early to spend the day at Disneyland.   PROS: Price was great rate for a Sat night   Lobby was decorated with a modern trendy feel.  Outside looks old.  Shell gas station next door and close proximity to Mickey's Parking Garage.  I have an annual disneyland pass that includes parking so driving around the corner to disneyland drive into Mickeys parking garage was a plus. Room  was clean with an updated decor.  Front desk  clerk was  just o.k not too much eye contact and acknowledgement of the guest. Somewhat surprise of the lack of  customer service displayed by

Stayed here for one night and did the local 2fer deal at Disneyland and Cal. Adventure.  We were travelling with 3yr old and 7yr old.  Needed someplace close enough to get to park and didn't want to have to wait for a shuttle. Got a great deal on PL and we were lucky to get this hotel.  It is right behind the Disney parking garage but not quite as easy to get to garage as we expected. You have to basically go all the way around the garage by walking down Walnut and around.  Not a big deal for us - we had a stroller for the little one but still - it took about 10 minutes - better than waiting for a shuttle though. We jumped on the tram and were there.  Hotel charges a $10 fee which basically covers parking but considering you get to park for 2 days at this price versus $14 a day

We arrived by bus from LA right in front of disney gates.The hotel is on walnut street which is very long with cases to walk to,but we made it would not walk with small kids to far.The reception tried to charge us 100$ for resort fee we said no but they still requested it off our mcard it has now been replaced.The room was in block 4 nice room clean but not a great bathroom very small.The maids come to the room very early make sure you have the latch on.A women was complaining at front desk about it. Staff are not that helpful and dont know much about the area considering its next to Disney.Disney fire work display is great from hotel car park if you dont want to stay in park all day.Very expensive restaurant not worth the money.Do not use the hotel computer room you only get

Summary Heading: very clean, affordble, excellent custmer srvice, kids eat free
Summary: we stay 4 night there room is very clean ,i book throu hot wire i find best price that time and hotel they not charge any extra money in the great food kids eat free iam very happy from this hotel

We stayed here for five nights during our most recent trip to Disneyland.  The hotel was clean, comfortable and affordable.  The walk to Disney was a little long.  After our oldest came down with a cold we opted to ride the Anaheim shuttle to Disney so she wouldn't have to walk.  The shuttle was convenient and we never waited more than 10 minutes.  For the price ($45/night) this place was a steal!!

Summary Heading: Pleasant, clean, enjoyable hotel with helpfull staff and good business centre facilty
Summary: Describe the service you experiencedAll staff on duty was really pleasant and very helpful.  A tasty buffet breakfast served and pricing was very reasonable.  Our room was spacious, very clean, bathroom tidied daily & beds made.  Quiet hotel, comp newspaper daily.  Hotel is set in an good area surrounded by other hotels.  Lots of safe, free parking.  Situated fairly close to Disneyland and close to freeway and many interesting restaurants. My credit card bill was settled and held balances were released within 24hours which was great.  We will easily return to stay.  No negative points experienced.

Summary Heading: Great value, friendly service, close to Disney
Summary: I stayed here over a Saturday night after spending the day at Disneyland. I parked at the Disney parking garage and drove over to the hotel, I saw several people who appeared to be walking over from Disneyland. The hotel is right next to the Disneyland Parking Garage, so there must be some way to take the tram to/from the park then navigate from the parking garage to the hotel as it seems like it would be a very long walk from this place to the front gate of the park.  I would imagine that the hotel has some sort of shuttle as well.  The rooms were really nice clean and up to date. No flat panel TV, and the AC was one you have to control on the AC unit by turning the knob to the correct combination of blue and red to get to the ideal temp. The windows in the room partially open

We have stayed at the HIH and S many times.  Convenient to little D and very family friendly.  The cafe is a value for breakfast before a long day at the parks.   Free breakfast for the little ones.  When I booked this trip, there was a resort fee not readily posted when I submitted my information for payment.  I phoned the hotel directly and within minutes the manager had this rectified for us.   We're looking forward to enjoying the renovations that have taken place this year.   Sad to see they've added a parking fee.

Summary Heading: The best location we've had so far for Disneyland
Summary: Pros:    - Literally, this hotel is on the other side of the Mickey and Friends parking structure.  You are just as close coming from the hotel as you would be if you parked at Disneyland.  A 5 minute walk to Downtown Disney, a further minute or two to get to the Disneyland main gates.  - Modern, updated lobby  - Clean rooms  - Room service breakfast available (we didn't order, but liked that we had the option!)  - Inexpensive (we paid under $100 for a Saturday night in October)  - Easy access to free in room wireless internet  Cons:  - $10 additional charge for parking.  The parking is still cheaper than it is just on the other side of the building at Disneyland, but an extra charge is never welcome.  Hotels really should just figure this into the cost of the room . . . I don't

This hotel was the perfect compliment for the happiest place on earth. It is only a 15 minute stroll to Disneyland, and if you don't feel like walking, there is a shuttle every 10 minutes, so you will have no issues getting to Mickey's House. The room we booked was a Suite so it was slightly larger, and we were grateful for the room. We had a lounge area and a kitchenette which we used every day, and the room was clean, spacious and had two brand new and soooooooo comfortable beds. We spent each night in the spa and large outdoor swimming pool, and when not swimming we used the guest laundry which was well kept and perfect for our needs. Only 50 meters up the road there is a convenience store and a Subway, so we were always topped up with snacks, drinks and chockie!!.  The Hotel

My husband and i spent 5 nights here as  a base for visiting Univeral Studios, Santa Monica and Disneyland. The hotel is clean and modern. We were located in Building 2, floor 3 - with a fabulous view over the car park (although i'd requested a pool view)!! The room was a good size with 2  double beds. The bathroom was slightly strange in that it contained a bath/shower & toilet but the vanity / sink area was actually located in the bedroom. The room and bathroom were  clean, but the AC was very nosiy so we couldn't have it on during the night. On our 1st morninig we discovered there was no hot water. The hotel dealt with this very quickly and within 10 minutes of reporting it to Reception they brought up the key to another room so we could use the bathroom facilities there.

We stayed here in September and our first impression of the hotel was that it was nice and clean and modern. Exactly what we wanted!  After a short wait to check in the reception staff upgraded us to a suite after informing them that my partner and I had recently got in engaged. The staff were only too happy to help. We asked for directions to hollywood, sunset boulevard and Laguna beach and he gave us directions in detail and was very helpful.  The suite itself overlooked the pool and was lovely and huge.   It had a seperate kitchen, living room, bedroom and bathroom. The room was kept spotless by housekeeping.   The staff at reception can also change travellers cheques up to $100 for no fee which we used on a regular basis.   The pool area was very nice and clean, there was a

Summary Heading: Satisfied with Stay, not overexcited though....
Summary: We stayed here because I used the Bid on Priceline.  We got it for a great price and paying for 2 days parking at Disneyland made it worth it.  However, it is WAY too far to walk and the shuttle takes forever.  It was very clean, the beds were comfortable, the bathroom was big, and there were Bath and Body amenities.  I would never pay full price for it because you'd have to add on parking for Disneyland, but overall we were satisfied with our stay

Read the fine print before you book this hotel.  When you check out, they will add $10 per night plus tax to your bill.  This allows them to advertise a price that is lower than the actual price.  The room itself was fine, but I do not plan to return to a hotel that has bait-and-switch pricing like this.

Booked a night thru priceline for $49 (tax included).  Since we arrived at LAX late evening, we wanted a decent 3 star hotel.  Our bid was accepted by the holiday inn for disneyland area.  We wanted a central location since we are heading out to legoland the next morning.  We already booked the next 3 nights at Ayres hotel.  See a separate review for Ayres.  They don't nickel and dime you there. I knew before hand from reading the review that there is a $10 parking fee.  So I expected that but it was a $11 resort fee (internet, parking,etc). So you pay this fee regardless of a car or not.  That is kind of absurd since you don't even get a fridge in your room.  The room was in a building separate from the lobby.  The hallway was clean and not musty.  The room was basic.   So, if

Summary Heading: Comfortable Bed and lotsa pillows hot hallways $10.00 hidden fee
Summary: The bed and room were clean nicely decorated.  They had lotsa pillows. There is a $10.00 charge for parking inside complex they don't tell you this until you get there. The hallways were hot we came in early sept.

Summary Heading: NOISE IN THE BATHROOM AND BREAKFAST RIP OFF
Summary: I haven't gotten back with the hotel yet but I stayed at this hotel the bed was so confortable the room was big enough for me. But there was a knocking or pinging sound coming from the bathroom, i don't know if it was the pipes or what but at night it would get so loud ( i'm a sound sleeper if the room is totally quiet if there is noice just a little i can't get myself to sleep fast) I finally had to put tissue paper in my ears to get to sleep at first then it was sound sailing for me.  also the breakfast is a rip off for 6.95, most hotels their breakfasts are for free not this one. It wasn't worth the price, cereal toast boiled eggs begals and muffins. i wish i could have been at the holiday inn express like they advertise on tv as free breakfasts.

I originally chose this hotel because I believed a internet description of this place. I have to first say that it isn't horrible. This is just an average hotel with nothing special about it. It is not within walking distance of Disneyland. There are shuttles to Disneyland $4.00 a person return . The hallways smell like a musty dirty vacuum cleaner bag (very strong). No room service. For what it is I would only consider paying $50.00 a night per couple per room.

Summary Heading: Room Confortable - Don't Eat Breakfast Here
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for two nights during our recent trip to Disney. We travel a lot and try to look for top hotels in town but this was a last minute change of hotel that landed us at his property. Room was clean and comfortable.  Washroom had a little odd setup with the vanity area separated from the rest of the washroom and there was carpet in front of vanity which must have caused the slight musty feeling we experienced initially. Some items need attention (a fused bulb and a toilet bowl level that need 200lbs of pressure to flush) but we didn't bother calling anyone. The walk to Disney may be long but we just walked up to Disney parking and took the tram from there.  A 10 minutes walk. Business Center is a nice touch. Gym has some treadmills and climbers and a few free

We stayed here for 6 nights in february 2009 in a one bedroom suite. Travelled with my husband, 2 young children and a teenager. We all liked the suite. It was nice to have a kitchen area and the beds were really comfortable. This was our longest stay on our 2 week vacation. Our trip started with a 2 night stay in Excalibur, Las Vegas, 1 night stay in Garden Suites Inn, Bakersfield, 2 nights at Tavellodge by the Bay in San Francisco, 6 nights here and then back to Las Vegas and stayed at the Luxor. This hotel did beat them all!

Summary Heading: Clean, good location, attractive to families
Summary: This recently renovated hotel is clean and comfortable.  The bathroom layout in the room I was in was awkward.  The work area was moderately comfortable and the in-room WIFI was free.  This hotel is popular with families, and therefore there is noise in the halls during "awake" hours for children, but nights were quiet.  Walking to Disneyland wouldn't be that advisable due to the distance, but the ART comes by regularly and passes are available in the gift shop.  Getting to other locations in Orange County by car is relatively easy from this location.  This is a "Resort" area hotel, and therefore you have to pay the $10 resort fee.  This seems to be mainly the honor of being at an ART stop, which you have to pay to ride.  As I got this hotel at a hotwire rate, those paying in

I traveled with my daughter, best friend and her 3 kids in June. We got a family suite that had one king bed in one bedroom and 2 queens in the other bedroom along with a living area and kitchenette. This was perfect for the 6 of us! The room was recently renovated and the beds were very comfortable (better than mine at home)! The king room had a very large bathroom and the queen room had a much smaller bath which was a little small for her family, but they made do. The kitchenette had a microwave and small fridge. We chose to drive to Disney and parked in the lot next to the parking garage. It was 11.00 per day and rode the tram over to the park. Since we were only there for one day, this was certainly affordable for us. The night we got in we went to Downtown Disney and parked

My family of five stayed here for two nights.  Upon arriving we were informed that we couldn't have a roll-a-way because of restrictions in fire code.  They had no suites to upgrade to.  When I asked why they advertised that the rooms would accommodate a baby crib, but nothing was implied that the fifth could only be an infant. My kids are 11, 11, and 12, a little big for a crib.   They eventually let me sign a waiver for the fire code and gave us a bed.  It fit fine, with room to move in the event of a fire.  Also, the breakfast was nothing more than a continental breakfast that cost us 6.95 per adult.  Waffles, hard boiled eggs, yogurt, donuts, and fruit.  For 6.95 a meat of some sort would have been appropriate.  A garbage truck comes (daily) at an awful early time with its

We stayed here with our 6 kids and my parents - 10 people in all.  We had 2 rooms.  It was a LONG walk to Disneyland, especially on the way back.  It took us about 20 minutes.  We parked in the Disneyland parking structure a couple days, but it wasn't worth the money.  We still had to walk quite a distance and wait for the tram.  It took longer than walking!  The rooms were small.  The kids thought the pool was okay.  Not great at keeping the room stocked with towels, cups, and soap.  We liked the outside tables and chairs and enjoyed a meal out there one night.  We liked the gift shop and business center.  We had a good view of the fireworks.  We liked the new renovation - nicely decorated.  We booked this trip at the last minute and felt lucky to find a place that could

We were very pleased and satisfied with our stay at this Holiday Inn. The interior of the hotel building looked clean and updated, and our room was fully renovated as well. It had a small bathroom with the vanity and sink detached (see photo). I only had a minor issue with the toilet's flush which I had reported to front desk, and they seemed to be aware of the problem. They said I just have to apply a little more pressure when pressing the flush. Thankfully that did the trick.  We also needed help accessing the hotel's free WiFi connection, and a staff member was quick to respond and got us going on the hotel's network in no time.   The double beds were really comfortable with plush sheets and pillows. The TV was not a flat-panel LCD, but it did have the Disney channel which

Summary Heading: It's a pretty long block to Disneyland
Summary: Because neither my husband, nor mother-in-law, had ever been to Disneyland, we decided that this would be the perfect time to go and needed an inexpensive hotel in the area.   They are TECHNICALLY correct in saying that the hotel is a block from the park. It‚Äôs a LONG block from Disney property; the very tail end of Downtown Disney, not the actual park. Also, they do have a free shuttle (just call the front desk and give them 15 minutes notice) but that shuttle drops you off at Downtown Disney-not great if you‚Äôre with people who can‚Äôt walk very far.  Also, if you call the shuttle, wait by the door. The driver does not care who arrived first and even if a crowd of people come after you, but manage to get in first, (which is almost what happened to us because we waited by the

I am please the makeover was completed at the hotel and it was a lovely comfy stay.  Continental breakfast at $6.95 was very good value and started you off for the day before walking to disney.  It is an easy walk but about a mile to the park entrance, very tiring walking back, we got the shuttle one morning and it took ages so walk its much quicker. Beds really comfy and rooms nice, no restaurants nearby if you dont have a car.

Read some bad reviews, but had a super good time.  We took our 5 children to Disneyland, so we booked a 5 bed suite for 4 days.  Receptionists were great; room was clean and cleaners kept it tidy each day.  Lots of space in suite.  Breakfasts a great price.  Re: going to Disneyland, I'd recommend either walking or take a taxi.  A fabulous stay.

Hotel was clean and our room was an excellent size.  We had a queen suite so we could have a small kitchen, the kitchen however was poorly stocked with not even enough bowls etc for our family.  The renovations we had read about were not visible and in no way affected our stay.  The restaurant was not open but the hotel offer a free shuttle to Downtown Disney or Garden Walk every afternoon/evening so you can go out to eat.  You just ring when you are finished and the driver comes back for you.  The location was great.  No need to use the Disney bus as the walk is not long.  We walked along Disney Way thru the Disney Hotel carpark and then through Downtown Disney to get to the park entrance.  If you already have your tickets you can get on the monorail near the rainforest cafe

We spent two nights here while visiting the Disney Resort and were very happy with the accomodations and the location. As many have mentioned, the hotel has recently been renovated so main lobby and pool area are new and modern. Our room was a two-queen suite in a small buidling near the pool. The room was just average and although recenlty decorated, was nothing special. Much of the furntiure was older and did not really match the decor. The beds and linens were great and the shower worked so they have the basics covered. The room was quite large (almost double the size of a normal room) with separate bedroom. and living area. The living area had a kitchenette.  The best feature of the hotel is its proximity to Disneyland and the complimentary shuttle in the evening. Disneyland

Summary Heading: Horrible, don't spend your money here
Summary: Over priced, unsafe and not what you think you are getting.   In a nutshell: Stayed for 8 days and had to call the front desk 5 of those days, plus a call to head office!!   No towels left in our room, hot water tap was backwards in the shower, almost burning my child, the SMELL was repulsive. I called after the 1st day and nothing done about it.  Not moved or even air freshener was sprayed.  Toilietries not replenished, never vacuumed, dirty towel put on rack..not ours!  Our room door was left OPEN! We returned from Disneyland around 9pm and found our door was not closed.  Anyone walking by could clearly see the door was not closed.  Thankfully we had nothing stolen.  When I told the front desk about it, the said that the entry door to the building (We were not in the main

My husband I just returned from this hotel and were very pleased with our stay.  We were concerned beacause of the recent mixed reviews.  Our room was very clean.  They were recently remodeled and very comfortable.  We did not use the ART to get to Disney.  We saw other couples and families make their way by foot as well.  The walk is about 1/2 mile to the entrance to Downtown Disney.  It is another 1/2 mile to the Disneyland and California Adventure main  entrance.  If you have small children you may want to use ART but we preferred to walk and burn off extra calories we ate at the park and at the restaurants on Harbor across from the Disneyland Resort.  We have stayed at the HOJO and Doubletree on Harbor.   We felt this was a better deal and would stay here again.

We booked this back in July 08 and we stayed there from Jan 1st 09 to Jan 7th 09 and were not aware they were undergoing major changes.  Our room had 2 double beds, tv with lots of channels but no dvd, the bathroom was quite small but i like how it the bath/shower & toilet was separated from the sink area.... plus they had coffee and tea!!!! (the only place that had this facilty ).  The room itself was new and fresh and extremely clean.... the bath tub was extremely white i felt bad for using it! The new was a little smaller than expected but was very comfy and cozy.  Now, the business centre was located in a normal bedroom with one computer, the free complimentry breakfast was cereal or muffin with coffee or tea etc in a white tent... good thing we didnt pay for breakfast when

I booked this hotel at a very deep discount so have no major complaints. I was not expecting to use the pool or the restaurant. The renovation is still ongoing but the reception should now be back in the actual building. Lots of scaffolding, plastic sheeting and builders. Our newly renovated room was Ok but TBH did not look that updated! The restaurant is still closed as is the pool. There was one ice machine for the 6 floors of the block. The 'free' breakfast and free shuttle are really not true compensation for the rebuild though at least they are trying. Once complete this will be an OK hotel.

We booked this hotel through a travel agent in March this year.  We were going as a family group (5 rooms - 15 people).  We chose this hotel for its location and its features.  We were told it had a pool and a restaurant.  The children were to eat for free in the restaurant.  We were really looking forward to spending time as a family around the pool etc. Unfortunately when we arrived at around 7 pm on Thursday night it was to a construction site.  No pool, no restaurant - the registration is in a construction trailer.  The staff were friendly but in no way made up for the lack of facilities. We were not warned about this renovation and were incredibly disappointed about this.  It really should be closed down until the renovations are complete. Be warned do not use this hotel if

Stayed here for 3 nights, Oct. 3rd to Oct.6th.  Was not aware the hotel is currently undergoing a major renovation... I do mean major, so much so they shoul have just torn the whole thing down.  There was no warning as to this listed on the hotel website.  Let me say the staff was helpful and very friendly, a couple were quite quirky, but polite.  Note, the hotel has a free shuttle to downtown disney only.  Do not spend the $3 per day for the Anaheim resort Suttle service.  You can walk in from Downtown Disney.  Also, there is no excuse for not walking directly to the Disney Resort, its a 10 minute walk tops...  So about the renovation, there is no restaurant, they are now serving a free breakfast in a tent in the parking lot.  The lobby?  What Lobby?  It's now in a trailer in

Stayed in the Holiday Inn for three nights during our recent trip to California. The hotel was clean and tidy, and the reception staff were very pleasant.   We had two queen sized beds, and the room and bathroom were kept well maintained by the housekeeping staff. There is a shuttle bus to Disney, but hotel is only about a 10 minute stroll to both Disneyland, and DowntownDisney, so we didn't bother with the shuttle,  and it's only a couple of minutes drive from local restaurants, and shops on Katella Avenue. All in all a nice property to stay in for a few nights in Anaheim.

I chose this hotel because it was just my husband and me and I wasn't looking to spend a lot.  I didn't have high expectations, just a clean place to rest for two nights.  The room was clean but old and definitely needed a new carpet.  However, the beds were VERY comfortable.  Everything worked correctly and it was a good price.

We booked our Disneyland package online, so you are never sure what your going to get.  We were very pleased with our hotel.  It was just close enough to Disneyland without all of the noise.  We were able to see the fireworks from our hotel, which was a real plus.  The staff was very friendly and the rooms were clean.  I would stay there again.  We used the shuttle to get to Disneyland, I was unsure about it, but it ended up not being too big of a hassle and it pulls up right at the hotel, unlike some of the other stops that I saw where you had to walk to the stop.

The room interior design needs some renovation. Old carpet, decolored wall paniting and small sized room . Some disappointed impression in comparison with the photos on the internet. However, the hotel staff was nice to any questions.

I don't like booking hotels to far from Disneyland, because I prefer to walk and not ride shuttles.  I am glad I broke out of that cycle.  This was a very clean and quiet hotel.  The front desk was nice and so was housekeeping.  The room was clean and I felt comfortable staying there.  The bed, pillow and down comforter was great.  We ate breakfast at the hotel and it was good breakfast fair such as pancakes and eggs.  Kids ate free which was nice.  The shuttle is $3 for adults and $1 for kids 9 and under.  The shuttle takes you from  hotel to Disney and it was an all day pass.  The suttle drops you off at the front of Disney and  arrives every 30 minutes.  The last shuttle was 12:30 a.m.  After a long day at Disney, I was grateful not to have walked further than I had to.   I

We recently stayed here for a quick road trip to Disneyland.  We booked the hotel via priceline and received a discounted rate.   We arrived late at night since we had driven from the SF Bay Area.  One thing to note if you book on priceline--you are not guranteed your room type.  For this reason, we had to stay in a smoking room because it was all that they had remaining at that late hour.  After we aired out the room/put on the fan, either the smell was not that bad or we got used to it.    The room itself was fair.  Beds were OK.  I liked the fact that it had a mini fridge and cabinets.  Also the shower was nice --- we had a walk in shower with no curtain.   The bathroom was a good size.  Room was clean and besides the smoke smell, no complaints on the room.  The park is close

Summary Heading: Very Nice Stay at Holiday Inn!
Summary: I booked a three night stay at the Holiday Inn Anaheim through Hotwire.com.   The check-in was quick and easy. The front-desk staff was very friendly and helpful.   The room was nice.  The beds were very comfortable, with nice linens and plenty of pillows.  The shower had great water pressure and plenty of hot water.  The room was quiet, we never heard any other guests, except for when thier water ran. We were a little worried about the walk to Disneyland.  The walk wasn't  bad.  Our 1st day we walked over to the Mickey & Friends parking tram and rode the tram to the parks.  The next couple of days we just walked through Downtown Disney, one day we jumped on the Monorail.  All were fairly easy walks.  All in all, a very nice stay.  My only complaint is there are no

Summary Heading: OK Hotel/Little overpriced on some dates.
Summary: I was surprised this property was not a little nicer given some of the prices I saw online.  I received a deeply discounted rate due to work related employee discount.  Rooms are basic...nothing special.  Pool area was kept up well.  Lobby is nice.  Free internet access in the lobby by showing room key.  The restaurant had a good breakfast.  Kids eat free with paying adult.  I found the servers/hosts of the onsite restaurant to be very polite and nice.  I thought they were great!  You do have to drive to Disneyland from this site if you have little ones with you.  I would recommend the motels on Harbor Blvd. over this hotel due to their proximity to the park.  I would only stay at this Holiday Inn again if I received a deeply discounted rate.

Holiday Inn Anaheim was the first place we stayed when visiting the states and also the last on the way home!!.. we called it our home away from home.. it was in what seemed a safe neighbourhood.. all the staff were friendly and the rooms were great!!.. We made some good friends in Anaheim and the hotel just topped it all off for us!! it also has a great shuttle service to Disneyland so getting around was never an issue... we would definitley go back..

Summary Heading: Great hotel, great price, great location
Summary: This hotel is within easy walking distance to Disneyland. So close that we didn't use the available shuttle during our stay. The beds are very comfortable. Our room was clean and well furnished. Since the hotel does not back up to I-5 like many in the area It's quiet also. The staff was friendly and helpful. We would stay at this hotel again.

Summary Heading: Not perfect, but made for a nice Disney trip
Summary: I have to disagree with the previous review about Hotwire rates being a rip-off. Rates with the anaheim hotels (especially the Good Neighbor Hotels which this is one of) are season- higher at times and lower at others. I have seen peak rates for non discounted rooms at 120+ a night for this property.   There are basic rooms and there are "suites". We contemplated upgrading to a "suite"- I called the hotel after pricing around and they said we could upgrade for $60 a night (an actual cost of $120 a night, which was a $40 break of the price at the time). Bottomline, we paid $56 a night via priceline- and that was a *fabulous* rate. In fact, overall it was a terrific value.  We were put in the back of the property- didn't bother me- it actually allowed us good parking spots and

... beware of "deals" on Hotwire.  I have only used Hotwire once (and prob never again), for this hotel, based largely on the misleading description that I was getting a $149/night hotel room for $69/night.  There is NO WAY anyone in their right mind would have paid $149 for the room we had!  $69 was fair, but beware Hotwire's misleading (IMHO) rhetoric!  So, back to the room/hotel - the room was your basic hotel room, somewhat cramped but at least the vanity & bathroom had their own space.  Housekeeping was fine, no problems there.  We were only in the pool once (the weather was sunny & pleasant, but not really hot) but no complaints there.  We ate in the restaurant one night (being so tired from a long day at Disney) and the service was excellent and the food was fine.  No

Was a little worried about staying in this hotel but was amazed at how clean etc.   Would recommend to others.  Not too far from Disney via trolley (walking is an option)  Gift shop over priced. Suggest buying in Disney and if you think you might need a memory card for camera, get one before you go to either hotel or Disney land as they both charge extrodinary prices. In short, buy a memory card on-line and save paying 10 times the amount at the resort/hotel.  Pool a little dirty but this might be time used  Resturant and Check in staff were fantastic

Stayed at the Anaheim Holiday Inn in November 2006. Had an awesome stay with my family. The rooms were very tidy and clean. My mum had trouble sleeping some nights, not because of noise but because the pillows were too hard. The hotel restaurant was definately the best part of the hotel. We had breakfast there every morning. The food was really delicious and the portions were huge! (portions are much smaller in New Zealand). The restaurant service was excellent! Definately wouldn't hesistate staying at the Anaheim Holiday Inn again!

We were allocated a room at this hotel by the travel company we were touring with.  On arrival there were no room keys available due to a breakdown of the system, the rooms were left open for us but once we locked the door we had to ask at reception for the room to be reopened. We were supposed to show our passports but no-one asked to see them!! We wanted to use the laundry facilities but needed soap powder, a notice on the laundry wall said that soap powder could be bought at the gift shop.  The gift shop had very little stock inside, lots of nearly empty shelves & when we asked for soap powder they were out of stock!!!  We were told to try the store at the corner of the block which turned out to be 10 to 15 minutes walk away.  The laundry had three washers & dryers, two of

I got a great rate on this hotel as a 3 Star Disneyland South on Hotwire. I arrived and was greeted by a friendly and helpful employee names Javier? Requested an early check in and got it no problem. Room was very clean and nice, no problems whatsoever. Free and abundant parking. Did not use the restaurant or pool.  To get to Disney it is .6 miles to the parking lot shuttle, yes we measured it with a GPS. Turn left out of the hotel and walk down the side walk to Magic Way hang a left and cut through the parking lot near the parking garage to the Disney Shuttle and ride the rest of the way to Disney. There are no traffic problems as you are on sidewalks the entire time. It is one block from Disney, just a very long block. We walked it everyday without any problems or complaints.

Our camera was stolen.  The room was never restocked with towels ect. And the room service includes 15% tip in the bill so the servers don't even try to earn the tip. We stayed here last year and had a very differant review but this trip was bad.

I was pleasantly surprised how comfortable this hotel was.   Stayed 3 nights with granddaughter. Kids Eat Free Hotel Staff great, Food was good (especially breakfast) Room very clean and nice pillows. We took Super Shuttle to Hotel and rode the Anaheim Resort bus back and forth to Disneyland $3.00 for Adult and kids free (I think under 12) sometimes it was a little slow on schedule but easier than finding parking. Great little hotel and was a lot quieter than those on the main drag by Disneyland. We enjoyed the Hottub and pool after a long day on our feet.!!  Would definitely stay here again.

We booked this hotel because it advertised one block from Disneyland.We had a person in our party that is handicapped and can't walk far. What the ad forgot to say is" one block from Disneyland emploee parking lot".We walked for a least a mile to enter Disneyland. And that was the shortcut the hotel staff told us about.... Rooms old and walls are made of paper. Elevator broken part of our stay, but that was a blessing because it was so noisy you could not hear television when it was running. Staff friendly and helpful. Pancakes in restaurant EXCELLENT! Won't stay there again. Disappointed in 3 different Holiday Inns this trip!

the hotel was okay but we found the reception staff very badly trained and unhelpful also when we arrived home we had 2 payments booked on our credit card of $450 which after contacting our card provider fraud line was refunded but we are yet to receive the $250 still in dispute one payment for example breakfast $116 there is only 3 of us and the buffet is $10 be very carefull check your bill note the payments where added after we left for england very convenient

I got a steal on this room on Hotwire, and after reading other reviews, was a bit worried about the hotel.    The biggest drawback would be the distance from Disneyland.  While it may be a block away, it is a long block and I'm not sure I would want to walk (although I did see other people walking).  This wasn't an issue for my family, as we get free parking at the Mickey & Friends structure with our annual passes, and this hotel backs that parking lot.   We would drive around the corner, park, and take a tram to the main entrance.   The hotel itself was fine.  I didn't experience any problems with the staff.  The room and facilities were dated but clean, and breakfast at the restaurant was fine.    It isn't a luxury hotel, but it certainly wasn't gross.  I would stay there

This is a very basic Holiday Inn.  It's clean, comfortable, and cheap.  It is also very close to Disneyland.  It may be too long to walk to Disneyland (traffic is heavy), but the hotel provides transportation to and from the park.  The hotel also has a very pretty and inviting pool area.  Recommend.

Summary Heading: A Nice Hotel in a nice location
Summary: Stayed here from 23 - 27 Jul.  Check in was easy and the room was about what we expected.  We had a room with a king sized bed,  nice bath and shower.  The room was nicely furnished, with a coffee maker in the room.  The only down side is they had no refrigerator or microwave in the room, although they would rent you one for $10 a day each.  We passed, bought a collapsible ice chest, kept it full  of ice and water bottles and sodas.  The hotel backs up to Disney and every night you can stand in the parking lot and see a wonderful fireworks display.    The pool and hot tub look wonderful, but we never used them so can't comment, although everyone using them seemed to be having fun.  The hotel had a nice restaurant, we had two breakfasts there, but we should have shared them, they

¬£45/ night from Priceline ($90 USD) for our stay here - what a bargain!  It's on the other side of Disneyland, not far from the 5.  Our room was clean and comfortable.  The pool was small and cold but the jacuzzi was really nice after a long day at the park.    The shuttle took too long though but for the price, and any environmental consciousness directing us to use public transport, we did.  They're supposed to run every 15 minutes but both in to the park and back we waited 1/2 hour.  Reception was very friendly with maps, etc. and we had no problem with wi-fi access, either.    Definitely would stay here again!
great deal, nice location,easy access,clean rooms,nice pool,nice  staff,early checkin

This is a very simple, comfrtable Holiday Inn, very close to Disneyland, although I don't recommend walking.  Our rooms were clean and comfortable, our group of 3 rooms were all located very near each other as requested at check-in, and we got a king bedroom as we had reserved.  We ended up with a handicap-access room, which was fine, although using the hand shower was a little weird.  There was free wi-fi in the rooms as well, which was really nice.  Transportation to the parks with self-driving and the Anaheim resort bus was quick and relatively painless, although the resort bus doesn't run too late, so if you are planning on staying at Downtown Disney late be advised you will need a cab, which ran us $8.  Overall i was very satisfied with my experience here, nothing fancy but

Summary Heading: Please read this before you book!
Summary: We had a group of 8 rooms booked. 5 of those rooms had problems and needed to change rooms. From mold to wet carpet it was just bad. One of our group members got changed to a room that someone was still IN! The staff is not great at all the managers are not that friendly have no idea what they are doing. However, Javier the desk staff is awesome. He has true customer service and should be working in a better hotel or be in management. Just awesome customer service and so friendly.   The walk from the park is long and lonely. I wouldn't advise walking by yourself as across the street is a not so nice area. The walk from the park to the hotel is about 25min if you take the parking lot tram it takes about 8 min off your walk. Let this be known this is *not* a close hotel. It may

We stayed at this hotel June 10- 15. We had booked it through priceline for $45 a night. We  have no major complaints about this hotel at all. If you are looking for a super cushy hotel look elsewere. I personally would rate this hotel as a 2 1/2 star property. It is a very basic hotel, but it suited our needs great. We were there for Disneyland of course, and all we did was sleep and shower in the room. The room was clean except for a few small stains on the carpet and there were plenty of towels. It was nice to have the sink disconnected from the shower area. The beds were nice and they even had a pillow menu you could order off off depending on the firmness of the pillow you like. Housekeeping was excelent. ( Side Note: People please tip the houskeeping staff. I can only

My boyfriend and I stayed at the Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort from May 12th until May 16th.  We arrived to the hotel after taking a shuttle from LAX in the morning. The grounds were clean and inviting. The hotel is situated by the freeway, however, we did not encounter any noise because of this.  The check in went quickly and our room was not ready yet, so they let us keep our luggage in the bell desk closet. We had lunch at the American Brasserie which we found a good price and great service. The food itself was good, average. We checked again after lunch and they had a room ready for us. We are Priority Club members, which I signed up for online, for free, so we were upgraded at no extra cost for a club room.  The room was HUGE. It was clean and comfortable. We were on the 9th

We stayed for 4 nights at the end of May, 2007.  The front desk was friendly and helpful.  I had booked through hotwire for $49 plus tax, so found this to be a very nice hotel for the price.  We emailed ahead of time requesting 2 Q beds, which they graciously gave us.  Our room was very clean with lots of drawers if you like to unpack.  The sink is outside of the bathroom, which was nice.  Any requests made were filled immediately.  My family enjoyed the pool and jacuzzi, although it closed at 10 pm, which was our only complaint. (it was hard to get some time in the jacuzzi when Disneyland closed at 9 pm).  We drove and parked in M&F parking, since we had free parking with our CSAA tickets.  ART picks up right in front of the hotel though, for $3/pp per day.  There is a

Summary Heading: A disappointment for other Holiday Inn hotels
Summary: I decided to treat my mom to a mother's day disneyland trip for three days.  After using the holiday inn's website to book this hotel, I was excited because I had stayed at other holiday inn hotels and was (at the very least) satisfied. However, this hotel should've been rated a two star, not three.  First off, the room's air/heating unit was extremely loud and filled the air with this unpleasant "burning" odor. (As we would later find out, this is "standard".) Secondly, the first room we were given had dirty sheets on the beds. One of the beds had BLOODY sheets. (You just KNOW that the housekeeping should've seen this. There were so many blood stains on the sheets that one could immediately see them, when the top blankets were pulled back.) When we called down to the front desk

I'll be honest with you, I was skeptical about this place from what some other reviews had been, but I *seriously* needn't have worried.  This place was AWESOME!  I got this from hotwire.com for only $50.00 a night.  We got a room on the 2nd floor.  I do not remember hearing any of my neighbors, and we were next to the elevator.  The room was *very* spacious.  We had two queen beds, desk, and a tv armoire (sp?).  Now, there was some wear and tear, such as in the bathroom, I could see the wall paper peeling in the corners, etc.  However, for the price I could care less!  The beds were comfortable and I was very satisfied.  Now, we actually walked to Disneyland, and yes it's about a 20 minute walk, but we're that type of family, so it's not that big of a deal for us.  We had a 7

Summary Heading: We loved this Disneyland area hotel!
Summary: After doing a ton of research online to find a reasonably priced hotel that received great reviews from people who stayed there, we came across this Holiday Inn.  We were not disappointed!  Even our check-in was pleasant because of the friendly and helpful staff.   Because we have a toddler, our main concern at any hotel is it being clean and well maintained.  This hotel is definitely both of those!  As Disneyland annual passholders, we've stayed at many properties in the area in various price ranges, and have had our share of good and bad experiences.  We've even had cleanliness and poor maintenance issues with some of the pricier, better rated hotels in the area.  While the property is located within walking distance to the parks, it is still quiet and somewhat secluded

We stayed here last year and liked it so much we thought we'd come back with the WHOLE family.  Again, after a long flight from Australia we arrived early morning hoping for early check-in.  Because there were 14 of us this time, we actually booked a room for the night before so we'd be guaranteed at least one room for when we arrived.  Unfortunately this became a problem because the computer system marked us down as a no-show and cancelled the rest of the reservation!  While the woman at the front desk was not as good as others we've met there, in the end (taking close to 3/4 of an hour) she had everything sorted and we ALL had early check in by 10.30am - a real bonus that we hadn't expected.  Unfortunately our agent had not booked non-smoking rooms so we were on a smoking

Summary Heading: Hotel is not what you think is should be
Summary: I was very disappointed in this Holiday Inn.  Up to this stay I have been very happy with other properties.  We had requested a King non smoking room but as soon as we stepped into the room you could tell the room had a very very strong smoke smell.  I called the front desk and was told all the King rooms were not smoking.  A very disinterested desk clerk said they had not other rooms available but they would send a maid up.  She arrived very fast and sprayed something that only covered the smell for awhile.  I have asthma so this was not an enjoyable stay.  The rug going into the bathroom was coming apart and the room looked very dated.

This was a no frills hotel. It was clean, parking was ample, but there was nothing special. The bed was average, and no too comfortable.   There are many hotels much closer to the gate than this one. Also there is another Holiday Inn around the corner. Don't be fooled, you won't be any closer.   This hotel has a store. Don't waste your money. There is a convience store not 400 feet away. The prices will be much better.   They did offer a shuttle to and from Disney, but it took forever after being picked up to get there. I thinhk the bus stopped at least 6 times at various hotel. I could have walked there faster. Not to mention it cost $3.00 a ticket. If you have a large family over age 9, don't take the bus.

Let me start off by saying that I didn't book this hotel.  I was sent here from another that messed up.  Unfortunatly it was the only one available, and I now see why.   Driving up, I was very excited.  The outside of this hotel is beautiful.  It is a fairly easy walk to get to a tram to Downtown Disney.  I didn't notice the pool... The staff at the front desk was very kind as I was in a bad mood from the referring hotel.  They were quick to get anything I asked for.  The room itself would have been fine for 2-3 people, but I had 5.  The roll away bed had to be placed in the very tiny walkway and almost completely blocked the door.  The microwave and refrigerator were both VERY tiny and came at an extra cost. This is when it gets interesting.  The faceplates for the power

Clean....Comfortable.....Spacious We stayed here overnight while visiting Disneyland and California Adventures. We were looking for someplace comfortable to stay while taking a break from all the day's activities. We were pleased with the hotel. Do not choose this hotel if you are looking for a short walk to Disneyland. Use the ART which cost $3 per adult to ride all day and save your walking  for inside the park. It's about a 20 minutes ride to the park (other stops along the way). They do not serve a continental breakfast and the meals at the caf√© are a bit overprice. Overall a very good experience.

I absolutely loved this hotel. We stayed here from the 23/09 - 26/09 and were not dissappointed. Our room was on the 3rd floor in the main building and our view was nothing spectacular. But who goes to a hotel and stares out the window the whole time. This was our first time in America and we found the front desk were extremely helpful with any of our needs. Very convenient having a small shop inside the hotel. We found that walking to Downtown Disney was a good option for meals as it was only a 10-15 minute walk down the street. Downtown Disney also has access to the actual park. Quite a few times we actually walked to Disneyland instead of catching the ART bus. But the ART buses were also a good way to see more of Anaheim as they had to go to other places before they dropped

I had booked this hotel thinking that I would receive the same quality that I have experienced at other Holiday Inn's. I was very dissapointed.  I'm not a major clean freak, but the room was noticeably dirty. There were large black smudges all over the curtains, stains on the carpet  and grimy black smuges on the bathroom floor. I wiped the room down with clorox wipes, but still never felt comfortable handling anything. The staff was quite nice and pleasant to work with. ART was directly outside the front door and ran promptly every 20 minutes. It was a 10 minute ride to Disneyland with 3 stops prior to the park. Coming back from the park, the hotel is the first stop.  I would not stay at this hotel again. There are cleaner hotels closer to the park for around the same price

We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights, mainly to see Disneyland.  The hotel was really nice, staff helpful, and Disneyland and bus tours close-by. The only thing is there's not much within walking distance in terms of restaurants or night-life, but the hotel bar and restaurant did the trick for the 3 nights we were there.

We stayed here for 3 nights, in a 1 bedroom suite (Room 3604), which had 2 double beds, a toilet, bath and shower.  It had a kitchenette area and a living room.  We had a nice view of the car park and the garbage cans.  The decor is dated and is need of some improvements, especially the bathroom.  It was dark and had peeling wallpaper.    The phone didn't work in our bedroom, so we had to run to the living each time we received an incoming call.  The staff came over as rude and unhelpful.  They were unknowlegable.    The cleaning of the room was inadequate.  The floor was not wiped at all during our stay and we had to do it ourselves!  There were no basic items provided in the kitchenette.  For example, they only had cofee and no tea bags!  They probably couldn't wait, as the

Within walking distance to Disneyland and California Adventure Park. Staff were very courteous and helpful with information about tours etc. The rooms were spacious and comfortable but the restaurant is looking a bit tired and in need of redecorating.

We stayed here for a week. I had read some reviews that made me nervous about staying here. However our experience was very good. The check-in was easy and efficient. Our room was on the 6th floor. We had a bedroom with 2 double beds (for a family of 4) and a lounge with sofa, chairs, desk, tv. It also had a kitchenette with a microwave, sink and coffee maker. It was very spacious. The staff were friendly. The pool looked good but we didn't use it.  The restaurant wasn't fancy but certainly nice enough. Kids eating free was a big plus for us as our 2 are small eaters and usually end up leaving food on their plates. We ate breakfast there most mornings and dinner a couple of times. We used the bus to Disneyland for 3 days. It was good but if you missed it there was a 20 minute

Summary Heading: Great Hotel - long walk to anything
Summary: We stayed here in July, great hotel, well presented rooms, clean and well laid out hotel. Great focus on kids and the whole Disneyland experience. The pool area is huge and was great for relaxing after a hard day at the parks. There is a little shop in the foyer area to buy grocery items, etc, cold drinks, snacks etc.  The restaurant is well-priced with thh kids eat free thing happening, but we got a bit bored with the selection, the problem with this hotel being that it is not within walking distance of anything except a small shop. If you catch the shuttle back to the hotel from the park you will pass a little market, looks a bit ramshackled, but you can walk there in about 5 mins, great selection of beers, wine, snacks and stuff, for 1/10 of the price charged in the hotel.

I wasn't expecting much from this hotel to be honest considering I got a low rate by booking & paying early. We paid 72.00 a night for a King room and we stayed 9/20-9/26.  The hotel was nice, updated, had a restaurant and bar. Our room was on the 5th floor and was quite spacious with a nice view, a large vanity area and a desk & 25inch TV. The rooms have menus for room service as well as local pizza & chinese places.   The rooms were clean and the room service was great. I recommend the cinnamon roll french toast. I ate it every morning we were there. The food is a priced adequately. For 4 slices of french toast it was about 7 dollars.   What made this hotel great was the staff. Anything we needed from directions, maps, extra towels or bus passes, they helped us out. We called

Summary Heading: This will be my Anaheim vacation hotel from now on.
Summary: I went to Disneyland on my Birthday with my family.  I call the central number for Holiday Inn and booked my reservation on the phone but somehow I booked my reservation at the wrong hotel.  I originally wanted the one right off the freeway across from Disneyland. But I ended up at this one.  After staying at this Holiday Inn, I am glad that I did.    This hotel has that cowboy theme going which I think is kind of cool.  The staff there are all very helpful.  They told me where the locals go for their Birthdays and tips of Disneyland and California Adventures that only expert would know.  What impress me the most is that the front desk agent that checked me in the first night remembered my name and that I came for my birthday and asked me how everything went.    My room was a

I'm glad I booked our room on Hotwire, because it was not worth more than what I'd paid.  Our room was small and the decor was dated.  We showered in relative darkness because the shower curtain was brown, the liner pink, and the ceiling light placed on the other side of the shower curtain rod.  I appreciated how quiet the hotel was, especially considering the number of families coming and going to and from Disneyland, but I find it unacceptable that not only is there no continental breakfast, but the rooms don't have refrigerators or microwaves, either.  I knew this going in, but I still found it frustrating that in a neighborhood where many of the hotels provide both breakfast AND a light supper, the Holiday Inn forces its guests to pay to eat in the restaurant or to go

1.  Room We loved it!  Many of the reviews only talk about the standard rooms.  We stayed one night in the two bedroom suite for only $200/nite with taxes.  Because we split that with another family, it was cheap for us.   The suite had two separate bedrooms with a living room in the middle.  That was great because my baby could sleep in one room and the rest could chit chat all nite in the living room. Lucky for us and my baby, the room looked over the swimming pool.  The building we were in only had 4 suites so it was very quiet.  Unfortunately, we didn't have time to enjoy the jacuzzi tub in the master bedroom :(  We did room service for breakfast and that was about the same price as going to the restaurant.  2.  Location Only hotel with the 2 bedroom suite we wanted closest

This area is full of overpriced, average hotels.  We could have paid $50 more per night to stay at one of them, with slightly better location or stay at this HI.  We are glad we stayed here and saved the money to spend inside the parks, especially since we spent so little time in our room anyway.   As are many in the area, this hotel is a bit dated.  The western theme is a little hokey, but it stopped at the lobby.  Our room was very clean,  and a good size for our family of 5.  It was quiet.  It was convenient that the sink was outside the bathroom.  It is close to Disneyland.  We could see the fireworks from the parking lot.  We did not take the ART, but felt is was a reasonable distance to walk to the parks.  You have to walk down the street around the Disney parking garage

The first thing I noticed about the hotel was the funky smell but I overcame that and found the hotel is just wonderful!!! the staff are so helpful and work very hard to make sure you get what you want.  They helped out with whatever information I was trying to obtain.  And most of all it was in the quiet end of the hotel I was told and I was truly thankful for that as well.   The bus service, the Art bus was wonderful as well.   Hmm nothing really bad to say about this place. I will definately be going back.

As a travel agent I stay in all kinds of places, but I find Holiday Inn to be consistantly agreeable.  We have stayed at most of the Holiday Inns' in the Anaheim area and return to this one quite often.  It's very quiet and accommodating, however the ART shuttle service really sucks!  Many people have gotten tired of waiting after 45 minutes past the scheduled arrival time at the hotel and walked to the park; they beat us there!  It was great early on, but it has gotten terrible since.  But don't let that stop you from staying there, it's worth the inconvenience, plus it's cheaper than the other Holiday Inns' in the area and the service is excellent.

Summary Heading: Best Location for the money and Very Nice
Summary: I have a house here in anaheim just two miles away but live in Las Vegas and the kids wanted to stay at a hotel. I grew up in anaheim and worked at the Disney land hotel for many years like most of my family. We know hotel  business and for the price this is where we are going to stay from now on. Great staff rooms are very clean, the location is the best. The hotel is backed up  against the downtown disney parking lot. You still need to take the free shuttle. But it is only a two minute drive. The walls seem to be thick because I never heard a sound from any of the other guest rooms. It has a qute little bar down stairs in the main lobby... This is my first review ever and I knew I had to after staying here... Hope this helps someone...  PS: Book online, rooms are cheaper

Had a great stay here, very nice staff, room was clean if a little outdated in decor. The staff were able to give us good information (a great help as it was our first time in the US) The walk to Disneyland is about 15 minutes if you cut across the carpark on Walnut street. I notice some reviews mention it is a long walk and it is if you go the wrong way as we did on the first day! We did not eat at the hotel so we can't comment on the food, there are plenty of places to eat around the Disney resort.

Summary Heading: Great, but what does Advance Purchase really mean?
Summary: My husband and I often travel with my best girlfriend, and this was no exception. Since we are all larger people, and since my husband and I have bad knees, we prefer a king bed, and were happy to find that this hotel had King Suites, a king bed with a queen sofa sleeper. Going through the Holiday Inn website, I found that a King Suite would only be $530 (room and tax) for 4 nights Advance Purchase (non-refundable), only $156 more than a Standard 2-Queen room. Our friend would pay the difference, so SOLD! A month later, we arrive, only to find that the only suite available was a Queen Handicapped, which meant that my husband and I spent the next four nights fighting for space (you should SEE my bruises - the 3 incher on my knee is a real beauty!). AND, the bathroom was a

This was our first 3 nights on a tour of the USA, the hotel is great, lovely big rooms, restaurant was very nice too, had breakfast there, reasonable prices. This hotel is near Disney! It is only a ten minute stroll - I think that American people like to drive everywhere and if it is more than 100 yards its a long walk. We walked to Disney both days! would recommend this hotel

Summary Heading: Excellent Stay for a Reasonable price
Summary: My young niece & I arrived here on Easter Sunday (April 16) for a 5-night stay, after spending a long weekend in San Diego.  Our main purpose was to visit Disneyland, although we also planned to visit Universal Studios Hollywood  and an L.A. Dodgers game.  I had booked a non-smoking room at a very attractive price, by taking advantage of an advance-payment offer they had available on their site.  The check-in staff was very nice & offered Easter candy to my niece, although one woman seemed annoyed with me because I didn't remember which credit card I had used to book the room, so I had to find the right one.      The room itself was large, very clean & the bed was very comfortable.  My back really appreciated that, after the hard bed I had suffered with in San Diego!  The window

We got such a great deal staying at this hotel! The rooms were nice, clean, spacious, cleaning kadies were very courteous & efficient, and the gym was nicely equipped w/ quality cardio machines!  Most of all, the service people at the front desk were so warm, helpful & accommodating!!! They're reason enough to go back- will most definitely return! =)

Summary Heading: Best Holiday Inn hotel in Anaheim
Summary: as a business man, i usually travel to orange county at least twice per month.  on my last trip, i decided to bring my family because we were going to disneyland.  i am also a priority club member and i usually prefer staying at holiday inn hotels, which also include crowne plaza and staybridge suites.  let me tell you, there are three holiday inns in anaheim, a crowne plaza, staybridge suites, and couple of holiday inn express hotels.  the holiday inn hotel & suites on walnut is by far the best hotel amongst the other ones.    the holiday inn on manchester is a much newer hotel but the rooms look tired and their location is really bad because it is on a one-way street.  to get to disneyland, the drive literally takes 15 minutes (plus you have to deal with the parking).  the

i stayed here for 7 nights in september last year. i asked for a room with a disneyland view and ended up getting a view of the carpark! the room was big and clean. this hotel is quite a fair distance  walk to get to disneyland entrance, would definetly recommend people to stay in a hotel directly opposite the entrance, as this hotel was too far away and didnt have the disney atmosphere or feeling

I had a pleasant 3 night stay at this hotel while visiting Disneyland.  I have to say the service was outstanding, and every staff member would greet you.  For what you pay per night, the rooms are in good order.  I would consider staying at this hotel again!

Summary Heading: Ok but for the money great!
Summary: OK so when we arrived they had us in a building that was off from the others, not near the pool, on the ground floor and anyone could have climbed in the window it was that close to the parking lot.  They were very kind to move us to the building closer to the lobby and on the 5th floor which was safer.  As far as the hotel it was nice and the staff pleasant.  The walk is a good 20 minutes to the entrance of the park.  Not great after you have walked all day long.  Now the shuttle was terrible!  I went at 7:30 on our last day to get breakfast from the bakery in Downtown that we enjoyed and I had been to the bakery and back by 8am.  I waited 31 minutes for a shuttle that was supposed to be running every twenty minutes.  So the hotel was great but honestly the shuttle service

Summary Heading: Great Clean and Spacious Hotel for the money
Summary: Great Hotel!  We stayed April 17, 2006 for 4 nights and wished we would have stayed longer instead of changing to the San Diego hotel.  This hotel is super clean and very spacious for the price.  The staff is great and helpful!  The hotel is actully more than a block away.  The walk is a good 15 to 20 minutes, but they do have a shuttle service for $3 per person per day, but we ended up walking every time.   For a budget hotel, this is the way to go for sure!

Summary Heading: So Close, Yet so far Away
Summary: Don't be deceived, this is not near the entrance to Disneyland. It is a long walk, at least 15-20, almost a mile, to a parking garage shuttle, where you have to stand in line to be shuttled to an area where you have to walk another 10 minutes to the entrance. We tried the ART shuttle a couple of times and every time it was extremely late. Other ART shuttles picked up and dropped off passengers twice while we waited to be picked up. Believe the reviews, the ART is horrible on this route.  We had a rental car and drove one day to Disneyland but for $10 we still felt like we had to walk a very long way and with 3 kids, ages 3,7,and 8 it was tough.  The hotel itself was okay. The carpet had stains on it, the wallpaper outdated, but otherwise it was clean. The service in the

What a nightmare.  We had just stayed in the Holiday Inn express in Marina Del Ray a couple of days before and what a difference.  We booked a non-smoking room for three nights, to take our kids to Disney.  We arrived in the evening and were given our room keys.  Just getting out of the elevator we could smell the smoke in the corridor.  Got to our room and could smell the smoke before opening the door.  Not only that, the room had not been made up from the previous guests, with the beds unmade, towels all over the place and I won't mention the bathroom!!  We went down to reception to explain and were told that they would fix the room while we ate in the restaurant, but could not move us to a non-smoking room until the next night as they were full and gave us a $20 breakfast

Summary Heading: Warning..Don't Stay Here !!!   You have many more options!!!! Warning
Summary: Warning‚Ä¶ Will not stay there again !!! Holiday Inn Anaheim  We ended up planning a last minute ‚Äúgirls trip‚Äù during the Presidents Day Weekend.  The hotels we usually stay at were already booked.  So after doing a lot of research with the use of Trip Advisor I decided to book at this property at the Entertainment Book rate of $69.00 a night.  I was a little worried about my choice and I wasn‚Äôt really happy about taking the transportation to the park but we were grateful to have a place to stay over the holiday weekend. Upon arrival we were rudely greeted by the front desk person with food spilling out of her mouth at us.  It was not pretty and I have stayed away from potato chips since,  It was truly a struggle even getting our keys and paper work.  (Not a great welcome at all)

I just stayed at this hotel for the first time, and I was very pleased.  The rooms were large and immaculately clean.  There is a nice outdoor pool, but it was too cool for me to enjoy when I was there.  People at the front desk are very friendly and efficient.  It's a pretty reasonable walk to the Disney parks (the equivalent of a few blocks).  They also have a shuttle bus at $3 per person, but I didn't take it.  Because rain was threatening, I ended up driving to the parks and spending $10 to park there.  Since there were six of us in the vehicle, it was cheaper than the shuttle bus.  I had breakfast in the hotel.  The food was OK, I thought, but pretty expensive.  Not many people were in the restaurant at breakfast time, so I assume they walked to one of the nearby

This is a clean hotel and the staff is nice and does a good job.  You could smell smoke alot though in the corridors and a bit in the room, even our non-smoking one. I think from now on we will stay at non-smoking properties only. This hotel was quite aways from Disney and made it difficult to take breaks mid-day. We will stay closer next time.

We had a great trip to Disneyland and found our stay at the Holiday Inn clean and comfortable.  The front desk and restaurant staff were friendly and pleasant.  And yes, the hotel could used some renovations since it does look dated, but I found the rooms and public areas to be clean.  We also took advantage of 'kids eat for free' and had a couple of good breakfasts at the hotel restaurant before heading out to DL/CA each day.  The only hiccup that we encountered was remedied immediately when we realized that they had checked us onto a smoking floor, though our room was smoke free. When we mentioned this to them the next day, they immediately offered us a different room on a non-smoking floor.  With 2 smaller kids I did feel that with all the walking that's done at DL/CA, it was

We (myself, husband & 8 yo son) stayed in the Holiday Inn for 4 nights from the 24th to the 28th of December 2005. Considering the hotel is so reasonably priced, I think it represents excellent value for money. We booked through a travel agent in our country, and paid around US$100 per night for a one bedroom suite with full kitchen facilities. Whilst we didn't end up using the kitchen, I'm sure it would be quite valuable for people wanting to save money by cooking their own meals. There was plenty of room to spread out in the separate living area, and the bathroom was a reasonable size. Everything was kept very clean by the housekeeping staff too.   The staff on the front desk were very helpful: calling our cabs for us, calling restaurants to see if they were open (on Xmas

Between May 30 - and Dec 10th, 2005 I stayed at this Holiday Inn and Suites 26 nights. Just spent two nights last weekend (Jan 2006).  The Good: Clean Rooms and well maintained Attentive Staff Great Rates Safe Area Easy walk to the Disneyland Hotel or the Parking Lot Shuttle  The OK: Bar(menu is limited) Restaurant (service is slow) Hotel has had a very busy season and it's starting to show in carpet and lobby furnishings.    The Ugly: ART (Anaheim Resort Transportation) The Holiday Inn is on the poorest route of ART. Slow, slow service and never on time. All the other ART Routes are really good. Wish the hotel would go back to their own form of transportation.  Although it's like a 2/5 of a mile to the parking lot shuttle. Walk it a lot.  Don't let the transportation keep you

Summary Heading: Best Budget hotel in the Area. Would go back again.
Summary: The hotel dose shows its age in the area of carpeting and a few other minor things, but I must say it was Very Clean. I have stayed at other hotels of the same class in this area, and I must say this is by far the best in the area. I stayed with my family and, we utilized the pool and sauna every night. The pool was heated to about 75 degrees Fahrenheit, not as warm as I would of liked but, It was very swim able in January. The only interaction I had with the staff was at check in and check out. Both were extremely nice and quick. If you would like to walk to Disneyland from this hotel It is possible but, I would not recommend it. The Distance would be about a half mile each direction. Going there is not bad but coming back after a log day can be a pain. If your children are

Summary Heading: Good hotel, terrible shuttle bus service to Disney
Summary: First off, the rooms.  Lovely, clean, looked like they'd recently been refurbished.  Cannot fault them at all.  Amongst the nicest during our trip.  Next, the staff - helpful and friendly, although at times it would have been nice if another staffer could have been called to assist.  I had to wait at times whilst the receptionist dealt with a (long) phone call... and a developing queue - if someone could have come to assist, this would not have happened.  Pool and spa area were very good - great whirlpool spa.  If you stay here, definitely make use of this facility.  Breakfast was of a reasonable standard.  Which is just as well bearing in mind this hotel isn't really near much.  Which brings me to the minus points.  This hotel is not as close to Disney as the publicity would

I stayed at the hotel for 3 nites. For the price we paid, I think its really quite good. Great value for money. Situated at a very quiet and homely neigbourhood. The hotel corridoor is abit old, but the rooms and the building exterior looks perfectly fine. No complain at all. Front desk is fairly helpful.   Just pay $3 for unlimited rides on shuttle just at the entrance of the hotel to Disney area (the bus ride is about 10 mins).  Dont thk you want to try walking to Disney - the $3 shuttle is worth it.

Summary Heading: Not a bad place to stay
Summary: Had a three night stay here on the way to Hawaii in November. I had mixed feelings about staying here after hearing up and down comments. I must say we were pleasantly surprised with this accommodation.  The Disneyland Coach from LAX International Airport will take you direct from the terminal to the Holiday Inn for 19 dollars one way per person. The room we had was clean we had adequate space. Bathroom was clean had a shower/bath.  It was about $11 dollars extra per night to hire a refrigerator. The room we had was air conditioned, it does make a slight noise but not too bad. Staff were ok answered any questions we had, we bought our Disneyland tickets from reception which saved queuing up at the park.   Location is not bad, although it is not the nearest hotel to the Disney

Summary Heading: Neither Adjacent To, Or One Block from Disneyland
Summary: I immediately need to clarify the information supplied by the hotel.  This HI is located on Walnut Ave between Ball Road and Magic Way behind the Disneyland Resort, (NOT theme parks).  It is one long block away from the DLR property line, but 3/4 mile away from the theme parks.  The hotel is Stop 3 on the "B" line of the Anaheim Resort Shuttle service, and the bus stops approx every 20 minutes at the front door of the HI.  If you're not walkers like we are at Disneyland, you'll appreciate the service.  Single day and multi-day shuttle tickets can be purchased in the lobby.  The only Disney property this hotel is one block away from is the parking structure next door!  But, you know what?, we enjoyed our two-day stay on October 19 and 20.  We were roomed in 3205, a second-story,
i stayed at the hotel first they gave us a room that was not finished then a couple of nights boy racers turned up playing loud music and shouting

The hotel was okay, I am not sure I would stay here again.  The staff is hit and miss for quality especially in the resturant (which does not serve lunch).  If you stay here be sure you get a room away from any main door or ice machine or you will hear everything!  If you do stay here the walk to Disneyland maingate is 10 min.  but a nice walk.  You can catch the parking area tram and shave off some time and walking distance.  you can catch it just before you go into the park or at the parking garage area.  You will see the parking area as you start walking towards the park.

Stayed her for 2 nights in September, it was not part of our original itinery and was booked by the reception staff at the HI we were staying at in Fresno.  We were greeted at reception and our room was ready.  It is a typical family friendly Holiday Inn.  Room was clean with all the amenities.  View was the Dinleyland car park but it was quiet and comfortable. Location to Dinsey was excellent if that is all you want,  but you definitely need a car to do anything else.

not what i expected from a holiday inn hotel. inexperienced unhelpful reception staff made any enquiry a drama. rooms were ok but the stairs were the fastest way because of very slow lifts. close enough to disney land to be able to walk

We stayed here for two nights 26th-28th July, check in was smooth and hassle free.  The room was adequate for our party two adults and two children for what we used it for (sleeping) but was dated.  The bathroom was small and didnt like the way the vanity was postioned outside the bathroom.  A tip!!  Buy your tickets to the theme parks from the hotel as saves on queuing when you get to the parks.  The shuttle bus is not as frequent as would have liked and again buy your tickets from the hotel before getting onto the bus as this saves money as you can go to and from the hotel to as often as you like on the one ticket.  Nothing wrong with the hotel but dont know if we would stop there again.

This hotel was fabulous. Everything was clean, hotel desk clerks were knowledgeable and friendly. Hotel is literally right across from the Disneyland Parking Structure. The restaurant and bar were very nice as well. Hotel has a gift shop also. Would definately stay again.

We stayed in this hotel from July 8 - July 12, 2005.  It is definitely off the beaten path which, in my opinion, was a little nice because it was a very  quiet location.  My sister and her husband stayed at the Fairfield and it was chaos over there but we parked the rental car over there and walked to the park.   It can be walking distance from the Holiday Inn if you walk to the tram which is about 4 blocks and take that in...it is too far to walk to the actual park unless you are ready to do a lot of walking.  There was nothing around it as far as restaurants and such so you have to have a car to get around.  The parking was easy and there was always a space.  Now to the room.  We had an Entertainment rate of $69 so I can't complain too much.  The air conditioner worked great

Stayed 4 nights at this hotel.  At first, was a little disappointed as I was promised 3 rooms on the same floor.  A family member checked in early and the desk clerk (Sam) promised us rooms together.  When the rest of our party arrived, a different desk clerk (Hector) told us that not only were we not on the same floor, we were in different buildings.  They were not willing to change or accomodate us.  However, the next morning, the same desk clerk Sam was able to move us together to have rooms adjacent to one another, which was awesome!
