The restaurant was great.  Good food, kids eat free, and VERY fast!!  The pool was perfect for the kids and we enjoyed a good view of the fireworks at disneyland from the pool area and also from our room (Bld 4).   The rooms were a bit small,

We booked our 4 night stay with Holiday Inn because of their reputation, and also of our past pleasant experiences in other facilities. We were highly disappointed with the noise level of the bathroom fans, both ours and in the rooms by or below us. The window type air conditioning unit was also very noisy, ours and ones from other rooms, so that there is a constant humming throughout the night, light sleepers will not be able to have a restful sleep. Upon mentioning this to the staff the second night, they apologized but did not suggest an alternative, they purported that all the rooms are the same. They did however change our room, unfortunately, the bathroom fan did not work and after a shower the humidity in the bathroom would not allow us to dry off completely. The light

Nice and clean hotel. Rooms a bit small, we tried to upgrade to a suite but unfortunately the hotel was booked and we were not able to.  Decor was nice, looked recently upgraded.  Didnt eat at the restaraunt, as other reviews were negative but pool area was nice and kids had a great time in it.  Nice and close to Disneyland, recommend taking trolley- it was nice to come back to the room in the afternoon and take a break ( and let the kids swim) and then go back.  The only problem we had was that the room key wouldnt always work and we had to go down 3 times and get new ones.   Check out Entertainment Book rates on their website- can order Entertainment book online and save.

Stayed 4 nights in mid-June in Bldg. #5 Suite.  Just enough for six - 2  adults & 1 child on 1 queen and 2 kids on other queen bed.  1 adult slept on the sofa in separate living area - said it was very comfortable.  2 lavs outside the bathroom.    Prefer if large bar in living area cut down into an eating table.  Microwave and nice sized refrigerator great for keeping drinks, snacks and meals.  Parking on 2 sides of Bldg. #5 and pool area on 3rd side.  Front desk and restaurant were beyond the pool.  Had good service at hotel restaurant breakfast and dinner.  Kids ate free.  The dining area small, spills into lounge when crowded.  Had parking lot view.  Pool view on opposite side seems nice.  With only 4 suites on each of 2 floors, room was nice and quiet.  Used Anaheim Resort

We have just spent four marvellous nights at this hotel.  The hotel is exceptionally clean and the staff in the hotel very friendly and helpful.  Had some difficulty finding the hotel as S Manchester Ave wasn't detailed on any Car Rental direction finders.  Used the shuttle to Disney daily and found it very useful, although the route tends to be one of the last to be picked up at the end of the evening, which could cause some headaches for parties with younger children.   Overall would definitely visit again.

Summary Heading: Good Value, not so good restaurant service.
Summary: We found the kid suite to be quite accomodating and the bell desk and room service were excellent.  The pool was small, but worked.  The closeness to Disneyland outweighed any uncomfortable hotel complaints.  The only negative was the restaurant.  The hostess needs to learn how to be a hostess and the service was VERY slow.  The food was just okay.  Next trip, we may stay here, but we will definitely not eat here.  I would recommend this hotel to Disney travelers.

Summary Heading: Noisy, noisy, noisy, but a nice suite.
Summary: My mistake was not finding out which building/floor/exact room previous reviewers who rated this joint "quiet" stayed.  We were on the 6th floor of Building 3, DEFINITELY not a quiet building/floor/room.  On the up side, we were able to check in early, around 2 pm and the suite was great.  The sitting room was as large as a standard room and had a big TV, HBO, desk, sofa and chair.  The bar area had padded stools, microwave and fridge.  On the down side, even though we were in a non-smoking suite, the sitting room and pillows smelled smoky.  We fell asleep just after the Disneyland fireworks stopped at 10 pm, but were rudely awakened just after midnight when the Disneyland crowd returned, then again after 2 am when the nightclub crowd returned, then again just after 4 am when a
Family stayed for three days durning the week. Hotel staff did an adverage job. Good value for the money.

We stayed at this hotel for a week over Spring Break.  We were very pleasantly surprised.  The room was OK, nothing exceptional, but it was very quiet at night.  There were several groups of teens/tweeners booked onto our floor at the same time as us and we never heard them at night.  Hard to believe that they were being quiet!!!!  The rooms were very clean.  Yes, the bathtub was very dark when the shower curtain was drawn.  Big deal.  We seemed to get several newspapers each day, most of which went unread, but nice touch anyway.  The restaurant was perfect for breakfast.  We got down there around 8:00 each morning and apparently just beat the crowd each day.  We arrived later on the last day and were kept waiting about 30 minutes to get a table.  The serving staff was

I had booked a king non-smoking room over 5 months ago. To my surprise, we were given a room with two single beds. This was a second honeymoon for my wife and I. After coming down to the front desk, we were told that nothing could be done.   Kids will run the halls all night, screaming, slamming and otherwise being loud. I realize that it's close to Disneyland, but it was getting out of hand.   On our last day, we had to catch an early flight so we ordered room service. They even called to confirm our order which we had placed on the door the night before. Much to our surprise, only 1/2 of what we had ordered was delivered and the bananna was rotten. After speaking with the manager and having her look over our order, she was very nice and did give us a gift bag with various

A five-star service at a 3 star hotel.  We stayed here for a couple of nights to attend a conference at the convention center.  There was a FREE shuttle taking us back and forth.  It is on a quiet street so you avoid all the noises and cars.  ALL the staff we encoutered were courteous and professional.  I mean ALL.  Room was very clean and roomy.  For the price, this was a bargain.  If you do not mind the shuttle to go to the convention, this hotel is a great deal!

Me and my family stayed at this hotel duriing the whole christmas vacation during this whole period our stay it was nothing but great hospitality from the whole staff.  The food was excellent in the resteraunt. When we needed anything a Mr Sam at the front desk took care of us as if we were family.  Rooms are very cozy and the Silver saloon staff was great as well.  Me and my family will definetly stay here again thank you Sam for everything.

My family and I went to Disneyland the week before Thanksgiving. Because of all the bad reviews on Hotels there, I was really terrified of what kind of service we would get.  I must say that I thought the Holiday Inn Anaheim was great.  The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were very clean.  When I need something the staff came right away.  We stayed in a one bedroom sutie.  My 15 year old and my 2 year old also loved it, as did my Husband.  I would stay at this Hotel again and again.  I do recommend it.

After reading the past reviews of this hotel I must say I was scared! Especially the "roaches" review (I will get to that in a minute)     Location: The hotel is right next to the "Mickey & Friend's" parking structure. Literally; right next door. However, there is a massive brick wall surrounding the property therefore, you can't just cut corners. You have to go all the way down this very long block then make a left and go all the way down half a block to reach the Parking Trams, then take the parking tram into the them parks Or you could just cut to Down Town Disney whichever you prefer. They are both about the same distance (time wise). The walk was 15-20  TO  THE TRAM station NOT to the parks. They do have the Anaheim Shuttle if you prefer.  I insist that no one drives into

I stayed at this hotel with my daughter as part of a larger trip to the area.  We came early to the hotel, expecting to stow our baggage and hit Disneyland.  Imagine our surprise when we were allowed to check in.  Staff was helpful.  Location is a reasonable walk.  A really good rate for what we got. If I come back to the area, I will definitely stay here again.

We hadn't made a reservation here and we drove around a few of the hotels in Anaheim to ask about prices & availability.  The receptionist tried very hard to find the best deal for us and managed to give us a good deal. The hotel is not walking distance to Disenyland but is on the shuttle which costs $3perperson for unlimited use of Disney shuttle.  Good size room with child friendly TV channels.

After looking at the reviews for this hotel I can only pressume that some people managed to confuse this Holiday Inn with others located in Anaheim - please note that there are a few when booking.  The hotel that we stayed in at S Walnut was cramped, dirty (even had cockroaches in the bath and crumbs on the bed on our arrival) and everytime someone so much as sneezed in the next room, you could hear it full volume in your room.  The only saving graces for this hotel are it's location to Disneyland and indeed the staff in it's restaurant whom were all helpful and friendly but as stated in my heading I would only book this hotel as a Last Resort!!!

Just got back from our stay and wanted to say we had a great room.  We were right next door to the parking garage for Disneyland which was where I wanted to be.  The room was very soundproofed (I had two small children which was great for our neighbors) and was very clean.  The only drawback was the hallway and elevator needed to be air conditioned because it was a very hot and muggy weekend.  That would honestly be the only complaint we had.  There was plenty of parking near our room and we could watch the fireworks right from the parking lot.  I would definitely stay here the next time we need a room!

Summary Heading: Large suites are a great value
Summary: We stayed here 3 nights in August. For the large, 3 room suite (which has 2 full bedrooms off each side of the living area), we found that the hotel's website had the best prices.  Other rooms were offered for less on Expedia and such, but the large suites are only available from corporate site (note that their search results call both the 2 room and 3 room suites 2 bedrooms, but the max # people allowed is 9 for the larger suites).  Anyway, since we have a family of 5 with 3 teens, we really wanted a large suite with beds for everyone.  Compared to the other suites available around Disney, this one was much larger and much less expensive. If you plan to take a break during the day or want to hang out in the evening, this place is very large and comfortable.  Unfortunately, we

We spent 3 nights at this hotel and it was A okay. No breakfast was included so we had the hotel restaurant breakfast in the mornings at that was alright. You managed to survive until 4-5 PM on that meal if you went for the omeletts and the hash browns. The room was okay, we had an rollerbed and managed to squeeze in 3 adults and two teenagers without too much problems. The pool was perfect in the afternoon coming back from Disneyland for a rest before going back to the evenings activities. There was a Food4Less apprx 5-7 minutes down Walnut and then turn right. There were also some pizza parlors there. You could also order pizza being delivered to the hotel. The shuttle service to Disneyland was perfect!

We enjoyed our 4 night stay here in March. Found the staff to be very friendly, although their English could be better. The rooms are clean and a good size and the queen beds were very comfortable. Although you could walk to Disney from the hotel I would conserve your energy and use the shuttle service. The only critisism is that I thought certain areas of the hotel looked a little tired and in need of 'a lick of piant'.

Was a bit concerned after some of the reviews but hotel was great, spent 3 nights there early April 04, suite was good size. Kids used the pool etc. close to Disney, an easy 10 mins walk to Downtown Disney and another 5 or so to get to park entrances. Used the ART shuttle as well as walking (on the way back !)  All staff friendly and helpful made a fuss of the kids etc. (breakfast staff kept getting orders wrong though maybe I need to practice my spanish !) food was a good standard and the free kids meals were a nice suprise.

This hotel was run down and in need of some work. The two bedroom units are only really one bedroom and the sitting area which has a sofa that converts to a queen size bed. For a family of five, not quite the 'perfect' holiday we expected from the web site and the brochures we had seen.  Staff were friendly and helpful but would not stay here as the walk to Disneyland, though close was a little too far for the family.  I would not stay here again - perhaps one of the offerings across the road from Disneyland on Harbour Blvde might be a better option.

We stayed on this hotel during the thanksgiving rush. The room was clean, the staff was courteus and the paid transportation ($3/pp) to disneyland was just two stops away (5-8 minute ride).  We didn't have a change to try the hotel ammenities (pool, gym) but they looked OK.  Food was not great, I would say bellow average.  Even though you are looking at the mickey parking structure from the hotel, it's a long walk to get around it to the tram station (15 min), you could certainly take this route. We did not since we were pushing two strollers!  I think the hotel is worth exactly what we paid for it ($55), I wouldn't stay there for more than that.

We had a great room and comfortable beds. The guest laundry was a disappointment. Dryers did not work. Had to walk up 3 flights to finish. Staff was very helpful in getting us tours. Spa was great!!  Enjoyed stay.
